analyzed: adhi sīla sikkhā pariyāpanna ttā abhivisiṭṭhaḥ samācāro ti abhisamācāro iti āha uttama samācāro ti  ābhisamācāro va ābhisamācārikam yathā venayikaḥ iti adhippāyaḥ abhisamācāro ukkaṭṭha niddesato
translated: The proper conduct is distinguished because it is included in the training in the higher virtue. Thus it is said: “The supreme proper conduct.”

original: maggasīlaṃ, phalasīlañca, taṃ ārabbha uddissa tadatthaṃ tappayojanaṃ paññattaṃ ābhisamācārikaṃ.
analyzed: magga sīlam phala sīlam ca tam ārabbha uddissa tad attham tad payojanam paññattam ābhisamācārikam
translated: The proper conduct is the proper conduct training. The intention is that it is like the training in the Monastic Law. The proper conduct is the virtue of the path and the virtue of the fruit. The proper conduct training is the training that is laid down in order to make that clear.

original: Suparisuddhāni tīṇi kāyakammāni, cattāri vacīkammāni, suparisuddho ājīvoti idaṃ ājīvaṭṭhamakaṃ.
analyzed: su parisuddhāni tīṇi kāya kammāni cattāri vacī kammāni su parisuddhaḥ ājīvaḥ ti idam ājīva ṭṭhamakam
translated: The three kinds of bodily action and the four kinds of verbal action are completely purified, and the livelihood is completely purified. This is the eighth factor of the noble path, the right livelihood.

original: Tattha kāmaṃ ājīvahetukato sattavidhaduccaritato virati sammāājīvoti sopi sattavidho
analyzed: tattha kāmam ājīva hetukato sattavidha duccaritato virati sammāājīvaḥ ti saḥ api sattavidhaḥ
translated: Herein, right livelihood is the abstinence from the seven kinds of wrong livelihood. It is of seven kinds because of the cause of livelihood and because of the abstinence from the seven kinds of wrong conduct.

original: hoti, sammājīvatāsāmaññena pana taṃ ekaṃ katvā vuttaṃ. Atha vā tividhakuhanavatthusannissayato
analyzed: hoti sammājīva tā sāmaññena pana tam ekam katvā vuttam atha vā tividha kuhana vatthu sannissayato
translated: and right livelihood is mentioned as one because of the similarity of the state of recluseship in the case of both. Or alternatively, abstinence from wrong livelihood is mentioned as one because of its being based on the three grounds for the arising of skill in livelihood.

original: micchājīvato viratiṃ ekajjhaṃ katvā vutto “ājīvo suparisuddho”ti. Seṭṭhacariyabhāvato
analyzed: micchājīvataḥ viratim ekajjham katvā vuttaḥ ājīvaḥ su parisuddho ti seṭṭha cariya bhāvato
translated: “His livelihood is purified” .

original: maggo eva brahmacariyanti maggabrahmacariyaṃ, tassa. Ādibhāvabhūtanti ādimhi bhāvetabbataṃ
analyzed: maggaḥ eva brahmacariyanti magga brahmacariyam tassa ādi bhāva bhūtanti ādimhi bhāvetabba tam
translated: The path is the life of purity because it is the best way of life.🔽It is the life of purity that has come to be in the beginning in the sense of being what should be brought about and made to arise at the beginning.

original: nipphādetabbataṃ bhūtaṃ pattaṃ ādibhāvabhūtaṃ. Kiñcāpi desanānukkamena sammādiṭṭhi🔽ādi, paṭipattikkamena pana ājīvaṭṭhamakasīlaṃ ādīti. Tassa sampattiyāti ābhisamācārikassa
analyzed: nipphādetabba tam bhūtam pattam ādi bhāva bhūtam kiñca api desanā anukkamena sammādiṭṭhi  ādi paṭipatti kkamena pana ājīva ṭhamaka sīlam ādi iti tassa sampattiyā āti ābhisamācārikassa
translated: And although right view is at the beginning in the order of teaching,🔽nevertheless virtue consisting in the last three of the eight path factors is at the beginning in the order of practice.

original: sampajjanena paripūraṇena ādibrahmacariyakaṃ sampajjati. Yo hi lahukānipi appasāvajjāni
analyzed: sampajjanena paripūraṇena ādibrahmacariyakam sampajjati yaḥ hi lahukāni pi appasāvajjāni
translated: “That comes to be fulfilled” : the life of purity that has come to be in the beginning is fulfilled by the fulfilment of the life of purity consisting in right action and right speech.

original: parivajjeti, so garukāni mahāsāvajjāni bahvādīnavāni parivajjessatīti vattabbameva
analyzed: parivajja iti saḥ garukāni mahā sāvajjāni bahu ādīnavāni parivajjessati iti vattabbam eva
translated: For it is surely necessary to say that he who avoids what is blameless and slight will also avoid what is blameworthy and serious and has much danger.

original: natthīti. Suttaṃ pana etamatthaṃ byatirekavasena vibhāveti. Tattha dhammanti sīlaṃ.
analyzed: natthi iti suttam pana etam attham byatireka vasena vibhāveti tattha dhammanti sīlam
translated: But the sutta analyses the meaning of this in terms of the distinction between the two kinds of life of purity. Herein, “Dhamma” is virtue.

original: Taṃ hi upariguṇavisesānaṃ dhāraṇaṭṭhena dhammoti vuccati.
analyzed: tam hi upari guṇa visesānam dhāraṇa ṭṭhena dhammo ti vuccati
translated: for it is called Dhamma in the sense of bearing its own special qualities above it.

original: Viratisīlassa itarasīlena satipi sampayogādike asammissakatādassanatthaṃ “veramaṇimatta”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: virati sīlassa itara sīlena sati pi sampayoga ādike asammissaka tā dassana attham veramaṇi mattanti vuttam
translated: The words “only abstention” are said in order to show that the virtue of abstention is not mixed up with other kinds of virtue, though it may be associated with them, etc.

original: “Nissitānissitavasenā”ti ettha labbhamānanissayaṃ tāva dassetuṃ “nissayo”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: nissita a nissita vasena āti ettha labbhamāna nissayam tāva dassetum nissaya utiādi vuttam
translated: As regards the words “according as it is dependent or independent,” the dependence that is possible is shown by the words “dependence” and so on.

original: Tattha taṇhācaritena nissayitabbato taṇhāva taṇhānissayo. Tathā diṭṭhinissayo. Diṭṭhicarito
analyzed: tattha taṇhā caritena taṇhā va taṇhā nissayaḥ tathā diṭṭhi nissayaḥ diṭṭhi carito
translated: Herein, craving is a dependence of craving because one dependent on craving is bound to be a person of craving. Likewise, a dependence of view is a dependence of a person of view.

original: hi asatipi diṭṭhiyā taṇhāvirahe diṭṭhinissitova pavattati. Devoti catumahārājasakkasuyāmādipākaṭadevamāha.
analyzed: hi asati pi diṭṭhiyā taṇhā virahe diṭṭhi nissitaḥ uva pavattati devaḥ iti catu mahā rāja sakka suyāma ādi pākaṭadevam āha
translated: For one who is dependent on view, though he may not have craving, still occurs only as a person of view. “God” is a visible god, such as the Four Great Kings, Sakka, and so on.

original: Devaññataroti apākaṭaṃ. Taṇhaṃ eva nissitanti taṇhānissitaṃ. Taṇhāya nissitanti ca
analyzed: devaññataraḥ ti apākaṭam taṇham eva nissitanti taṇhā nissitam taṇhāya nissitanti ca
translated: “Any other god” is an invisible one. “Dependent on craving” is dependent on craving.🔽Some say “dependent for craving” .

original: keci vadanti. Tesaṃ “dve nissayā”tiādinā virujjhati. Suddhidiṭṭhiyāti “iti saṃsārasuddhi
analyzed: keci vadanti tesam dve nissaya ati ādinā virujjhati suddhi diṭṭhiyā ti iti saṃsāra suddhi
translated: That is contradicted by the words “two kinds of dependence” and so on. “With pure view” : “Thus there is purification of the round of rebirths,

original: bhavissatī”ti evaṃ pavattadiṭṭhiyā, lokuttaraṃ sīlanti adhippāyo. Tassevāti lokuttarasseva
analyzed: bhavissati iti evam pavatta diṭṭhiyā lokuttaram sīlanti adhippāyaḥ tassa iva ati lokuttarassa iva
translated: The intention is that the virtue is supramundane.

original: sambhārabhūtaṃ kāraṇabhūtaṃ, vivaṭṭūpanissayanti attho.
analyzed: sambhāra bhūtam kāraṇa bhūtam vivaṭṭu upanissayanti atthaḥ
translated: It is the cause, the condition, for that, the support for its occurrence.

original: Kālaparicchedaṃ katvāti “imañca rattiṃ, imañca diva”ntiādinā viya kālavasena paricchedaṃ
analyzed: kāla paricchedam katvā ati imam ca rattim imam ca kāla vasena paricchedam
translated: Having defined the time: having defined the time by saying, “This night and this day” and so on.

original: katvā. Kālaparicchedaṃ akatvā samādinnampi antarāvicchinnaṃ sampattavirativasena🔽yāvajīvaṃ pavattitampi āpāṇakoṭikaṃ na hotīti dassetuṃ “yāvajīvaṃ samādiyitvā tatheva
analyzed: katvā kāla paricchedam a katvā antara avicchinnam sampatta virati vasena  yāvajīvam pavattitam pi āpāṇakoṭikam na hoti iti dassetum yāvajīvam samādiyitvā tathā iva
translated: Even though it is undertaken without defining the time, if it is interrupted in the meantime, and even though it continues as long as life lasts, it is not life-long.

original: pavattita”nti vuttaṃ.🔽Lābhayasañātiaṅgajīvitavasenāti lābhayasānaṃ anuppannānaṃ uppādanavasena, uppannānaṃ🔽rakkhaṇavasena ceva vaḍḍhanavasena ca ñātiaṅgajīvitānaṃ avināsanavasena. Kiṃ so vītikkamissatīti
analyzed: pavattitan ti vuttam  lābha yasa ñāti aṅga jīvita vasena ati lābha yasānam anuppannānam uppādana vasena uppannānam  rakkhaṇa vasena ca iva vaḍḍhana vasena ca ñāti aṅga jīvitānaṃ a vināsana vasena kim so vītikkamissati iti
translated: In order to show this, it is said: “Having undertaken it for life, it continues in the same way.”

original: yo vītikkamāya cittampi na uppādeti, so kāyavācāhi vītikkamissatīti kiṃ idaṃ, natthetanti
analyzed: yaḥ vītikkamāya cittam pi na uppādeti saḥ kāya vācāhi vītikkamissati iti kim idam nattha etat ti
translated: By the means of gain and fame, of relatives, limbs, and life: by the means of causing the gain and fame that have not arisen to arise, and by the means of preserving and increasing those that have arisen; and by the means of not causing the relatives, limbs, and life to be destroyed.

original: attho. Paṭikkhepe hi ayaṃ kiṃ-saddo.
analyzed: atthaḥ paṭikkhepe hi ayam kiṃsaddaḥ
translated: means: in the sense of a wound.🔽The meaning is: because it flows out like a wound in the sense of an object.

original: Ārammaṇabhāvena vaṇo viya āsave kāmāsavādike paggharatīti sampayogabhāvābhāvepi sahāsavehīti
analyzed: ārammaṇa bhāvena vaṇaḥ viya āsave kāma āsava ādike paggharati iti sampayoga bhāva abhāve api saha āsavehi iti
translated: Although there is no connection, it is said: “with pollutants” because of the connection with the pollutants.

original: sāsavaṃ. Tebhūmakadhammajātanti sīlaṃ tappariyāpannanti āha “sāsavaṃ sīlaṃ lokiya”nti.
analyzed: sa āsavam tebhūmaka dhamma jātanti sīlam tad pariyāpannanti āha sa āsavam sīlam lokiyanti
translated: The three planes and the kinds of ideas means: virtue, and what is included in that, therefore he said: “virtue with pollutants is mundane.”

original: Bhavavisesā sampattibhavā. Vinayoti vinayapariyatti, tattha vā āgatasikkhāpadāni.
analyzed: bhava visesā sampatti bhavā vinayo ti vinaya pariyatti tattha vā āgata sikkhāpadāni
translated: The special states of existence are the good states of existence. The Monastic Law means: the Monastic Code, or the training rules that are found there.

original: Pāmojjaṃ taruṇapīti. Yathābhūtañāṇadassanaṃ sapaccayanāmarūpadassanaṃ, tadadhiṭṭhānā
analyzed: pāmojjam taruṇa pīti yathā bhūta ñāṇa dassanam sa paccaya nāmarūpa dassanam tad adhiṭṭhānā
translated: Joy is tender rapture. The knowledge and vision of things as they really are means: the seeing of mentality-materiality with conditions, or tender insight that is based on that.

original: vā taruṇavipassanā. Nibbidāti nibbidāñāṇaṃ. Tena balavavipassanamāha. Virāgo maggo.
analyzed: vā taruṇa vipassanā nibbidā ti nibbidā ñāṇam tena balava vipassanam āha virāgaḥ maggo
translated: Disenchantment means: the knowledge of disenchantment. By that he refers to strong insight. Non-attachment is the path.

original: Vimutti arahattaphalaṃ. Vimuttiñāṇadassanaṃ paccavekkhaṇā. Kathāti vinayakathā. Mantanāti
analyzed: vimutti arahatta phalam vimutti ñāṇa dassanam paccavekkhaṇā kathā ati vinaya kathā mantanā ati
translated: Liberation is the fruition of Arahantship. The knowledge and vision of liberation is reviewing. Discussion means: discussion of the Monastic Law.

original: vinayavicāraṇā. Upanisāti yathāvuttakāraṇaparamparāsaṅkhāto upanissayo. Lokuttaraṃ
analyzed: vinaya vicāraṇā upanisā ti yathāvutta kāraṇa paramparā saṅkhātaḥ upanissayaḥ lokuttaram
translated: Disquisition means: consideration of the Monastic Law. Dependence means: the dependence called the succession of reasons as stated. The supramundane

original: maggaphalacittasampayuttaṃ ājīvaṭṭhamakasīlaṃ. Tattha maggasīlaṃ bhavanissaraṇāvahaṃ
analyzed: magga phala citta sampayuttam ājīva ṭṭhamaka sīlam tattha magga sīlam bhava nissaraṇa āvaham
translated: Virtue of livelihood is that associated with the consciousnesses of the path and of fruition. Herein, the virtue of the path leads to the surmounting of becoming,

original: hoti, paccavekkhaṇañāṇassa ca bhūmi, phalasīlaṃ pana paccavekkhaṇāñāṇasseva bhūmi.
analyzed: hoti paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇassa ca bhūmi phala sīlam pana paccavekkhaṇā ñāṇassa iva bhūmi
translated: and it is the plane of reflective acquiescence knowledge. But the virtue of fruition is the plane of reflective acquiescence knowledge only.

original: 12. Hīnādhimuttivasena chandādīnampi hīnatā. Paṇītādhimuttivasena paṇītatā. Tadubhayavemajjhatāvasena
analyzed: hīna adhimutti vasena chanda ādīnam pi hīna tā paṇīta adhimutti vasena paṇīta tā tad ubhaya vemajjha tā vasena
translated: The inferiority of zeal, etc., is according to inferior resolve, and their excellence is according to superior resolve. Their mediocrity is according to neutrality of resolve.

original: majjhimatā. Yatheva hi kammaṃ āyūhanavasena hīnādibhedabhinnaṃ hoti, evaṃ chandādayopi
analyzed: majjhimatā yathā iva hi kammam āyūhana vasena hīna ādi bheda bhinnam hoti evam chanda ādayaḥ api
translated: Just as an action is classed as inferior, etc., according to the accumulation, so too are zeal, etc.,

original: pavattiākāravasena. So ca nesaṃ pavattiākāro adhimuttibhedenāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Yasakāmatāyāti
analyzed: pavatti ākāra vasena so ca nesam pavatti ākāraḥ adhimutti bhedena ati daṭṭhabbam yasa kāma tāya ati
translated: according to the mode of their occurrence. And that mode of occurrence should be regarded as classed according to the distinction of resolve.🔽“Desire for gain” is either desire for fame and renown or desire for a retinue.

original: kittisilokābhiratiyā, parivāricchāya vā. “Kathaṃ nāma mādiso īdisaṃ kareyyā”ti pāpajigucchāya
analyzed: kittisi loka abhiratiyā parivāricchāya vā katham nāma mādisaḥ īdisam kareyya ati pāpa jigucchāya
translated: “Scrupulousness” is scrupulousness about evil because of the noble state.

original: ariyabhāvaṃ nissāya. Anupakkiliṭṭhanti attukkaṃsanaparavambhanāhi, aññehi ca upakkilesehi
analyzed: ariya bhāvam nissāya anupakkiliṭṭhanti attukkaṃsana paravambhanāhi aññehi ca upakkilesehi
translated: “Uncontaminated” is unadulterated with self-praise and disparagement of others and with other defilements.

original: anupakkiliṭṭhaṃ. Bhavabhogatthāyāti bhavasampattiatthañceva bhogasampattiatthañca.🔽Attano vimokkhatthāya pavattitanti sāvakapaccekabodhisattasīlamāha. Sabbasattānaṃ
analyzed: an upakkiliṭṭham bhava bhoga tthāya ati bhava sampatti attham ca iva bhoga sampatti attham ca  attanaḥ vimokkha atthāya pavattitan ti sāvaka pacceka bodhisatta sīlam āha sabba sattānam
translated: and unadulterated. For the sake of existence and enjoyment: for the sake of the excellence of existence and for the sake of the excellence of enjoyment.🔽The virtue of disciples, paccekabuddhas, and great bodhisattvas is called “practiced for the sake of one’s own deliverance.”

original: vimokkhatthāyāti sabbasattānaṃ saṃsārabandhanato vimocanatthāya. Pāramitāsīlaṃ mahābodhisattasīlaṃ.🔽Yā karuṇūpāyakosallapariggahitā mahābodhiṃ ārabbha pavattā paramukkaṃsagatasoceyyasallekhā
analyzed: vimokkha atthāya ati sabba sattānam saṃsāra bandhanataḥ vimocana atthāya pāramitā sīlam mahā bodhisatta sīlam  yā karuṇū upāya kosalla pariggahitā mahā bodhim ārabbha pavattā param ukkaṃsa gata soceyya sallekhā
translated: The virtue of great bodhisattvas, which is the perfection of virtue, is practiced for the sake of the deliverance of all beings.

original: desakālasattādivikapparahitā sīlapāramitā.
analyzed: desa kāla sattā ādi vikappa rahitā sīla pāramitā
translated: It is the virtue that is undertaken in relation to great enlightenment, and that is accompanied by compassion and skillful means. It is the most excellent of all virtues, and it is free from the restrictions of place, time, and the distinction between oneself and others.

original: Ananurūpanti asāruppaṃ. Attā eva garu adhipati etassāti attagaru, lajjādhiko. Attādhipatito
analyzed: ananurūpanti a sāruppam attā eva garu adhipati etassa ati atta garu lajjā adhikaḥ attā adhipatitaḥ
translated: “Inappropriate” means unsuitable. “Self-respect” is that which has self-respect as its essence. “Respect for others” is that which has respect for others as its essence.🔽The world is the master and the self-respecting person is the one who has self-respect as his master.

original: āgataṃ attādhipateyyaṃ. Loko adhipati garu etassāti lokādhipati, ottappādhiko. Dhammo
analyzed: āgatam attā ādhipateyyam lokaḥ adhipati garu etassa ati loka adhipati ottappa adhikaḥ dhammo
translated: The Dhamma is the master and the modest person is the one who has modesty as his master.

original: nāmāyaṃ mahānubhāvo ekantaniyyāniko, so ca paṭipattiyāva pūjetabbo. Tasmā “naṃ sīlasampadāya
analyzed: nāma ayam mahā anubhāvaḥ ekanta niyyāniko so ca paṭipattiyā ava pūjetabbo tasmā nam sīla sampadāya
translated: The Dhamma is powerful and leads to complete emancipation. It should be worshipped by practice.

original: pūjessāmī”ti evaṃ dhammamahattaṃ pūjetukāmena.🔽Parāmaṭṭhattāti parābhavavasena āmaṭṭhattā. Taṇhādiṭṭhiyo hi “imināhaṃ sīlena devo
analyzed: pūjessāmi iti evam dhamma mahattam pūjetu kāmena  parāmaṭṭha ttā ati parābhava vasena āmaṭṭha ttā taṇhā diṭṭhiyaḥ hi iminā aham sīlena devaḥ
translated: “I will worship it” means “I will worship it by the greatness of the Dhamma.”🔽“Because it is not clung to”: because it is not clung to by the clinging of views and craving in the way beginning “By this virtue or practice or spiritual life or sīla I shall become a

original: vā bhavissāmi devaññataro vā, iminā me sīlena saṃsārasuddhi bhavissatī”ti pavattassa
analyzed: vā bhavissāmi devaññataraḥ vā iminā me sīlena saṃsāra suddhi bhavissati iti pavattassa
translated: god or a Brahmā” or “Purification is through the spiritual life” .

original: sīlaṃ parāmasantiyo taṃ parābhavaṃ pāpenti maggassa anupanissayabhāvakaraṇato. Puthujjanakalyāṇakassāti
analyzed: sīlam tam parābhavam pāpenti maggassa an upanissaya bhāva karaṇato puthujjana kalyāṇakassa ati
translated: For craving and views cling to virtue and make it their own, and they lead it to destruction by preventing it from becoming a condition for the path.

original: puthujjanesu kalyāṇakassa. So hi puthujjanova hutvā kalyāṇehi sīlādīhi samannāgato.🔽Parāmasanakilesānaṃ vikkhambhanato, samucchindanato ca tehi na parāmaṭṭhanti aparāmaṭṭhaṃ.
analyzed: puthujjanesu kalyāṇakassa so hi puthujjanaḥ uva hutvā kalyāṇehi sīla ādīhi samannāgato  parāmasana kilesānam vikkhambhanataḥ samucchindanataḥ ca tehi na parāmaṭṭhanti a parāmaṭṭham
translated: “Of the good person among worldlings”: of the good person among worldlings. For he is a worldling only in name, but he is endowed with good virtue, etc.🔽“Because it is not clung to by the defilements of clinging”: because it is not clung to by the defilements of clinging that occur thus, “By this virtue or practice or spiritual life or sīla I shall become a god or a Brahmā” or “Purification is through the spiritual life” .

original: Tassa tassa kilesadarathassa paṭippassambhanato vūpasamanato paṭippassaddhaṃ.
analyzed: tassa tassa kilesa darathassa paṭippassambhanataḥ vūpasamanataḥ paṭippassaddham
translated: “Because it is tranquilized”: because it is tranquilized, because it is calmed, by the suppression and by the cutting off of the defilements.

original: Katapaṭikammanti vuṭṭhānadesanāhi yathādhammaṃ katapaṭikāraṃ. Evaṃ hi taṃ sīlaṃ paṭipākatikameva
analyzed: kata paṭikammam ti vuṭṭhāna desanāhi yathādhammam kata paṭikāram evam hi tam sīlam paṭipākatikam eva
translated: “Because amends have been made for it”: because amends have been made for it in accordance with the Dhamma by means of the acknowledgment of offenses. For that virtue is only a substitute for the virtue that has been destroyed.

original: hoti. Tenāha “taṃ visuddha”nti. “Katapaṭikamma”nti iminā ca “na punevaṃ karissa”nti
analyzed: hoti tena āha tam visuddham ti kata paṭikammam ti iminā ca na puna evam karissanti
translated: “He has purified himself” is said. And by “he has made amends” is meant that he has undertaken not to do it again.

original: adhiṭṭhānampi saṅgahitanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. “Acchamaṃsaṃ nu kho, sūkaramaṃsaṃ nu kho”tiādinā🔽vatthumhi vā, “pācittiyaṃ nu kho, dukkaṭaṃ nu kho”tiādinā āpattiyā vā, “mayā taṃ
analyzed: adhiṭṭhānam pi saṅgahitanti daṭṭhabbam accha maṃsam nu kho sūkara maṃsam nu kho iti ādinā  vatthumhi vā pācittiyam nu kho dukkaṭam nu kho ti ādinā āpattiyā vā mayā tam
translated: It should be understood that the undertaking of a rule of training is included here too.🔽When he is in doubt about the subject of the offense, thinking “Was it pork or was it beef?”🔽or when he is in doubt about the offense, thinking “Was it an offense entailing suspension or an offense entailing confession?”

original: vatthu vītikkantaṃ nu kho, na nu kho vītikkanta”ntiādinā ajjhācāre vā vematikassa
analyzed: vatthu vītikkantam nu kho na nu kho vītikkanta nti ādinā ajjhācāre vā vematikassa
translated: or when he is in doubt about the action, thinking “Have I committed that offense or not?”🔽he should resolve his doubt in accordance with the Teaching.

original: saṃsayāpannassa. Visodhetabbaṃ yathādhammaṃ paṭikammena. Vimati eva vematikaṃ, tasmiṃ🔽vematike sati, vimatiyā uppannāyāti attho. Vimati paṭivinetabbāti sayaṃ vā taṃ vatthuṃ
analyzed: saṃsaya āpannassa visodhetabbam yathādhammam paṭikammena vimati eva vematikam tasmin  vematike sati vimatiyā uppannāya ati atthaḥ vimati paṭivinetabbā ati sayam vā tam vatthum
translated: The meaning is: when doubt has arisen, because of doubt.

original: vicāretvā, vinayadhare vā pucchitvā kaṅkhā vinodetabbā. Nikkaṅkhena pana kappiyaṃ
analyzed: vicāretvā vinaya dhare vā pucchitvā kaṅkhā vinodetabbā nikkaṅkhena pana kappiyam
translated: He should resolve the doubt either by investigating the matter himself or by questioning those who know the Monastic Law.🔽But if he is sure that it is allowable, he should do it; if he is sure that it is not allowable, he should stop.

original: ce kātabbaṃ, akappiyaṃ ce chaḍḍetabbaṃ. Tenāha “iccassa phāsu bhavissatī”ti.
analyzed: ce kātabbam a kappiyam ce chaḍḍetabbam tena āha iccassa phāsu bhavissati iti
translated: “In this way he will be at ease.”

original: “Catūhi ariyamaggehī”tiādinā maggaphalapariyāpannaṃ sīlaṃ maggaphalasampayuttaṃ vuttaṃ. Samudāyesu pavattavohārā avayavesupi pavattantīti. Sesanti sabbaṃ lokiyasīlaṃ.
analyzed: catūhi ariya maggehi iti ādinā magga phala pariyāpannam sīlam magga phala sampayuttam vuttam samudāyesu pavatta vohārāḥ avayavesu pi pavattanti iti sesanti sabbam lokiya sīlam
translated: “With the four noble paths” : virtue included in the path and fruit is said to be associated with the path and fruit. Expressions used in reference to a collection are used in reference to the components of the collection. “The rest” : all mundane virtue.

original: Pakatipīti sabhāvopi. Sukhasīlo sakhilo sukhasaṃvāso. Tena pariyāyenāti pakatiatthavācakatthena.
analyzed: sabhāvaḥ api sukha sīlaḥ sa khilaḥ sukha saṃvāso tena pariyāyena ati pakati attha vācaka tthena
translated: “By nature” : by essence. “Virtuous by nature” : one who has virtue by nature, who is gentle, easy to live with. “By that method” : by the method of expressing the meaning of the word “nature.”

original: Ekaccaṃ abyākataṃ sīlaṃ idhādhippetasīlena ekasaṅgahanti akusalassevāyujjamānataṃ🔽dassetuṃ “tattha akusala”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Tathā hi sekkhattikaṃ idha gahitaṃ, idha
analyzed: ekaccam abyākatam sīlam idha adhippeta sīlena eka saṅga hanti  dassetum tattha akusala nti ādi vuttam tathā hi sekkhattikam idha gahitam idha
translated: Some indeterminate virtue is included in the virtue intended here.🔽“Therein, the unwholesome” is stated in order to show that the unwholesome is not included in the wholesome.

original: na upanītaṃ kusalattikanti adhippāyo. Vuttanayenevāti vutteneva nayena kusalattikaṃ
analyzed: na upanītam kusala ttikam ti adhippāyaḥ vutta nayena iva ati vuttena iva nayena kusala ttikam
translated: For the threefold virtue of the trainee is included here, but the threefold virtue of the adept is not included here.

original: aggahetvā hīnattikādīnaṃ pañcannaṃ tikānaṃ vasena assa sīlassa tividhatā veditabbā.🔽13. Yodhāti yo idha. Vatthuvītikkameti āpattiyā vatthuno vītikkamane ajjhācāre. Kāmasaṅkappādayo
analyzed: aggahetvā hīnattika ādīnam pañcannam tikānam vasena assa sīlassa tividha tā veditabbā 🔽yo idha vatthu vītikkameti āpattiyāḥ vatthuno vītikkamane ajjhācāre kāma saṅkappa ādayaḥ
translated: “By the same method” : by the same method as stated above, without taking up the threefold virtue of the wholesome, the threefold virtue should be understood by way of the five triads beginning with the inferior.

original: nava mahāvitakkā micchāsaṅkappā. Evarūpassāti edisassa. Tassa hi sīlavante anupasaṅkamitvā
analyzed: nava mahā vitakkāḥ micchā saṅkappāḥ evarūpassa ati edisassa tassa hi sīlavante an upasaṅkamitvā
translated: The nine great reasons are wrong thoughts. Such as these: for if he does not approach the virtuous man but

original: dussīle sevantassa tato eva tesaṃ diṭṭhānugatiṃ āpajjanena paṇṇattivītikkame adosadassāvino🔽micchāsaṅkappabahulatāya manacchaṭṭhāni indriyāni arakkhato sīlaṃ ekaṃseneva hānabhāgiyaṃ
analyzed: dussīle sevantassa tatas eva tesam diṭṭha anugatim āpajjanena paṇṇatti vītikkame a dosa dassāvino  micchā saṅkappa bahula tāya indriyāni a rakkhato sīlam ekaṃsena iva hāna bhāgiyam
translated: serves the immoral man, then he falls into line with their views and, being unobservant of the danger in transgressing the rules,🔽he is full of wrong thoughts. So his six internal bases are unguarded. His virtue is only of the kind that partakes of diminution, not of the kind that partakes of steadiness, much less of the kind that partakes of distinction.

original: hoti, na ṭhitibhāgiyaṃ, kuto visesādibhāgiyatā. Sīlasampattiyāti sīlapāripūriyā catupārisuddhisīlena.
analyzed: hoti na ṭhiti bhāgiyam kutas visesa ādi bhāgiya tā sīla sampattiyā ati sīla pāripūriyā catu pārisuddhi sīlena
translated: By virtue’s excellence: by the fulfilment of virtue consisting in the four purifications of virtue .

original: Aghaṭantassa uttarīti uttari visesādhigamāya avāyamantassa. Ṭhitibhāgiyaṃ sīlaṃ bhavati
analyzed: a ghaṭantassa uttari iti uttari visesa adhigamāya avāyamantassa ṭhiti bhāgiyam sīlam bhavati
translated: Not striving: not making effort for the attainment of distinction. His virtue is of the kind that partakes of steadiness

original: asamādhisaṃvattaniyattā. Sampādite hi samādhismiṃ sīlassa samādhisaṃvattaniyatā nicchiyati.
analyzed: a samādhi saṃvatta niyat tā sampādite hi samādhismin sīlassa samādhi saṃvatta niyatā
translated: because it leads to concentration. For when concentration has been perfected, virtue is confirmed as leading to concentration.

original: Samādhatthāyāti samathavasena samādhānatthāya. Nibbidanti vipassanaṃ. Balavavipassanādassanatthaṃ
analyzed: samādhatthāya ati samatha vasena samādhāna atthāya nibbidanti vipassanam balava vipassanā dassana ttham
translated: For concentration: for the sake of concentration by means of serenity. Disenchantment: insight. For the sake of showing that insight is powerful

original: nibbidāgahaṇaṃ tāvatāpi sīlassa nibbedhabhāgiyabhāvasiddhito.
analyzed: nibbidā gahaṇam tāvatā api sīlassa nibbedha bhāgiya bhāva siddhito
translated: The inclusion of dispassion is established as a factor of penetration by virtue.🔽The construction is: “The training precepts which should be guarded by them.”

original: Yāni ca sikkhāpadāni nesaṃ rakkhitabbānīti sambandho, tāni pana asādhāraṇapaññattito
analyzed: yāni ca sikkhāpadāni nesam rakkhitabbāni iti sambandhaḥ tāni pana asādhāraṇa paññattitaḥ
translated: But these are other than the training precepts which are the subject of the sutta.🔽The word “them” is in the genitive case because of the word “should be guarded” .

original: aññāni. Nesanti “rakkhitabbānī”ti padaṃ apekkhitvā kattari sāmivacanaṃ, tehi bhikkhūhīti
analyzed: aññāni na isanti rakkhitabbāni iti padam apekkhitvā kattari sāmi vacanam tehi bhikkhūhi iti
translated: The meaning is: “by those bhikkhus.”

original: attho. Sati vā ussāheti ussakkitvā sīlāni rakkhituṃ ussāhe sati. Dasāti sāmaṇerehi
analyzed: attho sati vai ussāheti ussakkitvā sīlāni rakkhitum ussāhe sati dasāti sāmaṇerehi
translated: Or alternatively, “if there is zeal” means if there is zeal to guard virtue by striving.🔽“Eight” refers to the virtue to be guarded by novices, like that of Ghaṭīkāra and others.

original: rakkhitabbasīlamāha ghaṭikārādīnaṃ viya. Aṭṭhāti naccādimālādiveramaṇiṃ ekaṃ katvā
analyzed: rakkhitabba sīlam āha ghaṭi kārā ādīnam viya nacca ādi mālā di veramaṇim ekam katvā
translated: “Ten” refers to the eight principal precepts together with the refraining from dancing, singing, music, and looking at dancing, etc.,

original: sabbapacchimavajjāni aṭṭha.🔽Avītikkamoti pañcannaṃ sīlānaṃ avītikkamo. Pakatisīlanti sabhāvasīlaṃ. Tatrūpapattiniyataṃ
analyzed: sabba pacchima vajjāni aṭṭha  avītikkamaḥ ti pañcannam sīlānam avītikkamaḥ pakati sīlam tatru upapatti niyatam
translated: which is the last of the eight.🔽“Non-transgression” is non-transgression of the five precepts.🔽“Natural virtue” is natural morality. For the virtue of the Uttarakurus is determined by rebirth.

original: hi sīlaṃ uttarakurukānaṃ. Mariyādācārittanti tassa tassa sāvajjassa akaraṇe mariyādabhūtaṃ,
analyzed: hi sīlam uttarakurukānam tassa tassa sāvajjassa a karaṇe mariyāda bhūtam
translated: “Conventional virtue” is the conventional rule for not doing this or that wrong,

original: tattha tattha kulādīsu pubbapurisehi ṭhapitaṃ cārittaṃ. Kuladesapāsaṇḍadhammo hi
analyzed: tattha tattha kula ādīsu pubba purisehi ṭhapitam cārittam kula desa pāsaṇḍa dhammaḥ hi
translated: which is established in such and such families, etc., by the former inhabitants of the country.

original: “ācārasīla”nti adhippetaṃ. Tattha kuladhammo tāva brāhmaṇādīnaṃ amajjapānādi, desadhammo
analyzed: ācāra sīlanti adhippetam tattha kula dhammo tāva brāhmaṇa ādīnam amajja pāna ādi desa dhammo
translated: “The virtue of conduct” is what is meant. Herein, the brahmans’ and so on’s not drinking alcohol and so on is the “family virtue.”

original: ekaccajanapadavāsīnaṃ ahiṃsanādi, pāsaṇḍadhammo titthiyānaṃ yamaniyamādi. Titthiyamataṃ
analyzed: ekacca janapada vāsīnam ahiṃsana ādi pāsaṇḍa dhammaḥ titthiyānam yama niyama ādi titthiya matam
translated: The virtue of the people who live in some districts of not harming living beings and so on is the “local virtue.”🔽The virtue of the ascetics, such as the self-mortification of the naked ascetics, is the “ascetic virtue.” The virtue of the sectarians, such as the Yamas and the Nāṭas, is the “sectarian virtue.”

original: hi diṭṭhipāsena, taṇhāpāsena ca ḍeti pavattati, pāsaṃ vā bādhaṃ ariyavinayassa ḍetīti
analyzed: hi diṭṭhi pāsena taṇhā pāsena ca ḍeti pavattati pāsam vā bādham ariya vinayassa ḍeti iti
translated: For the doctrine of the sectarians spreads by means of the net of views and the net of craving, and it spreads as a snare or a trap for the noble Dispensation.🔽“The virtue of the Bodhisatta’s mother is the “natural virtue.”

original: “pāsaṇḍa”nti vuccati. “Pakatiyā sīlavatī hotī”ti vacanato bodhisattamātu pañcasikkhāpadasīlaṃ
analyzed: pāsaṇḍanti vuccati pakatiyā sīlavatī hoti iti vacanato bodhisatta mātu pañca sikkhāpada sīlam
translated: From the words “She was naturally virtuous” it is evident that the five training precepts of the Bodhisatta’s mother were complete.

original: paripuṇṇameva. Idaṃ pana ukkaṃsagataṃ bodhisattapitaripi cittuppādamattenapi asaṃkiliṭṭhaṃ🔽“dhammatāsīla”nti vuttaṃ. Kāmaguṇūpasaṃhitanti kāmakoṭṭhāsesu assādūpasaṃhitaṃ kāmassādagadhitaṃ.
analyzed: paripuṇṇam eva idam pana ukkaṃsa gatam bodhisatta pitari pi cittuppāda mattena api a saṃkiliṭṭham  dhamma tā sīlanti vuttam kāma guṇa upasaṃhitanti kāma koṭṭhāsesu assāda upasaṃhitam kāma ssāda gadhitam
translated: But this natural virtue of the Bodhisatta’s mother is called “natural virtue” because it was unadulterated even by the mere thought of doing evil.🔽“Virtue associated with the strands of sensual desire” is virtue associated with the gratification of the strands of sensual desire, virtue that is addicted to the enjoyment of sensual desires.

original: Dhammatāsīlanti dhammatāya kāraṇaniyāmena āgataṃ sīlaṃ. Sīlapāramiṃ hi paramukkaṃsaṃ
analyzed: dhammatā sīlam ti dhammatāya kāraṇa niyāmena āgatam sīlam sīla pāramim hi paramukkaṃsam
translated: “Natural virtue” is virtue that has come by reason of natural law.

original: pāpetvā kucchigatassa mahābodhisattassa sīlatejena guṇānubhāvena bodhisattamātu saraseneva
analyzed: pāpetvā kucchigatassa mahā bodhisattassa sīla tejena guṇa anubhāvena bodhisatta mātu sarasena iva
translated: and after bringing it into the womb, the Bodhisatta’s mother’s virtue reached perfection with the perfection of virtue of the Great Being himself, by the power of his virtue and his special qualities.

original: paramasallekhappattaṃ sīlaṃ hoti. Mahākassapādīnanti ādi-saddena bhaddādike saṅgaṇhāti.
analyzed: parama sallekha ppattam sīlam hoti mahākassapa ādīnam ti ādi saddena bhadda ādike saṅgaṇhāti
translated: The Great Kassapa and others: the word “and” includes Bhaddā and the others.

original: Te kira suciraṃ kālaṃ suparisuddhasīlā eva hutvā āgatā. Tenāha “suddhasattāna”nti.
analyzed: te kira su ciram kālam su parisuddha sīlāḥ eva hutvā āgatā tena āha
translated: They had come, it seems, after a long time, having been of quite pure virtue all that time. Hence it is said: “of pure beings.”🔽In those and those births: in the births of the Great Being, the King of the Great Sage, and so on. The cause that was accomplished

original: Tāsu tāsu jātīsūti sīlavarājamahiṃsarājādijātīsu. Pubbe purimajātiyaṃ siddho hetu🔽etassāti pubbahetukasīlaṃ. Idaṃ pana pakatisīlādisamādānena vinā avītikkamalakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: tāsu tāsu jātīsu iti sīlava rāja mahiṃsa rāja ādi jātīsu pubbe purima jātiyam siddhaḥ hetu  etassa ti pubba hetuka sīlam idam pana pakati sīla ādi samādānena vinā avītikkama lakkhaṇam
translated: in the previous birth is the cause of virtue in the present birth.

original: sampattaviratisaṅgahaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: sampatta virati saṅgaham daṭṭhabbam
translated: This virtue should be regarded as having the characteristic of non-transgression, which is attained by the avoidance of the ten courses of unwholesome kamma, and as consisting in the avoidance of the five kinds of wrong livelihood.

original: Yaṃ bhagavatā evaṃ vuttaṃ sīlanti sambandho. Idhāti vakkhamānasīlaparipūrakassa puggalassa
analyzed: yam bhagavatā evam vuttam sīlam ti sambandhaḥ idha āti vakkhamāna sīla paripūrakassa puggalassa
translated: The meaning of the words of the stanza may be thus analysed: “Virtue” is what is meant. “Here” refers to the person who is fulfilling virtue.

original: sannissayabhūtasāsanaparidīpanaṃ, aññasāsanassa ca tathābhāvapaṭisedhanaṃ. Vuttaṃ
analyzed: sannissaya bhūta sāsana paridīpanam añña sāsanassa ca tathābhāva paṭisedhanam vuttaṃ
translated: The Dispensation is shown to be the support for the fulfilment of virtue, and other dispensations are denied that capacity.

original: hetaṃ “idheva, bhikkhave, samaṇo…pe… suññā parappavādā samaṇebhi aññehī”ti. Bhikkhūti
analyzed: ha itam idha iva bhikkhave samaṇa upe suññā parappavādā samaṇebhi aññehi iti bhikkhu iti
translated: “Bhikkhu”: this shows the person who fulfills that virtue.

original: tassa sīlassa paripūrakapuggalaparidīpanaṃ. Pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvutoti idamassa pātimokkhasīle🔽patiṭṭhitabhāvaparidīpanaṃ. Viharatīti idamassa tadanurūpavihārasamaṅgibhāvaparidīpanaṃ.
analyzed: tassa sīlassa paripūraka puggala paridīpanam pātimokkha saṃvara saṃvuto ti idam assa pātimokkha sīle  patiṭṭhita bhāva paridīpanam viharati iti idam assa tad anurūpa vihāra samaṅgi bhāva paridīpanam
translated: “Restrained with the Pātimokkha restraint”: this shows that he is established in virtue consisting in the Pātimokkha rules.🔽“He trains himself” shows that he possesses a way of life in conformity with that .

original: Ācāragocarasampannoti idaṃ pātimokkhasaṃvarassa, upariadhigantabbaguṇānañca upakārakadhammaparidīpanaṃ.
analyzed: ācāra gocara sampanno ti idam pātimokkha saṃvarassa upari adhigantabba guṇānaṃ ca upakāraka dhamma paridīpanaṃ
translated: “Possessed of conduct and resort”: this shows the qualities that are helpful to the virtue of restraint by the Pātimokkha and the qualities that are to be attained above that .

original: Aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvīti idaṃ pātimokkhato acavanabhāvaparidīpanaṃ. Samādāyāti
analyzed: aṇu mattesu vajjesu bhaya dassāvī iti idam pātimokkhataḥ a cavana bhāva paridīpanam samādāya ati
translated: “Seeing fear in the slightest fault”: this shows that he does not transgress the Pātimokkha rules.🔽“Having undertaken” shows that he has taken up the training rules without exception.

original: sikkhāpadānaṃ anavasesato ādānaparidīpanaṃ. Sikkhatīti sikkhāya samaṅgibhāvaparidīpanaṃ.
analyzed: sikkhāpadānam anavasesataḥ ādāna paridīpanam sikkhati iti sikkhāya samaṅgi bhāva paridīpanam
translated: “He trains himself” shows that he possesses the training.

original: Sikkhāpadesūti sikkhitabbadhammaparidīpanaṃ. Yaṃ panettha vattabbaṃ, taṃ parato āvi bhavissati.
analyzed: sikkhāpadesu iti sikkhitabba dhamma paridīpanam yat pana ittha vattabbam tat paratas bhavissati
translated: “In the training rules”: this shows the things in which he is to be trained. But what is to be said here will be said later on.

original: Soti pātimokkhasaṃvarasīle patiṭṭhitabhikkhu. Tena yādisassa indriyasaṃvarasīlaṃ
analyzed: so ti pātimokkha saṃvara sīle patiṭṭhita bhikkhu tena yādisassa indriya saṃvara sīlam
translated: The bhikkhu who is established in virtue consisting in restraint by the Patimokkha is the one who is “he.”🔽The kind of virtue consisting in restraint of the sense faculties that he should wish for is shown by the words “If he should wish.”

original: icchitabbaṃ, taṃ dasseti. Cakkhunāti yato so saṃvaro, taṃ dasseti. Rūpanti yattha🔽so saṃvaro, taṃ dasseti. Disvā na nimittaggāhī hoti nānubyañjanaggāhīti saṃvarassa
analyzed: icchitabbam tam dasseti cakkhunā ati yatas so saṃvaro tam dasseti rūpam ti yattha  saḥ saṃvaraḥ tam dasseti disvā na nimitta ggāhī hoti na anubyañjana ggāhī iti saṃvarassa
translated: “Eye” shows the source of the restraint. “ Visible objects” shows what🔽the restraint is in regard to. “On seeing visible objects with the eye” shows the means to the restraint.🔽“He should not grasp at a sign” and “he should not grasp at secondary characteristics” show the danger in the visible objects, etc., as a basis for the arising of lust, etc.

original: upāyaṃ dasseti. Yatvādhikaraṇa…pe… anvāssaveyyunti saṃvarassa paṭipakkhaṃ tattha🔽ādīnavaṃ dasseti. Saṃvarāya paṭipajjatīti pageva satiyā upaṭṭhapetabbataṃ dasseti.
analyzed: upāyam dasseti yatvā adhikaraṇape anvāssaveyyunti saṃvarassa paṭipakkham tattha  ādīnavam dasseti saṃvarāya paṭipajjati iti pagā iva satiyāḥ upaṭṭhapetabba tam dasseti
translated: “He should practice in such a way that evil does not come upon him through the eye” shows the need to establish mindfulness in order to guard the eye faculty.🔽“He guards the eye faculty” shows that the guarding of the eye faculty is done by establishing mindfulness.

original: Rakkhati cakkhundriyanti satiyā upaṭṭhāpanameva cakkhundriyassa ārakkhāti dasseti.🔽Cakkhundriye saṃvaraṃ āpajjatīti tathābhūtā satiyevettha saṃvaroti dasseti. Vītikkamassa
analyzed: rakkhati cakkhu indriyanti satiyāḥ upaṭṭhāpanam eva cakkhu indriyassa ārakkha ati dasseti  cakkhu indriye saṃvaram āpajjati iti tathābhūtā satiyā iva itthā saṃvaraḥ ti dasseti vītikkamassa
translated: “He enters upon the way of its restraint” shows that the restraint itself is just that mindfulness.🔽The connection is this: “If he should wish: ‘May I, with the breakup of the body, after death, be reborn among the devas of the heaven of the Four Great Kings’ …🔽‘among the devas of the heaven of the Thirty-three’ … ‘among the Yama devas’ … ‘among the Tusita devas’ … ‘among the devas who delight in creating’ … ‘among the devas who wield power over others’ creations’ … ‘may I become a Wheel-turning Monarch, a righteous king who rules by the Dhamma, possessing the seven treasures,

original: vasenāti sambandho. Channaṃ sikkhāpadānanti “ājīvahetu ājīvakāraṇā asantaṃ abhūtaṃ
analyzed: vasena ati sambandhaḥ channam sikkhā padānam ti ājīva hetu ājīva kāraṇā asantam abhūtam
translated: Translation: Soti pātimokkhasaṃvarasīle patiṭṭhitabhikkhu | Tena yādisassa indriyasaṃvarasīlaṃ icchitabbaṃ, taṃ dasseti | Cakkhunāti yato so saṃvaro, taṃ dasseti | Rūpanti yattha so saṃvaro, taṃ dasseti | Disvā na nimittaggāhī hoti nānubyañjanaggāhīti saṃvarassa upāyaṃ dasseti | Yatvādhikaraṇā ti ādiṃ ādiṃ katvā yāva anvāssaveyyāti saṃvarassa paṭipakkhaṃ tattha ādīnavaṃ dasseti | Saṃvarāya paṭipajjatīti pageva sati

original: uttarimanussadhammaṃ ullapatī”tiādinā āgatānaṃ channaṃ pārājikādipaṭisaṃyuttānaṃ
analyzed: uttari manussa dhammam ullapati itiādinā āgatānam channam pārājika ādi paṭisaṃyuttānam
translated: The six training precepts beginning with the one on superhuman qualities are given in the passage: “He boasts about superhuman qualities” .

original: sikkhāpadānaṃ. Sāmantajappanādinā tividhena kuhanavatthunā vimhāpanaṃ kuhanā. Attānaṃ,🔽dāyakaṃ vā ukkhipitvā yathā so kiñci dadāti, evaṃ kathanaṃ lapanā. Nimittaṃ vuccati
analyzed: sikkhāpadānam sāmanta jappana ādinā tividhena kuhana vatthunā vimhāpanam kuhanā attānam  dāyakam vā ukkhipitvā yathā saḥ kiñci dadāti evam kathanam lapanā nimittam vuccati
translated: Deceit is the deceiving of others by the three kinds of scheming, namely, by scheming with regard to speech, with regard to action, and with regard to goods.🔽Flattery is the speaking in such and such a way in order to get something from someone, by praising him, by speaking pleasantly to him, by doing him some service, or by hinting.🔽The sign is bodily and verbal action that causes the other to understand that one is giving a requisite. One who acts by means of that sign is a fortune-teller. The state of that is fortune-telling.

original: paccayadānasaññuppādakaṃ kāyavacīkammaṃ, tena nimittena carati, nimittaṃ vā karotīti🔽nemittiko, tassa bhāvo nemittikatā. Gandhādayo viya lābhāya paresaṃ akkosanādinā
analyzed: paccaya dāna saññā uppādakam kāya vacī kammam tena nimittena carati nimittam vā karoti iti  nemittikaḥ tassa bhāvaḥ nemittika tā gandha ādayaḥ viya lābhāya paresam akkosana ādinā
translated: One who is envious is jealous. The state of that is envy.🔽One who is avaricious is miserly. The state of that is miserliness.🔽One who is fraudulent is a cheat. The state of that is cheating.🔽One who is a hypocrite is a braggart. The state of that is bragging.🔽One who is a schemer is a deceiver. The state of that is scheming.🔽One who is a flatterer is a crawler. The state of that is crawling.🔽One who is a fortune-teller is a diviner. The state of that is fortune-telling.🔽One who is envious is jealous. The state of that is envy.🔽One who is avaricious is miserly. The state of that is miserliness.🔽One who is fraudulent is a cheat. The state of that is cheating.

original: nipisatīti nippeso, nippesova nippesiko, tassa bhāvo nippesikatā. Mahicchatāya attanā
analyzed: nipisati iti nippesaḥ nippeso uva nippesiko tassa bhāvaḥ nippesika tā mahiccha tāya attanā
translated: One who is a hypocrite is a braggart. The state of that is bragging.🔽One who is a schemer is a deceiver. The state of that is scheming.🔽One who is a flatterer is a crawler. The state of that is crawling.🔽One who is a fortune-teller is a diviner. The state of that is fortune-telling.🔽One who is envious is jealous. The state of that is envy.🔽One who is avaricious is miserly. The state of that is miserliness.🔽One who is fraudulent is a cheat. The state of that is cheating.

original: laddhalābhena parato lābhapariyesanā lābhena lābhaṃ nijigīsanatā. Evamādīnanti ādi-saddena
analyzed: laddha lābhena paratas lābha pariyesanā lābhena lābham nijigīsana tā ādi saddena
translated: One who is a hypocrite is a braggart. The state of that is bragging.🔽One who is a schemer is a deceiver. The state of that is scheming.🔽One who is a flatterer is a crawler. The state of that is crawling.

original: anuppiyabhāṇitācāṭukamyatādiṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Paṭisaṅkhānena paccavekkhaṇāya parisuddho
analyzed: anuppiya bhāṇita ācāṭu kamya tā ādim saṅgaṇhāti paṭisaṅkhānena paccavekkhaṇāya parisuddhaḥ
translated: One who

original: asaṃkiliṭṭho paṭisaṅkhānaparisuddho. Cattāro paccayā paribhuñjīyanti etenāti catupaccayaparibhogo,
analyzed: a saṃkiliṭṭho paṭisaṅkhāna parisuddho cattāro paccayā paribhuñjīyanti etena ati catu paccaya paribhogo
translated: and it is untorn, being purified by reviewing. It is the enjoyment of the four requisites with that,

original: tathāpavattā anavajjacetanā.
analyzed: tathā apavattā anavajja cetanā
translated: and the volition that occurs thus is blameless.

original: Pātimokkhasaṃvarasīlavaṇṇanā
translated: The virtue of the Pāṭimokkha restraint🔽Herein, among the Pāṭimokkha restraint, etc.,

original: 14. Tatrāti tesu pātimokkhasaṃvarādīsu. Ādito paṭṭhāyāti “idha bhikkhū”tiādinā āgatadesanāya
analyzed: tatra ati tesu pātimokkha saṃvara ādīsu āditaḥ paṭṭhāya ati idha bhikkhu iti ādinā āgata desanāya
translated: From the beginning: from the beginning of the teaching given in the words “Here bhikkhus” , etc.

original: ādito pabhuti. Vinicchayakathāti tattha saṃsayavidhamanena vinicchayāvahā kathā.
analyzed: āditas vinicchaya kathā ti tattha saṃsaya vidhamanena vinicchaya āvahā kathā
translated: Discussion of the decision: talk that leads to a decision by the removal of doubt there.

original: Paṭhamassa atthassa sabbasādhāraṇattā asādhāraṇaṃ pabbajitāveṇikaṃ pariyāyaṃ dassento🔽“chinnabhinnapaṭadharāditāya vā”ti āha. Evaṃ hissa paripuṇṇapātimokkhasaṃvarayogyatā
analyzed: paṭhamassa atthassa sabba sādhāraṇa ttā asādhāraṇam pabbajita āveṇikam pariyāyam dassento  chinna bhinna paṭadhara āditāya vā ati āha evam hi ssa paripuṇṇa pātimokkha saṃvara yogya tā
translated: Since the first meaning is common to all, he shows the method that is not common to worldlings, which is special to those gone forth,🔽saying “or because of wearing a robe made of scraps, etc.” For in this way his fitness for the restraint of the Pāṭimokkha is shown to be complete.

original: dassitā hoti. Bhinnapaṭadharādibhāvo ca nāma daliddassāpi niggahitassa hotīti tato
analyzed: dassitā hoti bhinna paṭadhara ādi bhāvo ca nāma daliddassa api niggahitassa hoti iti tatas
translated: And since even a poor man who has been restrained can have a robe made of scraps, etc.,

original: visesetuṃ “saddhāpabbajito”ti vatvā paṭipattiyā yogyabhāvadassanatthaṃ “kulaputto”ti
analyzed: visesetum saddhā pabbajito ti vatvā paṭipattiyā yogya bhāva dassana attham kula putto ti
translated: in order to distinguish him, he says “gone forth out of faith,” and in order to show that he is fit for practice he says “a clansman.”

original: vuttaṃ. Ācārakulaputto vā hi paṭipajjituṃ sakkoti jātikulaputto vā. Sikkhāpadasīlanti🔽cārittavārittappabhedaṃ sikkhāpadavasena paññattaṃ sīlaṃ. Yoti aniyamaniddeso yo🔽koci puggalo. Nanti vinayapariyāpannaṃ sīlaṃ. Tanti puggalaṃ. Mokkheti sahakārikāraṇabhāvato.🔽Apāye bhavāni āpāyikāni. Ādi-saddena tadaññaṃ sabbasaṃsāradukkhaṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Saṃvaraṇaṃ🔽kāyavacīdvārānaṃ pidahanaṃ. Yena te saṃvutā pihitā honti, so saṃvaro. Yasmā pana
analyzed: vuttam ācāra kula puttaḥ vā hi paṭipajjitum sakkoti jāti kula putto vā sikkhāpada sīlan ti  cāritta vāritta ppabhedam sikkhāpada vasena paññattam sīlam yaḥ ti aniyama niddesaḥ yaḥ  koci puggalaḥ vinaya pariyāpannam sīlam tanti puggalam mokkheti sahakāri kāraṇa bhāvato  apāye bhavāni āpāyikāni ādi saddena tad aññam sabba saṃsāra dukkham saṅgaṇhāti saṃvaraṇam  pidahanam yena te saṃvutāḥ pihitāḥ honti saḥ saṃvaraḥ yasmai pana
translated: For one of good conduct or one of good birth can practice it.🔽The “training precepts” are virtue that is laid down in terms of training precepts, which are divided into “courses of right conduct” and “courses of restraint.”🔽“Anyone” is a reference to any person.🔽“Virtue” is virtue that falls within the Vinaya.🔽“That” refers to the person.🔽“Liberates” means that it is a contributory cause.🔽“Evil destinations” are the states of loss. The word “etc.” includes all the suffering of the round of rebirths.🔽“Restraint” is the checking of the doors of the body and speech.🔽That by which they are checked and closed is “restraint.”

original: so sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ avītikkamo vītikkamapaṭipakkhoti katvā, tasmā vuttaṃ🔽“kāyikavācasikassa avītikkamassetaṃ nāma”nti. Pātimokkhasaṃvarena saṃvutoti pātimokkhasaṃvarena🔽pihitakāyavacīdvāro. Tathābhūto ca yasmā taṃ upeto tena ca samaṅgī nāma hoti, tasmā
analyzed: so sattannam āpatti kkhandhānam a vītikkamaḥ vītikkama paṭipakkhaḥ ti katvā tasmai vuttam 🔽kāyika vācasikassa avītikkamassa etam nāmanti pātimokkha saṃvarena saṃvutaḥ ti pātimokkha saṃvarena 🔽pihita kāyavacī dvāraḥ tathābhūtaḥ ca yasmai tam upetaḥ tena ca samaṅgī nāma hoti tasmai
translated: For one of good birth or one of good conduct can practice it. The training precepts’ virtue: virtue that is laid down in terms of training precepts, which are divided into prohibitions and permissions. Whoever: this is an indefinite expression. Any: virtue included in the Monastic Law. That: a person. Is called: in the sense of a co-operating cause. Bad destinations: the bad destinations. The word “etc.” includes the other kinds of suffering in the round of rebirths. Restraint: the restraining of the doors of the body and speech. That by which they are restrained, closed, is restraint. But since that is the non-transgression of the seven classes of offenses, the opposite of transgression, therefore it is said: “It is called the non-transgression of bodily and verbal action.” Restrained by restraint according to the Monastic Law: restrained by the Monastic Law, with the doors of the body and speech closed. And since one who is such is provided with that, and is thus called “endowed with it,”

original: vuttaṃ “upagato samannāgatoti attho”ti.
analyzed: vuttam upagataḥ samannāgataḥ ti attho ti
translated: “Approached, possessed, is the meaning” .

original: Aparo nayo – kilesānaṃ balavabhāvato, pāpakiriyāya sukarabhāvato, puññakiriyāya ca🔽dukkarabhāvato bahukkhattuṃ apāyesu patanasīloti pātī, puthujjano. Aniccatāya vā🔽bhavādīsu kammavegakkhitto ghaṭiyantaṃ viya anavaṭṭhānena paribbhamanato gamanasīloti
analyzed: aparaḥ nayaḥ kilesānam balava bhāvataḥ pāpa kiriyāya sukara bhāvataḥ puñña kiriyāya ca  dukkara bhāvataḥ bahu kkhattum apāyesu patana sīlaḥ iti pātī puthujjanaḥ aniccatāya vā  bhava ādīsu kamma vega kkhittaḥ ghaṭiyantam viya anavaṭṭhānena paribbhamanataḥ gamana sīlaḥ ti
translated: Another method: because defilements are strong in him, because evil-doing is easy for him, and because good-doing is difficult for him,

original: pātī, maraṇavasena vā tamhi tamhi sattanikāye attabhāvassa pātanasīloti pātī, sattasantāno,🔽cittameva vā. Taṃ pātinaṃ saṃsāradukkhato mokkhetīti pātimokkhaṃ. Cittassa hi vimokkhena
analyzed: pātī maraṇa vasena vā tamhi tamhi satta nikāye atta bhāvassa pātana sīlo ti pātī satta santāno  cittam eva vā tam pātinam saṃsāra dukkhataḥ mokkheti iti pātimokkham cittassa hi vimokkhena
translated: he is a “faller” , a worldling, because he is prone to fall into the states of loss many times. Or he is a “faller” because he is prone to go, to wander about without rest, like a waterwheel, in the states of existence, owing to the impetus of kamma and defilements, or because he is prone to fall, to drop off, in each of the various kinds of generation, owing to death.

original: satto “vimutto”ti vuccati. Vuttaṃ hi “cittavodānā visujjhantī”ti, “anupādāya āsavehi
analyzed: sattaḥ vimuttaḥ ti vuccati vuttam hi citta vodānāḥ visujjhanti iti an upādāya āsavehi
translated: The “faller” is a being’s continuity, or it is the mind. The “Pāṭimokkha” is that by which he is freed from the suffering of the round of rebirths. For it is said that “a being is called ‘freed’ when his mind is liberated” , and “he is purified by the surmounting of the mind’s bondage” , and “his mind is liberated from taints through non-clinging” .

original: cittaṃ vimutta”nti ca. Atha vā avijjādinā hetunā saṃsāre patati gacchati pavattatīti
analyzed: cittam vimuttanti ca atha vā avijjā ādinā hetunā saṃsāre patati gacchati pavattati iti
translated: Or alternatively, he falls, he goes, he moves on, in the round of rebirths owing to ignorance, etc., as cause,

original: pātī, “avijjānīvaraṇānaṃ sattānaṃ taṇhāsaṃyojanānaṃ sandhāvataṃ saṃsarata”nti hi
analyzed: pātī avijjā nīvaraṇānam sattānam taṇhā saṃyojanānam sandhāvatam hi
translated: “The round of rebirths is the round of births of beings hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving” .

original: vuttaṃ. Tassa pātino sattassa taṇhādisaṃkilesattayato mokkho etenāti pātimokkhaṃ.
analyzed: vuttam tassa pātinaḥ sattassa taṇhā ādi saṃkilesa ttayataḥ mokkhaḥ etena ati pātimokkham
translated: So the Pātimokkha is that by means of which there is deliverance from the three defilements of craving, etc., of the being who is fallen into the round of rebirths.

original: “Kaṇṭhekāḷo”tiādīnaṃ viyassa samāsasiddhi veditabbā. Atha vā pāteti vinipāteti dukkheti
analyzed: kaṇṭhekāḷa uti ādīnam veditabbā atha vā pāteti vinipāteti dukkha iti
translated: The compound pātimokkha should be understood to be resolved in the way beginning “pāte kaṇṭhekāḷo” . Or alternatively, it is fallen into , is brought down into , suffering,

original: pāti, cittaṃ. Vuttaṃ hi “cittena nīyati loko, cittena parikassatī”ti. Tassa pātino🔽mokkho etenāti pātimokkhaṃ, patati vā etena apāyadukkhe, saṃsāradukkhe cāti pātī,
analyzed: pāti cittam vuttam hi cittena nīyati lokaḥ cittena parikassati iti tassa pātinaḥ  mokkhaḥ etena ati pātimokkham patati vā etena apāya dukkhe saṃsāra dukkhe ca ati pātī
translated: by citta, for this is said: “The world is led by mind, drawn by mind” . So the Pātimokkha is that by means of which there is deliverance from the fallen,

original: taṇhādisaṃkileso. Vuttaṃ hi “taṇhā janeti purisaṃ, taṇhādutiyo puriso”ti ca ādi.
analyzed: taṇhā ādi saṃkilesaḥ vuttam hi taṇhā janeti purisam taṇhā dutiyaḥ purisaḥ ti ca ādi
translated: from the defilements of craving, etc., for this is said: “Craving generates the person, The person is accompanied by craving” , and so on.

original: Tato pātito mokkhoti pātimokkhaṃ. Atha vā patati etthāti pātīni, cha ajjhattikabāhirāni
analyzed: tatas pātitaḥ mokkho ti pātimokkham atha vā patati ettha ati pātīni cha ajjhattika bāhirāni
translated: So the Pātimokkha is that by means of which there is deliverance from the fallen, from the defilements of craving, etc. Or alternatively, it is fallen into , is brought down into , the suffering of the states of loss,🔽and the suffering of the round of rebirths, by this,

original: āyatanāni. Vuttaṃ hi “chasu loko samuppanno, chasu kubbati santhava”nti. Tato chaajjhattikabāhirāyatanasaṅkhātato
analyzed: āyatanāni vuttam hi chasu lokaḥ samuppannaḥ chasu kubbati santhavanti tatas cha ajjhattika bāhira āyatana saṅkhātataḥ
translated: so it is a faller , and the six internal and external bases are called “the fallen” , for this is said: “The world has arisen in six bases, In six it makes its nest” . So the Pātimokkha is that by means of which there is deliverance from the fallen, from the six internal and external bases.

original: pātito mokkhoti pātimokkhaṃ. Atha vā pāto vinipāto assa atthīti pātī, saṃsāro. Tato
analyzed: pātitaḥ mokkho ti pātimokkham atha vā pāto vinipātaḥ assa atthi iti pātī saṃsāro tato
translated: “The escape from the fall” is the Pāṭimokkha. Or alternatively, “The fall” is the round of rebirths, since there is a falling into it.

original: mokkhoti pātimokkhaṃ, atha vā sabbalokādhipatibhāvato dhammissaro bhagavā “patī”ti🔽vuccati. Muccati etenāti mokkho, patino mokkho tena paññattattāti patimokkho, patimokkho
analyzed: mokkho ti pātimokkham atha vā sabba loka adhipati bhāvataḥ dhammissaraḥ bhagavā pati iti  vuccati muccati etena ati mokkhaḥ patinaḥ mokkho tena paññatta ttā ati patimokkhaḥ patimokkho
translated: “The escape from that” is the Pāṭimokkha. Or alternatively, the Blessed One, as the Lord of the Dhamma, is called “the faller” because of his lordship over the whole world.

original: eva pātimokkhaṃ. Sabbaguṇānaṃ vā mūlabhāvato uttamaṭṭhena pati ca so yathāvuttenatthena
analyzed: eva sabba guṇānam vā mūla bhāvataḥ uttama aṭṭhena ca saḥ yathāvuttena atthena
translated: “The escape by means of that” is the Pāṭimokkha. Or alternatively, the Pāṭimokkha is the faller and the escape, since it is the root of all good qualities in the sense of being their supreme foundation.

original: mokkho cāti patimokkho, patimokkho eva pātimokkhaṃ. Tathā hi vuttaṃ “pātimokkhanti🔽mukhametaṃ pamukhameta”nti vitthāro.🔽Atha vā pa-iti pakāre, atī-ti accantatthe nipāto, tasmā pakārehi accantaṃ mokkhetīti
analyzed: mokkhaḥ ca ati patimokkhaḥ patimokkhaḥ eva pātimokkham tathā hi vuttam pātimokkham ti  mukham etam pamukham etanti vitthāraḥ  atha vā paiti pakāre ati iti accanta atthe nipāto tasmā pakārehi accantam mokkheti iti
translated: Or the Pāṭimokkha is the faller and the escape in the sense just stated. For this is said: “The Pāṭimokkha is the mouth, the Pāṭimokkha is the front” , and so on.

original: pātimokkhaṃ. Idaṃ hi sīlaṃ sayaṃ tadaṅgavasena, samādhisahitaṃ paññāsahitañca vikkhambhanavasena,
analyzed: pātimokkham idam hi sīlam sayam tad aṅga vasena samādhi sahitam paññā sahitam ca vikkhambhana vasena
translated: Or alternatively, “Pā” is a syllable meaning “bases” , and “timukha” is a syllable meaning “to escape completely.” Thus the Pāṭimokkha is that by means of which one escapes completely from the bases. For this virtue, as a factor of concentration, and as accompanied by concentration and insight, is the escape from the bases in the sense of restraint and in the sense of suppression respectively.

original: samucchedavasena ca accantaṃ mokkheti mocetīti pātimokkhaṃ, pati pati mokkhoti vā
analyzed: samuccheda vasena ca mokkheti moceti iti pātimokkham vā
translated: And it is the Pātimokkha in the sense of “it delivers completely by way of cutting off” and “it delivers, it causes to be delivered,” and “it is a deliverance for each one.”🔽

original: patimokkho, tamhā tamhā vītikkamadosato paccekaṃ mokkhoti attho, patimokkho eva pātimokkhaṃ.🔽Mokkhoti vā nibbānaṃ, tassa mokkhassa paṭibimbabhūtoti patimokkho. Sīlasaṃvaro hi
analyzed: patimokkhaḥ tamhā tamhā vītikkama dosato paccekam mokkho ti attho patimokkhaḥ eva pātimokkham  mokkhaḥ ti vā nibbānam tassa mokkhassa paṭibimba bhūto ti patimokkhaḥ sīla saṃvaraḥ hi
translated: And it is the Pāṭimokkha in the sense of “it delivers utterly” by way of cutting off, and it delivers, it causes to be delivered, thus it is the Pāṭimokkha. Or alternatively, it is the Pāṭimokkha in the sense of “a deliverance for each” , since there is deliverance from each kind of transgression. The Pāṭimokkha itself is the Pāṭimokkha.

original: sūriyassa aruṇuggamanaṃ viya nibbānassa udayabhūto tappaṭibhāgo viya yathārahaṃ kilesanibbāpanato,🔽patimokkhoyeva pātimokkhaṃ. Atha vā mokkhaṃ pati vattati, mokkhābhimukhanti vā patimokkhaṃ,
analyzed: sūriyassa aruṇuggamanam viya nibbānassa udaya bhūtaḥ tad paṭibhāgaḥ viya yathāraham kilesa nibbāpanato  patimokkhaḥ yā iva pātimokkham atha vā mokkham pati vattati mokkha abhimukhanti vā patimokkham
translated: Or alternatively, Nibbāna is deliverance ; and the Pāṭimokkha is the counterpart of that deliverance. For the restraint consisting in the Pāṭimokkha is the dawning of Nibbāna, as it were, since it is a condition for the arising of the higher достижения, and it is a counterpart of Nibbāna since it causes the destruction of defilements in the way appropriate to it,

original: patimokkhameva pātimokkhanti evamettha pātimokkha-saddassa attho veditabbo. Iriyatīti
analyzed: patimokkham eva pātimokkhanti evam ettha pātimokkha saddassa atthaḥ veditabbaḥ iriyati iti
translated: as the rising of the sun is of dawn. The Pāṭimokkha itself is the Pāṭimokkha. Or alternatively, it occurs in conformity with deliverance, or it is directed towards deliverance, thus it is the Pāṭimokkha. The Pāṭimokkha itself is the Pāṭimokkha. This is how the word pāṭimokkha should be understood etymologically.🔽It occurs: it occurs in a person’s continuity.

original: attabhāvaṃ pavatteti. “Viharatī”ti iminā pātimokkhasaṃvarasīle ṭhitassa bhikkhuno
analyzed: atta bhāvam viharati iti iminā pātimokkha saṃvara sīle ṭhitassa bhikkhuno
translated: “He abides”: by this he shows the abiding of a bhikkhu who is established in the virtue of restraint by the Pāṭimokkha.

original: iriyāpathavihāro dassito. Pāḷiyanti jhānavibhaṅgapāḷiyaṃ.
analyzed: iriyāpatha vihāro dassito pāḷiyanti jhāna vibhaṅga pāḷiyam
translated: In the text: in the text of the Jhana Vibhanga.

original: Tattha kāmaṃ samaṇacāraṃ, samaṇagocarañca dassetuṃ “ācāragocarasampanno”ti vuttaṃ,
analyzed: tattha kāmam samaṇa cāram samaṇa gocaram ca dassetum ācāra gocara sampannaḥ ti vuttam
translated: Herein, the words “possessed of the right conduct and resort” are said in order to show the conduct of a recluse and the resort of a recluse.

original: yathā pana maggaṃ ācikkhanto “vāmaṃ muñca, dakkhiṇaṃ gaṇhā”ti vajjetabbapubbakaṃ
analyzed: yathā pana maggam ācikkhantaḥ vāmam muñca dakkhiṇam gaṇhāti vajjetabba pubbakam
translated: But just as one who is explaining a path would say: “Leave the left, take the right,” and would say what is to be left behind and what is to be taken up,

original: gahetabbaṃ vadeyya, yathā vā sasīsanhānena pahīnasedamalajallikassa mālāgandhavilepanādivibhūsanasaṃvidhānaṃ
analyzed: gahetabbam vadeyya yathā vā sasī sanhānena pahīna seda mala jallikassa mālā gandha vilepana ādi vibhūsana saṃvidhānam
translated: or just as it is fitting for one who has abandoned the defilements of passion, hate, and delusion, together with their residues, to adorn himself with garlands, scents, and unguents,

original: yuttarūpaṃ, evaṃ pahīnapāpadhammassa kalyāṇadhammasamāyogo yuttarūpoti “atthi ācāro,
analyzed: yutta rūpam evam pahīna pāpa dhammassa kalyāṇa dhamma samāyogo yutta rūpaḥ ti atthi ācāro
translated: so it is fitting for one who has abandoned evil states to take up good states. Thus, having stated the pair: “There is right conduct, there is wrong conduct,”

original: atthi anācāro”ti dvayaṃ uddisitvā anācāraṃ tāva vibhajituṃ “tattha katamo anācāro”tiādi
analyzed: atthi anācāro ti dvayam uddisitvā anācāram tāva vibhajitum tattha katamaḥ anācāra itiādi
translated: he said: “Herein, what is wrong conduct?” in order to analyze wrong conduct first.

original: vuttaṃ. Tattha kāyiko vītikkamoti tividhaṃ kāyaduccaritaṃ. Vācasiko vītikkamoti catubbidhaṃ
analyzed: vuttam tattha kāyikaḥ vītikkamaḥ ti tividham kāya duccaritam vācasikaḥ vītikkamaḥ ti catubbidham
translated: Herein, bodily transgression is the three kinds of bodily misconduct. Verbal transgression is the four kinds of verbal misconduct.

original: vacīduccaritaṃ. Kāyikavācasikoti tadubhayaṃ.
analyzed: vacīt uccaritam tat ubhayam
translated: Bodily and verbal transgression is both of them.

original: Evaṃ ājīvaṭṭhamakasīlassa vītikkamo dassito. Idāni mānasaṃ anācāraṃ dassetuṃ “sabbampi
analyzed: evam ājīva ṭṭhamaka sīlassa vītikkamaḥ dassitaḥ idāni mānasam anācāram dassetum sabbam pi
translated: Thus the transgression of the virtue consisting in livelihood as the fifth has been shown. Now, in order to show mental wrong conduct, he said: “All mental misconduct” .

original: dussīlyaṃ anācāro”ti vatvā tattha ekacciyaṃ dassento “idhekacco veḷudānena vā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: dussīlyam anācāraḥ iti vatvā tattha ekacciyam dassentaḥ idha ekaccaḥ veḷu dānena vā ati ādim āha
translated: and unvirtuousness is misconduct. ” Then, in order to show the individual cases there, he said, “Here someone gives a gift of a bamboo-slip, etc.”

original: Tattha veḷudānenāti paccayuppādanatthena veḷudānena. Pattadānādīsupi eseva nayo.🔽Veḷūti manussānaṃ payojanāvaho yo koci veḷudaṇḍo. Pattaṃ gandhikādīnaṃ gandhapaliveṭhanādiatthaṃ
analyzed: tattha veḷu dānena ati paccaya uppādana tthena veḷu dānena patta dāna ādīsu pi esa eva nayaḥ  veḷu uti manussānam payojana āvahaḥ yaḥ koci veḷu daṇḍaḥ pattam gandhika ādīnam gandha paliveṭhana ādi attham
translated: Herein, a gift of a bamboo-slip is a gift of a bamboo-slip as a means of making a living. The same method of explanation applies in the case of a gift of a bowl, etc.

original: vā, tālanāḷikerādipattaṃ vā. Pupphaṃ yaṃ kiñci manussānaṃ payojanāvahaṃ. Tathā phalaṃ.
analyzed: vā tāla nāḷikera ādi pattam vā puppham yam kiñci manussānam payojana āvaham tathā phalam
translated: A bamboo-slip is any bamboo-slip that is a means of making a living for human beings. A bowl is either a bowl for carrying scents, flowers, etc., for the purpose of worship, or a palm-leaf bowl, etc. A flower is any flower that is a means of making a living for human beings. Likewise fruit.

original: Sinānaṃ sirīsacuṇṇādinhāniyacuṇṇaṃ. Mattikāpi ettheva saṅgahaṃ gacchati. Dantakaṭṭhaṃ🔽yaṃ kiñci mukhasodhanatthaṃ dantaponaṃ. Cāṭukamyatā attānaṃ dāsaṃ viya nīcaṭṭhāne🔽ṭhapetvā parassa khalitavacanaṃ saṇṭhapetvā piyakāmatāya paggayhavacanaṃ. Muggasūpyatāti
analyzed: sinānam sirīsa cuṇṇa ādinhāniya cuṇṇam mattikā api etthā iva saṅgaham gacchati dantakaṭṭham  yam kiñci mukha sodhanattham danta ponam cāṭu kamyatā attānam dāsam viya nīca ṭṭhāne  ṭhapetvā parassa khalita vacanam saṇṭhapetvā piya kāma tāya paggayha vacanam mugga sūpya tā ati
translated: A bath is a bath powder made of sandalwood, etc., for the purpose of bathing. Clay is included here too. A tooth-stick is any tooth-stick for the purpose of cleaning the mouth.🔽Flattery is the speaking of words of endearment by one who has placed himself in an abject position like a slave, desiring to be loved by another. The state of a slave is the state of being a slave, a servant, a menial, one who is owned by another, one who has no freedom of action.

original: muggasūpasamatā saccālikena jīvitakappanaṃ. Yathā hi muggasūpe paccante bahū muggā
analyzed: mugga sūpa sama tā sacca alikena jīvita kappanam yathā hi mugga sūpe paccante bahū muggā
translated: The state of a kitchen-slave is the state of being a kitchen-slave, a servant who works in the kitchen. The state of a curry-drawer is the state of being a curry-drawer, a servant who draws out the curry. The state of a soup-drawer is the state of being a soup-drawer, a servant who draws out the soup.🔽For just as in a pot of curry that is boiling on the fire the curry is cooked by the heat and the bubbles rise up and subside again, so too, this person is cooked by the heat of the other’s anger and he weeps and his face is disfigured. He is like a kitchen-slave who draws out the curry.

original: paccanti, katipayā na paccanti, evaṃ saccālikena jīvitakappane bahu alikaṃ hoti,
analyzed: paccanti katipayāḥ na paccanti evam sacca alikena jīvita kappane bahu alikam hoti
translated: When they are cooking, some are not cooking. Thus, in the case of a living by deception, there is much deception and little truth.

original: appakaṃ saccanti. Paribhaṭatīti paribhaṭo, paresaṃ dārake pariharanto. Paribhaṭassa🔽kammaṃ pāribhaṭyaṃ, sā eva pāribhaṭyatā, alaṅkaraṇādinā kuladārakapariharaṇassetaṃ
analyzed: appakam saccanti paribhaṭati iti paribhaṭaḥ paresam dārake pariharantaḥ paribhaṭassa  kammam pāribhaṭyam sā eva pāribhaṭya tā alaṅkaraṇa ādinā kula dāraka pariharaṇassa etam
translated: The word pāribhaṭya is derived from the word paribhaṭa. A paribhaṭa is one who paribhaṭa, that is, who attends to the children of others.🔽The work of a paribhaṭa is pāribhaṭya. That itself is pāribhaṭyatā. This is a name for the attending to the children of families by means of adornments, etc.

original: nāmaṃ. Tesaṃ tesaṃ gihīnaṃ gāmantaradesantarādīsu sāsanapaṭisāsanaharaṇaṃ jaṅghapesanikaṃ.🔽Aññataraññatarenāti etesaṃ vā veḷudānādīnaṃ vejjakammabhaṇḍāgārikakammapiṇḍapaṭipiṇḍakammasaṅghuppādacetiyuppādapaṭṭhapanādīnaṃ
analyzed: nāmam tesam tesam gihīnam gāmantara desantara ādīsu sāsana paṭisāsana haraṇam jaṅgha pesanikam  aññatara aññatarena ati etesam vā veḷu dāna ādīnam vejja kamma bhaṇḍa āgārika kamma piṇḍa paṭipiṇḍa kamma saṅghuppāda cetiyuppāda paṭṭhapana ādīnam
translated: The running on errands for various householders, carrying messages from village to village, from one country to another, etc., is jaṅghapesanika.🔽Aññataraññatarenāti yena kenaci of these wrong ways of living, such as the giving of medicine, etc., or of the wrong ways of living such as the work of a physician, the work of a steward, the work of a spy, the work of a monk who solicits food for a monk in meditation, the work of a monk who solicits robes for a monk who makes robes, the work of a monk who solicits thread for a monk who makes thread, etc.

original: vā micchājīvena jīvitakappanakakammānaṃ yena kenaci. Buddhapaṭikuṭṭhenāti buddhehi
analyzed: vā micchājīvena jīvita kappanaka kammānam yena kenacid buddha paṭikuṭṭhena ati buddhehi
translated: Buddhapaṭikuṭṭhena means by that which is despised and rejected by Buddhas.

original: garahitena paṭisiddhena. Micchājīvenāti na sammāājīvena. Ayaṃ vuccati anācāroti ayaṃ
analyzed: gara hitena paṭisiddhena micchājīvena ati na sammāājīvena ayam vuccati anācāro ti ayam
translated: Micchājīvena means not by right livelihood. Ayaṃ vuccati anācāroti this is called bad conduct.

original: sabbopi “anācāro”ti kathīyati. Ācāraniddeso vuttapaṭipakkhanayeneva veditabbo.
analyzed: sabbaḥ api anācāraḥ ti kathīyati ācāra niddesaḥ vutta paṭipakkha nayena iva veditabbaḥ
translated: All of them are called “improper conduct.” The description of proper conduct should be understood in the opposite sense to the improper.

original: Gocaraniddesepi paṭhamaṃ agocarassa vacane kāraṇaṃ heṭṭhā vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: gocara niddese pi paṭhamam agocarassa vacane kāraṇam heṭṭhā vutta nayena iva veditabbam
translated: As to the description of the right and wrong resort, the reason for the statement about the wrong resort should be understood in the way already stated .

original: Gocaroti piṇḍapātādīnaṃ atthāya upasaṅkamituṃ yuttaṭṭhānaṃ. Ayuttaṭṭhānaṃ agocaro.🔽Vesiyā gocaro assāti vesiyāgocaro, mittasanthavavasena upasaṅkamitabbaṭṭhānanti attho.
analyzed: gocaro ti piṇḍapāta ādīnam atthāya upasaṅkamitum yutta ṭhānam a yutta ṭhānam a gocaro  vesiyā gocaraḥ assa ati vesiyā gocaraḥ mitta santhava vasena upasaṅkamitabba ṭhānanti attho
translated: A right resort is a place suitable for approaching for the purpose of alms food, etc.; a wrong resort is a place unsuitable for approaching.🔽A resort of courtesans is a place that should be approached by way of friendship and intimacy.

original: Vesiyā nāma rūpūpajīviniyo, tā mittasanthavavasena na upasaṅkamitabbā, samaṇabhāvassa
analyzed: vesiyāḥ nāma rūpa upajīviniyaḥ tāḥ mitta santhava vasena na upasaṅkamitabbā samaṇa bhāvassa
translated: Courtesans are those who live by their beauty. They should not be approached by way of friendship and intimacy because that would be an obstacle to the bhikkhu’s celibacy,

original: antarāyakarattā, parisuddhāsayassāpi garahahetuto, tasmā dakkhiṇādānavasena satiṃ🔽upaṭṭhapetvāva upasaṅkamitabbā. Vidhavā vuccanti matapatikā, pavutthapatikā vā. Thullakumārikāti
analyzed: antarāya karattā parisuddha āsayassa api garaha hetuto tasmā dakkhiṇā dāna vasena satim  upaṭṭhapetvā ava upasaṅkamitabbā vidhavāḥ vuccanti mata patikā pavuttha patikā vā thullakumārikā ati
translated: and it would be a cause for the censure of even one who is pure in bodily conduct. Therefore, he should approach them only after establishing mindfulness by way of giving alms,

original: mahallikā aniviṭṭhakumāriyo, paṇḍakāti napuṃsakā. Te hi ussannakilesā avūpasantapariḷāhā
analyzed: mahallikāḥ aniviṭṭha kumāriyaḥ te hi ussanna kilesāḥ a vūpasanta pariḷāhāḥ
translated: A widow is one whose husband is dead or has gone away. A “loose woman” is one who has intercourse with many men. A “lesbian” is one who has intercourse with women. A “paṇḍaka” is a eunuch. They are all of them lustful, and their passions are not subdued.

original: lokāmisasannissitakathābahulā, tasmā na upasaṅkamitabbā. Bhikkhuniyo nāma ussannabrahmacariyā.
analyzed: loka āmisa sannissita kathā bahulā tasmai na upasaṅkamitabbā bhikkhuniyaḥ nāma ussanna brahmacariyā
translated: Nuns are devoted to the higher life.

original: Tathā bhikkhūpi. Tesaṃ aññamaññaṃ visabhāgavatthubhāvato santhavavasena upasaṅkamane
analyzed: tathā bhikkhū pi tesam aññamaññam visa bhāga vatthu bhāvato santhava vasena upasaṅkamane
translated: So too monks. If they were to approach each other for conversation,

original: katipāheneva brahmacariyantarāyo siyā, tasmā na upasaṅkamitabbā. Gilānapucchanādivasena
analyzed: katipāhena iva brahmacariya antarāyaḥ siyā tasmai na upasaṅkamitabbā gilāna pucchanā ādi vasena
translated: then the higher life would be interrupted in a few days. So they should not be approached.🔽But if they approach each other to ask about health, etc.,

original: upasaṅkamane satokārinā bhavitabbaṃ. Pānāgāranti surāpānagharaṃ. Taṃ soṇḍajanehi
analyzed: upasaṅkamane satokārinā bhavitabbam pāna āgāranti surā pāna gharam tam soṇḍa janehi
translated: they should be on their guard. A drinking house is a place where liquor is drunk. It is not frequented by the kind of people who are not drunkards.

original: avivittaṃ hoti. Tattha tehi soṇḍatādivasena na upasaṅkamitabbaṃ brahmacariyantarāyakarattā.🔽Saṃsaṭṭho viharati rājūhītiādīsu rājāno nāma ye rajjamanusāsanti. Rājamahāmattā rājissariyasadisāya
analyzed: a vivittam hoti tattha tehi soṇḍa tā ādi vasena na upasaṅkamitabbam brahmacariya antarāya karattā  saṃsaṭṭhaḥ viharati rājūhi itiādīsu rājānaḥ nāma ye rajjam anusāsanti rāja mahāmattāḥ
translated: So it should not be approached by them for the purpose of drinking liquor, etc., because it would interrupt the higher life.🔽In the case of the terms “kings,” “princes,” and so on, kings are those who rule a kingdom.

original: issariyamattāya samannāgatā. Titthiyāti viparītadassanā bāhirakaparibbājakā. Titthiyasāvakāti
analyzed: issariya mattāya samannāgatā titthiyā ati viparīta dassanā bāhiraka paribbājakā titthiya sāvakā ati
translated: Great ministers are those who have the same authority as a king. Sectarians are outside recluses and brahmans who hold wrong views. Sectarian disciples are

original: tesu daḷhabhattā paccayadāyakā. Ananulomikena saṃsaggenāti tissannaṃ sikkhānaṃ ananulomikena
analyzed: tesu daḷha bhattā paccaya dāyakā ananulomikena saṃsaggena ati tissannam sikkhānam ananulomikena
translated: With those who are not in harmony with him: with those who are not in harmony with him in the three trainings,

original: paccanīkabhūtena saṃsaggena saṃsaṭṭho viharati, yena brahmacariyantarāyaṃ vā sallekhaparihāniṃ vā pāpuṇāti.
analyzed: paccanīka bhūtena saṃsaggena saṃsaṭṭhaḥ viharati yena brahmacariya antarāyam vā sallekha parihānim vā pāpuṇāti
translated: who are opposed to him. He associates with them and lives with them, and he comes to ruin and destruction in this very life.

original: Idāni aparenapi pariyāyena agocaraṃ dassetuṃ “yāni vā pana tānī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha
analyzed: idāni aparena api pariyāyena agocaram dassetum yāni vā pana tāni itiādi vuttam tattha
translated: Now, in order to point out the unsuitable by another method, the text is stated in the way beginning, “Or whatever other unsuitable things there are.” Herein,

original: assaddhānīti buddhādīsu saddhāvirahitāni. Tato eva appasannāni, kammakammaphalasaddhāya
analyzed: assaddhāni iti buddha ādīsu saddhā virahitāni tatas eva appasannāni kamma kamma phala saddhāya
translated: lacking in faith: devoid of faith in the Buddha, etc. They are also called “lacking in confidence” because of that, or they are called “lacking in faith” because of the absence of faith in kamma, its fruits, and the Triple Gem,🔽and they are called “lacking in confidence” because of the absence of confidence in the Triple Gem.

original: vā abhāvena assaddhāni. Ratanattayappasādābhāvena appasannāni. Akkosakaparibhāsakānīti🔽akkosavatthūhi akkosakāni ceva bhayadassanena santajjanakāni ca. Atthaṃ na icchanti
analyzed: vā abhāvena assaddhāni ratana taya pasāda abhāvena appasannāni akkosaka paribhāsakāni iti  akkosa vatthūhi akkosakāni ca iva bhaya dassanena santajjanakāni ca attham na icchanti
translated: Reproving and reviling: they are reproving because they reprove by means of the grounds for reproving, and they are reviling because they terrify by showing fear.

original: anatthameva icchantīti anatthakāmāni. Hitaṃ na icchanti ahitameva icchantīti ahitakāmāni.
analyzed: anattham eva icchanti iti anattha kāmāni hitam na icchanti ahitam eva icchanti iti ahita kāmāni
translated: They do not want what is good: they do not want what is good; they want only what is bad. They do not want what is beneficial: they do not want what is beneficial; they want only what is unbeneficial.

original: Phāsu na icchanti aphāsuṃyeva icchantīti aphāsukakāmāni. Yogakkhemaṃ nibbhayaṃ na🔽icchanti, ayogakkhemameva icchantīti ayogakkhemakāmāni. Bhikkhūnanti ettha sāmaṇerānampi
analyzed: phāsu naḥ icchanti a phāsum yā iva icchanti iti a phāsuka kāmāni yogakkhemam nibbhayam na  icchanti ayogakkhemam eva icchanti iti ayogakkhema kāmāni ettha sāmaṇerānam pi
translated: They do not want comfort, they only want discomfort, thus they are “bent on discomfort” . They do not want the security of deliverance, they only want the insecurity of non-deliverance, thus they are “bent on non-deliverance” . Bhikkhus: here novices too are included.

original: saṅgaho. Bhikkhunīnanti ettha sikkhamānasāmaṇerīnaṃ. Sabbesaṃ hi sāsanikānaṃ anatthakāmatādīpanapadamidaṃ🔽vacanaṃ. Tathārūpāni kulānīti tādisāni khattiyakulādīni. Sevatīti nissāya jīvati.
analyzed: saṅgahaḥ bhikkhunīnam ti ettha sikkhamāna sāmaṇerīnam sabbesam hi sāsanikānam anattha kāma tā dīpana padam idam  vacanam tathārūpāni kulāni iti tādisāni khattiya kula ādīni sevati iti nissāya jīvati
translated: They do not want comfort but only discomfort, thus they are “bent on discomfort” . They do not want the security of peace and fearlessness, but only insecurity, thus they are “bent on insecurity” . “ Bhikkhus” : here the novices are included. “ Bhikkhunis” : here the female probationers and the female novices are included. For this statement is made in order to show that all the disciples of the Buddha are bent on harm, etc. “ Such families” : such families of nobles, etc. “ Frequents” : depends on for a living.

original: Bhajatīti upasaṅkamati. Payirupāsatīti punappunaṃ upagacchati. Ayaṃ vuccatīti ayaṃ🔽vesiyādiko, rājādiko, assaddhakulādiko ca taṃ taṃ sevantassa tippakāropi ayutto gocaroti
analyzed: bhajati iti upasaṅkamati payis upāsati iti punappunam upagacchati ayam vuccati iti ayam  vesiya ādikaḥ rāja ādikaḥ assaddha kula ādiko ca tam tam sevantassa tippakāraḥ api ayuttaḥ gocaro ti
translated: “ Associates with” : approaches. “ Consorts with” : goes to again and again. “ Is called” : is called.

original: agocaro. Ettha hi vesiyādiko pañcakāmaguṇanissayato agocaro. Yathāha “ko ca, bhikkhave,
analyzed: agocaraḥ ettha hi vesiyā ādiko pañca kāmaguṇa nissayataḥ agocaraḥ yathā āha kaḥ ca bhikkhave
