translated: Āliṅgetvā = having embraced. Upanisīdeyyāti = having gone up to him by that very embracing, he would sit down. What is the point here?

original: satthā aggikkhandhāliṅganaṃ, kaññāliṅganañca ānesi, tamatthaṃ vibhāvetuṃ “ārocayāmī”tiādimāha.
analyzed: satthā aggi kkhandha āliṅganam kaññā liṅganañca ānesi tam attham vibhāvetum ārocayāmi iti ādim āha
translated: The Teacher related the story of the embracing of the fire-brand and the embracing of the maiden. In order to make clear the meaning of this, he said: “I declare to you, I make known to you.”

original: Tattha ārocayāmīti āmantemi. Voti tumhe. Paṭivedayāmīti pabodhemi. Dussīlassāti nissīlassa
analyzed: tattha ārocayāmi iti āmantemi vo ti tumhe paṭivedayāmi iti pabodhemi dussīlassa ati nissīlassa
translated: Herein, I declare to you = I announce to you. I make known to you = I inform you. To the unvirtuous = to the shameless.

original: sīlavirahitassa. Pāpadhammassāti dussīlattā eva hīnajjhāsayatāya lāmakasabhāvassa.
analyzed: sīla virahitassa pāpa dhammassa ati dussīla ttā eva hīna ajjhāsaya tāya lāmaka sabhāvassa
translated: To the evil-natured = to the low-minded, because of the absence of virtue.

original: Asucisaṅkassarasamācārassāti aparisuddhakāyasamācārāditāya asucissa hutvā saṅkāya🔽saritabbasamācārassa. Dussīlo hi kiñcideva asāruppaṃ disvā “idaṃ asukena kataṃ bhavissatī”ti🔽paresaṃ āsaṅkanīyova hoti, kenacideva vā karaṇīyena mantayante bhikkhū disvā “kacci
analyzed: asuci saṅkassara samācārassa ati a parisuddha kāya samācāra āditāya asucissa hutvā saṅkāya  saritabba samācārassa dussīlaḥ hi kiñcid eva a sāruppam disvā idam asukena katam bhavissati iti  paresam āsaṅkanīyaḥ uva hoti kenacid eva vā karaṇīyena mantayante bhikkhū disvā kacci
translated: To the one whose conduct is suspect and who is censured = to the one who is impure, because of the impurity of his bodily conduct, etc., and who is suspect and censured.🔽For the unvirtuous are suspect to others, thinking: “This must have been done by so and so.”

original: nu kho ime mayā kataṃ kammaṃ jānitvā mantentī”ti attanoyeva saṅkāya saritabbasamācāroti.
analyzed: nu kho ime mayā katam kammam jānitvā mantenti iti attanoyā iva saṅkāya saritabba samācāro ti
translated: Or, when they see bhikkhus discussing some matter, they think: “Perhaps they are discussing some action I have done.” And they are censured by themselves.

original: Paṭicchannakammantassāti lajjitabbatāya paṭicchādetabbakammantassa. Assamaṇassāti
analyzed: paṭicchanna kammantassa ati lajjitabba tāya paṭicchādetabba kammantassa assamaṇassa ati
translated: To the one whose actions are concealed = to the one whose actions are to be concealed because of shame. To the non-ascetic =

original: na samaṇassa. Salākaggahaṇādīsu “ahampi samaṇo”ti micchāpaṭiññāya samaṇapaṭiññassa.
analyzed: na samaṇassa salāka ggahaṇa ādīsu aham pi samaṇaḥ ti micchā paṭiññāya samaṇa paṭiññassa
translated: not to an ascetic. In the case of the taking of the voting ticket, etc., it is one who claims to be an ascetic by a false claim, thinking, “I too am an ascetic.”

original: Aseṭṭhacāritāya abrahmacārissa. Uposathādīsu “ahampi brahmacārī”ti micchāpaṭiññāya
analyzed: a seṭṭha cāritāya abrahmacārissa uposatha ādīsu aham pi brahmacārī iti micchā paṭiññāya
translated: It is one who is not a good person, who is not celibate, who claims to be celibate by a false claim, thinking, “I too am celibate,”

original: brahmacāripaṭiññassa. Pūtinā kammena sīlavipattiyā anto anupaviṭṭhattā antopūtikassa.🔽Chahi dvārehi rāgādikilesānuvassanena tintattā avassutassa. Sañjātarāgādikacavarattā,
analyzed: brahmacāri paṭiññassa pūtinā kammena sīla vipattiyāḥ antar an upaviṭṭha ttā antopūtikassa  chahi dvārehi rāga ādi kilesa anuvassanena tintattā avassutassa sañjāta rāga ādika cavarattā
translated: in the case of the observance day, etc. It is one who is rotten within because of being penetrated by the failure in virtue that is the foulness of action.🔽It is one who is lustful because of being stained by the defilements of lust, etc., that rain down through the six doors. It is one who is born in a cesspit because of being covered by the dust of lust, etc., that has arisen.

original: sīlavantehi chaḍḍetabbattā ca kasambujātassa. Aggikkhandhūpamāya hīnūpamabhūtāyāti
analyzed: sīlavantehi chaḍḍetabba ttā ca kasambujātassa aggi kkhandha upamāya hīna upama bhūtāya ati
translated: It is one who is like a firebrand because of being abandoned by those who are virtuous.

original: attho. Tenāha bhagavā – “etadeva tassa vara”nti. Bhagavā dukkhaṃ dassetvā dukkhaṃ
analyzed: atthaḥ tena āha bhagavā etat eva tassa bhagavā dukkham dassetvā dukkhaṃ
translated: The meaning is that it is like a firebrand. Hence the Blessed One said: “This is the better for him” . The Blessed One, having shown the suffering, shows the suffering

original: dassetīti sambandho.🔽Vāḷarajjuyāti vāḷehi katarajjuyā. Sā hi kharatarā hoti. Ghaṃseyyāti padhaṃsanavasena
analyzed: dasseti iti sambandhaḥ  vāḷa rajjuyā ati sā hi kharatarā sā hi kharatarā ghaṃseyya ati padhaṃsana vasena
translated: of the suffering. This is the construction.🔽By a rope of hide: by a hide rope. For that is very rough. He would flog: he would flog by way of beating.

original: ghaṃseyya. Teladhotāyāti telena nisitāya. Paccorasminti patiurasmiṃ urābhimukhaṃ,
analyzed: tela dhotāya ati telena nisitāya pacca urasmin ti pati urasmin ura abhimukham
translated: Well-oiled: well-oiled with oil. On his breast: on his chest, facing his breast.

original: uramajjheti adhippāyo. Ayosaṅkunāti saṇḍāsena. Pheṇuddehakanti pheṇaṃ uddehetvā,
analyzed: ura majjhā iti adhippāyaḥ ayaḥ saṅkunā ati saṇḍāsena pheṇuddehakam ti pheṇam uddehetvā
translated: The meaning is: the middle of the chest. ‘Iron stake’ means: with the shackle. ‘Spitting out foam’ means:

original: anekavāraṃ pheṇaṃ uṭṭhapetvāti attho.🔽Aggikkhandhāliṅganadukkhatopi adhimattadukkhatāya kaṭukabhūtaṃ dukkhaṃ phalaṃ etassāti
analyzed: aneka vāram pheṇam uṭṭhapetvā iti attho  aggi kkhandha āliṅgana dukkhataḥ api adhimatta dukkha tāya kaṭuka bhūtam dukkham phalam etassa ati
translated: having spat out foam, the meaning is: having vomited up foam many times.🔽Because of the extreme pain, the fruit of this is painful, being more painful than the pain of embracing a mass of fire.

original: aggikkhandhāliṅganadukkhādhikadukkhakaṭukaphalaṃ. Kāmasukhaṃ avijahato bhinnasīlassa
analyzed: aggi kkhandha āliṅgana dukkha adhika dukkha kaṭuka phalam kāma sukham a vijahataḥ bhinna sīlassa
translated: The meaning is: it has a fruit that is painful, being more painful than the pain of embracing a mass of fire. For one who does not abandon sensual pleasure, who has broken morality,

original: dussīlassa kuto tassa sukhaṃ natthevāti adhippāyo. Sādaneti sādiyane. Yanti añjalikammasādanaṃ.
analyzed: dussīlassa kutas tassa sukham nattha iva ati adhippāyaḥ sādane iti sādiyane yanti añjali kamma sādanam
translated: for the immoral, how can there be pleasure? There is none, is the meaning. ‘In accepting’ means: in consenting. ‘Y’ means: the consenting of the salutation.

original: Asīlinoti dussīlassa. Upahatanti sīlabyasanena upaddutaṃ. Khatanti kusalamūlānaṃ
analyzed: asīlino ti dussīlassa upahatam sīla byasanena upaddutam khatam kusala mūlānam
translated: ‘The unvirtuous’ means: the immoral. ‘Afflicted’ means: oppressed by the destruction of morality. ‘Cut’ means:

original: khaṇanena khataṃ, khaṇitaṃ vā guṇaṃ sarīreti adhippāyo. Sabbabhayehīti attānuvādādisabbabhayehi.
analyzed: khaṇanena khatam khaṇitam vā guṇam sarīra iti adhippāyaḥ sabba bhayehi iti atta anuvāda ādi sabba bhayehi
translated: cut by the cutting off of the roots of good, or the meaning is: the virtue is cut, split, and the body is carried away. ‘From all fears’ means: from all fears such as self-reproach, etc.

original: Upacārajjhānaṃ upādāya sabbehi adhigamasukhehi.
analyzed: upacāra jhānam upādāya sabbehi adhigama sukhehi
translated: From all the happiness of attainment, beginning with access concentration.

original: Vuttappakāraviparītatoti sīlavipattiyaṃ vuttākārapaṭipakkhato “manāpo hoti devamanussāna”ntiādinā.
analyzed: vutta ppakāra viparītataḥ ti sīla vipattiyam vutta ākāra paṭipakkhataḥ manāpaḥ hoti deva manussānam ti ādinā
translated: “The opposite of the kind already stated” is the opposite of the kind stated in the case of failure in virtue, namely, “he is dear to gods and men” and so on.🔽The fragrance of the virtuous bhikkhu

original: Kāyagandhopi pāmojjaṃ, sīlavantassa bhikkhuno. Karoti api devānanti ettha “gandho
analyzed: kāya gandhaḥ api pāmojjam sīlavantassa bhikkhuno karoti api ettha gandho
translated: Makes the devas glad, they say.🔽Herein, the verse beginning, “The fragrance of the seers who have gone to the end of suffering” should be quoted in detail.

original: isīnaṃ ciradikkhitāna”ntiādikā gāthā vitthāretabbā. Avighātīti appaṭighātī. Vadhabandhādiparikilesā
analyzed: isīnam cira dikkhitānam ti ādikā gāthā vitthāretabbā avighātī ti appaṭighātī vadha bandha ādi parikilesā
translated: “Not a source of terror” : not a source of fear.🔽The defilements of killing, binding, and so on,🔽are the taints of the present existence.🔽The root of future suffering is unvirtuous conduct.

original: diṭṭhadhammikā āsavā upaddavā. Samparāyikadukkhānaṃ mūlaṃ nāma dussīlyaṃ. Antamatikkantaṃ
analyzed: diṭṭhadhammikāḥ āsavāḥ upaddavāḥ samparāyika dukkhānam mūlam nāma dussīlyam antam atikkantam
translated: “Transcending the extreme” : the ultimate.🔽The ultimate peace is the perpetual peace, which is always peaceful

original: accantaṃ, accantaṃ santā accantasantā kilesapariḷāhasaṅkhātadarathānaṃ abhāvena sabbadā
analyzed: accantam accantam santā accanta santā abhāvena sabbadā
translated: because of the absence of the distress consisting in defilement and pain.🔽“Having been terrified” : having been frightened by the fear of knowledge.

original: santā. Ubbijjitvāti ñāṇutrāsena uttasitvā. Vodāpetabbanti visodhetabbaṃ.
analyzed: santāḥ ubbijjitvā ti uttasitvā vodāpetabbam ti visodhetabbam
translated: “Should be purified” : should be cleansed.

original: Sīlaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sīla niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Description of Virtue is finished.

original: Iti paṭhamaparicchedavaṇṇanā.
analyzed: iti paṭhama pariccheda vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the first chapter is finished.

original: 2. Dhutaṅganiddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dhutaṅga niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Ascetic Practices

original: 22. Appā icchā etassāti appiccho, paccayagedharahito. Tassa bhāvo appicchatā, alobhajjhāsayatāti
analyzed: appā icchā etassa ati appicchaḥ paccaya gedha rahito tassa bhāvo appiccha tā alobha jjhāsaya tā ati
translated: He is called “modest” because he has little desire, that is, because he is free from grasping for requisites. The meaning is: he has non-greed as his habit.

original: attho. Samaṃ tuṭṭhi, santena, sakena vā tuṭṭhi santuṭṭhi, santuṭṭhi eva santuṭṭhitā,
analyzed: attho samam tuṭṭhi santena sakena vā tuṭṭhi santuṭṭhi santuṭṭhi eva santuṭṭhi tā
translated: Content with: content is tuṭṭhi . Content with what is obtained by oneself is santuṭṭhi . The state of that is santuṭṭhitā .

original: aññaṃ apatthetvā yathāladdhehi itarītarehi paccayehi paritussanā. Santuṭṭhitādīhīti🔽ta-kāro vā padasandhikaro. “Santuṭṭhiādīhī”ti vā pāṭho. Te guṇeti te sīlavodānassa
analyzed: aññam a patthetvā yathāladdhehi itarītarehi paccayehi paritussanā santuṭṭhi tā ādīhi iti  takāraḥ vā pada sandhi karaḥ santuṭṭhi ādīhi iti vā pāṭhaḥ te guṇe ti te sīla vodānassa
translated: The meaning is: not seeking more, being satisfied with the requisites as obtained, whether good or bad. With santuṭṭhitā, etc.,🔽the -t- in te is a substitute for -n- to facilitate euphony. Or the reading is santuṭṭhitādīhi.🔽Those qualities: those qualities of modesty, etc., which are the cause of virtue and generosity.

original: hetubhūte appicchatādiguṇe. Sampādetunti sampanne kātuṃ. Te hi sīlavisuddhiyā paṭiladdhamattā🔽hutvā dhutadhammehi sampannatarā honti. Dhutaṅgasamādānanti kilesānaṃ dhunanakaaṅgānaṃ
analyzed: hetu bhūte appiccha tā ādi guṇe sampādetum ti sampanne kātum te hi sīla visuddhiyā  hutvā dhuta dhammehi sampannatarāḥ honti kilesānam dhunanaka aṅgānam
translated: To perfect: to make perfect. For when virtue has been obtained by purification, it becomes more perfect by the ascetic practices.🔽The undertaking of the ascetic practices: the proper undertaking of the practices that shake off and the causes for the shaking off and destruction of defilements.

original: viddhaṃsanakāraṇānaṃ sammadeva ādānaṃ. Evanti evaṃ sante, dhutaṅgasamādāne kateti
analyzed: ādānam evanti evam sante dhutaṅga samādāne kata iti
translated: If: if this is so, if the undertaking of the ascetic practices is done, is what is meant.

original: attho. Assa yogino. Sallekho kilesānaṃ sammadeva likhanā chedanā tanukaraṇaṃ. Paviveko
analyzed: atthaḥ assa yogino sallekhaḥ kilesānam sammad eva likhanā chedanā tanu karaṇam pavivekaḥ
translated: The yogi’s shaking off: the proper shaking off, cutting off, and weakening of defilements.

original: cittavivekassa upāyabhūtā vivekaṭṭhakāyatā. Apacayo yathā paṭipajjanato kilesā naṃ
analyzed: citta vivekassa upāya bhūtā viveka ṭṭhakāya tā apacayaḥ yathā paṭipajjanataḥ kilesāḥ
translated: and the state of solitude of the body is the means to the solitude of mind.🔽The state of decrease is the practice in such a way that defilements are decreased and not increased.

original: apacinanti na ācinanti, tathā paṭipajjanā. Vīriyārambho anuppannānaṃ pāpadhammānaṃ🔽anuppādanādivasena āraddhavīriyatā. Subharatā yathāvuttaappicchabhāvādisiddhā upaṭṭhakānaṃ
analyzed: apacinanti na ācinanti tathā paṭipajjanā vīriya ārambhaḥ anuppannānam pāpa dhammānam  an uppādana ādi vasena āraddha vīriya tā subhara tā yathāvutta appiccha bhāva ādi siddhā upaṭṭhakānam
translated: The state of exertion is the state of one who has begun to exert himself in the way beginning “arousing energy, he does not yield to sloth and torpor” .🔽The state of being easy to support is the state of one who is easy to support for his supporters because he has the aforesaid fewness of wishes, etc.,

original: sukhabharaṇīyatā suposatā. Ādi-saddena appakiccatāsallahukavuttiādike saṅgaṇhāti.
analyzed: sukha bharaṇīya tā su posa tā ādi saddena appa kicca tā sat lahuka vutti ādike saṅgaṇhāti
translated: and the word “etc.” includes magnanimity, contentment, and straightforwardness.

original: Sīlañceva yathāsamādinnaṃ paṭipakkhadhammānaṃ dūrībhāvena suparisuddhaṃ bhavissati.
analyzed: sīlam ca iva yathā samādinnam paṭipakkha dhammānam dūrībhāvena su parisuddham bhavissati
translated: and his virtue will be purified by his keeping far away from the things opposed to it, as described.

original: Vatāni ca dhutadhammā ca sampajjissanti sampannā bhavissanti, nipphajjissanti vā.
analyzed: vatāni ca dhuta dhammā ca sampajjissanti sampannāḥ bhavissanti nipphajjissanti vā
translated: and the ascetic practices will be successful, will be accomplished, will be fulfilled.

original: Yā thirabhūtā itarītaracīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanasantuṭṭhi porāṇānaṃ buddhādīnaṃ ariyānaṃ
analyzed: yā thira bhūtā itarītara cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana santuṭṭhi porāṇānam buddha ādīnam ariyānam
translated: The state of being established in the ancient line of the Noble Ones is the contentment with any kind of robe, alms food, resting place, and the requisite of medicine as cure for the sick that is established in the ancient Buddhas, etc.,

original: paveṇibhāvena ṭhitā, tattha patiṭṭhitabhāvaṃ sandhāyāha “porāṇe ariyavaṃsattaye patiṭṭhāyā”ti.
analyzed: paveṇi bhāvena ṭhitā tattha patiṭṭhita bhāvam sandhāya āha porāṇe ariya vaṃsattaye patiṭṭhāya ati
translated: as the ancient line of the Noble Ones. With reference to the state of being established in that he says “in the ancient line of the Noble Ones consisting of the three kinds of conduct.”

original: Bhāvanā āramitabbaṭṭhena ārāmo etassāti bhāvanārāmo, tabbhāvo bhāvanārāmatā, samathavipassanābhāvanāsu🔽yuttappayuttatā. Yasmā adhigamāraho bhavissati, tasmāti sambandho.
analyzed: bhāvanā āramitabba aṭṭhena ārāmaḥ etassa ati bhāvanā ārāmaḥ tad bhāvaḥ bhāvanā ārāma tā samatha vipassanā bhāvanāsu  yutta ppayutta tā yasmai adhigama arahaḥ bhavissati tasma iti sambandho
translated: He is devoted to development in the sense of being devoted to the development of serenity and insight, which are the means to the attainment of the goal.🔽The worldly material things are the material things of the world, which are to be enjoyed by the craving for gain, honour, etc., because they are to be tasted by craving and because they are included in the world.

original: Lābhasakkārādi taṇhāya āmasitabbato, lokapariyāpannatāya ca lokāmisaṃ. Nibbānādhigamassa🔽anulomato anulomapaṭipadā vipassanābhāvanā. Atthatoti vacanatthato. Pabhedatoti vibhāgato.
analyzed: lābha sakkāra ādi taṇhāya āmasitabbataḥ loka pariyāpanna tāya ca loka āmisam nibbāna adhigamassa  anulomataḥ anuloma paṭipadā vipassanā bhāvanā atthato ti vacana tthato pabhedato ti vibhāgato
translated: The conformity is the conformity path, which is insight development that is in conformity with the attainment of Nibbāna.🔽In the sense: in the meaning. In the sense of: in the sense of destruction.🔽The ascetic practices, etc., are the ascetic practices, the ascetic states, the ascetic way of living, and the ascetic virtues.

original: Bhedatoti vināsato. Dhutādīnanti dhutadhutavādadhutadhammadhutaṅgānaṃ. Samāsabyāsatoti saṅkhepavitthārato.
analyzed: bhedataḥ iti vināsataḥ dhuta ādīnam ti dhuta dhuta vāda dhuta dhamma dhutaṅgānam samāsa byāsataḥ ti saṅkhepa vitthārato
translated: In brief and in detail: in brief and in detail.

original: 23. Rathikāti racchā. Saṅkārakūṭādīnanti niddhāraṇe sāmivacanaṃ. Abbhuggataṭṭhenāti
analyzed: rathikā ati racchā niddhāraṇe sāmi vacanam
translated: The road is the highway. The dust-heap, etc., are mentioned by way of a particular example.

original: ussitaṭṭhena. “Nadiyā kūla”ntiādīsu viya samussayattho kūla-saddoti āha “paṃsukūlamiva
analyzed: ussita ṭṭhena nadiyā kūlanti ādīsu viya samussaya atthaḥ kūla saddo ti āha paṃsu kūlam iva
translated: The word “bank” is used in the sense of “heap” as in the expressions “the bank of the river” and so on.

original: paṃsukūla”nti. Ku-saddo kucchāyaṃ ula-saddo gatiatthoti āha “kucchitabhāvaṃ gacchatīti🔽vuttaṃ hotī”ti, paṃsu viya kucchitaṃ ulati pavattatīti vā paṃsukūlaṃ. Paṃsukūlassa
analyzed: paṃsukūlanti kusaddaḥ kucchāyam ula saddaḥ gati attho ti āha kucchita bhāvam gacchati iti  vuttam hoti iti paṃsu viya kucchitam ulati pavattati iti vā paṃsukūlam paṃsukūlassa
translated: “A rag-robe.” The word ku means “belly,” and ula means “to go.” The meaning is that it goes to the state of being a belly.🔽Or alternatively, it is a rag-robe because it goes, that is, occurs, like a rag, as a belly.

original: dhāraṇaṃ paṃsukūlaṃ uttarapadalopena, taṃ sīlamassāti paṃsukūliko, yathā “āpūpiko”ti.
analyzed: dhāraṇam paṃsukūlam uttara pada lopena tam paṃsukūlikaḥ yathā āpūpikā iti
translated: The wearing of a rag-robe is a rag-robe. The -ka in paṃsukūlika is a suffix in the sense of an agent. The meaning is: he who has the rag-robe as his nature.

original: Aṅgati attano phalaṃ paṭicca hetubhāvaṃ gacchatīti aṅgaṃ, kāraṇaṃ. Yena puggalo “paṃsukūliko”ti
analyzed: aṅgati attano phalam paṭicca hetu bhāvam gacchati iti aṅgam kāraṇam yena puggalo paṃsukūliko ti
translated: A part is so called because it goes, that is, serves, as a cause in dependence upon its own fruit. The state of being a part is the part. The meaning is: the cause.🔽By means of which a person is called “one who wears a rag-robe,” that is, by means of the state of being a part of one who wears a rag-robe, which is called “the virtue of wearing a rag-robe.”

original: vuccati, so samādānacetanāsaṅkhāto dhammo paṃsukūlikassa aṅganti paṃsukūlikaṅgaṃ.
analyzed: vuccati so samādāna cetanā saṅkhātaḥ dhammo paṃsukūlikassa aṅgam ti paṃsukūlika aṅgam
translated: The virtue of wearing a rag-robe is the part of one who wears a rag-robe.

original: Tenāha “paṃsukūlikassā”tiādi. Tassāti samādānassa. Samādiyati etenāti samādānaṃ, cetanā.
analyzed: tena āha paṃsukūlikassa atiādi tassa ati samādānassa samādiyati etena ati samādānam cetanā
translated: That is why he said “of one who wears a rag-robe.” The meaning of the word samādaṇa is “he undertakes by means of this.”

original: Eteneva nayenāti yathā paṃsukūladhāraṇaṃ paṃsukūlaṃ, taṃsīlo paṃsukūliko, tassa aṅgaṃ🔽samādānacetanā “paṃsukūlikaṅga”nti vuttaṃ, evaṃ eteneva vacanatthanayena ticīvaradhāraṇaṃ
analyzed: etena iva nayena ati yathā paṃsukūla dhāraṇam paṃsukūlam taṃsīlaḥ paṃsukūlikaḥ tassa aṅgam 🔽samādāna cetanā vuttam evam etena iva vacana attha nayena ti cīvara dhāraṇam
translated: By the same method: just as the wearing of a rag-robe is a rag-robe, and the virtue of that is the virtue of a rag-robe, and the undertaking of that is the part of one who wears a rag-robe,🔽so too, the wearing of the triple-robe is a triple-robe, and the virtue of that is the virtue of a triple-robe, and the undertaking of that is the part of one who wears the triple-robe.

original: ticīvaraṃ, taṃsīlo tecīvariko, tassa aṅgaṃ samādānacetanā “tecīvarikaṅga”nti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: ticīvaram taṃsīlaḥ tecīvariko tassa aṅgam samādāna cetanā veditabbaṃ
translated: The virtue of the three robes is the virtue of the three-robed one. The volition of undertaking that virtue is what should be understood as the “virtue of the three robes.”

original: Saṅghāṭiādīsu eva tīsu cīvaresu ticīvarasamaññā, na kaṇḍupaṭicchādivassikasāṭikādīsūti
analyzed: saṅghāṭi ādīsu eva tīsu cīvaresu ti cīvara samaññā na kaṇḍu paṭicchādi vassika sāṭika ādīsu uti
translated: The three robes are called the “three robes” in the sense of the three, namely, the outer cloak, the upper robe, and the inner robe, not in the sense of the three, namely, the bathing robe, the sheet, the rainy-season cloak, etc.

original: tāni sarūpato dassento “saṅghāṭiuttarāsaṅgaantaravāsakasaṅkhāta”nti āha.🔽Taṃ piṇḍapātanti parehi diyyamānānaṃ piṇḍānaṃ patte patanasaṅkhātaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ, taṃ
analyzed: tāni sarūpataḥ dassento saṅghāṭi uttarāsaṅga antaravāsaka saṅkhātanti āha  tam parehi diyyamānānam piṇḍānam patte patana saṅkhātam piṇḍapātam tam
translated: In order to show their individual characteristics he said “consisting of the outer cloak, the upper robe, and the inner robe.”🔽The “alms food” is the alms food consisting of morsels that fall into the bowl when given by others.🔽He “eats” that, thus he is an “alms-food eater” , like a “sesame-seed eater” or a “millet eater” .

original: uñchatīti piṇḍapātiko, yathā bādariko sāmākiko. Piṇḍapāti eva piṇḍapātiko, yathā🔽bhaddo eva bhaddako. Avakhaṇḍanaṃ vicchindanaṃ nirantaramappavatti. Tappaṭikkhepato
analyzed: uñchati iti piṇḍapātikaḥ yathā bādarikaḥ sāmākikaḥ piṇḍapātī eva piṇḍapātikaḥ yathā  bhaddaḥ eva bhaddakaḥ avakhaṇḍanam vicchindanam nirantaram appavatti tad paṭikkhepato
translated: He is an “alms-food eater” because he eats alms food, like a “good man” or a “handsome man” .🔽“Without mixing” means without interruption.

original: anavakhaṇḍanaṃ avicchindanaṃ nirantarappavatti. Saha apadānenāti saha anavakhaṇḍanena.
analyzed: an avakhaṇḍanam a vicchindanam nirantara ppavatti saha apadānena ati saha an avakhaṇḍanena
translated: “Without under-mixing” means without interruption, by way of the absence of mixing.🔽“Together with the giving up” means together with the absence of mixing.

original: Sapadānanti padassa kiriyāvisesanabhāvaṃ, yattha ca taṃ anavakhaṇḍanaṃ, tañca dassetuṃ
analyzed: padassa kiriyā visesana bhāvam yattha ca tam an avakhaṇḍanam tam ca dassetum
translated: “With the giving up” is a gerundive of the noun pada .

original: “avakhaṇḍanarahitaṃ anugharanti vuttaṃ hotī”ti vuttaṃ. Ekāsaneti iriyāpathantarena
analyzed: avakhaṇḍana rahitam anugharanti vuttam hoti iti vuttam eka āsane iti iriyāpatha antarena
translated: In one session: without interruption by a change of posture,

original: anantaritāya ekāyayeva nisajjāya. Patte piṇḍoti ettha vatthubhedo idhādhippeto, na
analyzed: anantaritāya ekāyayā iva nisajjāya patte piṇḍaḥ ti ettha vatthu bhedaḥ idha adhippetaḥ na
translated: in one sitting only. In one bowl: here the difference in the physical basis is intended, not the commonness.

original: sāmaññaṃ. Eva-kāro ca luttaniddiṭṭhoti dassento “kevalaṃ ekasmiṃyeva patte”ti āha.
analyzed: sāmaññam evakāro ca lutta niddiṭṭho ti dassento kevalam ekasmin yeva patte ti āha
translated: And showing that the word eva is to be construed as “only,” he said, “in one bowl only.”

original: Uttarapadalopaṃ katvā ayaṃ niddesoti dassento “pattapiṇḍagahaṇe pattapiṇḍasaññaṃ
analyzed: uttara pada lopam katvā ayam niddeso ti dassento patta piṇḍa gahaṇe patta piṇḍa saññam
translated: And showing that the demonstrative pronoun etaṃ is to be construed as “this,” he said, “having made the perception of the alms food in the bowl.”

original: katvā”ti āha. Esa nayo ito paresupi.🔽Pacchābhattaṃ nāma pavāraṇato pacchā laddhabhattaṃ eva. Khalu-saddassa paṭisedhatthavācakattā
analyzed: katvā iti āha e sa nayoḥ i taḥ paresupi  pacchābhattam nāma pavāraṇataḥ pacchā laddha bhattam eva khalu saddassa paṭisedha attha vācaka ttā
translated: The same method applies to the rest.🔽After the meal: the alms food obtained after the invitation ceremony.

original: tena samānatthaṃ na-kāraṃ gahetvā āha “na pacchābhattiko”ti. Sikkhāpadassa visayo
analyzed: tena samāna attham nakāram gahetvā āha na pacchābhattikaḥ ti sikkhāpadassa visayaḥ
translated: Since the word khalu expresses denial, he said, “not after the meal,” taking the negative na to have the same meaning as khalu.🔽The province of the training rule

original: sikkhāpadeneva paṭikkhitto. Yo tassa avisayo, so eva samādānassa visayoti āha “samādānavasena
analyzed: sikkhāpadena iva paṭikkhittaḥ yaḥ tassa avisayaḥ saḥ eva samādānassa visayaḥ ti āha samādāna vasena
translated: is prohibited by the training rule itself. What is not its province is the province of the undertaking. Thus he said, “by means of the undertaking.”

original: paṭikkhittātirittabhojanassā”ti. Abbhokāse nivāso abbhokāso. Susāne nivāso susānaṃ,
analyzed: paṭikkhitta atiritta bhojanassa ati abbhokāse nivāsaḥ abbhokāsaḥ susāne nivāsaḥ susānam
translated: The open air is a place in the open air. A charnel ground is a place in a charnel ground.

original: taṃ sīlaṃ assātiādinā sabbaṃ vattabbanti āha “eseva nayo”ti. Yathāsanthataṃ viya🔽yathāsanthataṃ, ādito yathāuddiṭṭhaṃ. Taṃ hesa “idaṃ bahumaṅkuṇaṃ duggandhapavāta”ntiādivasena
analyzed: tam sīlam assa ati ādinā sabbam vattabbanti āha esā iva nayo ti yathāsanthatam viya  āditaḥ yathā uddiṭṭham tam ha esaḥ idam bahu maṅkuṇam
translated: The same method of explanation should be followed in each instance.🔽The “as-is-found” is the “as-is-found-at-first.” He accepts it without rejecting it, thinking: “This is full of many worms and is foul-smelling.”

original: appaṭikkhipitvāva sampaṭicchati. Tenevāha “idaṃ tuyha”ntiādi. Sayananti nipajjanamāha.🔽Tena tena samādānenāti tena tena paṃsukūlikaṅgādikassa samādānena dhutakilesattāti
analyzed: a paṭikkhipitvā ava sampaṭicchati tena iva āha idam tuyhantiādi sayanam ti nipajjanam āha  tena tena samādānena ati tena tena paṃsukūlika aṅga ādikassa samādānena dhuta kilesa ttā ati
translated: That is why it is said: “This is yours.” “Bed” is sleep.🔽By that undertaking: by that undertaking of the refuse-rag-wearer’s practice, etc.

original: viddhaṃsitakilesattā, tadaṅgavasena pahīnataṇhupādānādipāpadhammattāti attho. Yehi🔽taṃ kilesadhunanaṃ, tāniyeva idha dhutassa bhikkhuno aṅgānīti adhippetāni, na aññāni
analyzed: viddhaṃsita kilesa ttā tad aṅga vasena pahīna taṇhu pādāna ādi pāpa dhamma ttā ti atthaḥ yehi  tam kilesa dhunanam tāni yeva idha dhutassa bhikkhuno aṅgāni iti adhippetāni na aññāni
translated: The shaking off of defilements: the shaking off of defilements is the shaking off of the defilements by the practice of the ascetic qualities. The meaning is that the taints and the assuming of assuming are abandoned by the practice of the ascetic qualities.🔽The ascetic qualities are the ascetic qualities of the ascetic bhikkhu. They are not other than those.🔽The meaning is that the ascetic qualities are included in the ascetic bhikkhu.

original: yāni kānici, aññena vā dhutassāti ayamattho atthato āpanno. “Ñāṇaṃ aṅgaṃ etesa”nti
analyzed: yāni kānici aññena vā dhutassa ati ayam atthaḥ atthataḥ āpannaḥ ñāṇam aṅgam etesan ti
translated: The knowledge is the knowledge of the ascetic.

original: iminā ñāṇapubbakataṃ tesaṃ samādānassa vibhāveti. Paṭipattiyāti sīlādisammāpaṭipattiyā.
analyzed: iminā ñāṇa pubba katam tesam samādānassa vibhāveti paṭipattiyā ti sīla ādi sammāpaṭipattiyā
translated: This shows that their undertaking is preceded by knowledge. By practice: by the practice of virtue, etc.,

original: Samādiyati etenāti samādānaṃ, samādānavasena pavattā cetanā, taṃ lakkhaṇaṃ etesanti
analyzed: samādiyati etena ati samādānam samādāna vasena pavattā cetanā tam lakkhaṇam etesan ti
translated: It is undertaken by this, thus it is an undertaking . The volition that occurs by way of the undertaking is the characteristic of these,

original: samādānacetanālakkhaṇāni. Vuttampi cetaṃ aṭṭhakathāyaṃ –
analyzed: samādāna cetanā lakkhaṇāni vuttam pi ca itam aṭṭhakathāyam
translated: thus they are characterized by the volition of undertaking. And this is said in the Paṭisambhidā:

original: “Samādānakiriyāya, sādhakatamabhāvato;
analyzed: samādāna kiriyāya
translated: “As to the act of undertaking, it is shown by the function of accomplishing.

original: Sampayuttadhammā yenāti, karaṇabhāvena dassitā”ti.
analyzed: sampayutta dhammā yena ati karaṇa bhāvena dassitā ati
translated: As to the associated states, it is shown by the function of being the cause of the associated states.”🔽The volition of undertaking is the characteristic of these, thus they are characterized by the volition of undertaking. The volition of refraining is also a practice of ascetic-sim since it has the same root as the volition of undertaking.

original: Samādānacetanāya gahaṇaṃ taṃmūlakattā pariharaṇacetanāpi dhutaṅgameva. Attanā, parammukhena
analyzed: samādāna cetanāya pariharaṇa cetanā api parammukhena
translated: The practice of asceticism is the meaning of the word dhuta. The word dhuta is derived from the verb dhovanā, which means shaking off, or from the verb dhūpana, which means to smoke out.🔽The practice of asceticism is the shaking off or smoking out of the defilements.🔽The practice of asceticism is the shaking off or smoking out of the defilements.🔽The practice of asceticism is the shaking off or smoking out of the defilements.🔽The practice of asceticism is the shaking off or smoking out of the defilements.🔽The practice of asceticism is the shaking off or smoking out of the defilements.🔽The practice of asceticism is the shaking off or smoking out of the defilements.🔽The practice of asceticism is the shaking off or smoking out of the defilements.🔽The practice of asceticism is the shaking off or smoking out of the defilements.🔽The practice of asceticism is the shaking off or smoking out of the defilements.

original: ca kusalabhaṇḍassa bhusaṃ viluppanaṭṭhena loluppaṃ taṇhācāro, tassa viddhaṃsanakiccattā
analyzed: ca kusala bhaṇḍassa bhusam viluppana ṭṭhena loluppam taṇhā ācāraḥ tassa viddhaṃsana kicca ttā
translated: The practice of asceticism is the shaking off or smoking out of the defilements.🔽The practice of asceticism is the shaking off or smoking out of the defilements.

original: loluppaviddhaṃsanarasāni. Tato eva nilloluppabhāvena paccupatiṭṭhanti, taṃ vā paccupaṭṭhāpentīti
analyzed: loluppa viddha ṃsana rasāni tatas eva nilloluppa bhāvena paccupatiṭṭhanti tam vā paccupaṭṭhāpenti iti
translated: The practice of asceticism is the shaking off or smoking out of the defilements.🔽The practice of asceticism is the shaking off or smoking out of the defilements.🔽The practice of asceticism is the shaking off or smoking out of the defilements.🔽The practice of asceticism is the shaking off or smoking out of the defilements.

original: nilloluppabhāvapaccupaṭṭhānāni. Ariyadhammapadaṭṭhānānīti parisuddhasīlādisaddhammapadaṭṭhānāni.
analyzed: nilloluppa bhāva paccupaṭṭhānāni ariya dhamma padaṭṭhānāni iti parisuddha sīla ādi saddhamma padaṭṭhānāni
translated: The practice of asceticism is the shaking off or smoking out of the defilements.🔽The practice of asceticism is the shaking off or smoking out of the

original: Bhagavatova santike samādātabbānīti idaṃ antarā avicchedanatthaṃ vuttaṃ, rañño santike🔽paṭiññātārahassa atthassa tadupajīvino ekaṃsato avisaṃvādanaṃ viya. Sesānaṃ santike
analyzed: bhagavataḥ iva santike samādātabbāni iti idam antarā avicchedana attham vuttam rañño santike  paṭiññāta arahassa atthassa tad upajīvino ekaṃsataḥ avisaṃvādanam viya sesānam santike
translated: In the presence of the rest:🔽the same method of undertaking applies.

original: samādānepi eseva nayo. Ekasaṅgītikassāti pañcasu dīghanikāyādīsu nikāyesu ekanikāyikassa.
analyzed: samādāne pi esa iva nayaḥ eka saṅgītikassa ati pañcasu dīgha nikāya ādīsu nikāyesu ekanikāyikassa
translated: Of one who has a single recitation: of one who has a single collection in the five collections beginning with the Long Collection.

original: Aṭṭhakathācariyassāti yassa aṭṭhakathātantiyeva visesato paguṇā, tassa. Etthāti attanāpi
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā cariyassa iti yassa aṭṭhakathā tantiyā iva visesataḥ paguṇā tassa ettha iti attanā api
translated: Of a teacher of the commentaries: of one who is well up in the commentaries distinguished as “commentaries.”🔽Herein:🔽in the case of his own undertaking’s failure.

original: samādānassa ruhane. Jeṭṭhakabhātu dhutaṅgappicchatāya vatthūti so kira thero nesajjiko,
analyzed: samādānassa jeṭṭhaka bhātu dhutaṅga ppiccha tāya so kira theraḥ nesajjikaḥ
translated: The story of the elder brother’s virtue of fewness of wishes: it seems that this elder was a reciter of the Long Collection.🔽He was a non-recliner, but no one knew it.

original: tassa taṃ na koci jānāti. Athekadivasaṃ rattiyā sayanapiṭṭhe nisinnaṃ vijjulatobhāsena
analyzed: tassa tam na koci jānāti atha eka divasam rattiyā sayana piṭṭhe nisinnam vijju latobhāsena
translated: One day, however, the other saw him sitting on his bed at night by the light of a flash of lightning.

original: disvā itaro pucchi “kiṃ, bhante, tumhe nesajjikā”ti. Thero dhutaṅgappicchatāya tāvadeva
analyzed: disvā itaraḥ pucchi kim bhante tumhe theraḥ tāvat eva
translated: He asked, “Venerable sir, are you a non-recliner?” The elder, out of virtue of fewness of wishes, lay down there and then.

original: nipajjitvā pacchā samādiyīti evamāgataṃ vatthu.
analyzed: nipajjitvā pacchā evamāgatam vatthu
translated: Afterwards he undertook it. This is how the story comes to be included here.

original: 1. Paṃsukūlikaṅgakathāvaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the virtue of wearing rag-robes is finished.

original: 24. Gahapatidānacīvaranti ettha dāyakabhāvena samaṇāpi ukkaṭṭhassa gahapatipakkhaṃyeva
analyzed: gahapati dāna cīvaram ti ettha dāyaka bhāvena samaṇā api ukkaṭṭhassa gahapati pakkham yeva
translated: “Householder-given robe” : here the ascetic is included as a giver, and so the ascetic’s side is the extreme of the householder’s side.

original: paviṭṭhāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. “Pabbajito gaṇhissatī”ti ṭhapitakaṃ siyā gahapaticīvaraṃ,
analyzed: paviṭṭhā ati daṭṭhabbam pabbajitaḥ gaṇhissati iti ṭhapitakam siyā gahapati cīvaram
translated: A robe set aside “thinking ‘An ascetic will take it’” may be a householder’s robe,

original: na pana gahapatidānacīvaranti tādisaṃ nivattetuṃ dānaggahaṇaṃ. Aññatarenāti ettha
analyzed: na pana gahapati dāna cīvaran ti tādisam nivattetum dāna ggahaṇam aññatarena ati ettha
translated: but it is not a householder-given robe. The inclusion of “given” is to exclude such a robe. “Another” :

original: samādānavacanena tāva samādinnaṃ hotu, paṭikkhepavacanena pana kathanti? Atthato🔽āpannattā. Yathā “devadatto divā na bhuñjatī”ti vutte “rattiyaṃ bhuñjatī”ti atthato🔽āpannameva hoti, tassa āhārena vinā sarīraṭṭhiti natthīti, evamidhāpi bhikkhuno gahapatidānacīvare
analyzed: samādāna vacanena tāva samādinnam hotu paṭikkhepa vacanena pana kathanti atthato  āpannattā yathā devadattaḥ divā na bhuñjati iti vutte rattiyam bhuñjati iti atthato  āpannam eva hoti tassa āhārena vinā sarīra ṭṭhiti natthi iti evam idha api bhikkhuno gahapati dāna cīvare
translated: how can it be that it is undertaken by the words of undertaking and yet prohibited by the words of prohibition?🔽It is implied by the meaning.

original: paṭikkhitte tadaññacīvarappaṭiggaho atthato āpanno eva hoti, cīvarena vinā sāsane ṭhiti natthīti.
analyzed: paṭikkhitte tad añña cīvara paṭiggaho atthataḥ āpannaḥ eva hoti cīvarena vinā sāsane natthi iti
translated: Just as when it is said “Devadatta does not eat by day,” it is implied by the meaning that he eats by night, since it is impossible for him to keep alive without food, so too here, when the ascetic’s robe is prohibited, the acceptance of another robe is implied by the meaning, since it is impossible for the ascetic to remain in the Dispensation without a robe.🔽The directions for the undertaking of the ascetic practice of the refuse-rag-wearer are given in the passage beginning “He undertakes with any one of the kinds of undertaking” .

original: Evaṃ samādinnadhutaṅgenātiādividhānaṃ paṃsukūlikaṅge paṭipajjanavidhi. Susāne laddhaṃ
analyzed: evam samādinna dhutaṅgena ati ādi vidhānam paṃsukūlika ṅge paṭipajjana vidhi su sāne laddham
translated: What is got at a charnel ground

original: sosānikaṃ. Taṃ pana yasmā tattha kenaci chaḍḍitattā patitaṃ hoti, tasmā vuttaṃ “susāne
analyzed: sosānikam tam pana yasmā tattha kenaci chaḍḍita ttā patitam hoti tasmā vuttam susāne
translated: And the refuse-rag-wearer’s practice is undertaken with one of these five perceptions. But since what is discarded there by someone is fallen, it is said, “Fallen in a charnel ground.”

original: patitaka”nti. Evaṃ pāpaṇikampi daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tālaveḷimaggo nāma mahāgāme ekā vīthi.
analyzed: patitakam ti evam pāpaṇikam pi daṭṭhabbam tālaveḷimaggaḥ nāma mahā gāme ekā vīthi
translated: The “mango grove lane” is a street in a large village.

original: Anurādhapureti ca vadanti. Ḍaḍḍho padeso etassāti ḍaḍḍhappadesaṃ, vatthaṃ. Magge
analyzed: anurādha purā iti ca vadanti ḍaḍḍhaḥ padesaḥ etassa ati ḍaḍḍha ppadesam vattham magge
translated: And they say it is in Anurādhapura.🔽They say that what is fallen on a road should be taken if it has been there for many days.

original: patitakaṃ bahudivasātikkantaṃ gahetabbanti vadanti. “Dvattidivasātikkanta”nti apare.
analyzed: patitakam bahu divasa atikkantam gahetabbanti vadanti dvatti divasa atikkantanti apare
translated: But others say it should be taken if it has been there for two or three days.🔽Having kept it for a little while: having waited for a few days.

original: Thokaṃ rakkhitvāti katipayaṃ kālaṃ āgametvā. Vātāhatampi sāmikānaṃ satisammosena
analyzed: thokam rakkhitvā ti katipayam kālam āgametvā vāta āhatam pi sāmikānam sati sammosena
translated: What is blown about by the wind is like what has fallen because of the owners’ forgetfulness.

original: patitasadisanti “sāmike apassantena gahetuṃ vaṭṭatī”ti vuttaṃ. Tasmā thokaṃ āgametvā gahetabbaṃ.🔽“Saṅghassa demā”ti dinnaṃ, coḷakabhikkhāvasena laddhañca laddhakālato paṭṭhāya “samaṇacīvaraṃ
analyzed: patita sadisanti sāmike a passantena gahetum vaṭṭati iti vuttam tasmā thokam āgametvā gahetabbam  saṅghassa dema iti dinnam coḷaka bhikkhā vasena laddham ca laddha kālataḥ paṭṭhāya samaṇa cīvaram
translated: So it is said that “what is fallen should be taken if the owners are not seen.” Therefore it should be taken after waiting for a little while.🔽“We give it to the Community” or “We give it to the Community of monks” or “We give it to the Community of nuns” or “We give it to the Community of both”: what is given thus is called “given to a particular individual.”🔽“We give it to the Community of monks in this monastery”: what is given thus is called “given to a particular individual.”🔽“We give it to the Community of nuns in this monastery”: what is given thus is called “given to a particular individual.”

original: siyā nu kho, no”ti āsaṅkaṃ nivattetuṃ “na taṃ paṃsukūla”nti vuttaṃ. Na hi taṃ tevīsatiyā
analyzed: siyā nu kho no ti āsaṅkam nivattetum na tat paṃsukūlam ti vuttam na hi tam tevīsatiyā
translated: “We give it to the Community of both in this monastery”: what is given thus is called “given to a particular individual.”🔽“We give it to the Community of monks in this district”: what is given thus is called “given to a particular individual.”🔽“We give it to the Community of nuns in this district”: what is given thus is called “given to a particular individual.”🔽“We give it to the Community of both in this district”: what is given thus is called “given to a particular individual.”🔽“We give it to the Community of monks in this country”: what is given thus is called “given to a particular individual.”🔽“We give it to the Community of nuns in this country”: what is given thus is called “given to a particular individual.”🔽“We give it to the Community of both in this country”: what is given thus is called “given to a particular individual.”🔽“We give it to the Community of monks in the world”: what is given thus is called “given to a particular individual.”🔽“We give it to

original: uppattiṭṭhānesu katthaci pariyāpannaṃ. Idāni imināva pasaṅgena yaṃ bhikkhudattiye
analyzed: uppatti ṭṭhānesu katthaci pariyāpannam idāni iminā ava pasaṅgena yam bhikkhudattiye
translated: It is included in some of the places of origin. Now, in order to show the division of the best and the best-of-the-best in the case of the refuse-rag-wearer’s practice, which is stated in the following passage in the Bhikkhu-diṭṭhi, “In the case of the refuse-rag-wearer’s practice, the best is the best-of-the-best” ,

original: lakkhaṇapattaṃ paṃsukūlaṃ, tassa ca ukkaṭṭhānukkaṭṭhavibhāgaṃ dassetuṃ “bhikkhudattiyepī”tiādi🔽vuttaṃ. Tattha gāhetvā vā dīyatīti saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā dentehi yaṃ cīvaraṃ vassaggena
analyzed: lakkhaṇa pattam paṃsukūlam tassa ca ukkaṭṭha anukkaṭṭha vibhāgam dassetum bhikkhu dattiye pi itiādi  vuttam tattha gāhetvā vā dīyati iti saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā dentehi yam cīvaram vassaggena
translated: the passage beginning, “In the case of the bhikkhu’s practice” is stated.🔽Herein, given after being taken is robe-cloth given by those who give it to the Community or to a group, after having brought it to the bhikkhus by means of a rainy-season bathing ticket.

original: pāpetvā bhikkhūnaṃ dīyati. Senāsanacīvaranti senāsanaṃ kāretvā “etasmiṃ senāsane🔽vasantā paribhuñjantū”ti dinnacīvaraṃ. Na taṃ paṃsukūlanti apaṃsukūlabhāvo pubbe
analyzed: pāpetvā bhikkhūnam dīyati senāsana cīvaranti senāsanam kāretvā etasmim senāsane  vasantā paribhuñjantu iti dinna cīvaram na tam paṃsukūlam a paṃsukūla bhāvaḥ pubbe
translated: The robe-cloth given for a dwelling is robe-cloth given by saying, “Let those who dwell in this dwelling use this” after having a dwelling built.

original: vuttakāraṇato, gāhetvā dinnattā ca. Tenāha “no gāhāpetvā dinnameva paṃsukūla”nti.
analyzed: vutta kāraṇataḥ gāhetvā dinna ttā ca tena āha no gāhāpetvā dinnam eva paṃsukūlanti
translated: That is not a refuse rag, because of the reason stated above and because it is given after being taken. Hence he said, “Only that given after being taken is a refuse rag.”

original: Tatrapīti yaṃ gāhetvā na dinnaṃ bhikkhudattiyaṃ, tatrapi yena bhikkhunā cīvaraṃ dīyati,
analyzed: tatra api iti yam gāhetvā na dinnam bhikkhudattiyam tatra api yena bhikkhunā cīvaram dīyati
translated: In that case too, in the case of the bhikkhu’s practice, where it is not given after being taken, there is respect and deference in the case of the bhikkhu by whom the robe-cloth is given,

original: tassa lābhe, dāne ca visuṃ visuṃ ubhayattha ādaragāravānaṃ sabbhāvato, tadabhāvato
analyzed: tassa lābhe dāne ca visum visum ubhayattha ādara gāravānam sabbhāvataḥ tad abhāvataḥ
translated: in the case of the one who receives it, and in the case of the one who gives it, in each case in both instances, because of the presence or absence of the true nature of respect and deference.

original: ca bhikkhudattiyassa ekatosuddhi ubhatosuddhi anukkaṭṭhatā hontīti imamatthaṃ dassetuṃ🔽“yaṃ dāyakehī”tiādi vuttaṃ, pādamūle ṭhapetvā dinnakaṃ samaṇenāti adhippāyo. Yassa
analyzed: ca bhikkhu dattiyassa ekatas suddhi ubhatas suddhi anukkaṭṭha tā honti iti imam attham dassetuṃ  yam dāyakehi itiādi vuttam pāda mūle ṭhapetvā dinnakam samaṇena āti adhippāyaḥ yassa
translated: The purpose of the passage beginning with the words “What is given by the giver” is to show that in the case of a bhikkhu who has a companion, there is purity of both, and that there is no need for a formal act.

original: kassacīti ukkaṭṭhādīsu yassa kassaci. Ruciyāti chandena. Khantiyāti nijjhānakkhantiyā.🔽Nissayānurūpapaṭipattisabbhāvoti upasampannasamanantaraṃ ācariyena vuttesu catūsu
analyzed: kassaci iti ukkaṭṭha ādīsu yassa kassaci ruciyā ati chandena khantiyā ati nijjhāna khantiyā  nissaya anurūpa paṭipatti sabbhāvaḥ ti upasampanna samanantaram ācariyena vuttesu catūsu
translated: The meaning is that it is given by placing it at the foot of the bhikkhu’s bed. “Of whatever kind”: of whatever kind, whether of the best, etc., “according to his wish”: according to his desire. “According to his liking”: according to his inclination.

original: nissayesu attanā yathāpaṭiññātadutiyanissayānurūpāya paṭipattiyā vijjamānatā. Ārakkhadukkhābhāvoti
analyzed: nissayesu attanā yathā paṭiññāta dutiya nissaya anurūpāya paṭipattiyāḥ vijjamāna tā ārakkha dukkha abhāvaḥ ti
translated: “The state of being in conformity with the dependence”: the state of being in conformity with the second dependence as undertaken by himself among the four dependences stated by the teacher immediately after the admission.

original: cīvarārakkhanadukkhassa abhāvo paṃsukūlacīvarassa alobhanīyattā. Paribhogataṇhāya🔽abhāvo savisesalūkhasabhāvattā. Pāsādikatāti paresaṃ pasādāvahatā. Appicchatādīnaṃ
analyzed: cīvara ārakkhana dukkhassa abhāvaḥ paṃsukūla cīvarassa a lobhanīya ttā paribhoga taṇhāya  abhāvaḥ pāsādika tā ati paresam pasāda āvaha tā appiccha tā ādīnam
translated: “The absence of the suffering of protection”: the absence of the suffering of protecting the robe, because the rag-robe is not a thing to be coveted. “The absence of craving for use”:

original: phalanipphatti dhutaṅgapariharaṇassa appicchatādīhiyeva nipphādetabbato. Dhutadhamme
analyzed: phala nipphatti dhutaṅga pariharaṇassa appiccha tā ādīhiyā iva nipphādetabbataḥ dhuta dhamme
translated: the absence of craving for the use of a robe, because it is by nature a special kind of comfort. “It inspires confidence”: it inspires confidence in others. “It is the fruit of fewness of wishes, etc.”: because it is to be produced only by fewness of wishes, etc., the practice of the ascetic practices is the fruit of fewness of wishes, and so on.

original: samādāya vattanaṃ yāvadeva upari sammāpaṭipattisampādanāyāti vuttaṃ “sammāpaṭipattiyā
analyzed: samādāya vattanam yāvat eva upari sammā paṭipatti sampādanāya ati vuttam sammāpaṭipattiyā
translated: The meaning of “in order to perfect the right way above” is that of “in order to perfect the right way above by undertaking and carrying out the ascetic practices.”

original: anubrūhana”nti. Mārasenavighātāyāti mārassa, mārasenāya ca vihananāya viddhaṃsanāya.
analyzed: māra sena vighātāya ati mārassa māra senāya ca vihananāya viddhaṃsanāya
translated: “For the destruction of the army of Death”: for the crushing and destroying of Mara and of the army of Mara.

original: Kāyavācācittehi yato saṃyatoti yati, bhikkhu. Dhāritaṃ yaṃ lokagarunā paṃsukūlaṃ,
analyzed: kāya vācā cittehi yatas yati bhikkhu dhāritam yam loka garunā paṃsukūlam
translated: “The ascetic” is the bhikkhu who is restrained by restraint in body, speech, and mind.

original: taṃ ko na dhāraye, yasmā vā lokagarunā paṃsukūlaṃ dhāritaṃ, tasmā ko taṃ na dhārayeti🔽yojanā yaṃtaṃsaddānaṃ ekantasambandhibhāvato. Paṭiññaṃ samanussaranti upasampadamāḷe
analyzed: tam kaḥ na dhāraye yasmai vā loka garunā paṃsukūlam dhāritam tasmai kaḥ tam na dhāraya iti  ekanta sambandhi bhāvataḥ paṭiññam samanussaranti upasampadam āḷe
translated: “Who would not wear the refuse-rag garment worn by the world’s Benefactor?” The construction here is by attraction.

original: “āma bhante”ti ācariyapamukhassa saṅghassa sammukhā dinnaṃ paṭiññaṃ samanussaranto.
analyzed: āma bhante ti ācariya pamukhassa saṅghassa sammukhā dinnam paṭiññam samanussarantaḥ
translated: “Remembering the declaration at the time of full admission” means remembering the declaration made in the presence of the teacher and the community of bhikkhus with “Yes, venerable sir.”

original: Iti paṃsukūlikaṅgakathāvaṇṇanā.
analyzed: iti paṃsukūlika aṅga kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: Thus is concluded the description of the refuse-rag-wearer’s practice.

original: 2. Tecīvarikaṅgakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: tecīvarika ṅga kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The triple-robe-wearer’s practice

original: 25. Catutthakacīvaranti nivāsanapārupanayogyaṃ catutthakacīvaranti adhippāyo, aṃsakāsāvassa
analyzed: catutthaka cīvaranti nivāsana pārupana yogyam catutthaka cīvaranti adhippāyaḥ aṃsa kāsāvassa
translated: The fourth robe: the intention is that it is a fourth robe suitable for wearing as an inner or an upper garment.

original: appaṭikkhipitabbato. Aññataravacanenāti ettha yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ heṭṭhā vuttanayameva.
analyzed: a paṭikkhipitabbataḥ aññatara vacanena ati ettha yat vattabbam tat heṭṭhā vutta nayam eva
translated: As to the words “in some cases”: what is to be said here has already been said above.🔽The word “until” is to be construed with each of the three clauses.🔽“Does not succeed” means “does not come about.”

original: Yāva na sakkoti, yāva na labhati, yāva na sampajjatīti paccekaṃ yāva-saddo sambandhitabbo.🔽Na sampajjatīti na sijjhati. Nikkhittapaccayā doso natthīti nicayasannidhidhutaṅgasaṃkilesadoso
analyzed: yāva na sakkoti yāva na labhati yāva na sampajjati iti paccekam yāva saddaḥ sambandhitabbo  na sampajjati iti na sijjhati nikkhitta paccayā doso natthi iti nicaya sannidhi dhuta aṅga saṃkilesa doso
translated: There is no offense if the conditions are not available.🔽“Nearby” means in a place near the robe.

original: natthi. Āsanneti cīvarassa āsanne ṭhāne. Rajanakkhaṇe paribhuñjanakāsāvaṃ rajanakāsāvaṃ.
analyzed: na atthi āsanne ti cīvarassa āsanne ṭhāne rajana khaṇe paribhuñjana kāsāvam rajana kāsāvam
translated: The robe to be dyed is the ochre robe to be used for dyeing at the time of dyeing.

original: Tatraṭṭhakapaccattharaṇaṃ nāma attano, parassa vā santakaṃ senāsane paccattharaṇavasena
analyzed: tatraṭṭhaka paccattharaṇam nāma attanaḥ parassa vā santakam senāsane paccattharaṇa vasena
translated: The bedspread that is there is either his own or another’s, which he has determined as a bedspread in the dwelling.

original: adhiṭṭhitaṃ. “Aṃsakāsāvaṃ parikkhāracoḷaṃ hoti, iti paccattharaṇaṃ, aṃsakāsāvanti
analyzed: adhiṭṭhitam aṃsa kāsāvam parikkhāra coḷam hoti iti paccattharaṇam aṃsa kāsāvanti
translated: The ochre robe on the shoulder is the cloth for the requisites. Thus the bedspread and the ochre robe on the shoulder

original: imāni dvepi atirekacīvaraṭṭhāne ṭhitānipi dhutaṅgabhedaṃ na karontī”ti aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: imāni dve pi atireka cīvaraṭṭhāne ṭhitāni pi dhutaṅga bhedam na karonti iti
translated: are both kept in a place other than the robe-cloth, but this does not constitute a breach of the ascetic practice.”

original: vuttanti vadanti. Pariharituṃ pana na vaṭṭatīti rajanakāle eva anuññātattā niccaparibhogavasena🔽na vaṭṭati tecīvarikassa. Aṃsakāsāvanti khandhe ṭhapetabbakāsāvaṃ. Kāyaparihārikenāti🔽vātātapādiparissayato kāyassa pariharaṇamattena. Samādāyevāti gahetvā eva. Appasamārambhatāti🔽appakiccatā. Kappiye mattakāritāyāti nisīdanādivasena, parikkhāracoḷavasena ca bahūsu
analyzed: vuttam ti vadanti pariharitum pana na vaṭṭati iti rajana kāle eva anuññāta ttā nicca paribhoga vasena  na vaṭṭati tecīvarikassa aṃsa kāsāvanti khandhe ṭhapetabba kāsāvam kāya parihārikena ati  vāta ātapa ādi parissayataḥ kāyassa pariharaṇa mattena samādāya iva ati gahetvā eva appa samārambha tā ati  appa kicca tā kappiye matta kāri tāya āti nisīdana ādi vasena parikkhāra coḷa vasena ca bahūsu
translated: “They say” means they speak. But it is not allowable to keep them: because they were allowed only for the time of dyeing, they are not allowable for the tecīvarika to use permanently. “Shoulder-cloth” means a cloth to be put on the shoulder. “For protecting the body” means for merely protecting the body from wind, sun, etc., “Having accepted” means having taken. “With little activity” means with few duties. “With the mere making of what is allowable” means with the mere making of a sitting-cloth, etc., and of a robe for wearing as a rag-robe, and with the mere making of a robe for wearing as a store-robe.

original: cīvaresu anuññātesupi ticīvaramatte ṭhitattā. Saha pattacaraṇāyāti sapattacaraṇo. Pakkhī sapakkhako.🔽Iti tecīvarikaṅgakathāvaṇṇanā.🔽3. Piṇḍapātikaṅgakathāvaṇṇanā🔽26. Atirekalābhanti “piṇḍiyālopabhojanaṃ nissāyā”ti evaṃ vuttabhikkhāhāralābhato🔽atirekalābhaṃ, saṅghabhattādinti attho. Sakalassa saṅghassa dātabbabhattaṃ saṅghabhattaṃ.
analyzed: cīvaresu anuññātesu pi ti cīvara matte ṭhita ttā saha patta caraṇāya ati sa patta caraṇaḥ pakkhī sa pakkhako 🔽iti tecīvarika ṅga kathā vaṇṇanā 🔽piṇḍapātika ṅga kathā vaṇṇanā 🔽atireka lābham ti piṇḍiyā lopa bhojanam nissāya ati evam vutta bhikkhāhāra lābhato 🔽atireka lābham saṅgha bhatta ādin ti attho sakalassa saṅghassa dātabba bhattam saṅgha bhattam
translated: They say that it is allowable. But it is not allowable to keep it: because it was allowed only for the rainy season, it is not allowable for the triple-robe wearer to keep it as a permanent possession. “Shoulder-cloth”: a cloth to be put over the shoulder. “For protection of the body”: for the mere purpose of protecting the body from wind, sun, etc. “Having taken”: having accepted. “With little difficulty”: with little trouble. “With the mere minimum allowable”: although many robes are allowed for sitting-cloths, etc., and for cloths to make a robe-rack, etc., he remains with the mere minimum of three robes. “Together with the bowl and the set of robes”: the bowl and the set of robes are together with him, as a bird is together with its wings.

original: Katipaye bhikkhū uddisitvā dātabbabhattaṃ uddesabhattaṃ. Ekasmiṃ pakkhe ekadivasaṃ🔽dātabbabhattaṃ pakkhikaṃ. Uposathe uposathe dātabbabhattaṃ uposathikaṃ. Paṭipadadivase🔽dātabbabhattaṃ pāṭipadikaṃ. Vihāraṃ uddissa dātabbabhattaṃ vihārabhattaṃ. Dhuragehe
analyzed: katipaye bhikkhū uddisitvā dātabba bhattam uddesa bhattam ekasmin pakkhe eka divasam  dātabba bhattam pakkhikam uposathe uposathe dātabba bhattam uposathikam paṭipada divase  dātabba bhattam pāṭipadikam vihāram uddissa dātabba bhattam vihāra bhattam dhura gehe
translated: A meal given to a certain number of monks by name is a named meal. A meal given on one day in one fortnight is a fortnightly meal. A meal given on the observance day is an observance-day meal. A meal given on the first day of the observance-day procedure is a first-day-of-the-fortnight meal. A meal given to the monastery is a monastery meal. A meal given to the storehouse is a storehouse meal.

original: eva ṭhapetvā dātabbabhattaṃ dhurabhattaṃ. Gāmavāsīādīhi vārena dātabbabhattaṃ vārakabhattaṃ.
analyzed: eva ṭhapetvā dātabba bhattam dhurabhattam gāmavāsī ādīhi vārena dātabba bhattam vārakabhattam
translated: A meal given to monks after naming some of them is a named meal. A meal given on one day in one fortnight is a fortnightly meal. A meal given on the observance day is an observance-day meal. A meal given on the first day of the fortnight is a first-day-of-the-fortnight meal. A meal given for the benefit of the monastery is a monastery meal. A meal given for the benefit of the storehouse is a storehouse meal. A meal given by turns to the residents of a particular monastery, etc., is a turn meal.

original: “Saṅghabhattaṃ gaṇhathātiādinā”ti ādi-saddena uddesabhattādiṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Sādituṃ
analyzed: saṅgha bhattam gaṇhatha ati ādinā ati ādi saddena uddesa bhatta ādim saṅgaṇhāti sāditum
translated: The words “and so on” include named meals, etc.🔽It is allowable to eat it because it is mentioned in the section on almsfood.

original: vaṭṭantīti bhikkhāpariyāyena vuttattā. Bhesajjādipaṭisaṃyuttā nirāmisasalākā. Yāvakālikavajjāti🔽ca vadanti. Vihāre pakkabhattampīti upāsakā idheva bhattaṃ pacitvā “sabbesaṃ ayyānaṃ
analyzed: vaṭṭanti iti bhikkhā pariyāyena vutta ttā bhesajja ādi paṭisaṃyuttā nirāmisa salākā yāvakālika vajjā ti  ca vadanti vihāre pakka bhattam pi iti upāsakāḥ idha iva bhattam pacitvā sabbesam ayyānam
translated: They say that a non-staple food ticket connected with medicine, etc., is a temporary ticket.🔽And cooked food in the monastery: lay followers cook the food right there, saying, “We will give it to all the masters,” and they prepare the meal right there in the monastery. That is allowable for the almsfood-refusers too.

original: dassāmā”ti vihāreyeva bhattaṃ sampādenti, taṃ piṇḍapātikānampi vaṭṭati. Āharitvāti
analyzed: dassāma ati vihāreya iva bhattam sampādenti tam piṇḍapātikānam pi vaṭṭati āharitvā iti
translated: Having brought it:

original: pattaṃ gahetvā gehato ānetvā. Taṃ divasaṃ nisīditvāti “mā, bhante, piṇḍāya carittha,🔽vihāreyeva bhikkhā ānīyatī”ti vadantānaṃ sampaṭicchanena taṃ divasaṃ nisīditvā. Serivihārasukhanti
analyzed: pattam gahetvā gehataḥ ānetvā tam divasam nisīditvā ati mā bhante piṇḍāya carittha  vihāreya iva bhikkhāḥ ānīyati iti vadantānam sampaṭicchanena tam divasam nisīditvā seri vihāra sukhanti
translated: and brought it from the house. Sat down for that day means: having accepted the invitation of those who said, “Venerable Sir, do not go for alms,

original: aparāyattavihāritāsukhaṃ. Ariyavaṃsoti ariyavaṃsasuttapaṭisaṃyuttā dhammakathā. Dhammarasanti🔽dhammūpasañhitaṃ pāmojjādirasaṃ.🔽Jaṅghabalaṃ nissāya piṇḍapariyesanato kosajjanimmaddanatā. “Yathāpi bhamaro puppha”ntiādinā🔽vuttavidhinā āhārapariyesanato parisuddhājīvatā. Niccaṃ antaragharaṃ pavisantasseva🔽suppaṭicchannagamanādayo sekhiyadhammā sampajjantīti sekhiyapaṭipattipūraṇaṃ. Paṭiggahaṇe
analyzed: a para āyatta vihāri tā sukham ariya vaṃso ti ariya vaṃsa sutta paṭisaṃyuttā dhamma kathā dhamma rasanti  dhammu upasañhitam pāmojja ādi rasam  jaṅgha balam nissāya piṇḍa pariyesanataḥ kosajja nimmaddana tā yathā api bhamaro pupphanti ādinā  vutta vidhinā āhāra pariyesanataḥ parisuddha ājīva tā niccam antara gharam pavisantassa iva  suppaṭicchanna gamana ādayaḥ sekhiya dhammā sampajjanti iti sekhiya paṭipatti pūraṇam paṭiggahaṇe
translated: alms will be brought to the monastery,” he sat down for that day. The bliss of dwelling in an empty place means the bliss of dwelling independently. The noble lineage means a talk on the Dhamma connected with the Noble Lineage Discourse. The taste of the Dhamma means the joy, etc., associated with the Dhamma.

original: mattaññutāya, saṃsaṭṭhavihārābhāvato ca aparapositā. Kule kule appakaappakapiṇḍagahaṇena
analyzed: mattaññu tāya saṃsaṭṭha vihāra abhāvataḥ ca apara positā kule kule appaka appaka piṇḍa gahaṇena
translated: The removal of laziness through the search for alms by means of the strength of one’s legs. The purity of livelihood through the search for alms in the manner described in the passage beginning, “Just as a bee, without injuring a flower or its stalk” . The fulfilment of the practice of the trainable rules through the fact that, when one enters a house every day, the trainable rules such as the proper way of entering a house, etc., are fulfilled. The absence of being put away by others through the knowledge of moderation in accepting and through the absence of dwelling in close association with others. The absence of being put away by families through the acceptance of a little alms in each house.

original: parānuggahakiriyā. Antimāya jīvikāya avaṭṭhānena mānappahānaṃ. Vuttañhetaṃ “antamidaṃ,
analyzed: para anuggaha kiriyā antimāya jīvikāya avaṭṭhānena māna ppahānam vuttam ha etam antam idam
translated: and the doing of good to others. The abandoning of pride is by not taking up the last kind of livelihood. For this is said: “This is the end,

original: bhikkhave, jīvikānaṃ, yadidaṃ piṇḍolya”ntiādi. Missakabhattena yāpanato rasataṇhānivāraṇaṃ.
analyzed: bhikkhave jīvikānam yat idam piṇḍolī anti ādi missaka bhattena yāpanataḥ rasa taṇhā nivāraṇam
translated: and the giving of help to others. The abandoning of pride by not persisting in the last kind of livelihood. For this is said: “Bhikkhus, this is the end of the search for alms by wandering from house to house, namely, living on offerings” . The prevention of craving for tastes by living on mixed food.

original: Nimantanāsampaṭicchanato gaṇabhojanādisikkhāpadehi anāpattitā.
analyzed: nimantanā sampaṭicchanataḥ gaṇa bhojana ādi sikkhāpadehi an āpatti tā
translated: The non-offensiveness by not accepting invitations.

original: Appaṭihatavuttitāya catūsupi disāsu vattanaṭṭhena cātuddiso. Ājīvassa visujjhatīti
analyzed: appaṭihata vutti tāya catūsu pi disāsu vattana ṭṭhena cātuddisaḥ ājīvassa visujjhati iti
translated: The being “four-quarted” in the sense of going in the four directions by the practice of unobstructed conduct.🔽His livelihood is purified:

original: ājīvo assa visujjhati. Attabharassāti appānavajjasulabharūpehi paccayehi attano bharaṇato
analyzed: ājīvaḥ assa visujjhati atta bharassa ati appāna vajja sulabha rūpehi paccayehi attanaḥ bharaṇataḥ
translated: his livelihood is purified. Self-sustained: by maintaining himself with requisites that are easy to get and not blameworthy,

original: attabharassa. Tato eva ekavihāritāya saddhivihārikādīnampi aññesaṃ aposanato anaññaposino.🔽Padadvayenāpi kāyaparihārikena cīvarena kucchiparihārikena piṇḍapātena vicaraṇato
analyzed: atta bharassa tatas eva ekavihāritāya saddhivihārika ādīnam pi aññesam aposanataḥ anaññaposino  pada dvayena api kāya parihārikena cīvarena kucchi parihārikena piṇḍapātena vicaraṇataḥ
translated: he is self-sustained. And because of that, he is not another’s support because he does not depend on others for a co-resident, etc.

original: sallahukavuttitaṃ, subharataṃ, paramaappicchataṃ, santuṭṭhiñca dasseti. Devāpi pihayanti
analyzed: subharatam parama appiccha tam santuṭṭhim ca dasseti devā api pihayanti
translated: The two phrases show that he is easy to support, easy to satisfy, and has few wants, since he goes about with a robe that is a mere covering for the body and with alms food that is a mere filling for the stomach.

original: tādinoti tādisassa bhusaṃ ativiya santakāyavacīmanokammatāya upasantassa paramena
analyzed: tādinaḥ ti tādisassa bhusam ativiya santa kāya vacī manaḥ kamma tāya upasantassa paramena
translated: The gods, the Sakka gods, etc.,

original: satinepakkena samannāgamato sabbakālaṃ satimato piṇḍapātikassa bhikkhussa sakkādayo
analyzed: satinepakkena samannāgamataḥ sabbakālam satimataḥ piṇḍapātikassa bhikkhussa sakka ādayaḥ
translated: long for, i.e., wish for, a bhikkhu who is a bowl-food-eater, who is possessed of mindfulness by being endowed with the highest watchfulness, who is calm, who is of such a nature, i.e., who is of such a kind as to be very quiet in body, speech, and mind.

original: devāpi pihayanti patthenti. Tassa sīlādiguṇesu bahumānaṃ uppādentā ādaraṃ janenti,
analyzed: devāḥ api pihayanti patthenti tassa sīla ādi guṇesu bahu mānam uppādentāḥ ādaram janenti
translated: They arouse great respect for his virtue, etc., and they generate reverence for him,

original: pageva manussā. Sace so lābhasakkārasilokasannissito na hoti, tadabhikaṅkhī na hotīti attho.
analyzed: pagā iva manussā sace saḥ lābha sakkāra siloka sannissitaḥ na hoti tad abhikaṅkhī na hoti iti attho
translated: not to speak of men. If he is not intent on gain, honour, and renown, the meaning is that he does not desire it.

original: Iti piṇḍapātikaṅgakathāvaṇṇanā.
analyzed: iti piṇḍapātika aṅga kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the exposition of the virtue of the bowl-food-eater is ended.

original: 4. Sapadānacārikaṅgakathāvaṇṇanā🔽27. Imināti sapadānacārikena. Kālataranti kālasseva. Aphāsukaṭṭhānanti saparissayādivasena
analyzed: sa padāna cārikā aṅga kathā vaṇṇanā  iminā ti sa padāna cārikena kālataranti kālassa iva a phāsuka ṭṭhānanti sa parissaya ādi vasena
translated: . Exposition of the virtue of the house-to-house seeker🔽“The house-to-house seeker”: by one who goes from house to house.🔽“In good time”: early.🔽“In a place that is not too far and not too near”: a place that is not difficult to get to by reason of the danger of wild beasts, etc.

original: duppavesanaṭṭhānaṃ. Puratoti vīthiyaṃ gacchantassa purato gharaṃ apaviṭṭhasseva.
analyzed: duppavesana ṭṭhānam puratas ti vīthiyam gacchantassa puratas gharam a paviṭṭhassa iva
translated: “In front”: in front of one who is going along the street, before he has reached the house.

original: Pattavissaṭṭhaṭṭhānanti pesakāravīthiyaṃ pesakārabhāvaṃ nimminitvā ṭhitassa sakkassa
analyzed: patta vissaṭṭha ṭṭhānam ti pesakāra vīthiyam pesakāra bhāvam nimminitvā ṭhitassa sakkassa
translated: “In a place suitable for receiving alms”: in the case of Sakka who, after creating the state of a weaver, stood in a weaver’s street.

original: gharadvāre pattavissaṭṭhaṭṭhānaṃ. Ukkaṭṭhapiṇḍapātiko taṃ divasaṃ na bhikkhaṃ āgamayamāno
analyzed: ghara dvāre patta vissaṭṭha ṭṭhānam ukkaṭṭha piṇḍapātikaḥ tam divasam na bhikkham āgamayamānaḥ
translated: The place where the alms-food is to be got is the house door. The alms-food gatherer who does not bring alms-food that day sits down;

original: nisīdati, tasmā taṃ anulometi. Katthacipi kule nibaddhaṃ upasaṅkamanābhāvato paricayābhāvena
analyzed: nisīdati tasmai tam katthacipi kule nibaddham paricaya abhāvena
translated: so he conforms to that. He is a stranger to families because he does not regularly approach any family.

original: kulesu niccanavakatā. Sabbattha alaggamānasatāya ca sommabhāvena ca candūpamatā.🔽Kulesu pariggahacittābhāvena tattha maccherappahānaṃ. Hitesitāya vibhāgābhāvato samānukampitā.
analyzed: kulesu nicca navaka tā sabbattha a lagga mānasa tāya ca somma bhāvena ca canda upama tā  kulesu pariggaha citta abhāvena tattha macchera ppahānam hita īsitāya vibhāga abhāvataḥ
translated: He is like the moon because he is not attached to anything and is pure in mind.🔽He has abandoned avarice there because he has no mind to hoard in families. He is impartial because he has no partiality due to his desire for welfare.

original: Kulānaṃ saṅgaṇhanasaṃsaṭṭhatādayo kulūpakādīnavā. Avhānānabhinandanāti nimantanavasena
analyzed: kulānam saṅgaṇhana saṃsaṭṭha tā ādayaḥ kulūpaka ādīnavāḥ avhāna anabhinandana ati nimantana vasena
translated: The dangers in being a family’s man-for-all-work, etc., are the socializing, etc., with families. He does not accept invitations because he does not consent to invitations to eat.

original: avhānassa asampaṭicchanā. Abhihārenāti bhikkhābhihārena. Sericāranti yathāruci vicaraṇaṃ.
analyzed: a vhānassa a sampaṭicchanā abhihārena ati bhikkhā abhihārena sa iricāranti yathāruci vicaraṇam
translated: He does not accept offers because he does not accept offers of alms-food. He wanders on without a fixed direction because he wanders on as he likes.

original: Iti sapadānacārikaṅgakathāvaṇṇanā.
analyzed: iti sa padāna cārika aṅga kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: So much for the commentary on the clause on “one who goes for alms from house to house.”

original: 5. Ekāsanikaṅgakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: ekāsanika aṅga kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: On “one who sits in one place”

original: 28. Nānāsanabhojananti anekasmiṃ āsane bhojanaṃ, ekanisajjāya eva abhuñjitvā visuṃ
analyzed: anekasmin āsane bhojanam eka nisajjāya eva a bhuñjitvā visum
translated: “Eating in one session” is eating in one sitting. Without eating after rising from the first sitting,

original: visuṃ nisajjāsu āhāraparibhoganti attho. Patirūpanti yuttarūpaṃ anuṭṭhāpanīyaṃ. Vattaṃ
analyzed: visum nisajjāsu āhāra paribhoganti attho patirūpanti yutta rūpam anuṭṭhāpanīyam vattam
translated: Suitable: fitting, not to be rejected.🔽To do the proper duties: it is proper to do the duties.

original: kātuṃ vaṭṭatīti vattaṃ kātuṃ yujjati. Vattaṃ nāma garuṭṭhānīye kattabbameva. Tattha
analyzed: kātum vaṭṭati iti vattam kātum yujjati vattam nāma garuṭṭhānīye kattabbam eva tattha
translated: The duties are what should be done for one who is senior.

original: pana paṭipajjanavidhiṃ dassetuṃ yaṃ theravādaṃ āha “āsanaṃ vā rakkheyya bhojanaṃ🔽vā”tiādi. Tassattho – ekāsanikaṃ bhikkhuṃ bhuñjantaṃ āsanaṃ vā rakkheyya, dhutaṅgabhedato🔽yāva bhojanapariyosānā na vuṭṭhātabbanti vuttaṃ hoti. Bhojanaṃ vā rakkheyya dhutaṅgabhedato,
analyzed: pana paṭipajjana vidhim dassetum yam thera vādam āha āsanam vā rakkheyya bhojanam  vā ti ādi tassa atthaḥ eka āsanikam bhikkhum bhuñjantam āsanam vā rakkheyya dhutaṅga bhedataḥ  yāva bhojana pariyosānā na vuṭṭhātabbanti vuttam hoti bhojanam vā rakkheyya dhutaṅga bhedato
translated: Herein, in order to point out the procedure for attending on him, it was said above, “He should guard the seat or the meal” .🔽The meaning is this: he should guard the seat of a bhikkhu who is an “one-seater” while he is eating, that is, he should not leave it while he is still eating, in order to avoid breaking the ascetic practice.🔽Or he should guard the meal, that is, he should not leave it while he is still eating, in order to avoid breaking the ascetic practice.

original: abhuñjiyamānaṃ yāva bhuñjituṃ nārabhati, tāva vuṭṭhātabbanti attho. Yasmā tayidaṃ
analyzed: a bhuñjiyamānam yāva bhuñjitum na ārabhati tāva vuṭṭhātabbanti atthaḥ yasmā tayā idam
translated: The meaning is that he should not leave it while he is still eating, in order to avoid breaking the ascetic practice.

original: dvayaṃ idha natthi, tasmā vattakaraṇaṃ dhutaṅgaṃ na rakkhatīti adhippāyo. Tenāha
analyzed: dvayam idha na atthi tasmā vatta karaṇam dhutaṅgam na rakkhati iti adhippāyaḥ tena āha
translated: Since these two are not found here, the intention is that he does not guard the ascetic practice of doing the proper duties.🔽Hence it was said:

original: “ayañcā”tiādi. “Bhesajjatthamevā”ti iminā bhesajjaparibhogavaseneva sappiādīnipi
analyzed: ayam ca atiādi bhesajja ttham eva ati iminā bhesajja paribhoga vasena iva sappi ādīni pi
translated: “And this” , etc. By the words “only for the purpose of medicine” it is shown that ghee, etc., are also not to be used for the purpose of enjoyment.

original: vaṭṭantīti dasseti. Appābādhatāti arogatā. Appātaṅkatāti akicchajīvitā sarīradukkhābhāvo.
analyzed: vaṭṭanti iti dasseti appa ābādha tā aroga tā appa ātaṅka tā ati akiccha jīvi tā sarīra dukkha abhāvo
translated: he shows that it is allowable. ‘Little illness’ is health. ‘Little affliction’ is the absence of trouble in the life of the body.

original: Lahuṭṭhānanti kāyassa lahuparivattitā. Balanti sarīrabalaṃ. Phāsuvihāroti sukhavihāro.
analyzed: lahu ṭṭhānan ti kāyassa lahu parivatti tā balanti sarīra balam phāsu vihāro ti sukha vihāro
translated: ‘Lightness’ is the lightness of the body’s movements. ‘Strength’ is bodily strength. ‘Comfort’ is living in bliss.

original: Sabbametaṃ bahukkhattuṃ bhuñjanapaccayā uppajjanavikārapaṭikkhepapadaṃ. Rujāti rogā.🔽Na kammamattanoti attano yogakammaṃ purebhattaṃ, pacchābhattañca na parihāpeti, bahuso
analyzed: sabbam etam bahu kkhattum bhuñjana paccayā uppajjana vikāra paṭikkhepa padam rujāti rogā  na kammam attanoti attanaḥ yoga kammam purebhattam pacchābhattam ca na parihāpeti bahuso
translated: All this is a term that rejects the alteration that arises contingent upon eating a lot. ‘Pain’ is sickness.🔽‘Not his own work’ : he does not neglect his own work of devotion either before meals or afterwards, because of his not being addicted to eating a lot and because of his being healthy.

original: bhojane abyāvaṭabhāvato, arogabhāvato cāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: bhojane a byāvaṭa bhāvataḥ aroga bhāvataḥ ca ati adhippāyo
translated: This is the purport.

original: Iti ekāsanikaṅgakathāvaṇṇanā.
analyzed: iti eka āsanika aṅga kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: So much for the commentary on the clause on the one-sessioner.

original: 6. Pattapiṇḍikaṅgakathāvaṇṇanā🔽29. Appaṭikūlaṃ katvā bhuñjituṃ vaṭṭati paṭikūlassa bhuttassa agaṇhanampi siyāti
analyzed: patta piṇḍika aṅga kathā vaṇṇanā  a paṭikūlam katvā bhuñjitum vaṭṭati paṭikūlassa bhuttassa a gaṇhanam pi siyāti
translated: On the bowl-food-eater’s practice🔽The purport is this: it is allowable to eat without making a choice, but if there is a choice, it is only what is eaten that should be counted.

original: adhippāyo. Pamāṇayuttameva gaṇhitabbanti “ekabhājanameva gaṇhāmī”ti bahuṃ gahetvā
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ pamāṇa yuttam eva gaṇhitabbanti eka bhājanam eva gaṇhāmi iti bahum gahetvā
translated: ‘Measured’ should be taken to mean ‘measured in the right amount.’ The meaning is: ‘I shall take only one bowlful.’

original: na chaḍḍetabbaṃ. Nānārasataṇhāvinodananti nānārasabhojane taṇhāya vinodanaṃ. Atra🔽atra nānābhājane ṭhite nānārase icchā etassāti atriccho, tassa bhāvo atricchatā,
analyzed: na chaḍḍetabbam nānā rasa taṇhā vinodanam ti nānā rasa bhojane taṇhāya vinodanam atra  atra nānā bhājane ṭhite nānā rase icchā etassa ati atricchaḥ tassa bhāvaḥ atriccha tā
translated: The satisfaction of craving for various tastes: the satisfaction of craving for various kinds of food.🔽Herein, he is called a “seeker of here” because he desires various kinds of food that are placed here in various kinds of dishes. The state of that is “seeking here.”

original: tassā atricchatāya pahānaṃ. Āhāre payojanamattadassitāti asambhinnanānārase gedhaṃ
analyzed: tassāḥ pahānam āhāre a sambhinna nānā rase gedham
translated: The abandoning of that seeking here.

original: akatvā āhāre satthārā anuññātapayojanamattadassitā. Visuṃ visuṃ bhājanesu ṭhitāni
analyzed: a katvā āhāre satthārā anuññāta payojana matta dassitā visum visum bhājanesu ṭhitāni
translated: The seeing of the purpose of nutriment: the seeing of the purpose of nutriment as permitted by the Teacher without seeking various kinds of food that are not mixed together.

original: byañjanāni gaṇhato tattha tattha sābhogatāya siyā vikkhittabhojitā, na tathā imassa
analyzed: byañjanāni gaṇhataḥ tattha tattha sa ābhoga tāya siyā vikkhitta bhojitā na tathā imassa
translated: When he takes the condiments placed in separate dishes here and there, he might eat in a scattered way because of his attachment to them here and there. But not so for one who has the perception of the bowl,

original: ekapattagatasaññinoti vuttaṃ “avikkhittabhojitā”ti. Okkhittalocanoti pattasaññitāya
analyzed: eka patta gata saññino ti vuttam a vikkhitta bhojitā ati okkhitta locano ti patta saññitāya
translated: it is said. “He eats without scattering” .

original: heṭṭhākhittacakkhu. Paribhuñjeyyāti paribhuñjituṃ sakkuṇeyya.🔽Iti pattapiṇḍikaṅgakathāvaṇṇanā.🔽7. Khalupacchābhattikaṅgakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: heṭṭhā ākhitta cakkhu paribhuñjeyya ati paribhuñjitum sakkuṇeyya 🔽iti patta piṇḍika aṅga kathā vaṇṇanā 🔽
translated: “With eyes cast down” : with eyes cast down because of the perception of the bowl.

original: 30. Bhuñjantassa yaṃ upanītaṃ, tassa paṭikkhepena taṃ atirittaṃ bhojananti atirittabhojanaṃ.
analyzed: bhuñjantassa yam upanītam tassa paṭikkhepena tam atirittam bhojananti atiritta bhojanam
translated: The eating of what has been brought is the eating of what has been brought to one who is eating. The excess is the eating of what is left over.🔽The undertaking is stated thus: “I undertake the practice of eating only what is left over after serving guests, etc.”

original: Puna bhojanaṃ kappiyaṃ kāretvā na bhuñjitabbaṃ, tabbisayattā imassa dhutaṅgassa.
analyzed: puna bhojanam kappiyam kāretvā na bhuñjitabbam imassa dhutaṅgassa
translated: The benefit is this. He does not eat again. For this ascetic practice is governed by that.🔽That is why it was said above that the undertaking is stated thus.

original: Tenāha “idamassa vidhāna”nti. Yasmiṃ bhojaneti yasmiṃ bhuñjiyamāne bhojane. Tadeva
analyzed: tena āha idam assa vidhānam ti yasmim bhojane iti yasmim bhuñjiyamāne bhojane tat eva
translated: In the eating of what is left over after serving guests, etc., he eats only that, not anything else.

original: bhuñjati, na aññaṃ. Anatirittabhojanapaccayā āpatti anatirittabhojanāpatti, tato
analyzed: bhuñjati na aññam an atiritta bhojana paccayā āpatti an atiritta bhojana āpatti tatas
translated: The non-occurrence of the offence that would be an offence for him if he ate again is the non-offence.

original: dūrībhāvo anāpajjanaṃ. Odarikattaṃ ghasmarabhāvo kucchipūrakatā, tassa abhāvo ekapiṇḍenāpi
analyzed: dūrībhāvaḥ anāpajjanam odarika ttam ghasmara bhāvaḥ kucchi pūraka tā tassa abhāvaḥ eka piṇḍena api
translated: The absence of the state of being greedy, the absence of the state of being a glutton, the absence of the state of being a glutton for scraps, is the absence of greed.

original: yāpanato. Nirāmisasannidhitā nihitassa abhuñjanato. Puna pariyesanavasena pariyesanāya
analyzed: yāpanataḥ nirāmisa sannidhi tā nihitassa a bhuñjanataḥ puna pariyesana vasena pariyesanāya
translated: The absence of the state of having stored is the absence of the state of having stored up. The non-occurrence of the search for food by reason of the search for it again is the absence of search.🔽The non-occurrence of weariness due to the search is the absence of weariness.

original: khedaṃ na yāti. Abhisallekhakānaṃ santosaguṇādīnaṃ vuddhiyā sañjananaṃ santosaguṇādivuḍḍhisañjananaṃ.
analyzed: khedam na yāti abhisallekhakānam santosa guṇa ādīnam vuddhiyā sañjananam santosa guṇa ādi vuḍḍhi sañjananam
translated: The arousing of the special qualities of fewness of wishes, etc., is the arousing of the special qualities.

original: Idanti khalupacchābhattikaṅgaṃ.🔽Iti khalupacchābhattikaṅgakathāvaṇṇanā.
analyzed: idam anti khalu pad chābhattikaṅgam 🔽iti khalu pacchābhattika aṅga kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: This, firstly, is the commentary on the term “after-meals ascetic practice.”🔽The explanation of the after-meals ascetic practice is ended.

original: 8. Āraññikaṅgakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: āraññika aṅga kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: 8. The explanation of the section on the forest-dweller’s practice

original: 31. Gāmantasenāsanaṃ pahāya araññe aruṇaṃ uṭṭhāpetabbanti ettha gāmantaṃ, araññañca
analyzed: gāmanta senāsanam pahāya araññe aruṇam uṭṭhāpetabbanti ettha gāmantam araññañca
translated: As to the words “Having abandoned a dwelling in a village area, he should rise at the crack of dawn in the forest,” the village area and the forest are

original: sarūpato dassetuṃ “tattha saddhiṃ upacārenā”tiādi āraddhaṃ. Tattha gāmapariyāpannattā
analyzed: sarūpataḥ dassetum tattha saddhim upacārena ati ādi āraddham tattha gāma a pariyāpanna ttā
translated: shown in their individual characteristics by the words “There, together with its precincts” and so on. Herein, since the dwelling in a village area is included in the village,

original: gāmantasenāsanassa “gāmoyeva gāmantasenāsana”nti vuttaṃ. Yo koci satthopi gāmo nāmāti🔽sambandho. Indakhīlāti ummārā. Tassāti leḍḍupātassa. Vinayapariyāyena araññalakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: gāmanta senāsanassa gāmaḥ yeva gāmanta senāsananti vuttam yaḥ koci sattho api gāmaḥ nāma ati  sambandhaḥ indakhīlā ati ummārā tassa ati leḍḍupātassa vinaya pariyāyena arañña lakkhaṇam
