analyzed: idam bhante katham imassa kaḥ attho ti paripucchana paripañha ākāra dassanam
translated: This is the way to see the asking of questions and the asking of explanations, namely, “What is this, venerable sir? What is the meaning of this? “🔽And when the text is not clear, they explain it from the tradition by showing the text in another place.

original: pāḷiyā atthaṃ padesantarapāḷidassanena āgamato vivaranti. Anuttānīkatañca yuttivibhāvanena
analyzed: pāḷiyā attham padesa antara pāḷi dassanena āgamataḥ vivaranti anuttānīka tañca yutti vibhāvanena
translated: And what has not been fully drawn out they draw out by the elucidation of the argument.

original: uttānīkaronti. Kaṅkhaṭṭhāniyesu dhammesu saṃsayuppattiyā hetutāya gaṇṭhiṭṭhānabhūtesu
analyzed: uttānīkaronti kaṅkhaṭṭhāniyesu dhammesu saṃsaya uppattiyāḥ hetutāya gaṇṭhiṭṭhāna bhūtesu
translated: And in the case of the knots that are a basis for doubt,

original: pāḷipadesesu yāthāvato vinicchayadānena kaṅkhaṃ paṭivinodenti. Ettha ca “nātidūraṃ,🔽nāccāsannaṃ, gamanāgamanasampanna”nti ekaṃ aṅgaṃ, “divā appākiṇṇaṃ, rattiṃ appasaddaṃ🔽appanigghosa”nti ekaṃ, “appaḍaṃsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassa”nti ekaṃ, “tasmiṃ
analyzed: pāḷi padesesu yāthāvataḥ vinicchaya dānena kaṅkham paṭivinodenti ettha ca na ati dūram  na acca āsannam gamana āgamana sampannam ti ekam aṅgam divā appa ākiṇṇam rattim appa saddam  ekam ekam tasmin
translated: They dispel doubt by giving the right interpretation of the text.

original: kho pana senāsane viharantassa…pe… parikkhārā”ti ekaṃ, “tasmiṃ kho pana senāsane
analyzed: kho pana senāsane viharantassa pe ekam tasmim kho pana senāsane
translated: Herein, “not too far” and “not too near” are one factor, “accessible for coming and going” is one factor, “secluded by day” and “with little noise and traffic by night” are one factor, “with an easily available supply of the requisite conditions of a bhikkhu’s life, that is, alms, lodgings, and medicine during illness” is one factor, “with companions of like qualities” is one factor.

original: therā…pe… kaṅkhaṃ paṭivinodentī”ti ekaṃ. Evaṃ pañca aṅgāni veditabbāni.
analyzed: therāpe kaṅkham paṭivinodenti iti ekam evam pañca aṅgāni veditabbāni
translated: So these should be understood as the five factors.

original: Khuddakapalibodhavaṇṇanā
analyzed: khuddaka pali bodha vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the minor impediments

original: 54. Khuddakapalibodhupacchede payojanaṃ parato āgamissati. Aggaḷaanuvātaparibhaṇḍadānādinā daḷhīkammaṃ vā. Tantacchedādīsu tunnakammaṃ vā kātabbaṃ.
analyzed: khuddaka pali bodha upacchede payojanam paratas āgamissati aggaḷa anuvāta paribhaṇḍa dāna ādinā daḷhī kammam vā tanta cheda ādīsu tunna kammam vā kātabbam
translated: . The purpose of the section on the minor impediments will appear later. The bed should be made firm by wedging it with wooden chocks, etc., and by tightening the ropes, and so on. The holes should be filled with clay, and so on.

original: Bhāvanāvidhānavaṇṇanā
analyzed: bhāvanā vidhāna vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the directions for development

original: 55. Sabbakammaṭṭhānavasenāti anukkamena niddisiyamānassa cattālīsavidhassa sabbassa
analyzed: sabba kammaṭṭhāna vasena ati anukkamena niddisiyamānassa cattālīsavidhassa sabbassa
translated: . “In all its aspects” : in all the forty aspects that will be specified.

original: kammaṭṭhānassa vasena. Piṇḍapātapaṭikkantenāti piṇḍapātaparibhogato paṭinivattena,🔽piṇḍapātabhuttāvinā onītapattapāṇināti attho. Bhattasammadaṃ paṭivinodetvāti bhojananimittaṃ
analyzed: kammaṭṭhānassa vasena piṇḍapāta paṭikkantena ati piṇḍapāta paribhogato paṭinivattena  piṇḍapāta bhuttāvinā onīta patta pāṇinā ti attho bhatta sammadam paṭivinodetvā iti bhojana nimittam
translated: By means of the meditation subject. Piṇḍapātapaṭikkantenā ti piṇḍapātaparibhogato paṭinivattena,

original: parissamaṃ vinodetvā. Āhāre hi āsayaṃ paviṭṭhamatte tassa āgantukatāya yebhuyyena
analyzed: parissamam vinodetvā āhāre hi āsayam paviṭṭha matte tassa āgantuka tāya yebhuyyena
translated: bhattasammadaṃ paṭivinodetvā ti bhojananimittaṃ parissamaṃ vinodetvā. Āhāre hi āsayaṃ paviṭṭhamatte tassa āgantukatāya yebhuyyena

original: siyā sarīrassa koci parissamo, taṃ vūpasametvā. Tasmiṃ hi avūpasante sarīrakhedena
analyzed: siyā sarīrassa koci parissamaḥ tam vūpasametvā tasmin hi a vūpasante sarīra khedena
translated: siyā sarīrassa koci parissamo, taṃ vūpasametvā. Tasmiṃ hi avūpasante sarīrakhedena

original: cittaṃ ekaggataṃ na labheyyāti. Pavivitteti janavivitte. Sukhanisinnenāti pallaṅkaṃ
analyzed: cittam ekagga tam na labheyya ati pavivittā iti jana vivitte sukha nisinnena ati pallaṅkam
translated: cittaṃ ekaggataṃ na labheyyāti. Pavivitte ti janavivitte. Sukhanisinnenā ti pallaṅkaṃ

original: ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya nisajjāya sukhanisinnena. Vuttañhetanti yaṃ “katāya
analyzed: ābhujitvā ujum kāyam paṇidhāya nisajjāya sukha nisinnena yam katāya
translated: ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya nisajjāya sukhanisinnena. Vuttañhetanti yaṃ “katāya

original: vā”tiādinā pathaviyā nimittaggahaṇaṃ idha vuccati, vuttaṃ hetaṃ porāṇaṭṭhakathāyaṃ.
analyzed: vāti ādinā pathaviyāḥ nimitta ggahaṇam idha vuccati vuttam ha etam porāṇa aṭṭhakathāyam
translated: vā”tiādinā pathaviyā nimittaggahaṇaṃ idha vuccati, vuttaṃ hetaṃ porāṇaṭṭhakathāyaṃ.

original: Idāni taṃ aṭṭhakathāpāḷiṃ dassento “pathavīkasiṇaṃ uggaṇhanto”tiādimāha. Tatthāyaṃ
analyzed: idāni tam aṭṭhakathā pāḷim dassento pathavī kasiṇam uggaṇhanto ti ādim āha tattha ayam
translated: Idāni taṃ aṭṭhakathāpāḷiṃ dassento “pathavīkasiṇaṃ uggaṇhanto”tiādimāha. Tatthāyaṃ

original: saṅkhepattho – pathavīkasiṇaṃ uggaṇhantoti uggahanimittabhāvena pathavīkasiṇaṃ gaṇhanto🔽ādiyanto, uggahanimittabhūtaṃ pathavīkasiṇaṃ uppādentoti attho. Uppādanañcettha tathānimittassa🔽upaṭṭhāpanaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. Pathaviyanti vakkhamānavisese pathavīmaṇḍale. Nimittaṃ gaṇhātīti
analyzed: saṅkhepa atthaḥ pathavī kasiṇam uggaṇhantaḥ ti uggaha nimitta bhāvena pathavī kasiṇam gaṇhantaḥ  ādiyantaḥ uggaha nimitta bhūtam pathavī kasiṇam uppādento ti atthaḥ uppādanam ca ittha tathā nimittassa  upaṭṭhāpanam daṭṭhabbam pathaviyanti vakkhamāna visese pathavī maṇḍale nimittam gaṇhāti iti
translated: The meaning of the words is this: He who is learning the earth kasiṇa: who is apprehending the earth kasiṇa as the learning sign.

original: tattha cakkhunā ādāsatale mukhanimittaṃ viya bhāvanāñāṇena vakkhamānavisesaṃ pathavīnimittaṃ🔽gaṇhāti. “Pathaviya”nti vatvāpi maṇḍalāpekkhāya napuṃsakaniddeso. Kateti vakkhamānavidhinā
analyzed: tattha cakkhunā ādāsa tale mukha nimittam viya bhāvanā ñāṇena vakkhamāna visesam pathavī nimittam  gaṇhāti pathaviyan ti vatvā api maṇḍala apekkhāya napuṃsaka niddeso katā iti vakkhamāna vidhinā
translated: He is beginning, he is producing the earth kasiṇa as the learning sign, is the meaning. And here the producing should be regarded as the establishing of the sign in that way. In the earth: in the earth disk of the kind described. He apprehends the sign: he apprehends the earth sign in the place described by means of the knowledge of the meditation.🔽Although he says “in the earth,” the neuter form “pathaviyā” is used because of the consideration of the disk. He makes it the sign: he makes it the sign by the method about to be described.

original: abhisaṅkhateti attho. Vā-saddo aniyamattho. Akateti pākatike khalamaṇḍalādike pathavīmaṇḍale.
analyzed: atthaḥ vā saddaḥ aniyama atthaḥ akata iti pākatike khala maṇḍala ādike pathavī maṇḍale
translated: The meaning is, he forms it. The word “or” has the meaning of non-restriction. He makes it the sign in the earth disk that is not made, that is, in the ordinary earth disk such as a threshing floor, etc.

original: Sāntaketi saantake eva, saparicchede evāti attho. Sāvadhāraṇañhetaṃ vacanaṃ. Tathā
analyzed: sa antaka iti sa antake eva sa paricchede eva ati vacanam tathā
translated: In the limited: the meaning is, in the limited, in the defined. For this is a restrictive statement.

original: hi tena nivattitaṃ dassetuṃ “no anantake”ti vuttaṃ. Sakoṭiyetiādīnipi tasseva vevacanāni.🔽Suppamatte vātiādīsu suppasarāvāni samappamāṇāni icchitāni. Keci pana vadanti “sarāvamattaṃ
analyzed: hi tena nivattitam dassetum no anantaka iti vuttam sa koṭiya iti ādīni pi tassa iva vevacanāni  suppa matte vā ti ādīsu suppa sarāvāni samappamāṇāni icchitāni keci pana vadanti sarāva mattam
translated: “Not in the infinite” is said to show that it is not in the infinite. “With a rim” , etc., are synonyms for it.🔽In the passage beginning, “The size of a bushel or the size of a saucer” , the size of a bushel and the size of a saucer are intended.

original: vidatthicaturaṅgulaṃ hoti, suppamattaṃ tato adhikappamāṇanti. Kittimaṃ kasiṇamaṇḍalaṃ
analyzed: vidatthi catur aṅgulam hoti su pamattam tatas adhikappamāṇanti kittimam kasiṇa maṇḍalam
translated: But some say that the size of a saucer is🔽four finger-breadths square, and the size of a bushel is larger than that.

original: heṭṭhimaparicchedena sarāvamattaṃ, uparimaparicchedena suppamattaṃ, na tato adho,
analyzed: heṭṭhima paricchedena sarāva mattam uparima paricchedena suppa mattam na tatas adhas
translated: The kasiṇa disk is the size of a bushel at the bottom and the size of a saucer at the top, not larger than that,

original: uddhaṃ vāti parittappamāṇabhedasaṅgaṇhanatthaṃ ‘suppamatte vā sarāvamatte vā’ti vutta”nti.
analyzed: uddham vā ati paritta ppamāṇa bheda saṅgaṇhana attham suppamatte vā sarāva matte vā iti vuttan ti
translated: and it is said to be “the size of a bushel or the size of a saucer” in order to include the difference in size.

original: Yathāupaṭṭhite ārammaṇe ekaṅgulamattampi vaḍḍhitaṃ appamāṇamevāti vuttovāyamattho.
analyzed: yathā upaṭṭhite ārammaṇe eka aṅgula mattam pi vaḍḍhitam appamāṇam eva ati vuttaḥ uva ayam attho
translated: The meaning is that it is “infinite” because it is extended as far as it appears.

original: Keci pana “chattamattampi kasiṇamaṇḍalaṃ kātabba”nti vadanti.🔽So taṃ nimittaṃ suggahitaṃ karotīti so yogāvacaro taṃ pathavīmaṇḍalaṃ suggahitaṃ
analyzed: keci pana chatta mattam pi kasiṇa maṇḍalam kātabbanti vadanti 🔽saḥ tam nimittam suggahitam karoti iti saḥ yogāvacaraḥ tam pathavī maṇḍalam suggahitam
translated: But some say that the kasiṇa disk should be made the size of an umbrella.

original: nimittaṃ karoti. Yadā cakkhuṃ ummīletvā oloketvā tattha nimittaṃ gahetvā nimmīletvā
analyzed: nimittam karoti yadā cakkhum ummīletvā oloketvā tattha nimittam gahetvā nimmīletvā
translated: he makes a sign. When he has opened his eyes, looked, taken a sign there, closed his eyes,🔽🔽

original: āvajjentassa ummīletvā olokitakkhaṇe viya upaṭṭhāti, tadā suggahitaṃ karoti nāma.🔽Athettha satiṃ sūpaṭṭhitaṃ katvā abahigatena mānasena punappunaṃ sallakkhento sūpadhāritaṃ🔽upadhāreti nāma. Evaṃ upadhāritaṃ pana naṃ punappunaṃ āvajjento manasi karonto tamevārabbha
analyzed: āvajjentassa ummīletvā olokita kkhaṇe viya upaṭṭhāti tadā suggahitam karoti nāma  atha ittha satim su upaṭṭhitam katvā a bahigatena mānasena punappunam sallakkhentaḥ su upadhāritam  upadhāra iti nāma evam upadhāritam pana nam punappunam āvajjentaḥ manasi karontaḥ tam eva ārabbha
translated: He makes a sign. When he opens his eyes and looks and apprehends the sign, and then closes them and adverts to it, it appears to him as it did when he looked with his eyes open. Then he has made a good apprehension.🔽Next, after establishing the mindfulness well-founded, he should look again and again with a mind that does not stray elsewhere. Then he has made a good determination.

original: āsevanaṃ bhāvanaṃ bahulaṃ pavattento suvavatthitaṃ vavatthapeti nāma. Tasmiṃ ārammaṇeti
analyzed: āsevanam bhāvanam bahulam pavattentaḥ su vavatthitam vavatthapeti nāma tasmin ārammaṇeti
translated: Looking at it again and again in this way, giving attention to it, and frequently inclining his mind to that object, he defines it well.

original: evaṃ suggahitakaraṇādinā sammadeva upaṭṭhite tasmiṃ pathavīkasiṇasaññite ārammaṇe.🔽Cittaṃ upanibandhatīti attano cittaṃ upacārajjhānaṃ upanetvā nibandhati aññārammaṇato
analyzed: evam sugga hita karaṇa ādinā sammat eva upaṭṭhite tasmin pathavī kasiṇa saññite ārammaṇe  cittam upanibandhati iti attanaḥ cittam upacāra jhānam upanetvā nibandhati añña ārammaṇato
translated: When it is defined in this way, he should bring his mind down on to that object, which is called the earth kasiṇa.

original: vinivattaṃ karoti. Addhā imāyātiādi ānisaṃsadassāvitādassanaṃ.
analyzed: vinivattam karoti addhā
translated: He should lead his mind by means of applied thought onto the neighbourhood of access jhāna and bind it there, and so prevent its straying elsewhere.🔽The passage beginning “And he should give attention to it as ‘earth, earth’” should be understood to describe the way in which he gives attention to it.

original: Idāni yathādassitassa aṭṭhakathāpāṭhassa atthappakāsanena saddhiṃ bhāvanāvidhiṃ vibhāvetukāmo
analyzed: idāni yathā dassitassa aṭṭhakathā pāṭhassa attha ppakāsanena saddhim bhāvanā vidhim vibhāvetu kāmo
translated: Now, wishing to expound the method of development together with the elucidation of the meaning of the text of the commentary as shown above,

original: akate tāva nimittaggahaṇaṃ dassento “tattha yena atītabhavepī”tiādimāha. Tattha tatthāti
analyzed: akate tāva nimitta ggahaṇam dassento tattha yena atīta bhave pi iti ādim āha tattha tattha ati
translated: he said “Herein, by one who has had” in order to show the sign-grasping that has not been done. Herein, herein means

original: tasmiṃ aṭṭhakathāpāṭhe. Catukkapañcakajjhānānīti catukkapañcakanayavasena vadati.
analyzed: tasmin aṭṭhakathā pāṭhe catukka pañcaka jjhānāni iti catukka pañcaka naya vasena vadati
translated: in that text of the commentary. The fourfold and fivefold jhānas: he says this in terms of the fourfold and fivefold jhānas.

original: Puññavatoti bhāvanāmayapuññavato. Upanissayasampannassāti tādiseneva upanissayena
analyzed: puñavataḥ ti bhāvanā maya puññavataḥ upanissaya sampannassa ati tādisena iva upanissayena
translated: Endowed with merit: endowed with the merit consisting in development. Possessed of the requisite conditions: possessed of the requisite conditions of that kind.

original: samannāgatassa. Khalamaṇḍaleti maṇḍalākāre dhaññakaraṇaṭṭhāne. Taṃṭhānappamāṇamevāti
analyzed: samannāgatassa khala maṇḍale ti maṇḍala ākāre dhañña karaṇa ṭṭhāne tad ṭhāna ppamāṇam eva ati
translated: In a threshing-floor: in a place for threshing grain, which is shaped like a threshing-floor. The size of the place looked at:

original: olokitaṭṭhānappamāṇameva.
analyzed: olokita ṭṭhāna ppamāṇam eva
translated: the size of the place looked at.

original: Avirādhetvāti avirajjhitvā vuttavidhinā eva. Nīlapītalohitaodātasambhedavasenāti
analyzed: a virādhetvā ati a virajjhitvā vutta vidhinā eva nīla pīta lohita odāta sambheda vasena ati
translated: Without letting it go: without losing it. In the way stated: in the way stated thus: “He should not review it too often” . By the division of blue, yellow, red, and white:

original: nīlādivaṇṇāhi mattikāhi paccekaṃ, ekajjhañca saṃsaggavasena. Gaṅgāvaheti gaṅgāsote.
analyzed: nīla ādi vaṇṇāhi mattikāhi paccekam ekajjhañca saṃsagga vasena gaṅgāvahā iti gaṅgāsote
translated: by means of the clays that have the colours of blue, etc., separately and mixed together. Like the Ganges: like the current of the Ganges.

original: Sīhaḷadīpe kira rāvaṇagaṅgā nāma nadī, tassā sotena chinnataṭaṭṭhāne mattikā aruṇavaṇṇā.
analyzed: sīhaḷadīpe kira rāvaṇagaṅgā nāma nadī tassā sotena chinna taṭa ṭṭhāne mattikā aruṇa vaṇṇā
translated: In the Sihala country, it seems, there is a river called the Ravana Ganga. The clay on the bank cut by the current of that river is reddish in colour.

original: Taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “gaṅgāvahe mattikāsadisāya aruṇavaṇṇāyā”ti. Aruṇavaṇṇāya aruṇanibhāya,
analyzed: tam sandhāya vuttam gaṅgāvahe mattikā sadisāya aruṇa vaṇṇāya ati aruṇa vaṇṇāya aruṇa nibhāya
translated: It is with reference to that that it is said, “like the clay of the Ravana Ganga, reddish in colour”. Reddish in colour, reddish in appearance;

original: aruṇappabhāvaṇṇāyāti attho.
analyzed: aruṇa ppabhā vaṇṇāya ati attho
translated: the meaning is, having the appearance of a reddish glow.

original: Evaṃ kasiṇadose dassetvā idāni kasiṇakaraṇādike sesākāre dassetuṃ “tañca kho”tiādi🔽vuttaṃ. Saṃhārimanti saṃharitabbaṃ gahetvā caraṇayoggaṃ. Tatraṭṭhakanti yatra kataṃ,
analyzed: evam kasiṇa dose dassetvā idāni kasiṇa karaṇa ādike sesa ākāre dassetum tat ca kho ti ādi  vuttam saṃhāriman ti saṃharitabbam gahetvā caraṇa yoggam yatra katam
translated: Having thus shown the faults of the kasiṇa, he now said, “And that” in order to show the remaining modes of procedure beginning with the making of the kasiṇa.🔽“To be gathered”: to be gathered and carried. “To be made there”: to be made right there.

original: tattheva tiṭṭhanakaṃ. Vuttappamāṇanti “suppamatte vā sarāvamatte vā”ti vuttappamāṇaṃ.
analyzed: tattha eva tiṭṭhanakam vutta ppamāṇam ti su ppamatte vā sarāva matte vā ati vutta ppamāṇam
translated: “To be made there and then”: to be made right there and then. “The size stated”: the size stated thus, “the size of a bushel or the size of a saucer”.

original: Vaṭṭanti maṇḍalasaṇṭhānaṃ. Parikammakāleti nimittuggahaṇāya bhāvanākāle. Etadevāti🔽yaṃ vidatthicaturaṅgulavitthāraṃ, etadeva pamāṇaṃ sandhāya “suppamattaṃ vā sarāvamattaṃ
analyzed: vaṭṭanti maṇḍala saṇṭhānam parikamma kāle iti nimittu ggahaṇāya bhāvanā kāle etat eva ati 🔽yam vidatthi catur aṅgula vitthāram etat eva pamāṇam sandhāya suppa mattam vā sarāva mattam
translated: “Round”: the shape of a circle. “The preliminary work”: the time of development for the purpose of apprehending the sign. “Just that”:🔽the size of a span or four fingerbreadths. “The size stated”: the size stated thus, “the size of a bushel or the size of a saucer” .

original: vā”ti vuttaṃ. Suppaṃ hi nātimahantaṃ, sarāvañca mahantaṃ cāṭipidhānappahonakanti samappamāṇaṃ hoti.
analyzed: vā ti vuttam suppam hi na atimahantam sarāvam ca mahantam ca āṭi pidhāna pahonakam ti sama ppamāṇam hoti
translated: for it is said, “The disc should be the size of a bushel, and the colour should be the size of a saucer.”

original: 56. Tasmāti paricchedatthāya vuttattā. Evaṃ vuttapamāṇaṃ paricchedanti yathāvuttappamāṇaṃ🔽vidatthicaturaṅgulavitthāraṃ paricchedaṃ katvā, evaṃ vuttappamāṇaṃ vā kasiṇamaṇḍalaṃ
analyzed: tasmā ati pariccheda tthāya vutta ttā evam vutta pamāṇam yathā vutta ppamāṇam  vidatthi catur aṅgula vitthāram paricchedam katvā evam vutta ppamāṇam vā kasiṇa maṇḍalam
translated: “Therefore”: because the size is stated for the purpose of delimitation. “The size stated thus”: the size stated thus,🔽having made a delimitation of a span in width and four fingerbreadths in breadth.🔽“The kasiṇa disc the size stated thus” is delimited by a colour different from that of the kasiṇa. “Tree resin” is red sandalwood, etc.;

original: visabhāgavaṇṇena paricchedaṃ katvā. Rukkhapāṇikāti kucandanādirukkhapāṇikā aruṇavaṇṇassa
analyzed: visa bhāga vaṇṇena paricchedam katvā rukkhapāṇikā ti kucandana ādi rukkhapāṇikā aruṇa vaṇṇassa
translated: it produces a colour different from the colour of dawn,

original: visabhāgavaṇṇaṃ samuṭṭhapeti. Tasmā taṃ aggahetvāti vuttaṃ. Pakatirukkhapāṇikā pana🔽pāsāṇapāṇikāgatikāva. Ninnunnataṭṭhānābhāvena bherītalasadisaṃ katvā. Tato dūrataretiādi
analyzed: visa bhāga vaṇṇam samuṭṭhapeti tasmā tam aggahetvā iti vuttam pakati rukkha pāṇikā pana  ninnunnata ṭṭhāna abhāvena bherī tala sadisam katvā tatas dūratara iti ādi
translated: therefore it is said, “do not take that.” But natural tree resin🔽is like the resin of the pāṇī tree.🔽having made it like the surface of a drum, neither hollowed nor raised. “From that place” and so on

original: yathāvuttato padesato, pīṭhato ca aññasmiṃ ādīnavadassanaṃ. Kasiṇadosāti hatthapāṇipadādayo idha kasiṇadosā.
analyzed: yathā vuttato padesato pīṭhato ca aññasmin ādīnava dassanam kasiṇa dosā ti hattha pāṇi pada ādayo idha kasiṇa dosā
translated: is the seeing of danger in a place and a posture other than the one stated. “The fault in the kasiṇa” is the hand, foot, etc., here.

original: Vuttanayenevāti “aḍḍhateyyahatthantare padese, vidatthicaturaṅgulapādake pīṭhe”ti
analyzed: vutta nayena iva ati aḍḍhateyya hatthantare padese vidatthi catur aṅgula pādake pīṭha iti
translated: In the way already stated: in the place measuring one and a half cubits by one cubit, on a seat with legs a span long.

original: ca vuttavidhināva. Kāmesu ādīnavanti “kāmā nāmete aṭṭhikaṅkalūpamā nirassādaṭṭhena,🔽tiṇukkūpamā anudahanaṭṭhena, aṅgārakāsūpamā mahābhitāpaṭṭhena, supinakūpamā ittarapaccupaṭṭhānaṭṭhena,
analyzed: ca vutta vidhinā ava kāmesu ādīnavanti kāmāḥ nāma ete aṭṭhi kaṅkalūpamāḥ nirassāda ṭṭhena  tiṇukkūpamā anudahana ṭhena aṅgārakāsūpamā mahā abhitāpa ṭṭhena supinakūpamā ittara paccupaṭṭhāna ṭhena
translated: The danger in sensual desires: “Sensual desires are like a skeleton, in that they are devoid of substance;🔽like a grass torch, in that they burn the hand; like a pit of coals, in that they are a great blaze; like a dream, in that they are a brief experience;🔽like borrowed goods, in that they are for a brief period; like a fruit tree, in that they are shared by many;🔽like a butcher’s knife and block, in that they bring about one’s own destruction; like a sword and knife, in that they are a cutting off; like a snake’s head, in that they are full of poison;

original: yācitakūpamā tāvakālikaṭṭhena, rukkhaphalūpamā sabbaṅgapaccaṅgapalibhañjanaṭṭhena,🔽asisūnūpamā adhikuṭṭanaṭṭhena, sattisūlūpamā vinivijjhanaṭṭhena, sappasirūpamā sapaṭibhayaṭṭhenā”tiādinā🔽“appassādā kāmā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā”tiādinā “kāmasukhañca nāmetaṃ bahuparissayaṃ,
analyzed: yācitaka upamā tāvakālika ṭṭhena rukkha phala upamā sabbaṅga paccaṅga palibhañjana ṭṭhena  asi sūnu upamā adhikuṭṭana ṭhena satti sūlūpamā vinivijjhana ṭhena sappa sirūpamā sa paṭibhaya ṭṭhena ati ādinā  appassādāḥ kāmāḥ bahu dukkhāḥ bahu pāyāsā ati ādinā kāma sukham ca nāma etam bahu parissayam
translated: like a murder weapon, in that they are fearful; like a stake for a dog or pig, in that they are contemptible;🔽like a mire, in that they are a quagmire; like a pit of excrement, in that they are a stench; like a skeleton, in that they are disgusting; like a cesspool, in that they are a filthy receptacle; like a spider’s web, in that they ensnare one; like a baited hook, in that they are a trap; like a snare, in that they are a noose; like a pitfall, in that they are a trap for birds; like a robber, in that they are a brigand; like a fish-hook, in that they are a fisherman’s bait; like a mirage, in that they are a delusion; like a monkey, in that they are fickle; like a dream, in that they are a brief experience; like a borrowed article, in that they are not one’s own; like a fruit tree, in that they are shared by many; like a butcher’s knife and block, in that they bring about one’s own destruction; like a sword and knife, in that they are a cutting off; like a snake’s head, in that they are full of poison;🔽like a murder weapon, in that they are fearful; like a stake for a dog or pig, in that they are contemptible;

original: sāsaṅkaṃ, sabhayaṃ, saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ, mīḷhaparibhogasadisaṃ, hīnaṃ, gammaṃ, pothujjanikaṃ,
analyzed: sa āsaṅkam sa bhayam saṃkiliṭṭham mīḍha paribhoga sadisam hīnam gammam pothujjanikam
translated: like a mire, in that they are a quagmire; like a pit of excrement, in that they are a stench; like a skeleton, in that they are disgusting; like a cesspool, in

original: anariyaṃ, anatthasaṃhita”ntiādinā ca anekākāravokāraṃ vatthukāmakilesakāmesu ādīnavaṃ
analyzed: anariyam anattha saṃhitan ti ādinā ca aneka ākāra vokāram vatthu kāma kilesa kāmesu ādīnavam
translated: and as “a fetter of akuṣala and a condition for the origination of dukkha” , etc., in the way beginning, “Sensual pleasures give little enjoyment” .

original: dosaṃ paccavekkhitvā. Kāmanissaraṇeti kāmānaṃ nissaraṇabhūte, tehi vā nissaṭe. Aggamaggassa
analyzed: dosam paccavekkhitvā kāma nissaraṇa iti kāmānam nissaraṇa bhūte tehi vā nissaṭe aggamaggassa
translated: He reflects on the escape from sensual desires as the escape from sensual desires, or as the escape in sensual desires themselves.🔽He reflects on renunciation as the means for surmounting all suffering, as the footing for the supramundane states, and as the forerunner of the noble fruitions.

original: pādakabhāvena sabbadukkhasamatikkamassa upāyabhūte. Nekkhammeti jhāne. Jātābhilāsena
analyzed: pādaka bhāvena sabba dukkha samatikkamassa upāya bhūte nekkhamme iti jhāne jāta abhilāsena
translated: He arouses desire to undertake, thinking, “I will generate renunciation, which has not yet been generated,” and so on.🔽He generates desire for renunciation, thinking, “May renunciation arise in me,” and so on.🔽He generates desire for the conditions of renunciation, thinking, “May there be in me the faith, etc., that are conditions for renunciation,” and so on.

original: sañjātacchandena. “Sammāsambuddho vata bhagavā aviparītadhammadesanattā, svākkhāto🔽dhammo ekantaniyyānikattā, suppaṭipanno saṅgho yathānusiṭṭhaṃ paṭipajjanato”ti evaṃ
analyzed: sañjāta chandena sammāsambuddhaḥ vata bhagavā aviparīta dhamma desana ttā su ākkhātaḥ  dhammaḥ ekanta niyyānika ttā suppaṭipannaḥ saṅghaḥ yathānusiṭṭham paṭipajjanato ti evam
translated: He generates desire for the realization of renunciation, thinking, “May renunciation be realized by me,” and so on.🔽He generates desire for the realization of the conditions for renunciation, thinking, “May the faith, etc., that are conditions for renunciation be realized by me,” and so on.🔽He generates desire for the undertaking of renunciation, thinking, “May I undertake renunciation,” and so on.🔽He generates desire for the realization of the undertaking of renunciation, thinking, “May I realize the undertaking of renunciation,” and so on.

original: buddhadhammasaṅghaguṇānussaraṇena ratanattayavisayaṃ pītipāmojjaṃ janayitvā. Nekkhammaṃ🔽paṭipajjati etāyāti nekkhammapaṭipadā, saupacārassa jhānassa, vipassanāya, maggassa,
analyzed: buddha dhamma saṅgha guṇa anussaraṇena rata nattaya visayam pīti pāmojjam janayitvā nekkhammam  paṭipajjati etāya ati nekkhamma paṭipadā sa upacārassa jhānassa vipassanāya maggassa
translated: He generates desire for the realization of the conditions for the undertaking of renunciation, thinking, “May I realize the faith, etc., that are conditions for the undertaking of renunciation,” and so on.🔽He generates desire for the development of renunciation, thinking, “May I develop renunciation,” and so on.🔽He generates desire for the realization of the development of renunciation, thinking, “May I realize the development of renunciation,” and so on.🔽He generates desire for the realization of the conditions for the development of renunciation, thinking, “May I realize the faith, etc., that are conditions for the development of renunciation,” and so on.

original: nibbānassa ca adhigamakāraṇanti attho. Pubbe pana paṭhamajjhānameva nekkhammanti
analyzed: nibbānassa ca adhigama kāraṇanti attho pubbe pana paṭhamajjhānam eva nekkhammanti
translated: He generates desire for the realization of the undertaking of the development of renunciation, thinking, “May I realize the undertaking of the development of renunciation,” and so on.🔽He generates desire for the realization of the conditions for the undertaking of the development of renunciation, thinking, “May I realize the

original: vuttattā vuttāvasesā sabbepi nekkhammadhammā. Yathāha –
analyzed: vutta ttā vutta avasesā sabbe pi nekkhamma dhammāḥ yathā āha
translated: as is said:🔽“Going forth, the first jhāna,

original: “Pabbajjā paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ, nibbānaṃ ca vipassanā;
analyzed: pabbajjā paṭhamam jhānam nibbānam ca vipassanā
translated: Nibbāna, and insight too,🔽All profitable states

original: Sabbepi kusalā dhammā, ‘nekkhamma’nti pavuccare”ti. ;
analyzed: sabbe pi kusalāḥ dhammāḥ nekkhammanti pavuccara ti
translated: Are called ‘renunciation.’ ”

original: Pavivekasukharasassāti cittavivekādivivekajassa sukharasassa. Evametehi pañcahi padehi
analyzed: citta viveka ādi viveka jassa sukha rasassa evam etehi pañcahi padehi
translated: Happiness in renunciation: the happiness of the taste of the bliss of the kinds of seclusion beginning with that of the first jhāna.

original: “ānisaṃsadassāvī”tiādīnaṃ padānaṃ attho dassitoti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Samena ākārenāti atiummīlanaatimandālocanāni
analyzed: ānisaṃsa dassāvi iti ādīnam padānam atthaḥ dassito ti daṭṭhabbam samena ākārena ati ati ummīlana ati manda ālocanāni
translated: So the meaning of the words “seeing the danger” and so on should be regarded as shown by these five terms.

original: vajjetvā nātiummīlananātimandālocanasaṅkhātena samena ālocanākārena. Nimittaṃ gaṇhantenāti
analyzed: vajjetvā na ati ummīlana na ati manda ālocana saṅkhātena samena ālocana ākārena nimittam gaṇhantena ati
translated: With an even mind: avoiding excessive opening of the eyes and excessive closing of them, he should advert with an evenness consisting in neither excessive opening nor excessive closing.

original: pathavīkasiṇe cakkhunā gahitanimittaṃ manasā gaṇhantena. Bhāvetabbanti tathāpavattaṃ
analyzed: pathavī kasiṇe cakkhunā gahita nimittam manasā gaṇhantena bhāvetabbanti tathāpavattam
translated: Apprehending the sign: apprehending with the mind the sign that is visible-data apprehended by the eye in the earth kasiṇa.

original: nimittaggahaṇaṃ vaḍḍhetabbaṃ āsevitabbaṃ bahulīkātabbaṃ.
analyzed: nimitta ggahaṇam vaḍḍhetabbam āsevitabbam bahulīkātabbam
translated: It should be developed: that apprehension of the sign should be extended, cultivated, repeated.

original: Cakkhu kilamati atisukhumaṃ, atibhāsurañca rūpagataṃ upanijjhāyato viya. Ativibhūtaṃ
analyzed: cakkhu kilamati ati sukhumam ati bhāsuram ca rūpa gatam upanijjhāyataḥ viya ati vibhūtam
translated: The eye tires if one looks at an object that is too subtle or too brilliant, as if one were looking at a very fine or very bright visible object.

original: hoti attano sabhāvāvibhāvato. Tathā ca vaṇṇato vā lakkhaṇato vā upatiṭṭheyya. Tena
analyzed: hoti attanaḥ sabhāva avibhāvato tathā ca vaṇṇataḥ vā lakkhaṇataḥ vā upatiṭṭheyya tena
translated: and it does not appear as the individual essence of what is apprehended. And it does not appear as the individual essence of what is apprehended because it does not appear as the individual essence of what is apprehended by way of colour or by way of mark.

original: vuttaṃ “tenassa nimittaṃ nuppajjatī”ti. Avibhūtaṃ hoti gajanimmīlanena pekkhantassa
analyzed: vuttam tena assa nimittam nuppajjati iti avibhūtam hoti gaja nimmīlanena pekkhantassa
translated: Therefore it is said, “The sign does not appear to him.” It is not distinguished, like the state of the visible-data base to one who looks with half-closed eyes.

original: rūpagataṃ viya. Cittañca līnaṃ hoti dassane mandabyāpāratāya kosajjapātato. Tenāha🔽“evampi nimittaṃ nuppajjatī”ti. Ādāsatale mukhanimittadassinā viyāti yathā ādāsatale
analyzed: rūpa gatam viya cittam ca līnam hoti dassane manda byāpāra tāya tena āha  evam pi nimittam nuppajjati iti ādāsa tale mukha nimitta dassinā viyāti yathā ādāsa tale
translated: And the mind is slack in looking because of the weakness of the impact. It is on the point of lapsing into lethargy. Therefore it is said,🔽“The sign does not appear to him in this way either.”

original: mukhanimittadassī puriso na tattha atigāḷhaṃ ummīlati, nāpi atimandaṃ, na ādāsatalassa🔽vaṇṇaṃ paccavekkhati, nāpi lakkhaṇaṃ manasi karoti. Atha kho samena ākārena olokento
analyzed: mukha nimitta dassī purisaḥ na tattha atigāḷham ummīlati na api atimandam na ādāsa talassa  vaṇṇam paccavekkhati na api lakkhaṇam manasi karoti atha kho samena ākārena olokento
translated: As to one who sees the reflection of his face in a looking-glass: just as a man who sees the reflection of his face in a looking-glass does not look at it too intently, nor too slackly, nor does he review the colour of the looking-glass, nor does he give attention to its mark,

original: attano mukhanimittameva passati, evameva ayampi pathavīkasiṇaṃ samena ākārena olokento
analyzed: attanaḥ mukha nimittam eva passati evam eva ayam pi pathavī kasiṇam samena ākārena olokento
translated: but rather, looking with an even appearance, he sees only the reflection of his face, so too, this meditator, looking with an even appearance at the earth kasiṇa,

original: nimittaggahaṇappasutoyeva hoti, tena vuttaṃ “samena ākārenā”tiādi. Na vaṇṇo paccavekkhitabboti
analyzed: nimitta ggahaṇa ppasutaḥ yeva hoti tena vuttam samena ākārena atiādi na vaṇṇaḥ paccavekkhitabbaḥ ti
translated: is intent only on apprehending the sign. That is why it is said, “With an even appearance” and so on. The colour should not be reviewed.

original: yo tattha pathavīkasiṇe aruṇavaṇṇo, so na cintetabbo. Cakkhuviññāṇena pana gahaṇaṃ
analyzed: yaḥ tattha pathavī kasiṇe aruṇa vaṇṇo so na cintetabbo cakkhu viññāṇena pana gahaṇam
translated: But it is impossible to prevent its being apprehended by eye-consciousness.

original: na sakkā nivāretuṃ. Tenevettha “na oloketabbo”ti avatvā paccavekkhaṇaggahaṇaṃ kataṃ.
analyzed: na sakkā nivāretum tena iva ittha na oloketabbaḥ ti avatvā paccavekkhaṇa ggahaṇam katam
translated: That is why, instead of saying “should not be looked at,” it is said here “should not be reviewed.”

original: Na lakkhaṇaṃ manasi kātabbanti yaṃ tattha pathavīdhātuyā thaddhalakkhaṇaṃ, taṃ na manasi kātabbaṃ.
analyzed: na lakkhaṇam manasi kātabbanti yam tattha pathavī dhātuyā thaddha lakkhaṇam tam na manasi kātabbam
translated: The characteristic should not be given attention: the earth element’s characteristic of hardness should not be given attention there.

original: Disvā gahetabbattā “vaṇṇaṃ amuñcitvā”ti vatvāpi vaṇṇavasenettha ābhogo na kātabbo,
analyzed: disvā gahetabba ttā vaṇṇam a muñcitvā iti vatvā api vaṇṇa vasena itthā ābhogaḥ na kātabbaḥ
translated: Although it is said “without relinishing the colour,” still absorption should not be undertaken by means of the colour there.

original: so pana vaṇṇo nissayagatiko kātabboti dassento āha “nissayasavaṇṇaṃ katvā”ti. Nissayena🔽samānākārasannissito so vaṇṇo tāya pathaviyā samānagatikaṃ katvā, vaṇṇena saheva🔽“pathavī”ti manasi kātabbanti attho. Ussadavasena paṇṇattidhammeti pathavīdhātuyā
analyzed: so pana vaṇṇaḥ nissaya gatikaḥ kātabbaḥ iti dassentaḥ āha nissaya savaṇṇam katvā iti nissayena  samāna ākāra sannissitaḥ saḥ vaṇṇaḥ tāya pathaviyā samāna gatikam katvā vaṇṇena saha iva  pathavī iti manasi kātabbanti atthaḥ ussada vasena paṇṇatti dhammā iti pathavī dhātuyā
translated: Showing that the colour should be made to occur with the support, he said “making the colour the support’s colour.”🔽The colour should be made to occur with the same mode of occurrence as the support. The meaning is that “earth” should be given attention by making the colour the same as the earth element.

original: ussannabhāvena sattito adhikabhāvena sasambhārapathaviyaṃ “pathavī”ti yo lokavohāro,
analyzed: ussanna bhāvena sattitaḥ adhika bhāvena sa sambhārapathaviyam pathavī iti yaḥ lokavohāro
translated: The term is applied by a manner of excess: the ordinary use of the term “earth” is in what is called “earth with preparations” by the fact of the earth element’s predominance,

original: tasmiṃ paṇṇattidhamme cittaṃ paṭṭhapetvā “pathavī, pathavī”ti manasi kātabbaṃ. Yadi
analyzed: tasmin paṇṇatti dhamme cittam paṭṭhapetvā pathavī pathavī iti manasi kātabbam yadi
translated: He should establish his cognizance on that concept- dhamma and give attention to it as “earth, earth.”

original: lokavohārena paṇṇattimatte cittaṃ ṭhapetabbaṃ, nāmantaravasenapi pathavī manasi kātabbā
analyzed: loka vohārena paṇṇatti matte cittam ṭhapetabbam nāma antara vasena api pathavī manasi kātabbā
translated: If the establishment of cognizance is to be done by way of the ordinary term for a concept, then it should be possible to give attention to “earth” by means of any other name as well.

original: bhaveyyāti, hotu, ko dosoti dassento “mahī medinī”tiādimāha. Tattha yamicchatīti🔽yaṃ nāmaṃ vattuṃ icchati, taṃ vattabbaṃ. Tañca kho yadassa saññānukūlaṃ hoti yaṃ
analyzed: bhaveyyā ti hotu kaḥ dosaḥ iti dassentaḥ mahī medinī iti ādim āha tattha yam icchati iti  yam nāmam vattum icchati tam vattabbam tat ca kho yat assa saññā anukūlam hoti yam
translated: Let it be so. What is the harm? —showing this, he said “earth,” “ground,” “the great one,” “the broad one,” etc. Herein, what he wishes is🔽the name he wishes to use. And that should be used as is favourable to his perception,

original: nāmaṃ assa yogino pubbe tattha gahitasaññāvasena anukūlaṃ pacuratāya, paguṇatāya🔽vā āgacchati, taṃ vattabbaṃ. Vattabbanti ca paṭhamasamannāhāre kassaci vacībhedopi
analyzed: nāmam assa yoginaḥ pubbe tattha gahita saññā vasena anukūlam pacura tāya paguṇa tāya  vā āgacchati tam vattabbam vattabbanti ca paṭhama samannāhāre kassaci
translated: that name which comes to be favourable to the meditator by reason of his having previously taken it up there, by reason of its being familiar to him, or by reason of its being well known to him.🔽“Should be used” is said because in the first application some people have a verbal repetition.🔽Or it can be taken as said with reference to the teacher’s using it.

original: hotīti katvā vuttaṃ, ācariyena vā vattabbataṃ sandhāya. Kiṃ vā bahunā, pākaṭabhāvoyevettha
analyzed: hoti iti katvā vuttam ācariyena vā vattabba tam sandhāya kim vā bahunā
translated: Or what is the use of many? —he said “Besides” in order to show that the obviousness itself is the criterion here.

original: pamāṇanti dassetuṃ “apicā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Kālena ummīletvā kālena nimmīletvāti kiñci
analyzed: pamāṇam ti dassetum api ca atiādi vuttam kālena ummīletvā kālena nimmīletvā ati kiñci
translated: From time to time he should open his eyes and from time to time he should close them.

original: kālaṃ cakkhuṃ ummīletvā nimittaggahaṇavasena pathavīmaṇḍalaṃ oloketvā puna kiñci
analyzed: kālam cakkhum ummīletvā nimitta ggahaṇa vasena pathavī maṇḍalam oloketvā puna kiñci
translated: He should open his eyes and look at the earth disk as the sign,🔽and then close his eyes again and advert to it.

original: kālaṃ cakkhuṃ nimmīletvā āvajjitabbaṃ. Yenākārena oloketvā gahitaṃ, tenākārena puna🔽taṃ samannāharitabbaṃ.
analyzed: kālam cakkhum nimmīletvā āvajjitabbam yena ākārena oloketvā gahitam tena ākārena puna  tam samannāharitabbam
translated: He should bring it to mind as he has seen it.🔽Comes within range: comes within range as object of the impulsions of the mind door.

original: 57. Āpāthamāgacchatīti manodvārikajavanānaṃ gocarabhāvaṃ upagacchati. Tassa uggahanimittassa.🔽Na tasmiṃ ṭhāne nisīditabbaṃ. Kasmā? Yadi uggahanimitte jātepi pathavīmaṇḍalaṃ oloketvā
analyzed: āpātham āgacchati iti manodvārika javanānam gocara bhāvam upagacchati tassa uggaha nimittassa  na tasmin ṭhāne nisīditabbam kasmā yadi uggaha nimitte jāte api pathavī maṇḍalam oloketvā
translated: Of that learning sign.

original: bhāveti, paṭibhāganimittuppatti na siyā. Samīpaṭṭhena ca na oloketuṃ na sakkā. Tena
analyzed: bhāveti paṭibhāga nimitta uppatti na siyā samīpa ṭṭhena ca na oloketum na sakkā tena
translated: He should not sit in that place. Why? If he looks at the earth disk and develops it after the learning sign has arisen, the counterpart sign will not arise. And it cannot be looked at by approximation.

original: vuttaṃ “attano vasanaṭṭhānaṃ pavisitvā”tiādi. Nissaddabhāvāya ekapaṭalikūpāhanāgahaṇaṃ,
analyzed: vuttam attanaḥ vasana ṭṭhānam pavisitvā atiādi nissadda bhāvāya eka paṭalikūpāhanā gahaṇam
translated: Therefore it is said, “He should go to his own lodging” and so on. The taking of a single-stranded twisted grass ring is for the purpose of non-confusion.

original: parissayavinodanatthaṃ kattaradaṇḍaggahaṇaṃ. Sace nassati, athānena bhāvetabbanti
analyzed: parissaya vinodana attham kattara daṇḍa ggahaṇam sace nassati atha anena bhāvetabbanti
translated: The taking of a walking stick is for the purpose of warding off fatigue. If it is lost, then he should develop it with that.

original: sambandho. Vakkhamānesu asappāyesu kenacideva asappāyena kāraṇabhūtena. Nimittaṃ🔽ādāyāti yathājātaṃ uggahanimittaṃ gahetvā. Samannāharitabbanti āvajjitabbaṃ nimittanti🔽adhippāyo, sammā vā anu anu āharitabbaṃ kammaṭṭhānanti attho. Takkāhataṃ vitakkāhatanti
analyzed: sambandhaḥ vakkhamānesu asappāyesu kenacid eva asappāyena kāraṇa bhūtena nimittam  ādāya ati yathājātam uggaha nimittam gahetvā samannāharitabbanti āvajjitabbam nimittam ti  adhippāyaḥ sammā vā anu anu āharitabbam kammaṭṭhānan ti attho takka āhatam vitakka āhatam ti
translated: “The connection” is the connection by some unsuitable object as a cause of the unsuitable things being spoken. “Taking the sign” is taking the sign of the learning sign as it has arisen. “Should be recollected” means should be adverted to. The meaning is: “The sign should be recollected, that is to say, should be recollected by taking it correctly or by bringing it to mind again and again.” “The thought- impact, the thinking-mind-impact” .🔽

original: takkanato, savisesaṃ takkanato ca “takko, vitakko”ti ca evaṃ laddhanāmena bhāvanācittasampayuttena🔽sammāsaṅkappena āhananapariyāhananakiccena aparāparaṃ vattamānena kammaṭṭhānaṃ āhataṃ,
analyzed: takkanataḥ savisesam takkanataḥ ca takkaḥ ca evam laddha nāmena bhāvanā citta sampayuttena  sammāsaṅkappena āhanana pariyāhanana kiccena apara aparam vattamānena kammaṭṭhānam āhatam
translated: ‘Association’ is with unsuitable things. ‘With some unsuitable thing as cause’ means with some unsuitable thing as reason. ‘Taking the sign as object’ means taking the sign as it has arisen. ‘Should be recollected’ means should be adverted to. The meaning is: ‘The sign should be recollected by bringing it to mind correctly and continuously.’ ‘Stabilized by pondering, by pondering well’ means that the meditation subject should be pondered and well pondered by the kind of right reflection associated with the consciousness of development that has got the name of ‘pondering’ and ‘reflection’ because it ponders and reflects.

original: pariyāhatañca kātabbaṃ, balappattavitakko manasikāro bahulaṃ pavattetabboti attho.🔽Evaṃ karontassāti evaṃ kammaṭṭhānaṃ takkāhataṃ vitakkāhataṃ karontassa. Yathā bhāvanā
analyzed: pariyāhatam ca kātabbam bala ppatta vitakkaḥ manasikāraḥ bahulam pavattetabbaḥ iti atthaḥ  evam karontassa ati evam kammaṭṭhānam takka āhatam vitakka āhatam karontassa yathā bhāvanā
translated: The meaning is that the kind of attention accompanied by strong-developed reflection should be given attention again and again.

original: pubbenāparaṃ visesaṃ āvahati, evaṃ anuyuñjantassa. Anukkamenāti bhāvanānukkamena.
analyzed: pubbena aparam visesam āvahati evam anuyuñjantassa anukkamena ati bhāvanā anukkamena
translated: ‘As he does so’ means as he does this pondering and well-pondering of the meditation subject. ‘The meditation will be successful’ means that the development will be successful. ‘As he goes on doing’ means as he goes on re-collecting in this way. ‘In due course’ means by the order of the development.

original: Yadā saddhādīni indriyāni suvisadāni tikkhāni pavattanti, tadā assaddhiyādīnaṃ dūrībhāvena
analyzed: yadā saddhā ādīni indriyāni su visadāni tikkhāni pavattanti tadā assaddhi ādīnam dūrībhāvena
translated: When the faculties of faith, etc., are very clear and strong, then,🔽because of the removal of non-faith, etc., the jhāna factors of applied thought, etc., which have reached a higher stage of development than before,

original: sātisayathāmappattehi sattahi balehi laddhūpatthambhāni vitakkādīni kāmāvacarāneva🔽jhānaṅgāni bahūni hutvā pātubhavanti. Tato eva tesaṃ ujuvipaccanīkabhūtā kāmacchandādayo🔽saddhiṃ tadekaṭṭhehi pāpadhammehi vidūrī bhavanti, paṭibhāganimittuppattiyā saddhiṃ
analyzed: sa atisaya thāma ppattehi sattahi balehi laddha upatthambhāni vitakka ādīni kāmāvacarān eva  bahūni hutvā pātubhavanti tatas eva tesam uju vipaccanīka bhūtā kāmacchanda ādayaḥ  saddhim tad ekaṭṭhehi pāpa dhammehi vidūrī bhavanti paṭibhāga nimitta uppattiyā saddhim
translated: become very evident by the support of the seven powers, namely, the faith power, etc. Then, because of the very evident presence of the jhāna factors,🔽the hindrances are suppressed, and the jhāna is called “access” since it is close to absorption.

original: taṃ ārabbha upacārajjhānaṃ uppajjati. Tena vuttaṃ “nīvaraṇāni vikkhambhantī”tiādi.🔽Tattha sannisīdantīti sammadeva sīdanti, upasamantīti attho.🔽Imassāti paṭibhāganimittassa. Aṅgulipadapāṇipadādiko kasiṇadoso. Ādāsamaṇḍalūpamādīhi
analyzed: tam ārabbha upacāra jhānam uppajjati tena vuttam nīvaraṇāni vikkhambhanti itiādi  tattha sannisīdanti iti sammadeva eva sīdanti upasamanti iti attho  imassa ati paṭibhāga nimittassa aṅguli pada pāṇi pada ādikaḥ kasiṇa dosaḥ ādāsa maṇḍala upama ādīhi
translated: The words “and the hindrances are suppressed” are stated in this way in order to show that the jhāna factors are very evident by the removal of the hindrances.🔽“Settled”: well steadied.

original: uggahanimittato paṭibhāganimittassa suparisuddhataṃ, saṇhasukhumatañca dasseti. Tañca
analyzed: uggaha nimittataḥ paṭibhāga nimittassa su parisuddha tam saṇha sukhuma tam ca dasseti tam ca
translated: “The sign”: the counterpart sign. “The fault of the kasiṇa”: the fault in the kasiṇa, such as the appearance of the kasiṇa as black, etc., or the appearance of the kasiṇa as though pierced by an arrow. “The appearance of the bowl, etc.,” is mentioned in order to show the counterpart sign’s extreme clarity and fineness by comparison with the learning sign. For the counterpart sign appears as if drawn in fine lines, like the streaks in marble, and it appears as if made of pure crystal, like a crystal gem. And it is called “the counterpart sign” because it is the counterpart of the learning sign.

original: kho paṭibhāganimittaṃ neva vaṇṇavantaṃ na saṇṭhānavantaṃ aparamatthasabhāvattā. Īdisanti
analyzed: kho paṭibhāga nimittam na iva vaṇṇavantam na saṇṭhānavantam īdisanti
translated: The counterpart sign is not possessed of colour and shape because it does not exist in the ultimate sense. ‘Like that’:🔽possessed of colour and shape. ‘Stamped with the three characteristics’: imbued with the three characteristics beginning with that of rise ;

original: vaṇṇasaṇṭhānavantaṃ. Tilakkhaṇabbhāhatanti uppādādilakkhaṇattayānupaviṭṭhaṃ, aniccatādilakkhaṇattayaṅkitaṃ
analyzed: vaṇṇa saṇṭhānavantam ti lakkhaṇa bbhā hatam ti uppāda ādi lakkhaṇa ttayā an upaviṭṭham anicca tā ādi lakkhaṇa ttayaṅkitam
translated: or ‘marked with the triad of characteristics beginning with impermanence.’

original: vā. Yadi na panetaṃ tādisaṃ vaṇṇādivantaṃ, kathaṃ jhānassa ārammaṇabhāvoti āha “kevalañhī”tiādi.
analyzed: vā yadi na pana itam tādisam vaṇṇa ādivantam katham jhānassa ārammaṇa bhāvaḥ ti āha kevalam hi itiādi
translated: If it is not like that, possessed of colour, etc., how can it be the object of jhāna? He answers this by ‘merely the mode of appearance,’ etc.

original: Saññajanti bhāvanāsaññājanitaṃ, bhāvanāsaññāya sañjātamattaṃ. Na hi asabhāvassa kutoci
analyzed: saññajanti bhāvanā saññā janitam bhāvanā saññāya sañjāta mattam na hi a sabhāvassa kutocid
translated: ‘Born of perception’: produced by the perception of development; merely arisen with the perception of development. For what does not exist in the ultimate sense has no origination from anywhere.

original: samuṭṭhānaṃ atthi. Tenāha “upaṭṭhānākāramatta”nti.
analyzed: samuṭṭhānam atthi tena āha upaṭṭhāna ākāram atta ti
translated: That is why he said, ‘merely the mode of appearance.’

original: 58. Vikkhambhitāneva sannisinnāva, na pana tadatthaṃ ussāho kātabboti adhippāyo.🔽“Upacārasamādhinā”ti vutte itaropi samādhi atthīti atthato āpannanti tampi dassetuṃ
analyzed: vikkhambhitāna iva sannisinnā ava na pana tad attham ussāhaḥ kātabbaḥ ti adhippāyaḥ  upacāra samādhinā iti vutte itaraḥ api samādhi atthi iti atthataḥ āpannanti tam pi dassetum
translated: ‘As if suppressed, as if subsided’: the meaning is that no effort need be made to suppress it or to subside it.🔽When it is said ‘access concentration,’ it is implied that there is another kind of concentration besides this. In order to point that out he said ‘Concentration is of two kinds.’

original: “duvidho hi samādhī”tiādi āraddhaṃ. Dvīhākārehīti jhānadhammānaṃ paṭipakkhadūrībhāvo,
analyzed: duvidhaḥ hi samādhi itiādi āraddham dvīhā ākārehi iti jhāna dhammānam paṭipakkha dūrībhāvaḥ
translated: ‘In two ways’: the states of jhāna are far removed from their opposites,

original: thirabhāvappatti cāti imehi dvīhi kāraṇehi. Idāni tāni kāraṇāni avatthāmukhena dassetuṃ
analyzed: thira bhāva ppatti ca ati imehi dvīhi kāraṇehi idāni tāni kāraṇāni avatthā mukhena dassetuṃ
translated: And the attainment of steadiness: for these two reasons. Now, in order to show those reasons by way of the plane of access and the plane of obtainment,

original: “upacārabhūmiyaṃ vā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Upacārabhūmiyanti upacārāvatthāyaṃ. Yadipi tadā
analyzed: upacāra bhūmiyam vā atiādi vuttam upacāra bhūmiyanti yadi pi tadā
translated: “On the plane of access” is said, etc. Although at that time

original: jhānaṅgāni paṭutarāni mahaggatabhāvappattāni na uppajjanti, tesaṃ pana paṭipakkhadhammānaṃ
analyzed: jhāna aṅgāni paṭutarāni mahaggata bhāva pattāni na uppajjanti tesam pana paṭipakkha dhammānam
translated: the jhāna factors do not arise more purified and reach absorption,

original: vikkhambhanena cittaṃ samādhiyati. Tenāha “nīvaraṇappahānena cittaṃ samāhitaṃ hotī”ti.🔽Paṭilābhabhūmiyanti jhānassa adhigamāvatthāyaṃ. Tadā hi appanāpattānaṃ jhānadhammānaṃ
analyzed: vikkhambhanena cittam samādhiyati tena āha nīvaraṇa ppahānena cittam samāhitam hoti iti  paṭilābha bhūmiyanti jhānassa adhigama avatthāyam tadā hi appanā āpattānam jhāna dhammānam
translated: nevertheless the mind becomes concentrated by suppression of the opposing states. Hence he said: “The mind becomes concentrated through the surmounting of the hindrances.”

original: uppattiyā cittaṃ samādhiyati. Tenāha “aṅgapātubhāvenā”ti. Cittaṃ samāhitaṃ hotīti sambandho.
analyzed: uppattiyā cittam tena āha aṅga pātu bhāvena ati cittam samāhitam hoti iti sambandhaḥ
translated: “On the plane of obtainment” is on the plane of the attainment of jhāna. For at that time the mind becomes concentrated through the arising of the jhāna factors that have reached absorption. Hence he said: “Through the appearance of the jhāna factors.” The mind becomes concentrated: this is the construction.

original: Na thāmajātānīti na jātathāmāni, na bhāvanābalaṃ pattānīti attho. Cittanti jhānacittaṃ.
analyzed: na thāma jātāni iti na jāta thāmāni na bhāvanā balam pattāni iti attho cittanti jhāna cittam
translated: Not born of the power of development: not born of the power of meditation, is the meaning. The mind: the jhāna consciousness.

original: Kevalampi rattiṃ kevalampi divasaṃ tiṭṭhatīti samāpattivelaṃ sandhāyāha. Upacārabhūmiyaṃ
analyzed: kevalam pi rattim kevalam pi divasam tiṭṭhati iti samāpatti velam sandhāya āha upacāra bhūmi iyam
translated: He is able to do so for a whole night and a whole day, he says, referring to the attainment period.🔽He extends the sign, he says, because it is proper to extend the sign in the access stage.

original: nimittavaḍḍhanaṃ yuttanti katvā vuttaṃ “nimittaṃ vaḍḍhetvā”ti. Laddhaparihānīti laddhaupacārajjhānaparihāni.🔽Nimitte avinassante tadārammaṇajhānampi aparihīnameva hoti, nimitte pana ārakkhābhāvena
analyzed: nimitta vaḍḍhanam yuttanti katvā vuttam nimittam vaḍḍhetvā ati laddha parihāni iti laddha aupacāra jhāna parihāni  nimitte a vinassante tad ārammaṇa jhānam pi a parihīnam eva hoti nimitte pana ārakkha abhāvena
translated: Loss of what has been gained is loss of the access jhāna that has been gained.

original: vinaṭṭhe laddhaṃ laddhaṃ jhānampi vinassati tadāyattavuttito. Tenāha “ārakkhamhī”tiādi.
analyzed: vinaṭṭhe laddham laddham jhānam pi vinassati tad āyatta vuttito tena āha ārakkhamhi itiādi
translated: When the sign is not lost, the jhāna that has that as its object is not lost either. But when the sign is destroyed by the absence of protection, the jhāna that has that as its object is also destroyed, because it is dependent on that. That is why he said, “I guard the sign” and so on.

original: Sattasappāyavaṇṇanā🔽59. “Thāvarañca hotī”ti vatvā yathā thāvaraṃ hoti, taṃ dassetuṃ “sati upaṭṭhāti,🔽cittaṃ samādhiyatī”ti vuttaṃ. Yathāladdhañhi nimittaṃ tattha satiṃ sūpaṭṭhitaṃ katvā
analyzed: thāvaram ca hoti iti vatvā yathā thāvaram hoti tam dassetum sati upaṭṭhāti  cittam samādhiyati iti vuttam yathā laddham hi nimittam tattha satim su upaṭṭhitam katvā
translated: The explanation of the seven good dhammas🔽. After saying, “It becomes steadier,” he said, “Mindfulness is established,” etc., in order to show how it becomes steadier. For when he finds unification by making well-established mindfulness well-established in the sign as it has been acquired,

original: ekaggataṃ vindantassa thiraṃ nāma hoti, surakkhitañca. Sati-ggahaṇena cettha sampajaññaṃ,
analyzed: ekagga tam vindantassa thiram nāma hoti su rakkhitam ca sati ggahaṇena ca ittha sampajaññam
translated: it becomes steady and well protected. And here the word “mindfulness” includes full awareness too,

original: samādhiggahaṇena vīriyañca saṅgahitaṃ hoti nānantariyabhāvato. Tatthāti tesu āvāsesu.
analyzed: samādhi ggahaṇena vīriyam ca saṅgahitam hoti na ānantariya bhāvato tattha ati tesu āvāsesu
translated: and by the mention of concentration, energy is included too, because it is not separate from that. Therein: in those monasteries.

original: Tīṇi tīṇīti ekekasmiṃ āvāse avutthaavutthaṭṭhāne vasananiyāmena tayo tayo divase vasitvā.
analyzed: tīṇi tīṇi iti ekekasmin āvāse avuttha avuttha ṭṭhāne vasana niyāmena tayo tayo divase vasitvā
translated: Three by three: having dwelt three days each in the place of residence in each monastery, in the place of residence that has been vacated and that has not been vacated, in the order of dwelling.

original: Uttarena vā dakkhiṇena vāti vuttaṃ gamanāgamane sūriyābhimukhabhāvanivāraṇatthanti. Sahassadhanuppamāṇaṃ diyaḍḍhakosaṃ.
analyzed: uttarena vā dakkhiṇena vā iti vuttam gamana āgamane sūriya abhimukha bhāva nivāraṇa attham ti sahassa dhanuppamāṇam diyaḍḍha kosam
translated: To the north or to the south: this is said in order to prevent facing the sun when going and coming. A thousand is equal to a myriad, and a myriad is equal to a myrobalan.

original: Dvattiṃsa tiracchānakathāti rājakathādike sandhāyāha. Tā hi pāḷiyaṃ sarūpato anāgatāpi
analyzed: dvattiṃsa rāja kathā ādike sandhāya āha tāḥ hi sarūpataḥ anāgatā api
translated: Thirty-two kinds of animal talk: he says this referring to talk about kings, etc. For although these are not given in the text in their own form,

original: araññapabbatanadīdīpakathā iti-saddena saṅgahetvā saggamokkhānaṃ tiracchānabhāvato
analyzed: arañña pabbata nadī dīpa kathā iti saddena saṅgahetvā sagga mokkhānam tiracchāna bhāvato
translated: they are included by the word “etc.,” as talk about the forest, mountains, rivers, and so on, and are called “animal talk” because they lead to the animal realm.

original: “dvattiṃsa tiracchānakathā”ti vuttā. Dasakathāvatthunissitanti “appicchatā, santuṭṭhi,
analyzed: dvattiṃsa tiracchāna kathā ati vuttā dasa kathā vatthu nissitanti appiccha tā santuṭṭhi
translated: Dependent on the ten topics of talk: “fewness of wishes, contentment,

original: paviveko, asaṃsaggo, vīriyārambho, sīla, samādhi, paññā, vimutti, vimuttiñāṇadassana”nti
analyzed: pavivekaḥ asaṃsaggaḥ vīriya ārambhaḥ sīla samādhi paññā vimutti vimutti ñāṇa dassananti
translated: seclusion, aloofness from society, the arousal of energy, virtue, concentration, wisdom, deliverance, knowledge and vision of deliverance.”

original: imāni appicchakathādīnaṃ vatthūni, tannissitaṃ bhassaṃ sappāyaṃ.
analyzed: imāni appiccha kathā ādīnam vatthūni tad nissitam bhassam sappāyam
translated: These are the subjects for talk on fewness of wishes, and so on. The talk based on them is suitable.

original: Atiracchānakathikoti natiracchānakathiko, tiracchānakathā vidhuraṃ dhammikaṃ kammaṭṭhānapaṭisaṃyuttameva🔽kathaṃ kathetīti adhippāyo. Sīlādiguṇasampannoti sīlasamādhiādiguṇasampanno. Yo hi
analyzed: a tiracchāna kathikā iti na tiracchāna kathikaḥ tiracchāna kathā vidhuram dhammikam kammaṭṭhāna paṭisaṃyuttam eva  katham kathā iti iti adhippāyaḥ sīla ādi guṇa sampannaḥ ti sīla samādhi ādi guṇa sampannaḥ yaḥ hi
translated: Not given to long conversations: not given to irrelevant talk. He talks only about the meditation subject connected with the Dhamma, which is not irrelevant.

original: samādhikammaṭṭhāniko, samādhikammaṭṭhānassa vā pāraṃ patto, so imassa yogino sappāyo.🔽Tenāha “yaṃ nissāyā”tiādi. Kāyadaḷhībahuloti kāyassa santappanaposanappasuto. Yaṃ🔽sandhāya vuttaṃ “yāvadatthaṃ udarāvadehakaṃ bhuñjitvā seyyasukhaṃ passasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ
analyzed: samādhi kammaṭṭhāniko samādhi kammaṭṭhānassa vā pāram patto saḥ imassa yogino sappāyo  tena āha yam nissāya atiādi kāya daḷhī bahulo ti kāyassa santappana posana ppasutaḥ yam  sandhāya vuttam yāvadattham udara avadehakam bhuñjitvā seyya sukham passa sukham middha sukham
translated: This is the meaning. Possessed of virtue, etc.: possessed of the special qualities of virtue, concentration, etc. For one who is a meditator or has reached perfection in the meditation subject is suitable for this meditator.🔽Hence it is said: “Depending on whom,” and so on. Given to bodily vigor: devoted to the nourishing and refreshing of the body.

original: anuyutto viharatī”ti.
analyzed: anuyuttaḥ viharati iti
translated: This is what is referred to by the words: “He eats as much as he needs to keep body and life going, and he enjoys sleeping, lying, and lolling about” .

original: Bhojanaṃ yebhuyyena madhurambilarasavasena sattānaṃ upayogaṃ gacchati dadhiādīsu
analyzed: bhojanam yebhuyyena madhu rambila rasa vasena sattānam upayogam gacchati dadhi ādīsu
translated: Food is used by beings mostly in the form of sweet and sour juices, such as curd, etc.

original: tathā dassanato. Kaṭukādirasā pana kevalaṃ abhisaṅkhārakā evāti āha “kassaci madhuraṃ,
analyzed: tathā dassanataḥ kaṭuka ādi rasāḥ pana kevalam abhisaṅkhārakāḥ eva ati āha kassaci madhuram
translated: and because of the way it is seen. But the taste of what is bitter, etc., is only a condition for relishing. That is why he said: “For some it is sweet,

original: kassaci ambilaṃ sappāyaṃ hotī”ti.
analyzed: kassaci ambilam sappāyam hoti iti
translated: for some it is sour that is suitable.”

original: Yasmiṃ iriyāpathe ādhārabhūte, vattamāne vā, yasmiṃ vā iriyāpathe pavattamānassa.
analyzed: yasmin iriyāpathe ādhāra bhūte vattamāne vā yasmin vā iriyāpathe pavattamānassa
translated: In whatever posture is the basis, or in whatever posture it occurs,

original: Nimittāsevanabahulassāti nimitte āsevanābahulassa paṭibhāganimitte visayabhūte bhāvanāmanasikāraṃ
analyzed: nimitta āsevana bahulassa ati nimitte āsevanā bahulassa paṭibhāga nimitte visaya bhūte bhāvanā manasikāram
translated: in the case of one who is devoted to the sign, that is to say, in the case of one who is devoted to repetition of the sign, to the counterpart sign which is the objective field of the development consciousness,

original: bahulaṃ āsevantassa, nimittassa vā gocarāsevanavasena āsevanābahulassa. Yena hi bhāventassa
analyzed: bahulam āsevantassa nimittassa vā gocara āsevana vasena āsevanā bahulassa yena hi bhāventassa
translated: who is devoted to repetition of the sign by way of repetition of the sign’s objective field, or in the case of one who is devoted to repetition of the sign’s objective field,

original: bhāvanāsevanā, tena gocarāsevanāpi icchitabbāti.
analyzed: bhāvanā sevanā tena gocara asevanā api icchitabbā ati
translated: for it is to be understood that the repetition of the development is the repetition of the objective field of the development.

original: Dasavidhaappanākosallavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dasavidha appanā kosalla vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the tenfold skill in absorption

original: 60. Na hoti appanā. Yena vidhinā appanāyaṃ kusalo hoti, so dasavidho vidhi appanākosallaṃ,
analyzed: na hoti appanā yena vidhinā appanā ayam kusalaḥ hoti saḥ dasavidhaḥ appanā kosallam
translated: . There is no absorption. The tenfold skill in absorption is the tenfold method by which one becomes skilled in absorption,

original: tannibbattaṃ vā ñāṇaṃ. Vatthuvisadakiriyatoti vatthūnaṃ visadabhāvakaraṇato appanākosallaṃ
analyzed: tad nibbattam vā ñāṇam vatthu visada kiriyato ti vatthūnam visada bhāva karaṇataḥ appanā kosallam
translated: or it is the knowledge that is produced by that. The skill in absorption should be understood as the making of the object clear. The construction is:

original: icchitabbanti sambandho. Evaṃ sesesupi.
analyzed: icchitabbanti sambandhaḥ evam sesesu pi
translated: by making the object clear. So too with the rest.

original: 61. Cittacetasikānaṃ hi pavattiṭṭhānabhāvato sarīraṃ, tappaṭibaddhāni cīvarādīni🔽ca idha “vatthūnī”ti adhippetāni. Tāni yathā cittassa sukhāvahāni honti, tathā karaṇaṃ
analyzed: citta cetasikānam hi pavatti ṭṭhāna bhāvato sarīram tad paṭibaddhāni cīvara ādīni  ca idha vatthūni iti adhippetāni tāni yathā cittassa sukha āvahāni honti tathā karaṇam
translated: The body is the physical basis for the occurrence of consciousness and its concomitants. The robe, etc., are bound up with the body.🔽They are called “the internal and external bases” here. The way to make them favorable to the mind is

original: tesaṃ visadabhāvakaraṇaṃ. Tena vuttaṃ “ajjhattikabāhirāna”ntiādi. Sarīraṃ vāti vā-saddo🔽aṭṭhānappayutto, sarīraṃ sedamalaggahitaṃ vā aññena vā avassutakiccena vibādhitanti🔽adhippāyo. Senāsanaṃ vāti vā-saddena pattādīnampi saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo. Nanu cāyaṃ nayo
analyzed: tesam visada bhāva karaṇam tena vuttam ajjhattika bāhira ananti ādi sarīram vā ati vā saddaḥ  aṭṭhāna ppayuttaḥ sarīram sa idam alagga hitam vā aññena vā avassuta kiccena vibādhitanti  adhippāyaḥ senāsanam vā ti vā saddena patta ādīnam pi saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ nanu ca ayam nayo
translated: to make them clear. Hence “the internal and external bases” are mentioned. The word “body”🔽is used without reference to a basis. The meaning is: the body that is seized by sloth and torpor or afflicted by some other ailment.🔽The word “resting place” should be understood to include the bowl, etc., as well.

original: khuddakapalibodhupacchedena saṅgahito, puna kasmā vuttoti? Saccaṃ saṅgahito, so ca🔽kho bhāvanāya ārambhakāle. Idha pana āraddhakammaṭṭhānassa upacārajjhāne ṭhatvā appanāparivāsaṃ
analyzed: khuddaka pali bodha upacchedena saṅgahito puna kasmā vuttaḥ iti saccam saṅgahito so ca  kho bhāvanāya ārambha kāle idha pana āraddha kammaṭṭhānassa upacāra jhāne ṭhatvā appanā parivāsam
translated: But was it not already included by the phrase “the internal and external bases”?

original: vasantassa kālantare jāte tathāpaṭipatti appanākosallāya vuttā. Avisade sati, visayabhūte
analyzed: vasantassa kāla antare jāte tathāpaṭipatti appanā kosallāya vuttā avisade sati visaya bhūte
translated: It was, but that phrase was stated at the beginning of the development. Here the practice is stated for one who has already begun the development, who has reached access concentration and is now living in the neighborhood of absorption.

original: vā. Kathaṃ bhāvanamanuyuñjantassa tāni visayo? Antarantarā pavattanakacittuppādavasenevaṃ
analyzed: vā katham bhāvanam anuyuñjantassa tāni visayaḥ antar antarā pavattanaka cittuppāda vasena ivam
translated: How are they objects of development? They are so in the following way.🔽

original: vuttaṃ. Te hi cittuppādā cittekaggatāya aparisuddhabhāvāya saṃvattanti. Cittacetasikesu🔽nissayādipaccayabhūtesu. Ñāṇampīti pi-saddo sampiṇḍane. Tena “na kevalaṃ taṃ vatthuyeva,🔽atha kho tasmiṃ aparisuddhe ñāṇampi aparisuddhaṃ hotī”ti dassitaṃ. Taṃsampayuttānaṃ
analyzed: vuttam te hi citta uppādāḥ citta ekagga tāya a parisuddha bhāvāya saṃvattanti citta cetasikesu  nissaya ādi paccaya bhūtesu ñāṇam pi iti pi saddaḥ sampiṇḍane tena na kevalam tam vatthuyā iva  atha kho tasmin aparisuddhe ñāṇam pi aparisuddham hoti iti dassitam tad sampayuttānam
translated: How are they the object of development? It is said that they are so in the sense of the occurrence of the process of consciousness that arises in the interval between the jhāna and the reviewing knowledge. For those processes of consciousness tend to the purification of the jhāna by way of the unification of mind.🔽In the phrase “and the knowledge that is associated with them,” the word “and” is inclusive. It shows that not only is the object of the jhāna defiled but also the knowledge associated with it is defiled.

original: pana aparisuddhatā avuttasiddhā, ñāṇassa ca visuṃ gahaṇaṃ appanāya bahukārattā. Tathā
analyzed: pana aparisuddha tā avutta siddhā ñāṇassa ca visum gahaṇam appanāya bahu kāra ttā tathā
translated: The fact that the associated states are defiled is established by implication, but the knowledge is mentioned separately because it is the most prominent factor in absorption.

original: hi jhānaṃ “dandhābhiññaṃ, khippābhiñña”nti ñāṇamukhena niddiṭṭhaṃ. Nissayanissayopi
analyzed: hi jhānam dandha abhiññam khippa abhiññanti ñāṇa mukhena niddiṭṭham nissaya nissayaḥ pi
translated: For jhāna is described as “slow in knowledge” or “quick in knowledge” according to the knowledge.

original: nissayotveva vuccatīti āha “dīpakapallikavaṭṭitelāni nissāyā”ti. Ñāṇe avisade vipassanābhāvanā
analyzed: nissayaḥ tu eva vuccati iti āha dīpaka pallika vaṭṭita ilāni nissāya ati ñāṇe avisade vipassanā bhāvanā
translated: And the condition by way of support is called simply “support.” That is why he said, “depending on the lamp, the wick is consumed.”🔽When the knowledge is unclear, the development of insight

original: viya samādhibhāvanāpi paridubbalā hotīti dassetuṃ “aparisuddhena ñāṇenā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: viya samādhi bhāvanā api paridubbalā hoti iti dassetum aparisuddhena ñāṇena atiādi vuttam
translated: and so too the development of concentration is weak.🔽Herein, the meditation subject is the serenity meditation subject.

original: Tattha kammaṭṭhānanti samathakammaṭṭhānaṃ āha. Vuḍḍhiṃ aṅgapātubhāvena, virūḷhiṃ
analyzed: tattha kammaṭṭhānam ti samatha kammaṭṭhānam āha vuḍḍhim aṅga pātubhāvena virūḷhim
translated: It should be understood that it has grown by the manifestation of the factors,

original: guṇabhāvena, vepullaṃ sabbaso vasibhāvappattiyā veditabbaṃ. Visade panāti sukkapakkho,
analyzed: guṇa bhāvena vepullam sabbasas vasi bhāva ppattiyā veditabbam visade pana ati sukkapakkho
translated: has increased by the possession of special qualities, and has become great by the complete acquisition of mastery.🔽In the bright half of the month,

original: tassa vuttavipariyāyena attho veditabbo.
analyzed: tassa vutta vipariyāyena atthaḥ veditabbaḥ
translated: the meaning should be understood in the opposite sense.🔽The making even is the making neither deficient nor excessive in function.

original: 62. Samabhāvakaraṇanti kiccato anūnādhikabhāvakaraṇaṃ. Yathāpaccayaṃ saddheyyavatthusmiṃ
analyzed: sama bhāva karaṇam ti kiccataḥ anūna adhika bhāva karaṇam yathāpaccayam saddheyya vatthusmim
translated: In the case of the object of faith, which is the cause,🔽the faith faculty is strong by the keenness of the function of resolving.

original: adhimokkhakiccassa paṭutarabhāvena, paññāya avisadatāya, vīriyādīnaṃ ca sithilatādinā
analyzed: adhimokkha kiccassa paṭutara bhāvena paññāya avisada tāya vīriya ādīnam ca sithila tā ādinā
translated: The other faculties are weak by the dullness of understanding and by the slackness of energy, etc.,

original: saddhindriyaṃ balavaṃ hoti. Tenāha “itarāni mandānī”ti. Tatoti tasmā saddhindriyassa
analyzed: saddhi indriyam balavam ha iti tena āha itarāni mandāni iti tasmā saddhi indriyassa
translated: The faith faculty is strong. Therefore it is said, “The others are weak.”🔽From that,🔽because the faith faculty is strong and the others are weak,

original: balavabhāvato, itaresañca mandattā. Kosajjapakkhe patituṃ adatvā sampayuttadhammānaṃ
analyzed: balava bhāvataḥ itaresam ca manda ttā kosajja pakkhe patitum a datvā sampayutta dhammānam
translated: without falling into the side of idleness,

original: paggaṇhanaṃ anubalappadānaṃ paggaho, paggahova kiccaṃ, paggahakiccaṃ kātuṃ na sakkotīti
analyzed: paggaṇhanam anubala ppadānam paggahaḥ paggahaḥ uva kiccam paggaha kiccam kātum na sakkoti iti
translated: The act of exerting is the giving of support; the act of exerting is the act of giving support. It is unable to do the act of exerting,🔽the act of giving support. The meaning is: it is unable to do the act of giving support. The meaning is: it is unable to do the act of giving support.

original: sambandhitabbaṃ. Ārammaṇaṃ upagantvā ṭhānaṃ, anissajjanaṃ vā upaṭṭhānaṃ, vikkhepapaṭipakkho.🔽Yena vā sampayuttā avikkhittā honti, so avikkhepo. Rūpagataṃ viya cakkhunā yena yāthāvato
analyzed: sambandhitabbam ārammaṇam upagantvā ṭhānam a nissajjanam vā upaṭṭhānam vikkhepa paṭipakkho  yena vā sampayuttāḥ a vikkhittāḥ honti saḥ avikkhepaḥ rūpa gatam viya cakkhunā yena yāthāvato
translated: The state of standing by after approaching the object, or the state of not letting go, is steadying. It is the opposite of distraction.🔽Or alternatively, that by which the associated states are undistracted is non-distraction. It is unable to do the act of seeing, which is the act of seeing the individual essences of objects as they are,

original: visayasabhāvaṃ passati, taṃ dassanakiccaṃ kātuṃ na sakkoti balavatā saddhindriyena🔽abhibhūtattā. Sahajātadhammesu hi indaṭṭhaṃ kārentānaṃ sahapavattamānānaṃ dhammānaṃ
analyzed: visaya sabhāvam passati tam dassana kiccam kātum na sakkoti balavatā saddhindriyena  abhibhūta ttā sahajāta dhammesu hi indaṭṭham kārentānam saha pavattamānānam dhammānam
translated: as though they were forms with the eye. Because it is overcome by the powerful faith faculty,

original: ekarasatāvaseneva atthasiddhi, na aññathā. Tasmāti vuttamevatthaṃ kāraṇabhāvena paccāmasati.
analyzed: ekarasa tā vasena iva na aññathā tasmā iti vuttam evattham kāraṇa bhāvena
translated: for the success of the associated states that occur together with it is effected only by their having a single function, not otherwise. That is why the reason is repeated in the words “because it is overcome by the powerful faith faculty.”

original: Tanti saddhindriyaṃ. Dhammasabhāvapaccavekkhaṇenāti yassa saddheyyavatthuno uḷāratādiguṇe
analyzed: tatti saddhi indriyam dhamma sabhāva paccavekkhaṇena ati yassa saddheyya vatthunaḥ uḷāra tā ādi guṇe
translated: “It”: the faith faculty. By reviewing the individual essences of states: by reviewing the special qualities of the object that inspires confidence, such as greatness, etc.,

original: adhimuccanassa sātisayappavattiyā saddhindriyaṃ balavaṃ jātaṃ, tassa paccayapaccayuppannādivibhāgato
analyzed: adhimuccanassa sa atisaya ppavattiyā saddhi indriyam balavam jātam tassa paccaya paccaya uppanna ādi vibhāgato
translated: The faith faculty has become strong through the predominance of resolution.🔽When it is investigated by discerning its conditions, conditionals, and so on,

original: yāthāvato vīmaṃsanena. Evañhi evaṃdhammatānayena sabhāvarasato pariggayhamāne savipphāro
analyzed: yāthāvataḥ vīmaṃsanena evam hi evaṃdhammatā nayena sabhāva rasataḥ pariggayhamāne sa vipphāro
translated: and by discerning its individual essence and its specific nature,🔽then the faith faculty is not predominant,

original: adhimokkho na hoti, “ayaṃ imesaṃ dhammānaṃ sabhāvo”ti parijānanavasena paññābyāpārassa
analyzed: adhimokkhaḥ na hoti ayam imesam dhammānam sabhāvaḥ ti parijānana vasena paññā byāpārassa
translated: because the function of understanding is predominant in the discerning of the individual essences of these states.

original: sātisayattā. Dhuriyadhammesu hi yathā saddhāya balavabhāve paññāya mandabhāvo hoti,
analyzed: sā ati saya ttā dhuriya dhammesu hi yathā saddhāya balava bhāve paññāya manda bhāvaḥ hoti
translated: For just as the faith faculty is strong when the understanding faculty is weak,🔽so the understanding faculty is strong when the faith faculty is weak.

original: evaṃ paññāya balavabhāve saddhāya mandabhāvo hotīti. Tena vuttaṃ “taṃ dhammasabhāvapaccavekkhaṇena hāpetabba”nti.
analyzed: evam paññāya balava bhāve saddhāya manda bhāvaḥ hoti iti tena vuttam tam dhamma sabhāva paccavekkhaṇena hāpetabbanti
translated: That is why it is said that it should be abandoned by reviewing the individual essences of the states.

original: Tathā amanasikārenāti yenākārena bhāvanamanuyuñjantassa saddhindriyaṃ balavaṃ hoti,
analyzed: tathā amanasikārena ati yena ākārena bhāvanam anuyuñjantassa saddhi indriyam balavam hoti
translated: “By non-attention to it”: by non-attention to it in the way in which the faith faculty becomes strong.🔽What is meant is: by not attending to it in the way in which he would develop it.

original: tenākārena bhāvanāya ananuyuñjanatoti vuttaṃ hoti. Idha duvidhena saddhindriyassa
analyzed: tena ākārena bhāvanāya an anuyuñjanato ti vuttam hoti idha duvidhena saddhindriyassa
translated: Herein, the faith faculty is twofold:

original: balavabhāvo, attano vā paccayavisesato kiccuttariyena, vīriyādīnaṃ vā mandakiccatāya.🔽Tattha paṭhamavikappe hāpanavidhi dassito, dutiyavikappe pana yathā manasi karoto🔽vīriyādīnaṃ mandakiccatāya saddhindriyaṃ balavaṃ jātaṃ, tathā amanasikārena vīriyādīnaṃ
analyzed: balava bhāvaḥ attanaḥ vā paccaya visesataḥ kiccuttariyena vīriya ādīnam vā manda kicca tāya  tattha paṭhama vikappe hāpana vidhi dassitaḥ dutiya vikappe pana yathā manasi  vīriya ādīnam manda kiccatāya saddhindriyam balavam jātam tathā amanasikārena vīriya ādīnam
translated: and the strength of the faculties is due either to the superiority of the function of one faculty over the others or to the weakness of the function of energy, etc.

original: paṭukiccabhāvāvahena manasikārena saddhindriyaṃ tehi samarasaṃ karontena hāpetabbaṃ.
analyzed: paṭu kicca bhāva āvahena manasikārena saddhi indriyam tehi sama rasam karontena hāpetabbam
translated: In the first permutation, the method of dropping is shown. In the second permutation, when the faculty of faith becomes strong through the weakness of the function of energy, etc., in one who attends to the meditation subject, then he should drop it by not attending to it and by attending to energy, etc., in such a way that the faculty of faith is brought into balance with them.

original: Iminā nayena sesindriyesupi hāpanavidhi veditabbo.🔽Vakkalittheravatthūti so hi āyasmā saddhādhimuttatāya katādhikāro satthu rūpakāyadassanappasuto🔽eva hutvā viharanto satthārā “kiṃ te, vakkali, iminā pūtikāyena diṭṭhena? Yo kho,
analyzed: iminā nayena veditabbo  so hi saddhā adhimutta tāya kata adhikāraḥ satthu rūpa kāya dassana ppasuto  eva hutvā viharantaḥ satthārā kim te iminā pūti kāyena diṭṭhena yaḥ kho
translated: And in the same way the method of dropping should be understood in the case of the other faculties.🔽The story of the Elder Vakkali is given in the Majjhima Nikaya . He was devoted to the faith and had made the breakthrough. But he was so intent on seeing the Master’s material body that he was neglecting the meditation subject.🔽The Master advised him thus: “What is it to you, Vakkali, what this foul body is? He who sees the Dhamma, Vakkali, he sees me” , and so on.

original: vakkali, dhammaṃ passati, so maṃ passatī”tiādinā ovaditvā kammaṭṭhāne niyojitopi
analyzed: vakkali dhammam passati saḥ mama passati itiādinā ovaditvā kammaṭṭhāne niyojitaḥ api
translated: And he gave him a meditation subject.

original: taṃ ananuyuñjanto paṇāmito attānaṃ vinipātetuṃ papātaṭṭhānaṃ abhiruhi. Atha naṃ satthā
analyzed: tam an anuyuñjantaḥ paṇāmitaḥ attānam vinipātetum papāta ṭṭhānam abhiruhi atha nam satthā
translated: and when he was not able to do so, he was sent away. He then went to the place where he had formerly thrown himself down to die. The Teacher

original: yathānisinnova obhāsaṃ visajjento attānaṃ dassetvā –
analyzed: yathā nisinnaḥ uva obhāsam visajjentaḥ attānam dassetvā
translated: appeared to him, even as he sat there, and said,

original: “Pāmojjabahulo bhikkhu, pasanno buddhasāsane;
analyzed: pāmojja bahulaḥ pasannaḥ buddha sāsane
translated: “The monk who is full of joy, who has faith in the Dispensation of the Buddha,

original: Adhigacche padaṃ santaṃ, saṅkhārūpasamaṃ sukha”nti. –
analyzed: adhigacche padam santam saṅkhā rūpa samam
translated: Will attain the state of peace, the bliss of the stilling of all the In-breaths and Out-breaths.”

original: Gāthaṃ vatvā “ehi vakkalī”ti āha. So tena amateneva abhisitto haṭṭhatuṭṭho hutvā
analyzed: gātham vatvā ehi vakkali iti āha saḥ tena amatena iva abhisittaḥ haṭṭha tuṭṭhaḥ hutvā
translated: And when he had thus spoken, he said to him, “Come, Vakkali.” And he, as though he had been sprinkled with nectar, filled with joy and gladness,

original: vipassanaṃ paṭṭhapesi. Saddhāya pana balavabhāvato vipassanāvīthiṃ na otari. Taṃ
analyzed: vipassanam paṭṭhapesi saddhāya pana balava bhāvataḥ vipassanā vīthim na otari tam
translated: began to practice insight. But because of the strength of his faith, he was unable to enter the Path of Insight. The Teacher,

original: ñatvā bhagavā indriyasamataṃ paṭipādento kammaṭṭhānaṃ sodhetvā adāsi. So satthārā
analyzed: ñatvā bhagavā indriyasamatam paṭipādento kammaṭṭhānam sodhetvā adāsi so satthārā
translated: understanding his thoughts, taught him the doctrine of the Equality of all the Faculties, purified his meditation-subject, and gave it back to him. He,

original: dinnanayena vipassanaṃ ussukkāpetvā maggapaṭipāṭiyā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ
analyzed: dinna nayena vipassanam ussukkāpetvā magga paṭipāṭiyā arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam
translated: following the method taught by the Teacher, brought his insight to the test, and by the successive stages of the Path attained Arahatship. Therefore it is said,

original: “vakkalittheravatthu cettha nidassana”nti.
analyzed: ca ittha
translated: “The story of the Elder Vakkali is related here as an example.”

original: Itarakiccabhedanti upaṭṭhānādikiccavisesaṃ. Passaddhādīti ādi-saddena samādhiupekkhāsambojjhaṅgānaṃ
analyzed: itara kicca bhedam ti upaṭṭhāna ādi kicca visesam passaddha ādi iti ādi saddena samādhi upekkhā sambojjhaṅgānam
translated: The difference in other duties is the difference in the duties of nursing, etc. The words “tranquillity, etc.” should be understood to include the enlightenment factors of concentration and equanimity.

original: saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo. Hāpetabbanti yathā saddhindriyassa balavabhāvo dhammasabhāvapaccavekkhaṇena🔽hāyati, evaṃ vīriyindriyassa adhimattatā passaddhiādibhāvanāya hāyati, samādhipakkhiyattā🔽tassā. Tathā hi sā samādhindriyassa adhimattataṃ kosajjapātato rakkhantī vīriyādibhāvanā
analyzed: saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ hāpetabbanti yathā saddhi indriyassa balava bhāvaḥ dhamma sabhāva paccavekkhaṇena  hāyati evam vīriya indriyassa adhimatta tā passaddhi ādi bhāvanāya hāyati samādhi pakkhiya tā  tassā tathā hi sā samādhi indriyassa adhimatta tam kosajja pātataḥ rakkhantī vīriya ādi bhāvanā
translated: It is to be abandoned by the development of tranquillity, etc., just as the strength of the faith faculty is abandoned by the reviewing of the specific nature of dhammas.🔽In the same way, the excess of the energy faculty is abandoned by the development of tranquillity, etc., because the latter are on the side of concentration.

original: viya vīriyindriyassa adhimattataṃ uddhaccapātato rakkhantī ekaṃsato hāpeti. Tena
analyzed: viya vīriya indriyassa adhimatta tam uddhacca pātataḥ rakkhantī ekaṃsataḥ hāpeti tena
