analyzed: vaṇṇayanti tat ayuttam tathā hi sati ajjhāna dhammehi jhānassa guṇa saṃkittanam nāma
translated: This is inappropriate, since in that case the jhāna would be described as having the special qualities of the jhāna factors, and one plane of existence cannot belong to another.

original: kataṃ hoti. Na hi bhūmantaraṃ bhūmantarapariyāpannaṃ hoti. Pāḷiyā cetaṃ viruddhanti
analyzed: katam hoti na hi bhūmantaram bhūmantara pariyāpannam hoti pāḷiyā ca itam viruddhanti
translated: And it is contrary to the texts.

original: dassetuṃ “yasmā panā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha ekattagataṃ cittanti indriyānaṃ ekarasabhāvena,
analyzed: dassetum yasmā pana atiādi vuttam tattha ekatta gatam cittam ti indriyānam eka rasa bhāvena
translated: The passage beginning with “But because” is stated to show this. Herein, the consciousness that has reached unification is the consciousness that has reached unification in conformity with the unification that is the single function of the faculties,🔽and the single mode of their activity, and the single proximate cause of their occurrence, and the single nature of their manifestation, and the single object of their exercise, and the single way of their appearing, and the single way of their falling away.

original: ekaggatāya ca sikhāppattiyā tadanuguṇaṃ ekattaṃ gatanti ekattagataṃ, sasampayuttaṃ🔽appanāpattacittaṃ. Tasseva paṭipadāvisuddhipakkhandatādi anantarameva vuccati. Tasmāti
analyzed: ekagga tāya ca sikhā appattiyā tad anuguṇam ekattam gatanti ekatta gatam sa sampayuttam  appanā āpatta cittam tassa iva paṭipadā visuddhi pakkhanda tā ādi anantaram eva vuccati tasmā iti
translated: It is accompanied by its associated states.🔽The purification of the way is said immediately next to it. Because:

original: yasmā ekasmiṃyeva appanācittakkhaṇe paṭipadāvisuddhiādi pāḷiyaṃ vuttaṃ, tasmā āgamanavasenāti🔽parikammāgamanavasena. Anativattanādīti ādi-saddena indriyekarasatātadupagavīriyavāhanāsevanāni
analyzed: yasmai ekasmin yeva appanā citta kkhaṇe paṭipadā visuddhi ādi pāḷiyam vuttam tasmai āgamana vasena ati
translated: because the purification of the way, etc., are stated in the text in the single moment of the consciousness of absorption, therefore:

original: saṅgaṇhāti. Pariyodāpakassāti parisodhakassa pabhassarabhāvakarassa. Anativattanādibhāvasādhanameva🔽cettha ñāṇassa kiccanipphatti veditabbā.🔽Tasminti tasmiṃ vāre, catupañcacittaparimāṇāya appanāvīthiyanti attho. Tato paripanthato.
analyzed: saṅgaṇhāti pariyodāpakassa ati parisodhakassa pabhassara bhāva karassa an ativattana ādi bhāva sādhanam eva 🔽ca ittha ñāṇassa kicca nipphatti veditabbā 🔽tasmin ti tasmin vāre catu pañca citta parimāṇāya appanā vīthiyan ti attho tatas paripanthataḥ
translated: by the arrival at that. By the arrival at the access is the meaning. By the arrival at the path is the meaning. By the arrival at the fruition is the meaning. By the arrival at the path and fruition is the meaning. By the arrival at the path, fruition, and the noble person is the meaning. By the arrival at the path, fruition, noble person, and the supramundane aggregates is the meaning. By the arrival at the path, fruition, noble person, supramundane aggregates, and the noble person’s in-breaths and out-breaths is the meaning. By the arrival at the path, fruition, noble person, supramundane aggregates, noble person’s in-breaths and out-breaths, and the noble person’s mindfulness of breathing is the meaning. By the arrival at the path, fruition, noble person, supramundane aggregates, noble person’s in-breaths and out-breaths, noble person’s mindfulness of breathing, and the noble person’s development of mindfulness of breathing is the meaning. By the arrival at the path, fruition, noble person, supramundane aggregates, noble person’s in-breaths and out-breaths, noble person’s mindfulness of breathing, noble person’s development of mindfulness of breathing, and the noble person’s attainment of the development of mindfulness of breathing is the meaning. By the arrival at the path, fruition, noble person, supramundane aggregates, noble person’s in-breaths and out-breaths, noble person’s mindfulness of breathing, noble person’s development of mindfulness of breathing, noble person’s attainment of the development of mindfulness of breathing, and the noble person’s emergence from the

original: Cittaṃ visujjhatīti yadipi āgamanaṃ gahetuṃ avisesena viya vuttaṃ, parikammavisuddhito
analyzed: cittam visujjhati iti yadi api āgamanam gahetum avisesena viya vuttam parikamma visuddhitaḥ
translated: “The mind becomes purified” is said as if referring to the approach without distinction, but the purification of access is more outstanding than that of absorption.

original: pana appanāvisuddhi sātisayāva. Tenāha “visuddhattā”tiādi. Āvaraṇavirahitaṃ hutvāti
analyzed: pana tena āha visuddha ttā atiādi āvaraṇa virahitam hutvā iti
translated: Therefore it is said, “because of purity, etc.”

original: yenāvaraṇena āvaṭattā cittaṃ tato pubbe majjhimaṃ samathanimittaṃ paṭipajjituṃ na🔽sakkoti, tena vivittaṃ hutvā, taṃ vikkhambhetvāti attho. Līnuddhaccasaṅkhātānaṃ ubhinnaṃ
analyzed: yena āvaraṇena cittam tatas pubbe majjhimam samatha nimittam paṭipajjitum na  sakkoti tena vivittam hutvā tam vikkhambhetvā ti atthaḥ līn uddhacca saṅkhātānam ubhinnam
translated: Free from obstruction: the meaning is, free from that obstruction by which the mind was previously unable to enter upon the middle way, the sign of serenity.🔽The middle way is so called because it does not approach either extreme called “depression” or “excitement.”

original: antānaṃ anupagamanena majjhimo, savisesaṃ paccanīkadhammānaṃ vūpasamanato samatho,
analyzed: antānam an upagamanena majjhimaḥ sa visesam paccanīka dhammānam vūpasamanataḥ samathaḥ
translated: It is serenity because it is the stilling of opposing states in a more outstanding way.

original: yogino sukhavisesānaṃ kāraṇabhāvato nimittañcāti majjhimaṃ samathanimittaṃ. Tenāha
analyzed: yoginaḥ sukha visesānam kāraṇa bhāvataḥ nimittam ca ati majjhimam samatha nimittam tena āha
translated: It is the sign of serenity because it is the cause of the meditator’s outstanding pleasure.

original: “samappavatto appanāsamādhiyevā”ti. Tadanantaraṃ pana purimacittanti tassa appanācittassa
analyzed: sama ppavatto appanā samādhiyā iva ati tad anantaram pana purima cittanti tassa appanā cittassa
translated: Therefore it is said, “The absorption concentration that occurs thus is the absorption itself.”🔽But the “mind next to that” is the mind that is a condition by conascence for the absorption mind; the meaning is, the lineage- born mind.

original: anantarapaccayabhūtaṃ purimaṃ cittaṃ, gotrabhucittanti attho. Ekasantatipariṇāmanayenāti
analyzed: anantara paccaya bhūtam purimam cittam gotrabhu cittanti attho eka santati pariṇāma nayena ati
translated: By the process of transformation of a single continuity:

original: yathā “tadeva khīraṃ dadhisampanna”nti, evaṃ satipi parittamahaggatabhāvabhede, paccayapaccayuppannabhāvabhede
analyzed: yathā tat eva khīram dadhi sampannanti evam sati pi paritta mahaggata bhāva bhede paccaya paccaya uppanna bhāva bhede
translated: Just as it is said, “That same milk is the same as the curd,” so too, although there is a difference in the degree of greatness, and a difference in the state of condition and effect,

original: ca ekissā eva santatiyā pariṇāmūpagamananayena ekattanayavasena. Tathattanti tathabhāvaṃ
analyzed: ca ekissā eva santatiyā pariṇāma upagamana nayena ekatta naya vasena tathattanti tathabhāvam
translated: in the case of a single continuity, there is a single method of occurrence by way of the method of transformation. “Thatness”: the state of being that.

original: appanāsamādhivasena samāhitabhāvaṃ. Evaṃ paṭipannattāti vuttākārena paṭipajjamānattā.
analyzed: appanā samādhi vasena samāhita bhāvam evam paṭipanna ttā ati vutta ākārena paṭipajjamāna ttā
translated: “Concentration”: the state of being concentrated by means of absorption concentration. “Practising in this way”: because of practising in the way described.

original: Yasmiñhi khaṇe tathattaṃ majjhimaṃ samathanimittaṃ paṭipajjati, tasmiṃyeva khaṇe
analyzed: yasmin hi khaṇe tathattam majjhimam samatha nimittam paṭipajjati tasmin yeva khaṇe
translated: For at the moment he practises the middle sign of concentration, thatness,

original: tathattupagamanena appanāsamādhinā samāhitabhāvūpagamanena tattha pakkhandati nāma.
analyzed: tathattā upagamanena appanā samādhinā samāhita bhāva upagamanena tattha pakkhandati nāma
translated: at that very moment he enters into it by way of the attainment of thatness, by way of the attainment of the state of being concentrated by means of absorption concentration.

original: Purimacitteti appanācittassa purimasmiṃ citte gotrabhucitte. Vijjamānākāranipphādikāti
analyzed: purima cittā iti appanā cittassa purimasmin citte gotrabhu citte vijjamāna ākāra nipphādikā ati
translated: “In the preceding consciousness”: in the consciousness preceding the consciousness of absorption, in the consciousness of the lineage. “Having produced the sign”:🔽having produced the sign of the purification of the hindrances, the middle sign of concentration, the method of practice, and the entry into it,

original: tasmiṃ citte vijjamānānaṃ paripanthavisuddhimajjhimasamathapaṭipattipakkhandanākārānaṃ
analyzed: tasmin citte vijjamānānam paripantha visuddhi majjhima samatha paṭipatti pakkhandana ākārānam
translated: which are present in that consciousness.

original: nipphādikā, tenākārena nipphajjamānāti attho. Teyeva hi ākārā paccayavisesato jhānakkhaṇe
analyzed: nipphādikā tena ākārena nipphajjamānā ti attho te eva hi ākārā paccaya visesataḥ jhāna kkhaṇe
translated: The meaning is that they are produced in that way. For these three factors are produced in the jhāna at the moment of its arising through the specific condition consisting in the jhāna itself.

original: nipphajjamānā “paṭipadāvisuddhī”ti laddhasamaññā jhānassa taṃ visesaṃ nipphādentā
analyzed: nipphajjamānā paṭipadā visuddhī iti laddha samaññā jhānassa tam visesam nipphādentā
translated: The meaning is that they are produced in that mode. For these three modes, as conditions, are called “purity of way of practice” when they are being produced at the moment of jhāna. They are spoken of as if they were producing that distinction of jhāna.🔽At the moment of arising: at the moment of its obtaining its individual essence.

original: viya vuttā. Uppādakkhaṇeyevāti attalābhavelāyameva. Yadi evaṃ, kathaṃ te ākārā nipphajjantīti
analyzed: viya vuttā uppāda kkhaṇeya iva ati atta lābha velāyam eva yadi evam katham te ākārāḥ nipphajjanti iti
translated: If that is so, how are these modes produced?

original: āha “āgamanavasenā”ti.
analyzed: āha āgamana vasena iti
translated: He said “by way of coming” .

original: Tassāti cittassa. “Visuddhaṃ cittaṃ ajjhupekkhatī”ti pāḷiyaṃ puggalādhiṭṭhānena āgatāti🔽“byāpāraṃ akaronto”ti āha. Samathapaṭipattitathattupagamanañca idha samathabhāvāpattiyevāti
analyzed: tassa ati cittassa visuddham cittam ajjhupekkhati iti pāḷiyam puggala adhiṭṭhānena āgatā ti  byāpāram a karontaḥ iti āha samatha paṭipatti tathattu upagamanam ca idha samatha bhāva āpattiyā iva ati
translated: That: the consciousness. “He looks on at the purified consciousness with equanimity” . It comes in the text with reference to a person.🔽So he said “without exercising any influence” . And the “coming in the way of the serenity of the path” is the same as the “coming in the way of the serenity of the state” .🔽So he said “by way of coming in the way of the serenity of the state” .

original: āha “samathabhāvūpagamanenā”ti. Kilesasaṃsaggaṃ pahāya ekattena upaṭṭhitassāti pubbe
analyzed: āha samatha bhāva upagamanena āti kilesa saṃsaggam pahāya ekattena upaṭṭhitassa ati pubbe
translated: Having abandoned association with defilements, he is set in the single way.

original: “kathaṃ nu kho kilesasaṃsaggaṃ pajaheyya”nti paṭipannassa idāni samathapaṭipattiyā
analyzed: katham nu kho kilesa saṃsaggam pajaheyyanti paṭipannassa idāni samatha paṭipattiyā
translated: Having previously undertaken practice with the thought “How can I abandon association with defilements?” now, by the practice of serenity,

original: tassa pahīnattā kilesasaṅgaṇikābhāvena ekattena upaṭṭhitassa jhānacittassa. Paripanthavisuddhimajjhimasamathapaṭipattipakkhandanehi
analyzed: tassa pahīna ttā kilesa saṅgaṇikā bhāvena ekattena upaṭṭhitassa jhāna cittassa paripantha visuddhi majjhima samatha paṭipatti pakkhandanehi
translated: Because that has been abandoned, equanimity of the jhāna consciousness, which is then set up in unity by the absence of the company of defilements,🔽is assisted by the development of the jhāna consciousness, which is assisted in turn by the purification of the hindrances, the middle way, the practice, and the right endeavour.

original: vuddhippattiyā anubrūhite jhānacitte laddhokāsā tatramajjhattupekkhā sampayuttesu
analyzed: vuddhi ppattiyā jhāna citte laddha ukāsā tatram ajjhatta upekkhā sampayuttesu
translated: And when the jhāna consciousness has obtained the opportunity to occur with equanimity of the fourth jhāna associated with it,

original: samavāhitabhāvena pavattamānā te anubrūhentī viya hotīti āha “tatramajjhattupekkhāya
analyzed: samavāhita bhāvena pavattamānā te viya hoti iti āha
translated: equanimity occurs as if assisting that consciousness by occurring with it in a state of balance.

original: kiccavasena upekkhānubrūhanā veditabbā”ti.
analyzed: kicca vasena upekkhā anubrūhanā veditabbā ati
translated: That is why it is said that “the assisting of equanimity should be understood as the function of equanimity of the fourth jhāna.”🔽The words “the pair of states” are connected with the words “in the case of the fourth jhāna.”🔽Herein, in that jhāna, the two states of equanimity and unification of mind are yoked together, as it were, bound together, by the doing of their several functions without mutual obstruction,

original: Ye panete yuganaddhadhammāti sambandho. Tatthāti tasmiṃ jhānacitte. Aññamaññānativattanavasena
analyzed: ye pana ete yuga naddha dhammā ati sambandho tattha āti tasmim jhāna citte aññamañña an ativattana vasena
translated: and so they are called “yoked together” .

original: kiccakaraṇato yuge naddhā baddhā viya yuganaddhā. Vimuttirasenāti vimuccanakiccena,
analyzed: kicca karaṇataḥ yuge naddhāḥ baddhāḥ viya yuga naddhāḥ vimutti rasena ati vimuccana kiccena
translated: The “summit of the liberation” is the function of liberation,🔽or it is the excellence of liberation.🔽The meditator “drives” it: he makes it occur.

original: vimuccanasampattiyā vā. Esa yogī. Vāhayatīti pavatteti. Assāti jhānacittassa. Tasmiṃ
analyzed: vimuccana sampattiyā vā esa yogī vāhayati iti pavattā iti assa āti jhāna cittassa tasmin
translated: The “it” is the jhāna consciousness.

original: khaṇeti bhaṅgakkhaṇe. Uppādakkhaṇe atīte hi ṭhitikkhaṇato paṭṭhāya āsevanā pavattati
analyzed: khaṇe iti bhaṅga khaṇe uppāda khaṇe atīte hi ṭhiti khaṇataḥ paṭṭhāya āsevanā pavattati
translated: “At that moment”: at the moment of its dissolution. For the repetition of practice begins with the moment of the presence of the sign after the first-jhāna moment, which is the past kamma’s moment of producing an effect.

original: nāma. Te ākārāti aññamaññānativattanādayo tattha dhammānaṃ pavattiākārā. Āsevanāpi🔽hi āsevanapaccayabhāvīnaṃ dhammānaṃ pavattiākāroyeva. Saṃkilesavodānesūti samādhipaññānaṃ
analyzed: nāma te ākārā ti aññamañña anativattana ādayo tattha dhammānam pavatti ākārā āsevanā api  hi āsevana paccaya bhāvīnam dhammānam pavatti ākāro yā iva saṃkilesa vodānesu ti samādhi paññānam
translated: The “modes” are the modes of occurrence of the states there, namely, non-excess, etc.,🔽for occurrence is the mode of occurrence of states that are a condition by repetition.

original: samarasatāya akaraṇaṃ bhāvanāya saṃkileso, karaṇaṃ vodānaṃ. Tathā sesesupi. Evametesu🔽saṃkilesavodānesu taṃ taṃ ādīnavaṃ dosaṃ ānisaṃsaṃ guṇaṃ puretaraṃ pāṭihāriyañāṇena
analyzed: samarasatāya akaraṇam bhāvanāya saṃkilesaḥ karaṇam vodānam tathā sesesu pi evam etesu  saṃkilesa vodānesu tam tam ādīnavam dosam ānisaṃsam guṇam puretaram pāṭihāriya ñāṇena
translated: In the case of “defilement and cleansing,” the non-performance of concentration and understanding through lack of balance is defilement of development, and the performance of them is cleansing.🔽So too in the case of the rest. So when he has seen with insight the danger in defilement and the benefit in cleansing in this way,

original: disvā yathā aññamaññānativattanādayo honti, tathā bhāvanāya sampahaṃsitattā teneva🔽ñāṇena visodhitattā. Visodhanaṃ hettha sampahaṃsanaṃ. Te ākārā yasmā nipphannā, tasmā
analyzed: disvā yathā aññamañña anativattana ādayaḥ honti tathā bhāvanāya sampahaṃsita ttā tena iva  ñāṇena visodhita ttā visodhanam ha itthā sampahaṃsanam te ākārāḥ yasmā nipphannā tasmā
translated: and has thus confirmed his development by means of the knowledge of appearance as terror, and has thus purified his knowledge by means of the knowledge of equanimity about formations,🔽purification here being confirmation,

original: “dhammānaṃ…pe… veditabbāti vutta”nti lakkhaṇasaṃvaṇṇanāya ādimhi vuttaṃ nigamanavasena dasseti.
analyzed: dhammānam pe veditabbā ti vuttanti lakkhaṇa saṃvaṇṇanāya ādimhi vuttam nigamana vasena dasseti
translated: since these modes have been produced, he shows this by way of a conclusion in the description of the characteristic thus: “The ‘states’ are … to be understood” .

original: “Yasmā upekkhāvasena ñāṇaṃ pākaṭaṃ hotī”ti ko sambandho. Kasmā sampahaṃsanāva pariyosānanti
analyzed: yasmai upekkhā vasena ñāṇam pākaṭam hoti iti sambandho kasmai
translated: “But what is the connection between ‘the knowledge is evident through the equanimity’ and ‘the confirmation is the end’?🔽And why is the confirmation the end?”

original: vuttā, na upekkhānubrūhanāti codanaṃ sandhāya “tattha yasmā upekkhāvasena ñāṇaṃ pākaṭaṃ
analyzed: vuttā na upekkhā anubrūhanā ti codanam sandhāya tattha yasmai upekkhā vasena ñāṇam pākaṭam
translated: “And when it is said, ‘He does not pursue equanimity’ , this is said with reference to the urging on of the jhāna factors.

original: hotī”ti vuttaṃ. Tatthāti tasmiṃ bhāvanācitte. Upekkhāvasena ñāṇaṃ pākaṭaṃ hotīti
analyzed: hoti iti vuttam tattha ati tasmim bhāvanā citte upekkhā vasena ñāṇam pākaṭam hoti iti
translated: “Herein, it is knowledge that is evident through equanimity” :

original: appanākāle bhāvanāya samappavattiyā, paṭipakkhassa ca pahānato paggahādīsu byāpārassa
analyzed: appanā kāle bhāvanāya sama ppavattiyā paṭipakkhassa ca pahānataḥ paggaha ādīsu byāpārassa
translated: at the time of absorption, because of the occurrence of development, and because of the absence of any need to exercise the function of exerting, etc., there is only equanimity,

original: akātabbato ajjhupekkhanāva hoti. Yaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “samaye cittassa ajjhupekkhanā,
analyzed: a kātabbataḥ ajjhupekkhanā ava hoti yam sandhāya vuttam samaye cittassa ajjhupekkhanā
translated: with reference to which it is said, “Equanimity is the state of evenness of the mind” ,

original: visuddhaṃ cittaṃ ajjhupekkhatī”ti ca ādi. Sā panāyaṃ ajjhupekkhanā ñāṇassa kiccasiddhiyā🔽hoti, visesato ñāṇasādhanattā appanābyāpārassāti phalena kāraṇānumānañāyena. Yasmā
analyzed: visuddham cittam ajjhupekkhati iti ca ādi sā pana ayam ajjhupekkhanā ñāṇassa kicca siddhiyā  hoti visesataḥ ñāṇa sādhana ttā appanā byāpārassa ati phalena kāraṇa anumāna ñāyena yasmā
translated: “Equanimity is the state of looking on at the purified mind” , and so on.🔽And this equanimity is the result of the success of knowledge,🔽because absorption is the fulfilment of knowledge, and because of the absence of any need to exercise the function of exerting, etc.

original: upekkhāvasena ñāṇaṃ pākaṭaṃ hoti, tasmā ñāṇakiccabhūtā sampahaṃsanā pariyosānanti vuttāti sambandho.
analyzed: upekkhā vasena ñāṇam pākaṭam hoti tasmā ñāṇa kicca bhūtā sampahaṃsanā pariyosānan ti vuttā ati sambandho
translated: So the meaning is that the knowledge that is evident through equanimity is the culmination of the comforting that is the function of knowledge.🔽Now, in order to establish the meaning stated by the words “And when it is said, ‘He does not pursue equanimity’ , this is said with reference to the urging on of the jhāna factors” , etc., with the text of the sutta, he said, “And so it is said” ,

original: Idāni yathāvuttamatthaṃ pāḷiyā samatthetuṃ “yathāhā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tathāpaggahitaṃ
analyzed: idāni yathāvuttam attham pāḷiyā samatthetum yathā āha atiādi vuttam tathā apaggahitam
translated: and so on. And the meaning of the sutta passage is this:

original: cittanti yathā bhāvanācittaṃ kosajjapakkhe na patati, tathā vīriyasambojjhaṅgaṭṭhāniyānaṃ🔽dhammānaṃ bahulīkāravasena paggahitaṃ. Sādhukaṃ ajjhupekkhatīti paggaṇhantenāpi samādhissa🔽vīriyasamatāyojanavasena paggahitattā sakkaccaṃ ajjhupekkhati, tatramajjhattupekkhā🔽okāsaṃ labhati. Taṃ pana ajjhupekkhanaṃ upekkhāvasena pubbe pavattapārihāriyapaññāvasena
analyzed: cittam ti yathā bhāvanā cittam kosajja pakkhe na patati tathā vīriya sambojjhaṅga ṭṭhāniyānam  dhammānam bahulīkāra vasena paggahitam sādhukam ajjhupekkhati iti paggaṇhantena api samādhissa  vīriya sama tā yojana vasena paggahita ttā sakkaccam ajjhupekkhati tatram ajjhattupekkhā  okāsam labhati tam pana ajjhupekkhanam upekkhā vasena pubbe pavatta pārihāriya paññā vasena
translated: “Mind” is the development of consciousness in such a way that it does not fall into the side of indolence. “He looks on with perfect equanimity” : he looks on with perfect equanimity because he has aroused energy in such a way that he can direct his concentration to the state of balance of energy. The opportunity for the equanimity of neutrality is obtained. This looking on with equanimity is the equanimity of neutrality, which is the opportunity for the wisdom of investigation that has arisen previously.

original: appanāpaññāya kiccādhikatāti āha “paññāvasena paññindriyaṃ adhimattaṃ hotī”ti. Tassa🔽adhimattattā eva ajjhupekkhantasseva nānāsabhāvehi nīvaraṇapamukhehi kilesehi appanācittaṃ
analyzed: appanā paññāya kicca adhika tā ti āha paññā vasena paññindriyam adhimattam hoti iti tassa  adhimatta ttā eva ajjhupekkhantassa iva nānā sabhāvehi nīvaraṇa pamukhehi kilesehi appanā cittam
translated: “Mind” is the development of consciousness in such a way that it does not fall into the side of indolence. “He looks on with perfect equanimity” : he looks on with perfect equanimity because he has aroused energy by developing the states that are the basis for the enlightenment factor of energy. He gives opportunity for the equanimity of the middle way to arise. But this looking on with equanimity is the function of the absorption knowledge that arose previously through the equanimity of the middle way and through the insight knowledge that arose previously through the investigation of phenomena. Therefore it is said: “The understanding faculty is outstanding through understanding” .

original: vimuccati. Vimokkhavasena vimuccanavasena. Paññāvasenāti pubbe pavattapārihāriyapaññāvasena.
analyzed: vimuccati vimokkha vasena vimuccana vasena paññā vasena āti pubbe pavatta pārihāriya paññā vasena
translated: Because of its outstandingness, the mind of one who looks on with equanimity becomes liberated from the defilements headed by the hindrances through the various kinds of specific characteristics. “Through liberation” means through the liberation of the mind. “Through understanding” means through the insight knowledge that arose previously through the investigation of phenomena.

original: Vimuttattāti nānākilesehi vimuttattā eva. Te dhammā saddhādayo, visesato saddhāpaññāvīriyasamādhayo
analyzed: vimutta ttā ti nānā kilesehi vimutta ttā eva te dhammā saddhā ādayaḥ visesataḥ saddhā paññā vīriya samādhayaḥ
translated: “Because of their liberation”: because of their liberation from the various defilements.🔽These states, namely, faith, etc., are of one taste, of one function, especially faith, understanding, energy, and concentration.

original: ca ekarasā samānakiccā honti. Evamayaṃ indriyānaṃ ekarasaṭṭhena bhāvanā nipphajjamānā🔽ñāṇabyāpāroti āha “ñāṇakiccabhūtā sampahaṃsanā pariyosāna”nti. Evaṃ tividhāya paṭipadāvisuddhiyā
analyzed: ca ekarasā samāna kiccāḥ honti evamayam ekarasa ṭṭhena bhāvanā nipphajjamānā  ñāṇa byāpāraḥ iti āha ñāṇa kicca bhūtā sampahaṃsanā pariyosāna nti evam tividhāya paṭipadā visuddhiyā
translated: Thus the development of the faculties, which is successful in this way by the one- tastedness of the faculties,🔽is “the culmination of the act of gladdening, which is the function of knowledge,” as it was said above.

original: laddhavisesāya tividhāya upekkhānubrūhanāya sātisayaṃ paññindriyassa adhimuttabhāvena
analyzed: laddha visesāya tividhāya upekkhā anubrūhanāya sa atisayam paññindriyassa adhimutta bhāvena
translated: The gladdening, which is fourfold in this way, succeeds by the predominance of the understanding faculty in one who has attained distinction by means of the purification of the path of three kinds and by the increase of the three kinds of equanimity.

original: catubbidhāpi sampahaṃsanā sijjhatīti āgamanupekkhā ñāṇakiccavasena dasapi ākārā jhāne eva veditabbā.
analyzed: catubbidhā api sampahaṃsanā sijjhati iti āgamanupekkhā ñāṇa kicca vasena dasa api ākārā jhāne eva veditabbā
translated: So the nine aspects of equanimity as a resort to knowledge should be understood as occurring in the jhāna itself.

original: Gaṇanānupubbatāti gaṇanānupubbatāya, gaṇanānupubbatāmattaṃ vā paṭhamanti idanti attho.
analyzed: gaṇanā anupubba tā ti gaṇanā anupubba tāya gaṇanā anupubba tā mattam vā paṭhamam ti idam ti atthaḥ
translated: “In the order of enumeration”: in the order of enumeration, or the extent of the order of enumeration, is the meaning of “first.”🔽By this he indicates the order of teaching.

original: Tena desanākkamaṃ ulliṅgeti. “Paṭhamaṃ uppannanti paṭhama”nti iminā paṭipattikkamaṃ,
analyzed: tena desanā kkamam ulliṅgeti paṭhamam uppannam ti paṭhamam ti iminā paṭipatti kkamam
translated: By “first arisen” he indicates the order of practice.

original: uppannanti hi adhigatanti attho. “Paṭhamaṃ samāpajjitabbanti paṭhama”nti idaṃ pana
analyzed: uppannanti hi adhigatanti attho paṭhamam samāpajjitabbanti paṭhamam ti idam pana
translated: “Arisen” means “attained.” “To be entered upon first” is “first.”

original: na ekantalakkhaṇanti aṭṭhakathāyaṃ paṭisiddhattā idha na gahitaṃ. Ārammaṇūpanijjhānaṃ
analyzed: na ekanta lakkhaṇam ti aṭṭhakathāyam paṭisiddha ttā idha na gahitam ārammaṇa upanijjhānam
translated: But this is not taken here because it is not a single characteristic, since it is denied in the commentary.

original: lakkhaṇūpanijjhānanti duvidhe jhāne idhādhippetajjhānameva dassetuṃ “ārammaṇūpanijjhānato”ti
analyzed: lakkhaṇa upanijjhānam ti duvidhe jhāne idha adhippeta jhānam eva dassetum ārammaṇa upanijjhānato ti
translated: In the two kinds of jhāna, namely, that with a kasiṇa as object and that with an immaterial object, the jhāna intended here is that with a kasiṇa as object, so “because of the object’s being defined” is said.

original: vuttaṃ. Pathavīkasiṇasaṅkhātassa attano attano ārammaṇassa rūpaṃ viya cakkhunā upanijjhāyanato.
analyzed: vuttam pathavī kasiṇa saṅkhātassa attanaḥ attanaḥ ārammaṇassa rūpam viya cakkhunā upanijjhāyanato
translated: Because it defines the object consisting in materiality, which is its own, that is to say, the earth kasiṇa, by means of the eye.

original: Paccanīkajhāpanatoti nīvaraṇādīnaṃ paccanīkadhammānaṃ dahanato vikkhambhanavasena
analyzed: paccanīka jhāpanataḥ ti nīvaraṇa ādīnam paccanīka dhammānam dahanataḥ vikkhambhana vasena
translated: Because of the burning up of opposing states: because of the abandoning of opposing states such as the hindrances, etc., by suppression;

original: pajahanato. Sakalaṭṭhenāti heṭṭhā vuttanayena kate vā akate vā paricchijja gahite🔽pathavībhāge pathavīmaṇḍale sakalārammaṇakaraṇaṭṭhena. Na hi tassa ekadesamārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: pajahanataḥ sakala aṭṭhena ati heṭṭhā vutta nayena kate vā akate vā paricchijja gahite  pathavī bhāge pathavī maṇḍale sakala ārammaṇa karaṇa ṭṭhena na hi tassa eka desam ārammaṇam
translated: Because of the whole: because of making the whole the object, either in a part of earth delimited by a process of defining as described above or in the earth kasiṇa disk.🔽For it is not made the object by taking a part of it.

original: karīyati. Pathavīkasiṇasannissayatāya nimittaṃ pathavīkasiṇaṃ yathā “mañcā ukkuṭṭhiṃ
analyzed: karīyati pathavī kasiṇa sannissaya tāya nimittam pathavī kasiṇam yathā mañcāḥ ukkuṭṭhim
translated: The sign is the earth kasiṇa because it is the support for the jhāna. It is not the earth kasiṇa itself that is the jhāna’s object, but rather the sign that is the earth kasiṇa’s object. For the sign is the appearance of the earth kasiṇa disk as a circle of sand or a blue-black rock, for instance.

original: karontī”ti. Taṃsahacaraṇato jhānaṃ pathavīkasiṇaṃ yathā “kuntā pacarantī”ti.
analyzed: karonti iti jhānam pathavī kasiṇam yathā kuntā pacaranti iti
translated: and the jhāna is like the ploughshare because it accompanies that.

original: Ciraṭṭhitisampādanavaṇṇanā🔽76. Lakkhaṭṭhāne ṭhitaṃ sarena vālaṃ vijjhatīti vālavedhī. Idha pana anekadhā bhinnassa
analyzed: ciraṭṭhiti sampādana vaṇṇanā  lakkha ṭṭhāne ṭhitam sarena vālam vijjhati iti vālavedhī idha pana anekadhā bhinnassa
translated: The explanation of the fulfilment of long endurance🔽. A needle for splitting hair is a needle that splits a hair at the point where it is held. But here what is intended is a needle for splitting a hair that splits a hair split in a hundred parts.

original: vālassa aṃsuṃ vijjhanto “vālavedhī”ti adhippeto. Tena vālavedhinā. Sūdenāti bhattakārena.
analyzed: vālassa aṃsum vijjhantaḥ vālavedhī iti adhippeto tena vālavedhinā sūdena ati bhatta kārena
translated: With that needle for splitting a hair: with a needle for splitting a hair.

original: “Ākārā pariggahetabbā”ti saṅkhepato vuttamatthaṃ vivarituṃ “yathā hī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ākārā pariggahetabbā ti saṅkhepataḥ vuttam attham vivaritum yathā hi itiādi vuttam
translated: “The aspects should be discerned” : the meaning of this, stated in brief, is made clear by the words beginning with “For example.”🔽Herein, he is very skilled means he is quite clever.🔽A marksman means a bowman.

original: Tattha sukusaloti suṭṭhu cheko. Dhanuggahoti issāso. Kammanti yogyaṃ. Akkantapadānanti
analyzed: tattha su kusalo ti suṭṭhu chekaḥ dhanuggaho ti issāsaḥ kammanti yogyam akkanta padānam
translated: A shot means a suitable arrow.🔽The position of the foot means the position of the foot at the time of striking.

original: vijjhanakāle akkamanavasena pavattapadānaṃ. Ākāranti dhanujiyāsarānaṃ gahitākāraṃ.
analyzed: vijjhana kāle akkamana vasena pavatta padānam gahita ākāram
translated: The position of the bow means the position of the bow and arrow as held.🔽He should discern means he should investigate.

original: Pariggaṇheyyāti upadhāreyya. Bhojanasappāyādayoti ādi-saddo avuttākārānampi saṅgāhako
analyzed: pariggaṇheyya ati upadhāreyya bhojana sappāya ādayaḥ ti ādi saddaḥ a vutta ākārānam pi saṅgāhakaḥ
translated: The aspects favourable to eating, etc., are included by the word “etc.”

original: daṭṭhabbo. Tena utubhāvanānimittādīnampi pariggaṇhanaṃ vuttaṃ hoti. Tasminti tasmiṃ taruṇasamādhimhi.🔽Bhattāranti sāminaṃ, bhattavetanādīhi posakanti attho. Parivisantoti bhojento. Tassa
analyzed: daṭṭhabbaḥ tena utu bhāvanā nimitta ādīnam pi pariggaṇhanam vuttam hoti tasmin ti tasmin taruṇa samādhimhi  bhattāram ti sāminam bhatta vetana ādīhi posakam ti attho parivisantaḥ ti bhojentaḥ tassa
translated: So the apprehending of the sign of the order of the elements, etc., is also stated. In that: in that tender concentration.🔽Masters: owners; the meaning is, those who support by means of food, wages, etc.🔽Serving: feeding. The construction is: he observes the way in which the other eats with relish and then serves him. This meditator too.

original: ruccitvā bhuñjanākāraṃ sallakkhetvā tassa upanāmentoti yojanā. Ayampi yogī. Adhigatakkhaṇe
analyzed: ruccitvā bhuñjana ākāram sallakkhetvā tassa upanāmento ti yojanā ayam pi yogī adhigata kkhaṇe
translated: At the time of attaining: at the time of attaining the jhāna previously.

original: bhojanādayo ākāreti pubbe jhānassa adhigatakkhaṇe kiccasādhake bhojanādigate ākāre.
analyzed: bhojana ādayaḥ ākāre ti pubbe jhānassa adhigata kkhaṇe kicca sādhake bhojana ādi gate ākāre
translated: The way in which the food, etc., is useful: the way in which the food, etc., that has occurred is useful.

original: Gahetvāti pariggahetvā sallakkhetvā. Naṭṭhe naṭṭhe samādhimhi punappunaṃ appanāya.
analyzed: gahetvā ti pariggahetvā sallakkhetvā naṭṭhe naṭṭhe samādhimhi punappunam appanāya
translated: Having grasped: having discerned. In the concentration that has disappeared: again and again in the concentration that has disappeared by reappearing in it.

original: Mahānasavijjāparicayena paṇḍito. Tattha visadañāṇatāya byatto. Ṭhānuppattikakaosallayogena
analyzed: mahānasa vijjā paricayena paṇḍito tattha visada ñāṇa tāya byattaḥ ṭhāna uppattika kaosalla yogena
translated: Skilled in the knowledge of the great elements. Therein, he is clever because of his clear knowledge.🔽Skilled: skilled through possession of the skill consisting in the knowledge of how to re-arise in a particular place.

original: kusalo. Nānaccayehīti nānaccayehi nānāsabhāvehi, nānārasehīti attho. Tenāha “ambilaggehī”tiādi.
analyzed: kusalaḥ nānaccayehi iti nānaccayehi nānā sabhāvehi nānārasehi iti attho tena āha ambi laggehi itiādi
translated: By means of various tastes: by means of various kinds, various natures; the meaning is, by means of various flavours. Hence he said “by means of a morsel of sour salt” , and so on.

original: Sūpehīti byañjanehi. Ambilaggehīti ambilakoṭṭhāsehi, ye vā ambilarasā hutvā aggabhūtā,
analyzed: sūpehi iti byañjanehi ambila ggehi iti ambila koṭṭhāsehi ye vā ambila rasāḥ hutvā agga bhūtā
translated: ‘With sauces’ means with condiments. ‘With sour gruel’ means with sour rice water, or with any sour liquid that has become the best.

original: tehi caturambilādimissehi. Esa nayo tittakaggādīsupi. Khārikehīti vātiṅgaṇakaḷīrādimissehi.
analyzed: tehi catur ambila ādi missehi esa nayaḥ tittakagga ādīsu pi khārikehi iti vātiṅgaṇa kaḷīra ādi missehi
translated: With the four sour things mixed together, etc., and so on in the case of ‘with bitter’ and so on. ‘With potherbs’ means with potherbs of the vatiṅga, kaḷīra, etc., kinds.

original: Nimittanti ākāraṃ ruccanavasena bhuñjanākāraṃ. Uggaṇhātīti uparūpari gaṇhāti upadhāreti.🔽Imassa vā sūpeyyassa atthāya hatthaṃ abhiharati. Abhihārānanti abhimukhena haritabbānaṃ
analyzed: nimittam ti ākāram bhuñjana ākāram uggaṇhāti iti upari upari gaṇhāti upadhāra iti  imassa vā sūpeyyassa atthāya hattham abhiharati abhihāra ananti abhimukhena haritabbānam
translated: ‘Sign’ is the appearance as seen, the appearance of eating. ‘Remembers’ means remembers in order, recollects.

original: paṇṇākārānaṃ, pūjābhihārānaṃ vā. Nimittaṃ uggaṇhātīti “evaṃ me cittaṃ samāhitaṃ ahosī”ti
analyzed: pūjā abhihārānam vā nimittam uggaṇhāti iti evam me cittam samāhitam ahosi iti
translated: Or he remembers the sign of the food thus, ‘For the sake of this food I extended my hand.’ ‘Offerings’ are leaves, etc., that have to be carried to the bhikkhu who is in solitude, or offerings of requisites. ‘Remembers the sign’ means he remembers the sign thus, ‘My mind was concentrated in this way.’

original: nimittaṃ gaṇhāti sallakkheti.
analyzed: nimittam gaṇhāti sallakkheti
translated: He remembers, he reflects.

original: Samādhiparipanthānanti samādhissa paripanthabhūtānaṃ. Dhammānanti kāmacchandādinīvaraṇadhammānaṃ.
analyzed: samādhi paripanthānam ti samādhissa paripantha bhūtānam dhammānam ti kāmacchanda ādi nīvaraṇa dhammānam
translated: ‘Hindrances to concentration’: things that are hindrances to concentration. ‘Things’: things such as lust, etc., that are hindrances.

original: Suvisodhitattāti suṭṭhu visodhitattā, vikkhambhanavaseneva sammadeva pahīnattāti
analyzed: su visodhita ttā ati suṭṭhu visodhita ttā vikkhambhana vasena iva sammat eva pahīna ttā ati
translated: ‘Well purified’: well cleansed; well abandoned by suppression.

original: attho. Kāmādīnavapaccavekkhaṇādīhīti ādi-saddena asubhamanasikāranekkhammānisaṃsapaccavekkhaṇādīni
analyzed: kāma ādīnava paccavekkhaṇa ādīhi iti ādi saddena asubha manasikāra nekkhamma anisaṃsa paccavekkhaṇa ādīni
translated: The meaning. By the word “etc.” in “contemplation of the dangers in sense desires, etc.” is included the contemplation of the advantages of renunciation, the reflection on foulness, and so on.

original: saṅgaṇhāti. Nekkhammaguṇadassanenāpi hi tassa vibandhabhūte kāmacchande ādīnavo visesato
analyzed: saṅgaṇhāti nekkhamma guṇa dassanena api hi tassa vibandha bhūte kāmacchande ādīnavaḥ visesataḥ
translated: For by seeing the special qualities of renunciation the danger in sense desires, which is an obstruction to the development of concentration, becomes evident.

original: pākaṭo hotīti. Kāyaduṭṭhullanti kāyadarathaṃ sāraddhakāyataṃ. Tena kāyacittānaṃ sārambhanimittassa🔽byāpādanīvaraṇassa na visodhanamāha. Ārambhadhātumanasikārādīti ādi-saddena vīriyasambojjhaṅganimittānaṃ,🔽ālokasaññādīnañca saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo. Samathanimittamanasikārādīti ādi-saddena samādhisambojjhaṅgaṭṭhāniyānaṃ
analyzed: pākaṭaḥ hoti iti kāya duṭṭhullanti sāraddha kāyatam tena kāya cittānam sa ārambha nimittassa  byāpāda nīvaraṇassa na visodhanam āha ārambha dhātu manasikāra ādi iti ādi saddena vīriya sambojjhaṅga nimittānam  āloka saññā ādīnam ca saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbo samatha nimitta manasikāra ādi iti ādi saddena samādhi sambojjhaṅga ṭṭhāniyānam
translated: “Physical resistance” is physical obstruction, physical constraint. By that he shows the purification of the hindrance of ill will, which is the cause for the resistance of body and mind.🔽By the word “etc.” in “attention given to the element of initiative, etc.” is meant the sign of the enlightenment factor of energy, and the perception of light, and so on.🔽By the word “etc.” in “attention given to the sign of serenity, etc.” is meant the inclusion of the states that are the basis for the enlightenment factor of concentration.

original: dhammānaṃ saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo. Aññepi samādhiparipantheti vicikicchāṭṭhāniye, madamānādike🔽ca sandhāyāha. Āsayanti vasanakasusiraṃ. Suparisuddhanti āsaṅkanīyattābhāvena suṭṭhu
analyzed: dhammānam saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbo aññe pi samādhi paripanthā iti vicikicchā aṭṭhāniye mada māna ādike 🔽ca sandhāya āha āsayanti vasanaka susiram āsaṅkanīya tā bhāvena suṭṭhu
translated: “And other hindrances to concentration” are the states that are the basis for doubt, and also such things as conceit and pride.

original: parisuddhaṃ. Etthāha – nanu cāyaṃ pageva kāmādīnavaṃ paccavekkhitvā samathapaṭipadaṃ🔽paṭipanno upacārakkhaṇeyeva jhānena nīvaraṇāni vikkhambhitāni, atha kasmā puna kāmādīnavapaccavekkhaṇādi
analyzed: parisuddham ettha āha nanu ca ayam pagā iva kāma ādīnavam paccavekkhitvā samatha paṭipadam  paṭipannaḥ upacāra kkhaṇeya iva jhānena nīvaraṇāni vikkhambhitāni atha kasmā puna kāma ādīnava paccavekkhaṇa ādi
translated: Here it may be asked: “But didn’t he already see the danger in sensual desires and so on before he undertook the practice of serenity?🔽And didn’t he suppress the hindrances at the moment of access concentration? So why does he again🔽see the danger in sensual desires and so on? ”

original: gahitanti? Saccametaṃ. Taṃ pana pahānamattanti jhānassa ciraṭṭhitiyā atisayapahānatthaṃ puna gahitaṃ.
analyzed: gahitanti saccam etam tam pana pahāna mattam ti jhānassa cira ṭṭhitiyāḥ atisaya pahāna attham puna gahitam
translated: It is true, but that was only suppression by mere restraint. He now sees the danger in sensual desires and so on again in order to obtain the special kind of suppression that is a prerequisite for the jhāna to last long.

original: Uddhacca middhanti kukkuccaṃ, thinañca tadekaṭṭhatāya gahitamevāti katvā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: uddhat ca kukkuccam thinam ca tat ekaṭṭha tāya gahitam eva iti katvā vuttam
translated: “Excitement and remorse” is said because worry is included by “excitement” and drowsiness is included by “remorse” as having the same root.

original: Suddhantagatoti suparisuddhapariyantaṃ sabbaso visodhitakoṇapariyantaṃ uyyānaṃ gato.
analyzed: suddhanta gataḥ ti su parisuddha pariyantam sabbaso visodhita koṇa pariyantam uyyānam gataḥ
translated: “Gone to the end of consciousness” : gone to the end of consciousness that is quite purified and quite refined, that is, to the end of the consciousness that has been purified and refined in all aspects.

original: Tahiṃ rameti tasmiṃ jhāne rameyya divasabhāgampi jhānasamaṅgī eva bhaveyya.
analyzed: tahim rama iti tasmin jhāne rameyya divasa bhāgam pi jhāna samaṅgī eva bhaveyya
translated: “Finds delight in that” : he would delight in that jhāna; he would be possessed of jhāna even during the day.

original: Cittabhāvanāvepullatthanti samādhibhāvanāya vipulabhāvāya. Yathā hi bhāvanāvasena
analyzed: samādhi bhāvanāya vipula bhāvāya yathā hi bhāvanā vasena
translated: “For the sake of the abundant development of consciousness” : for the sake of the abundant development of concentration.

original: nimittassa uppatti, evamassa bhāvanāvaseneva vaḍḍhanampi. Tasmā ekaṅgulādivasena
analyzed: nimittassa uppatti evam assa bhāvanā vasena iva vaḍḍhanam pi tasmai ekaṅgula ādi vasena
translated: For just as the sign arises through development, so too its abundance comes about through development.🔽Therefore, in the case of the sign of water, for instance, it is said: “He sees the sign as small, he develops it, he develops it further, he makes it pure, he makes it pliable, he makes it workable. He sees the sign as large, he develops it, he develops it further, he makes it pure, he makes it pliable, he makes it workable” .

original: nimittaṃ vaḍḍhentassa punappunaṃ bahulīkārena jhānaṃ bhāvanāpi vuddhiṃ viruḷhiṃ vepullaṃ🔽āpajjati. Tena vuttaṃ “cittabhāvanāvepullatthañca yathāladdhaṃ paṭibhāganimittaṃ
analyzed: nimittam vaḍḍhentassa punappunam bahulīkārena jhānam bhāvanā api vuddhim viruḷhim vepullam  āpajjati tena vuttam citta bhāvanā vepulla ttham ca yathā laddham paṭibhāga nimittam
translated: As he extends the sign, the jhāna is developed, increased, and expanded by the repetition of the extension.🔽That is why it was said above: “The counterpart sign should be extended as far as possible in order to perfect the development of consciousness” .

original: vaḍḍhetabba”nti. Tassāti paṭibhāganimittassa.
analyzed: vaḍḍhetabbanti tassa ti paṭibhāga nimittassa
translated: As to him: as to the meditator.

original: Nimittavaḍḍhananayavaṇṇanā
analyzed: nimitta vaḍḍhana naya vaṇṇanā
translated: The method of extending the sign

original: 77. Tatrāti sāmiatthe bhummavacanaṃ, tassāti attho. Avaḍḍhetvāti yathā kumbhakāro
analyzed: tatra ati sāmi atthe bhumma vacanam tassa ati atthaḥ a vaḍḍhetvā iti yathā kumbhakāro
translated: Herein, the word “herein” is in the locative case in the sense of place, thus it is a place- locative. The meaning is: as to that.🔽Without extending: just as a potter extends a dish by gradually enlarging it without defining the edge, so too, without extending the sign by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,

original: mattikāya pattaṃ karonto paṭhamaṃ aparicchinditvāva pattaṃ vaḍḍheti, evaṃ pattavaḍḍhanayogena
analyzed: mattikāya pattam karontaḥ paṭhamam a paricchinditvā ava pattam vaḍḍheti evam patta vaḍḍhana yogena
translated: without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,

original: pattavaḍḍhanayuttiyā avaḍḍhetvā pūvikassa pūvavaḍḍhanaṃ. Bhattassa upari bhattapakkhipanaṃ
analyzed: patta vaḍḍhana yuttiyā a vaḍḍhetvā pūvikassa pūva vaḍḍhanam bhattassa upari bhatta pakkhipanam
translated: without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,

original: bhattavaḍḍhanaṃ. Vatthassa tintassa añchanādi dussavaḍḍhanaṃ. Paccekaṃ yoga-saddo
analyzed: bhatta vaḍḍhanam vatthassa tintassa añchana ādi dussa vaḍḍhanam paccekam yoga saddo
translated: without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,🔽without extending it by the method of extending the dish,

original: yojetabbo. Aparicchinditvā na vaḍḍhetabbaṃ saparicchede eva bhāvanāpavattito. Tathā
analyzed: yojetabbaḥ a paricchinditvā na vaḍḍhetabbam sa paricchede eva bhāvanā apavattito tathā
translated: without extending it by the

original: hi vuttaṃ “sāntake no anantake”ti.
analyzed: hi vuttam sa antake no anantake iti
translated: for it is said, “In what is finite, not in what is infinite” .

original: Haṃsapotakāti javanahaṃsapotakā. Ukkūlaṃ unnataṭṭhānaṃ. Vikūlaṃ ninnaṭṭhānaṃ. Nadīsotena kataṃ viduggaṃ nadīviduggaṃ. Visamākārena ṭhito pabbatapadeso pabbatavisamo.🔽Thūlāni hutvā upaṭṭhahanti paccavekkhaṇābāhullena vibhūtabhāvato. Dubbalāni hutvā
analyzed: haṃsa potakā ati javana haṃsa potakāḥ ukkūlam unnata ṭṭhānam vikūlam ninna ṭṭhānam nadī sotena katam viduggam nadī viduggam visama ākārena ṭhitaḥ pabbata padesaḥ pabbata visamaḥ  thūlāni hutvā upaṭṭhahanti paccavekkhaṇā bāhullena vibhūta bhāvataḥ dubbalāni hutvā
translated: “Geese’s young” : swift-flying young geese. “A slope” : an elevated place. “A ravine” : a low place. “A river’s slope” : a difficult place made by a river’s current. “A mountain’s unevenness” : a place in a mountain that is uneven in appearance.🔽They appear heavy because of the abundance of reviewing, which is a sign of development. They appear light

original: upaṭṭhahanti paguṇabalavabhāvassa anāpādikattā. Upari ussukkanāyāti bhāvanāya upari
analyzed: upaṭṭhahanti paguṇa balava bhāvassa anāpādika ttā upari ussukkanāya ati bhāvanāya upari
translated: because the state of being familiar and strong is not yet established. “In the higher stages” : in the higher stages of development,

original: ārohanāya, dutiyajjhānādhigamāyāti attho.
analyzed: ārohanāya dutiya jhāna adhigamāya ti attho
translated: that is, in the attainment of the second jhāna, and so on.

original: Pabbateyyāti pabbate bahulacārinī. Akhettaññūti agocaraññū. Samādhiparipanthānaṃ
analyzed: pabbateyyā ati pabbate bahula cārinī a khetta ññū iti a gocara ññū samādhi paripanthānam
translated: “Mountain-dweller” : one who lives mostly in mountains. “Unacquainted with the terrain” : unacquainted with the domain. Because of the lack of direct knowledge of the purification of the hindrances to concentration,

original: visodhanānabhiññātāya bālo. Jhānassa paguṇabhāvāpādanaveyyattiyassa abhāvena abyatto.
analyzed: visodhana anabhiññātāya bālaḥ jhānassa paguṇa bhāva āpādana veyyattiyassa abhāvena a byattaḥ
translated: he is a fool. Because of the lack of effort to bring about the state of being familiar with jhāna, he is unskillful.

original: Uparijhānassa padaṭṭhānabhāvānavabodhena akhettaññū. Sabbathāpi samāpattikosallābhāvena
analyzed: upari jhānassa padaṭṭhāna bhāva anavabodhena akhettaññū sabbathā api samāpatti kosalla abhāvena
translated: Because of the lack of understanding of the state of being the proximate cause for the higher jhāna, he is unacquainted with the terrain. Because of the lack of skill in attaining jhāna,🔽he is unskillful.

original: akusalo. Samādhinimittassa vā anāsevanāya bālo. Abhāvanāya abyatto. Abahulīkārena🔽akhettaññū. Sammadeva anadhiṭṭhānato akusaloti yojetabbaṃ. Ubhato bhaṭṭhoti ubhayato
analyzed: akusalaḥ samādhi nimittassa vā anāsevanāya bālaḥ abhāvanāya abyattaḥ a bahulīkārena  akhettaññū sammadeva anadhiṭṭhānataḥ akusalo ti yojetabbam ubhatas bhaṭṭhaḥ ti ubhayatas
translated: He is unwise. Or else, the fool is because of not cultivating the sign of concentration, the incompetent is because of not developing it, the one who does not know the field is because of not frequently practicing it.🔽He is unwise should be construed as follows: because of not determining it properly.🔽One who has lost both is one who has lost both the spiritual and the material.

original: jhānato bhaṭṭho. So hi appaguṇatāya na suppatiṭṭhitatāya saussāhopi vināsato, asāmatthiyato
analyzed: jhānataḥ so hi appaguṇa tāya na suppatiṭṭhita tāya saussāhaḥ api vināsataḥ a sāmatthiyato
translated: He is unskillful. Or he is a fool because he does not cultivate the sign of concentration. He is not a master because he does not develop it. He is not a knower of fields because he does not frequently practice it. He is unskillful because he does not determine it rightly. He is one who has fallen away on both sides: he has fallen away from both kinds of jhāna. He is a failure because he has little merit and is not well established, and he is a failure because he has lost his energy and is incapable.

original: ca jhānadvayato parihīno. Ciṇṇavasināti āsevitavasinā.
analyzed: ca jhāna dvayataḥ parihīnaḥ āsevita vasinā
translated: He has fallen away from the two kinds of jhāna. He is one who has lived the life: he has cultivated the life.

original: Pañcavasīkathāvaṇṇanā🔽78. Vasanaṃ vasīti dhātuniddesatāya kiriyāniddesoti adhippāyenāha “vasiyo”ti, yathāruci
analyzed: vasanam vasī iti dhātu niddesa tāya kiriyā niddeso ti adhippāyena āha vasiyā iti yathāruci
translated: The explanation of the five kinds of mastery

original: pavattiyoti attho. Āvajjanāya vasī, āvajjanāvasena vā vasī āvajjanavasī. Jhānaṃ āvajjituṃ
analyzed: pavattiyaḥ ti attho āvajjanāya vasī āvajjana avasena vā vasī āvajjana vasī jhānam āvajjitum
translated: . The meaning is that he has mastery in the sense of the ability to occur as he wishes, according to the explanation of the meaning of “mastery” in the Niddesa as “mastery in the sense of mastery of the elements” . He is a master of adverting, or he has mastery by means of adverting, thus he is a master of adverting. He is able to advert to jhāna🔽in whatever place he wishes, wherever he wishes. He is able to advert to jhāna

original: yattha yattha padese icchā yatthicchakaṃ. Yadā yadā, yasmiṃ yasmiṃ vā jhānaṅge icchā🔽yadicchakaṃ. Yāva yāva icchā yāvadicchakaṃ, da-kāro padasandhikaro. “Yāvā”ti ca idaṃ
analyzed: yattha yattha padese icchā yatthicchakam yadā yadā yasmin yasmin vā icchā 🔽yadicchakam yāva yāvaḥ icchā yāvat icchakam cakāro pada sandhi karaḥ ca idam
translated: in whatever jhāna factor he wishes, in whichever jhāna factor he wishes. He is able to advert to jhāna🔽for as long as he wishes, for as long as he wants.

original: bahūnaṃ javanavārānaṃ nirantaraṃ viya tathāpavattanaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ, na ekameva.🔽So hi paricchinnacittakkhaṇoti. Āvajjanāya dandhāyitattaṃ natthīti vuttanayena yattha
analyzed: bahūnam javana vārānam nirantaram viya tathā pavattanam sandhāya vuttam na ekam eva  so hi paricchinna citta kkhaṇo ti āvajjanāya dandhāyi tattam natthi iti vutta nayena
translated: It is said with reference to the occurrence of the adverting in this way uninterruptedly as though of many impulsions, not of a single adverting.🔽For that is a limited moment of consciousness.

original: katthaci ṭhāne yadā yadā yaṃ kiñci jhānaṅgaṃ āvajjentassa yathicchitaṃ kālaṃ āvajjanāya
analyzed: katthaci ṭhāne yadā yadā yam kiñci jhānaṅgam āvajjentassa yathicchitam kālam āvajjanāya
translated: There is no delay in adverting: in whatever place and whenever he adverts to any one of the jhāna factors, then at that place and then at that time,

original: āvajjanappavattiyā dandhāyitattaṃ vitthāyitattaṃ, cirāyitattaṃ vā natthi. Evaṃ āvajjanavasī
analyzed: āvajjana ppavattiyāḥ dandhāyi tattam vitthāyi tattam cirāyi tattam vā natthi evam āvajjana vasī
translated: according as he wishes, there is no delay, no slowness, no tardiness, in the adverting, in the occurrence of the adverting.

original: siddhā nāma hotīti attho. Sesāti vuṭṭhānaadhiṭṭhānapaccavekkhaṇāvasiyo.
analyzed: siddhā nāma hoti iti attho sesā ti vuṭṭhāna adhiṭṭhāna paccavekkhaṇa avasiyo
translated: So it is the mastery in adverting that is established, is what is meant. The rest: the masteries in emerging, in resolving, and in reviewing.

original: Aṅgasamudāyabhāvato jhānassa jhāne āvajjanavasiṃ nipphādetukāmena paṭipāṭiyā jhānaṅgāni
analyzed: aṅga samudāya bhāvataḥ jhānassa jhāne āvajjana vasim nipphādetu kāmena paṭipāṭiyā jhāna aṅgāni
translated: Since the jhāna is a combination of factors, one who wants to accomplish mastery in adverting in the jhāna should advert to the jhāna factors in due order.🔽So it is said: “When he adverts to thinking first” .

original: āvajjetabbānīti āha “paṭhamaṃ vitakkaṃ āvajjayato”ti. Yadipi āvajjanamevettha icchitaṃ
analyzed: āvajjetabbāni iti āha paṭhamam vitakkam āvajjayataḥ iti yadi pi āvajjanam eva itthā icchitam
translated: Although only the adverting is intended here,

original: āvajjanavasiyā adhippetattā, āvajjanāya pana uppannāya javanehi bhavitabbaṃ. Tāni
analyzed: āvajjana vasiyāḥ adhippeta ttā āvajjanāya pana uppannāya javanehi bhavitabbam tāni
translated: since mastery in adverting is intended, still the impulsions must occur after the adverting has arisen.

original: ca kho āvajjanatapparatāya cittābhinīhārassa yathāvajjitajhānaṅgārammaṇāni katipayāneva
analyzed: ca kho āvajjana tapparatāya citta abhinīhārassa yathā āvajjita jhāna aṅga ārammaṇāni katipayāni eva
translated: But because of the swiftness of the adverting, only a few impulsions occur, namely, those that have as their object the jhāna factors as given in the definition of the first jhāna, not the complete set of factors.🔽So it is said that “four or five impulsions impel with applied thought and sustained thought as their object.”

original: honti, na paripuṇṇānīti vuttaṃ “vitakkārammaṇāneva cattāri pañca vā javanāni javantī”ti.🔽Cattāri tikkhindriyassa. Pañca nātitikkhindriyassāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Nirantaranti visabhāgehi
analyzed: honti na paripuṇṇāni iti vuttam vitakka ārammaṇāni eva cattāri pañca vā javanāni javanti iti  cattāri tikkhindriyassa pañca na atitikkhindriyassa ati daṭṭhabbam nirantaranti visabhāgehi
translated: Four for one of quick understanding, five for one of not very quick understanding, should be understood.🔽Uninterruptedly: without interruption by dissimilar consciousnesses.

original: nirantaraṃ. Ayaṃ panāti bhavaṅgadvayantaritā catujavanacittā yathāvuttā āvajjanavasī.
analyzed: nirantaram ayam panāti bhavaṅga dvaya antaritā catu javana cittā yathā vuttā āvajjana vasī
translated: This is the adverting that is called “quick” in the sense of swiftness, which is the adverting of the two or three impulsions that have as their object the first jhāna as defined, and which is included in the cognitive series consisting of the two or three impulsions and the registration that follows them, and which is included in the cognitive series consisting of the two or three impulsions that have as their object the first jhāna as defined, and which is included in the cognitive series consisting of the two or three impulsions and the registration that follows them.🔽Or it is the adverting of others such as the General of the Dhamma.

original: Aññesaṃ vā dhammasenāpatiādīnaṃ. Evarūpe kāleti uṭṭhāya samuṭṭhāya lahutaraṃ āvajjanavasīnibbattanakāle.
analyzed: aññesam vā dhamma senāpati ādīnam evarūpe kāle ti uṭṭhāya samuṭṭhāya lahutaram āvajjana vasī nibbattana kāle
translated: Such is the adverting that is called “quick” in the sense of swiftness, which is the adverting of the two or three impulsions that have as their object the first jhāna as defined, and which is included in the cognitive series consisting of the two or three impulsions and the registration that follows them.

original: Sā ca kho ittarā parittakālā, na satthu yamakamahāpāṭihāriye viya ciratarappabandhavatī.
analyzed: sā ca kho ittarā paritta kālā na satthu yamaka mahā pāṭihāriye viya ciratara ppabandhavatī
translated: And that is of short duration, not of long continuity like the Blessed One’s double occurrence of the great primaries in the Twin Miracle.

original: Tathā hi taṃ sāvakehi asādhāraṇaṃ vuttaṃ. Adhigamena samaṃ sasampayuttassa jhānassa
analyzed: tathā hi tam sāvakehi asādhāraṇam vuttam adhigamena samam sa sampayuttassa jhānassa
translated: For that is said not to be shared by disciples.

original: sammā āpajjanaṃ paṭipajjanaṃ samāpajjanaṃ, jhānasamaṅgitā.
analyzed: sammā āpajjanam paṭipajjanam samāpajjanam jhāna samaṅgi tā
translated: The “attainment” is the right attainment, the entering upon, of the jhāna together with its concomitants, which is shared by disciples.

original: Sīghanti ettha samāpajjitukāmatānantaraṃ dvīsu bhavaṅgesu uppannesu bhavaṅgaṃ upacchinditvā
analyzed: ettha samāpajjitu kāma tā anantaram dvīsu bhavaṅgesu uppannesu bhavaṅgam upacchinditvā
translated: Swift is the ability to attain quickly, that is to say, the ability to attain after the two impulsions that arise next to the desire to attain, cutting off the life-continuum,

original: uppannāvajjanānantaraṃ samāpajjanaṃ sīghaṃ samāpajjanasamatthatā. Ayañca matthakappattā
analyzed: uppanna āvajjana anantaram samāpajjanam sīgham samāpajjana samattha tā ayam ca matthaka ppattā
translated: and after the adverting that arises next to that. This ability to attain quickly is found in one who has reached the summit of the fine-material sphere,

original: samāpajjanavasī satthu dhammadesanāyaṃ labbhati. Yaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “so kho ahaṃ,🔽aggivessana, tassā eva kathāya pariyosāne tasmiṃyeva purimasmiṃ samādhinimitte ajjhattameva
analyzed: samāpajjana vasī satthu dhamma desanā ayam labbhati yam sandhāya vuttam saḥ kho aham  aggivessana tassai eva kathāya pariyosāne tasmin yā iva purimasmin samādhi nimitte ajjhattam eva
translated: and it is found in the Blessed One through the teaching of the True Idea. For this is said by the Blessed One:

original: cittaṃ saṇṭhapemi sannisādemi ekodiṃ karomi samādahāmi yenassudaṃ niccakappaṃ viharāmī”ti.🔽Ito sīghatarā hi samāpajjanavasī nāma natthi. Juṇhāya rattiyā navoropitehi kesehi
analyzed: cittam saṇṭhapemi sannisādemi ekodim karomi samādahāmi yena udam nicca kappam viharāmi iti  itas sīghatarā hi samāpajjanavasī nāma natthi juṇhāya rattiyā na voropitehi kesehi
translated: “Then, Aggivessana, at the end of that talk I steadied my mind internally, quieted it, brought it to singleness, and concentrated it on that same sign of concentration as before, and I lived quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unwholesome states” .🔽For there is no ability to attain more quickly than this. When the venerable Sāriputta was living in the Dove-Ledge Cave with his head newly shaven after eight months,

original: kapotakandarāyaṃ viharantassa āyasmato sāriputtassa yakkhena mahantampi pabbatakūṭaṃ
analyzed: kapotakandarāyam viharantassa āyasmataḥ sāriputtassa yakkhena mahantam pi pabbata kūṭam
translated: and a yakkha had raised a huge boulder above the mouth of the cave,

original: padāletuṃ samatthe pahāre sīse dinne samāpajjanampettha nidassetabbaṃ. Tathā hi vakkhati
analyzed: padāletum samatthe pahāre sīse dinne samāpajjanam pa ittha nidassetabbam tathā hi vakkhati
translated: and the attainment of the jhāna should be demonstrated by the blow on the head that was capable of killing him. For it is said:

original: “tadā thero tassa paharaṇasamaye samāpattiṃ appesī”ti. Pāḷiyaṃ pana “aññataraṃ samādhiṃ🔽samāpajjitvā nisinno”ti vuttaṃ. Ime pana therā “samāpattito vuṭṭhānasamakālaṃ tena
analyzed: tadā thero tassa paharaṇa samaye samāpattim appesi iti pāḷiyam pana aññataram samādhim  samāpajjitvā nisinnaḥ ti vuttam ime pana therā samāpattitaḥ vuṭṭhāna sama kālam tena
translated: “At the time of the blow the elder entered upon the attainment.” But in the text it is said:🔽“he sat cross-legged, having entered upon a certain attainment” .

original: pahāro dinno”ti vadanti.🔽Accharāmattanti aṅguliphoṭamattaṃ khaṇaṃ. Ṭhapetunti setu viya sīghasotāya nadiyā
analyzed: pahāraḥ dinnaḥ iti vadanti  aṅguli phoṭa mattam khaṇam setu sīgha sotāya nadiyā
translated: But these elders say that the blow was given at the very moment when he emerged from the attainment.

original: oghaṃ vegena pavattituṃ adatvā yathāvuttakkhaṇaṃ jhānaṃ ṭhapetuṃ samatthatā. Abhibhuyya
analyzed: ogham vegena pavattitum a datvā yathāvutta khaṇam jhānam ṭhapetum samattha tā abhibhuyya
translated: The mere twinkling of an eye: the mere instant of a twinkling. He was able to stay: just as a dam is able to hold back a swift-flowing river’s flood and prevent it from going any further, so too, he was able to stay the jhāna for the stated time and prevent it from vanishing any further.

original: ṭhapanaṃ, adhiṭṭhānaṃ viyāti vā adhiṭṭhānaṃ. Tattha vasī adhiṭṭhānavasī. Tatheva
analyzed: ṭhapanam adhiṭṭhānam viyāti vā adhiṭṭhānam tattha vasī adhiṭṭhāna vasī tathā iva
translated: Staying by controlling: or alternatively, adhiṭṭhāna means “controlling and staying” . Herein, he who has mastery is an adhiṭṭhānavant .

original: lahuṃ vuṭṭhātunti accharāmattaṃ vā dasaccharāmattaṃ vā lahuṃ khaṇaṃ jhānasamaṅgī
analyzed: lahum vuṭṭhātunti accharāmattam vā dasa charāmattam vā lahum khaṇam jhāna samaṅgī
translated: He was able to emerge quickly: he was able to emerge in the mere twinkling of an eye or in the mere instant of a mere ten twinklings of an eye.

original: hutvā jhānato vuṭṭhātuṃ samatthatā. Bhavaṅgacittuppattiyeva hettha jhānato vuṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: hutvā jhānataḥ vuṭṭhātum samattha tā bhavaṅga citta uppattiyā iva ha ittha jhānataḥ vuṭṭhānam
translated: and the ability to emerge from jhāna. Here the emergence from jhāna is the arising of the mind-element belonging to the life-continuum.

original: nāma. Ettha ca yathā “ettakameva khaṇaṃ jhānaṃ ṭhapessāmī”ti pubbaparikammavasena
analyzed: nāma ettha ca yathā ettakam eva khaṇam jhānam ṭhapessāmi iti pubba parikamma vasena
translated: And here the ability to resolve thus, “I shall keep the jhāna going for so long a time,” by means of the prior adverting is the mastery of resolving;

original: adhiṭṭhānasamatthatā adhiṭṭhānavasī, evaṃ “ettakameva khaṇaṃ jhānasamaṅgī hutvā jhānato🔽vuṭṭhahissāmī”ti pubbaparikammavasena vuṭṭhānasamatthatā vuṭṭhānavasī veditabbā,
analyzed: adhiṭṭhāna samattha tā adhiṭṭhāna vasī evam ettakam eva khaṇam jhāna samaṅgī hutvā jhānato  vuṭṭhahissāmi iti pubba parikamma vasena vuṭṭhāna samattha tā vuṭṭhāna vasī veditabbā
translated: and the ability to emerge from the jhāna after keeping it going for that length of time by means of the prior adverting is the mastery of emerging,🔽which is called “skill in emerging.”

original: yā samāpatti “vuṭṭhānakusalatā”ti vuccati. Tadubhayadassanatthanti adhiṭṭhānavuṭṭhānavasīdassanatthaṃ.🔽Tatthāti tasmiṃ nimmitapabbate tassa vivare. Kiñcāpi ekaṃyeva taṃ abhiññācittaṃ yena
analyzed: yā samāpatti vuṭṭhāna kusala tā ti vuccati tad ubhaya dassana ttham ti adhiṭṭhāna vuṭṭhāna vasī dassana ttham  tattha ati tasmin nimmita pabbate tassa vivare kiñca api ekam yā iva tam abhiññā cittam yena
translated: The words “to show both” are to show the mastery of resolving and the mastery of emerging.

original: pabbataṃ nimmineyya, abhiññāpādakassa pana jhānassa lahutaraṃ ṭhapanaṃ, vuṭṭhānañca
analyzed: pabbatam nimmineyya abhiññā pādakassa pana jhānassa lahutaram ṭhapanam vuṭṭhānañca
translated: “There” means in that created mountain in the crevice of which he stood. And although it is the same kind of direct-knowledge consciousness by means of which he creates the mountain and by means of which he enters the jhāna, nevertheless it should be regarded as the lightness of keeping the jhāna in being and the lightness of emerging that are shown here.

original: idha nidassitanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. “Ettakā iddhimantā ekaṃ upaṭṭhākaṃ garuḷato rakkhituṃ
analyzed: idha nidassitanti daṭṭhabbam ettakāḥ iddhimantāḥ ekam upaṭṭhākam garuḷataḥ rakkhitum
translated: “As many as these possessors of supernormal power”

original: na sakkhiṃsū”ti gārayhā assāma.
analyzed: na sakkhiṃsūti gārayhāḥ assāma
translated: and they were unable to do so.

original: Āvajjanānantarānīti āvajjanavasībhāvāya yathākkamaṃ vitakkādīnaṃ jhānaṅgānaṃ āvajjanāya
analyzed: āvajjana anantarāni iti āvajjana vasībhāvāya yathākkamam vitakka ādīnam āvajjanāya
translated: The words next to the adverting are the words adverting to the jhāna factors of thinking, etc., in due succession for the purpose of mastering them.

original: parato yāni javanāni pavattāni, tāni tesaṃ paccavekkhaṇāni. Yadaggena āvajjanavasīsiddhi,
analyzed: paratas yāni javanāni pavattāni tāni tesam paccavekkhaṇāni yat aggena
translated: The impulsions that occur subsequently to that are the reviewing of those factors.

original: tadaggena paccavekkhaṇāvasīsiddhi veditabbā.🔽Dutiyajjhānakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: tad aggena paccavekkhaṇā vasī siddhi veditabbā  dutiya jhāna kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: And the success in adverting should be understood to be parallel to the success in reviewing.🔽The second jhāna🔽The first jhāna is called “with applied thought and sustained thought” because it is accompanied by the two kinds of applied thought and sustained thought described in the way beginning, “At that time applied thought and sustained thought occur in him internally as consciousness-concomitants” .🔽The second jhāna is called “without applied thought and without sustained thought” because it is not accompanied by the two kinds of applied thought and sustained thought described as “rough” and “subtle” .🔽The words “having abandoned pleasure” are a term for equanimity.

original: 79. Nīvaraṇappahānassa tappaṭhamatāya āsannanīvaraṇapaccatthikā. Thūlaṃ nāma vipulampi
analyzed: nīvaraṇa ppahānassa tad paṭhama tāya āsanna nīvaraṇa paccatthikā thūlam nāma vipulam pi
translated: The words “having abandoned pain” are a term for the disappearance of grief.🔽The words “having abandoned pleasure and pain” are a term for the disappearance of happiness and grief.

original: pheggu viya sukhabhañjanīyanti āha “oḷārikattā aṅgadubbalā”ti. Santato manasi karitvāti
analyzed: āha sukha bhañjanīyanti āha santataḥ manasi karitvā iti
translated: The words “having abandoned and gone beyond the former gladness and sadness” are a term for the disappearance of gladness and sadness.🔽The words “purified of defilements” are a term for the disappearance of the defilements of agitation and stiffness.🔽The words “having gained the fourth jhāna” are a term for the attainment of the fourth jhāna.🔽The words “neither painful nor pleasant” are a term for equanimity.

original: paṭhamajjhānaṃ viya anoḷārikaṅgattā, santadhammasamaṅgitāya ca “santa”nti manasi
analyzed: paṭhama jhānam viya anoḷārikaṅga ttā santa dhamma samaṅgi tāya ca santanti manasi
translated: The words “purified” are a term for the disappearance of the defilements of agitation and stiffness.🔽The words “having gained the fourth jhāna” are a term for the attainment of the fourth jhāna.

original: katvā. Ye hi dhammā dutiyajjhāne pītisukhādayo, kāmaṃ te paṭhamajjhānepi santi, tehi
analyzed: katvā ye hi dhammā dutiya jhāne pīti sukha ādayaḥ kāmam te paṭhama jhāne pi santi tehi
translated: The words “neither painful nor pleasant” are a term for equanimity.

original: pana te santatarā ceva paṇītatarā ca bhavantīti. Nikantinti nikāmanaṃ, apekkhanti
analyzed: pana te santatarā ca iva paṇītatarā ca bhavanti iti nikantinti nikāmanam apekkhanti
translated: but they are more peaceful and sublime.🔽Nikanti means inclination, expectation.

original: attho. Pariyādāyāti khepetvā. Cattāri pañcāti vā-saddo luttaniddiṭṭho. Dutiyajjhānaṃ
analyzed: pariyādāya ati khepetvā cattāri pañca ati vā saddaḥ lutta niddiṭṭhaḥ dutiya jhānam
translated: Pariyādiyati means to exhaust. The word vā means or.🔽The second jhāna has that, thus it is called “second-jhāna.”

original: etassa atthīti dutiyajjhānikaṃ. Vuttappakārānevāti paṭhamajjhāne vuttappakārāniyeva,🔽parikammādināmakānīti attho.
analyzed: etassa atthi iti dutiya jhānikam vutta ppakāra ānā iva ati paṭhama jhāne  parikamma ādi nāmakāni iti attho
translated: The kinds of jhāna are the same as those stated for the first jhāna,🔽the meaning of which is that the kinds of preliminary-work jhāna, etc., are the same.

original: 80. Vūpasamāti vūpasamahetu, vūpasamoti cettha pahānaṃ adhippetaṃ, tañca vitakkavicārānaṃ.
analyzed: vūpasamā ati vūpasama hetu vūpasamaḥ ti ca ittha pahānam adhippetam tat ca
translated: Tranquillization is the cause of tranquillization. Herein, abandoning is intended by “tranquillization,” and that is the surmounting of applied and sustained thought.

original: Atikkamo atthato dutiyajjhānakkhaṇe anuppādoti āha “samatikkamā”tiādi. Katamesaṃ
analyzed: atikkamaḥ atthataḥ dutiya jhāna kkhaṇe anuppādaḥ ti āha samatikkama atiādi katamesam
translated: The meaning is that they do not arise at the moment of the second jhāna.

original: panettha vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamo adhippeto, kiṃ paṭhamajjhānikānaṃ, udāhu dutiyajjhānikānanti.
analyzed: pana ittha vitakka vicārānam vūpasamaḥ adhippeto kim paṭhama jhānikānam udāhu dutiya jhānikānam ti
translated: Now, which of the applied and sustained thoughts here is intended by “tranquillization”? Are those of the first jhāna or those of the second jhāna?🔽And what if they are those of the first jhāna? There is no tranquillization of them,

original: Kiñcettha yadi paṭhamajjhānikānaṃ, natthi tesaṃ vūpasamo. Na hi kadāci paṭhamajjhānaṃ
analyzed: kiñca ittha yadi paṭhamajjhānikānam na atthi tesam vūpasamaḥ na hi kadāci paṭhamajjhānam
translated: for the first jhāna is never without applied and sustained thought.

original: vitakkavicārarahitaṃ atthi. Atha dutiyajjhānikānaṃ, evampi nattheva vūpasamo, sabbena🔽sabbaṃ tesaṃ tattha abhāvatoti? Vuccate – yehi vitakkavicārehi paṭhamajjhānassa oḷārikatā,
analyzed: vitakka vicāra rahitam atthi atha dutiya jhānikānam evam pi nattha iva vūpasamaḥ sabbena  sabbam tesam tattha abhāvato ti vuccate yehi vitakka vicārehi paṭhamajjhānassa oḷārika tā
translated: there is no such quieting of applied and sustained thought in the second jhāna, and so on.🔽But in that case there is no quieting of applied and sustained thought in the first jhāna either, since there is no complete absence of grossness in it.

original: tesaṃ samatikkamā dutiyassa jhānassa samadhigamo, na sabhāvato anoḷārikānaṃ phassādīnaṃ
analyzed: tesam samatikkamā dutiyassa jhānassa samadhigamaḥ na sabhāvataḥ anoḷārikānam phassa ādīnam
translated: The meaning intended is this: the second jhāna is reached by surmounting the grossness of applied and sustained thought, not by surmounting the grossness of contact, etc., which is not entirely absent from it.

original: samatikkamāti ayamattho “vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā”ti etena dīpito. Tasmā “kiṃ paṭhamajjhānikānaṃ🔽vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamo idhādhippeto, udāhu dutiyajjhānikāna”nti edisī codanā anokāsāva.
analyzed: samatikkamā ti ayam atthaḥ vitakka vicārānam vūpasamā iti etena dīpitaḥ tasmā kim paṭhama jhānikānam  vitakka vicārānam vūpasamaḥ idha adhippetaḥ udāhu dutiya jhānikānam ti edisī codanā
translated: So the question, “Is the quieting of applied and sustained thought intended here as in the first jhāna or not? ” is wrongly put.

original: Yasmā diṭṭhādīnavassa taṃtaṃjhānakkhaṇe anuppattidhammatāpādanaṃ vūpasamanaṃ adhippetaṃ.
analyzed: yasmā diṭṭha ādīnavassa taṃ taṃ jhāna kkhaṇe anuppatti dhamma tā āpādanam vūpasamanaṃ adhippetam
translated: For what is intended is the quieting of the appearance of grossness in the first jhāna, etc., which is due to applied and sustained thought, etc.

original: Vitakkādayo eva jhānaṅgabhūtā tathā karīyanti, na taṃsampayuttā phassādayo, tasmā
analyzed: vitakka ādayaḥ eva tathā na phassa ādayaḥ
translated: It is only the applied thought, etc., that are the factors of the jhāna that are so quieted, not the contact, etc., associated with them.

original: vitakkādīnaṃyeva vūpasamādivacanaṃ ñāyāgataṃ. Yasmā pana vitakkādīnaṃ viya taṃsampayuttadhammānampi🔽etena “etaṃ oḷārika”nti ādīnavadassanaṃ sutte āgataṃ, tasmā avisesena vitakkādīnaṃ,
analyzed: vitakka ādīnam yeva vūpasama ādi vacanam ñāya āgatam pana vitakka ādīnam viya  etena etam oḷārikam ti ādīnava dassanam sutte āgatam tasmai avisesena vitakka ādīnam
translated: The words “the stilling of applied and sustained thought” are appropriate only for applied and sustained thought. But since the words “the fading away of lust,” etc.,🔽are found in the sutta in the way already stated, the words “the stilling of applied and sustained thought” are said without making any distinction,🔽and so they imply a certain distinction.🔽The words “the stilling of applied and sustained thought” are said to imply some meaning other than that of the mere stilling of applied and sustained thought.

original: taṃsahagatānañca vūpasamādike vattabbe vitakkādīnaṃyeva vūpasamo vuccamāno adhikavacanaṃ🔽aññaṃ atthaṃ bodhetīti katvā kiñci visesaṃ dīpetīti dassetuṃ aṭṭhakathāyaṃ “oḷārikassa🔽panā”tiādi gahitanti idha “yehi vitakkavicārehī”tiādi vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. “Pītiyā
analyzed: tad sahagatānam ca vūpasama ādike vattabbe vitakka ādīnam yeva vūpasamaḥ vuccamānaḥ adhika vacanam  aññam attham bodheti iti katvā kiñci visesam dīpeti iti dassetum aṭṭhakathāyam oḷārikassa  pana atiādi gahitanti idha yehi vitakka vicārehi itiādi vuttanti daṭṭhabbam pītiyā
translated: The commentary takes the words “the stilling of applied and sustained thought” as implying the surmounting of the gross factor, etc.,🔽and so it is said here that the words “with the stilling of applied and sustained thought” imply a certain distinction.🔽The same method of explanation applies to the words “with the fading away of happiness” and so on.

original: ca virāgā”tiādīsupi eseva nayo. Tasmā vitakkavicārapītisukhasamatikkamavacanāni oḷārikoḷārikaṅgasamatikkamā
analyzed: ca virāga ati ādīsu pi esa iva nayaḥ tasmā vitakka vicāra pīti sukha samatikkama vacanāni oḷārika uḷārika aṅga samatikkamā
translated: Therefore the words “with the surmounting of happiness and sorrow” imply the surmounting of the gross factor, etc.,🔽and so they show the attainment of the second jhāna, etc., respectively.

original: dutiyādiadhigamadīpakānīti tesaṃ ekadesabhūtaṃ vitakkavicārasamatikkamavacanaṃ taṃdīpakaṃ
analyzed: dutiya ādi adhigama dīpakāni iti tesam eka desa bhūtam vitakka vicāra sama tikkama vacanam tat dīpakam
translated: The words “with the fading away of happiness” imply the surmounting of the fine factor, etc.,

original: vuttaṃ. Visuṃ visuṃ ṭhitepi hi vitakkavicārasamatikkamavacanādike paheyyaṅganiddesatāsāmaññena🔽cittena samūhato gahite vitakkavicāravūpasamavacanassa tadekadesatā daṭṭhabbā. Ayañca
analyzed: vuttam visum visum ṭhite api hi vitakka vicāra sama tikkama vacana ādike  cittena samūhataḥ gahite vitakka vicāra vūpasama vacanassa tad eka desa tā daṭṭhabbā ayam ca
translated: It is said. For although applied thought and sustained thought are mentioned separately, still the expression of the surmounting of applied thought and sustained thought should be regarded as a part of the expression of the surmounting of the hindrances, since the latter is the principal surmounting.

original: attho avayavena samudāyopalakkhaṇanayena vutto. Atha vā vitakkavicāravūpasamavacaneneva
analyzed: atthaḥ avayavena samudāya upalakkhaṇa nayena vuttaḥ atha vā vitakka vicāra vūpasama vacanena iva
translated: And this meaning is stated by the method of characterizing the whole by a part.

original: taṃsamatikkamā dutiyādhigamadīpakena pītivirāgādivacanānaṃ pītiādisamatikkamā tatiyādiadhigamadīpakatā
analyzed: tad samatikkamā dutiya adhigama dīpakena pīti virāga ādi vacanānam pīti ādi samatikkamā tatiya ādi adhigama dīpaka tā
translated: Or alternatively, by the expression of the surmounting of applied thought and sustained thought, which indicates the attainment of the second jhāna by surmounting them, the expression of the surmounting of happiness, etc., which indicates the attainment of the third, etc., is illustrated.

original: dīpitā hotīti tassa taṃdīpakatā vuttā.
analyzed: dīpitā hoti iti tassa taṃ dīpaka tā vuttā
translated: So the expression of the latter is stated by the former.

original: Niyakajjhattamadhippetaṃ na ajjhattajjhattādi. Tattha kāraṇamāha “vibhaṅge panā”tiādi.
analyzed: niyaka jjhattam adhippetam na ajjhatta ajjhatta ādi tattha kāraṇam āha vibhaṅge pana atiādi
translated: It is intended as “in oneself” in the sense of “one’s own” , not in the sense of “internal” , etc. The reason for this is given in the Vibhaṅga, which is quoted in the Paṭisambhidā with the words: “Herein, what is the first jhāna? It is the internal … of applied thought and sustained thought” , and so on.

original: Nīlavaṇṇayogato nīlavatthaṃ viyāti nīlayogato vatthaṃ nīlaṃ viyāti adhippāyo. Yena
analyzed: nīla vaṇṇa yogataḥ nīla vattham viyāti nīla yogataḥ vattham nīlam viyāti adhippāyaḥ yena
translated: The meaning of the words “in oneself” is this. Just as the cloth is called “blue” because of the combination with the blue colour, so too the jhāna is called “in oneself” because of the combination with the “one’s own” .🔽The meaning intended is this: “Just as the cloth is called ‘blue’ because of the combination with the blue colour, so too the jhāna is called ‘in oneself’ because of the combination with the ‘one’s own’ . ”

original: sampasādanena yogā jhānaṃ sampasādanaṃ. Tasmiṃ dassite “sampasādanaṃ jhāna”nti samānādhikaraṇaniddeseneva
analyzed: sampasādanena yogāḥ jhānam sampasādanam tasmin dassite sampasādanam jhānanti samāna adhikaraṇa niddesena iva
translated: By the confidence in which the jhāna is combined, the jhāna is called confidence-producing. When that is shown, the expression “confidence-producing jhāna” is a mere designation of the same way of expression as “confidence-producing” .

original: taṃyogā jhāne taṃsaddappavatti dassitāti avirodho yutto. Ekodibhāve kathanti ekodimhi
analyzed: tad yogā jhāne tad sadda pavatti dassitā ati avirodhaḥ yuttaḥ eka udi bhāve kathanti eka udimhi
translated: So there is no contradiction, and it is proper to take it thus.

original: dassite ekodibhāvaṃ jhānanti samānādhikaraṇaniddeseneva jhānassa ekodivaḍḍhanatā
analyzed: dassite ekodi bhāvam jhānanti samāna adhikaraṇa niddesena iva jhānassa ekodi vaḍḍhana tā
translated: If it be said that in the phrase “in the unification” the word “jhāna” is mentioned by a construction with a common base,🔽and so it is said that the unification is the increase of jhāna,

original: vuttā hotīti ce? “Ekodibhāva”nti padaṃ uddharitvā ekodissa niddeso na kātabbo siyāti
