translated: Still, since they are given in the text, they should be regarded as stated in the description of the recollection of the Buddha.🔽This discussion will come up again later.🔽The phrase “and the rest of the text” includes the supramundane Dhamma.

original: 147. Pariyattidhammopīti pi-saddena lokuttaradhammaṃ sampiṇḍeti. Itaresūti sandiṭṭhikādipadesu.
analyzed: pariyatti dhammaḥ api iti pi saddena lokuttara dhammam sampiṇḍeti itaresu iti sandiṭṭhika ādi padesu
translated: The rest are the phrases “visible here and now,” etc.

original: Lokuttaradhammovāti avadhāraṇaṃ nippariyāyena sandiṭṭhikādiatthaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ,
analyzed: lokuttara dhamma uvā ti avadhāraṇam nippariyāyena sandiṭṭhika ādi attham sandhāya vuttam
translated: The specification “only” is stated with reference to the meaning of “visible here and now,” etc., in the ultimate sense.

original: pariyāyato panete pariyattidhammepi sambhavanteva. Tathā hi pariyattidhammo bahussutena
analyzed: pariyāyato pana ete pariyatti dhamme api sambhavantā iva tathā hi pariyatti dhammaḥ bahussutena
translated: But they are also tenable in the sense of the Dhamma of the scriptures. For the Dhamma of the scriptures can be seen by one who is learned,

original: āgatāgamena paramena satinepakkena samannāgatena paññavatā ādikalyāṇatādivisesato
analyzed: āgata āgamena paramena sati nepakkena samannāgatena paññavatā ādi kalyāṇa tā ādi visesato
translated: who has mastered the scriptures, who possesses the highest mindfulness and full awareness, and who is wise, by means of the special qualities of being good in the beginning, etc.,

original: sayaṃ daṭṭhabboti sandiṭṭhiko. Ācariyapayirupāsanāya vinā na labbhāti ce? Lokuttaradhammepi
analyzed: sayam daṭṭhabbo ti sandiṭṭhikaḥ ācariya payirupāsanāya vinā na ce lokuttara dhamme pi
translated: and so it is “to be seen here and now.” If it be said that it cannot be seen without the attendance on teachers,

original: samāne kalyāṇamittasannissayeneva sijjhanato, tathā satthusandassanepi. “Sandiṭṭhiyā🔽jayatī”ti ayaṃ panattho titthiyanimmaddane nippariyāyatova labbhati, kilesajaye pariyāyato
analyzed: samāne kalyāṇa mitta sannissayena iva sijjhanato tathā satthu sandassane pi sandiṭṭhiyā  jayati iti ayam pana attho titthiya nimmaddane nippariyāyataḥ uva labbhati kilesa jaye pariyāyataḥ
translated: then the supramundane Dhamma too cannot be seen by one who has not the support of a good friend,🔽and so too the appearance of the Master. But the meaning of “conquest by what is seen here and now” is tenable only in the sense of the destruction of the teachers of other sects,🔽and in the sense of the conquest of defilements in the sense of the indirect cause.

original: paramparāhetubhāvato. “Sandiṭṭhaṃ arahatī”ti ayampi attho labbhateva, sabbaso saṃkilesadhammānaṃ
analyzed: paramparā hetu bhāvataḥ sandiṭṭham arahati iti ayam pi atthaḥ labbhate iva sabbaso saṃkilesa dhammānam
translated: And the meaning of “worthy to be seen here and now” is also tenable, since it occurs with reference to the abandoning of all defiling things

original: pahānaṃ, vodānadhammānaṃ paribrūhanañca uddissa pavattattā. Ayañca attho “ye kho
analyzed: pahānam vodāna dhammānam paribrūhanañca uddissa pavatta ttā ayañca atthaḥ ye kho
translated: and the development of purified things. And this meaning is also tenable in the sense of “those who are seen here and now are worthy of gifts, etc.”

original: tvaṃ, gotami, dhamme jāneyyāsi, ime dhammā sarāgāya saṃvattanti no virāgāya, saññogāya🔽saṃvattanti no visaññogāya, saupādānāya saṃvattanti no anupādānāya. Ekaṃsena, gotami,🔽dhāreyyāsi ‘neso dhammo, neso vinayo, netaṃ satthusāsana”’nti, “dhammāpi vo, bhikkhave,🔽pahātabbā, pageva adhammā”ti ca evamādīhi suttapadehi vibhāvetabbo. Akālikādhigamupāyatāya🔽akāliko. Vijjamānatāparisuddhatāhi ehipassavidhiṃ arahatīti ehipassiko. Tato eva
analyzed: tvam gotami dhamme jāneyyāsi ime dhammā sa rāgāya saṃvattanti no virāgāya saññogāya  saṃvattanti no visaññogāya sa aupādānāya saṃvattanti no anupādānāya ekaṃsena gotami  dhāreyyāsi na isaḥ dhammaḥ na isaḥ vinayaḥ na itam satthu sāsanan ti dhammā api vaḥ bhikkhave  pahātabbā pagā iva adhammā ti ca evamādīhi sutta padehi vibhāvetabbaḥ akālika adhigama upāya tāya  akālikaḥ vijjamāna tā parisuddha tāhi ehipassa vidhim arahati iti ehipassikaḥ tatas eva
translated: You, Gotami, should know about the Dhamma: these things lead to passion, not to dispassion, they lead to bondage, not to the absence of bondage, they lead to the acquisition of things, not to the absence of acquisition. You should definitely remember, Gotami,🔽that this is not the Dhamma, this is not the Discipline, this is not the Teacher’s instruction.’ And by such suttas as ‘The Dhamma should be abandoned, how much more so what is not Dhamma’ it should be made clear that it is timely.🔽It is timely because it is the means of attaining what is timeless.🔽It is inviting because it is pure in being, and so it is worthy of the method of ‘Come and see’. And because of that it is

original: vaṭṭadukkhanittharaṇatthikehi attano citte upanayanaṃ, cittassa vā tattha upanayanaṃ🔽arahatīti opaneyyiko. Vimuttāyatanasīse ṭhatvā paricayena sammadeva atthavedaṃ, dhammavedañca🔽labhantehi paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhīti. Evaṃ sandiṭṭhikādipadesu pariyattidhammampi
analyzed: vaṭṭa dukkha nittharaṇa atthikehi attanaḥ citte upanayanam cittassa vā tattha upanayanam 🔽arahati iti opaneyyikaḥ vimutta āyatana sīse ṭhatvā paricayena sammadeva attha vedam dhamma vedam ca 🔽labhantehi paccattam veditabbaḥ viññūhi iti evam sandiṭṭhika ādi padesu pariyatti dhammam pi
translated: You, Gotami, should know whether these things lead to passion or to passionlessness, to bondage or to freedom from bondage, to grasping or to non-grasping. You should remember them as ‘This is not Dhamma, this is not Discipline, this is not the Teacher’s Dispensation’ ” . And it should be demonstrated by such suttas as this: “Ideas, bhikkhus, should be abandoned, how much more so bad ideas” . It is timely because it is the means of attaining the deathless . It is inviting because it is purified in actuality and so it is fit for the invitation to come and see . It is leading because it is fit to lead those who want to cross the round of rebirths to the state of their own minds or to lead their minds to that state . It is to be experienced by the wise for themselves because those who stand at the head of the liberation-door and have discovered the meaning of the True Idea and the meaning of the good in the True Idea by acquaintance can experience it for themselves . So the scriptures should be understood in this way in the case of the words “to be seen here and now” , etc.

original: pakkhipitvā manasikāro yujjateva.
analyzed: pakkhipitvā manasikāraḥ yujjatā iva
translated: and it is proper to direct attention to it as included in the verse.

original: Sāti gāthā. Samantabhadrakattāti sabbabhāgehi sundarattā. Dhammassāti sāsanadhammassa.
analyzed: sā ati gāthā samanta bhadraka ttā ati sabba bhāgehi sundara ttā dhammassa ati sāsana dhammassa
translated: The verse: “Samantabhadra-composed, the Dhamma’s, well-proclaimed” : it is “beautiful in all ways” .

original: Kiñcāpi avayavavinimutto samudāyo nāma paramatthato koci natthi, yesu pana avayavesu
analyzed: kiñca api avayava vinimutto samudāyaḥ nāma paramatthato koci natthi yesu pana avayavesu
translated: Although there is no such thing as a collection apart from the components,

original: samudāyarūpena avekkhitesu “gāthā”ti samaññā, taṃ tato bhinnaṃ viya katvā saṃsāmivohāraṃ🔽āropetvā dassento “paṭhamena pādena ādikalyāṇā”tiādimāha. “Ekānusandhika”nti idaṃ🔽nātibahuvibhāgaṃ yathānusandhinā ekānusandhikaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ, itarassa pana teneva
analyzed: samudāya rūpena avekkhitesu gāthā ati samaññā tam tatas bhinnam viya katvā saṃsāmi vohāram  āropetvā dassento paṭhamena pādena ādi kalyāṇa ati ādim āha eka anusandhikanti idam  na ati bahu vibhāgam yathā anusandhinā eka anusandhikam sandhāya vuttam itarassa pana tena iva
translated: when the components are regarded as the collection, the concept “verse” is formed in regard to them. He therefore makes the conventional expression “verse” stand as if it were a separate entity,🔽and he shows it thus with the words “Well-proclaimed in the first place” .🔽“With a single consequence” : this is said with reference to the kind that has a single consequence in the way stated, not having many divisions. But the other kind has a beginning, middle, and end by virtue of the divisions of the teaching that should be taught in it.

original: desetabbadhammavibhāgena ādimajjhapariyosānabhāgā labbhantīti. Nidānenāti kāladesadesakaparisādiapadisanalakkhaṇena
analyzed: desetabba dhamma vibhāgena ādi majjha pariyosāna bhāgāḥ labbhanti iti nidānena ati kāla desa desaka parisā ādi apadisana lakkhaṇena
translated: “In the introduction” : by means of the introduction passage, which is characterized by the indication of the time, place, company, etc.

original: nidānaganthena. Nigamanenāti “idamavocā”tiādikena, “iti yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ, idametaṃ
analyzed: nidāna ganthena nigamanena ati idam avoca ati ādikena iti yam tam vuttam idam etam
translated: “In the conclusion” : by means of the words “Thus spoke the Exalted One” , etc., and by means of the words “This is what the Exalted One said” , etc.

original: paṭicca vutta”nti vā yathāvuttatthanigamanena.🔽Ayaṃ kathā visesato suttapiṭakasaṃvaṇṇanāti katvā suttapiṭakavasena dhammassa ādikalyāṇādikaṃ
analyzed: paṭicca vuttanti vā yathā vutta ttha nigamanena  ayam kathā visesataḥ sutta piṭaka saṃvaṇṇanā ti katvā sutta piṭaka vasena dhammassa ādi kalyāṇa ādikam
translated: Or else it is “in the way stated” by the way in which the meaning is stated in the text.🔽This is the teaching of the Dhamma’s goodness in the beginning, etc.,🔽by way of the Sutta Pitaka.

original: dassetvā idāni suttapiṭakavinayapiṭakānaṃ vasena taṃ dassetuṃ “sanidānasauppattikattā”tiādi
analyzed: dassetvā idāni sutta piṭaka vinaya piṭakānam vasena tam dassetum sa nidāna sauppattika ttā atiādi
translated: Having shown the Dhamma’s goodness in the beginning, etc., by way of the Sutta Pitaka, he now shows it by way of the Sutta Pitaka and the Vinaya Pitaka with the words “because it has a basis and an origin,” etc.

original: vuttaṃ. Tattha sanidānasauppattikattāti yathāvuttanidānena sanidānatāya, saaṭṭhuppattikatāya🔽ca. Veneyyānaṃ anurūpatoti sikkhāpadapaññattiyā, dhammadesanāya ca taṃtaṃsikkhāpadabhāvena
analyzed: vuttam tattha sa nidāna sauppattika ttā ti yathā vutta nidānena sa nidāna tāya sa aṭṭhuppattika tāya  ca veneyyānam anurūpato ti sikkhāpada paññattiyā dhamma desanāya ca tad tad sikkhāpada bhāvena
translated: Herein, because it has a basis and an origin means because it has a basis in the way stated and because it has an origin in the way stated.

original: paññāpiyamānassa veneyyajjhāsayānurūpaṃ pavattiyamānassa anurūpato. Atthassāti desiyamānassa🔽ca sīlādiatthassa. “Taṃ kissa hetu ? Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave”tiādinā tattha tattha
analyzed: paññāpiyamānassa veneyya ajjhāsayā anurūpam pavattiyamānassa anurūpatas atthassa ati desiyamānassa  ca sīla ādi atthassa tam kissa hetu seyyathā api bhikkhave iti ādinā tattha tattha
translated: Because it is in conformity with the dispositions of those requiring training means because it occurs in conformity with the dispositions of those requiring training who are being trained by the promulgation of the training rules and by the teaching of the Dhamma, in the sense of the various training rules being promulgated.🔽Because of the meaning means because of the meaning of virtue, etc., that is being taught.

original: hetūpamāgahaṇena hetudāharaṇayuttato.
analyzed: hetu upamā gahaṇena hetu dāharaṇa yuttataḥ
translated: “And why? It is, bhikkhus, just as if” , etc., are the similes and examples given there and there as the reason.

original: Evaṃ suttavinayavasena pariyattidhammassa ādimajjhapariyosānakalyāṇataṃ dassetvā idāni tīṇi piṭakāni ekajjhaṃ gahetvā taṃ dassetuṃ “sakalopī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha sāsanadhammoti –
analyzed: evam sutta vinaya vasena pariyatti dhammassa ādi majjha pariyosāna kalyāṇa tam dassetvā idāni tīṇi piṭakāni ekajjham gahetvā tam dassetum sakala upi itiādi vuttam tattha sāsana dhammo ti
translated: Having thus shown the goodness of the beginning, middle, and end of the Dhamma of the scriptures by way of the Sutta and Vinaya Pitakas, he now said “The entire Dispensation” in order to show it by taking the three Piṭakas together. Herein, the Dhamma of the Dispensation is that stated thus:🔽“Abstinence from all evil,

original: “Sabbapāpassa akaraṇaṃ, kusalassa upasampadā;
analyzed: sabba pāpassa akaraṇam kusalassa upasampadā
translated: Accomplishment of all good,🔽And the purification of one’s own mind:

original: Sacittapariyodapanaṃ, etaṃ buddhāna sāsana”nti. –🔽Evaṃ vuttassa satthusāsanassa pakāsako pariyattidhammo. Sīlena ādikalyāṇo sīlamūlakattā
analyzed: sa citta pariyodapanam etam buddhāna  evam vuttassa satthu sāsanassa pakāsakaḥ pariyatti dhammo sīlena ādi kalyāṇo sīla mūla kattā
translated: This is the teaching of the Buddhas” .🔽The Dhamma of the scriptures is the illuminator of the Dispensation of the Master stated thus. It is good in the beginning with virtue,🔽because virtue is the root of the Dispensation. It is good in the middle with serenity, etc.,

original: sāsanassa. Samathādīhi majjhekalyāṇo tesaṃ sāsanasampattiyā vemajjhabhāvato. Nibbānena
analyzed: sāsanassa samatha ādīhi majjhe kalyāṇaḥ tesam sāsana sampattiyāḥ vemajjha bhāvataḥ nibbānena
translated: because serenity, etc., are the middle of the Dispensation since they are the success of the Dispensation. It is good in the end with extinction,

original: pariyosānakalyāṇo tadadhigamato uttarikaraṇīyābhāvato. Sāsane sammāpaṭipatti nāma
analyzed: pariyosāna kalyāṇaḥ tad adhigamataḥ uttari karaṇīya abhāvataḥ sāsane sammāpaṭipatti nāma
translated: because there is nothing further to be done after the attainment of that. Right practice in the Dispensation is

original: paññāya hoti, tassā ca sīlaṃ, samādhi ca mūlanti āha “sīlasamādhīhi ādikalyāṇo”ti.
analyzed: paññāya hoti tassā ca sīlam samādhi ca mūlanti āha sīla samādhīhi ādi kalyāṇaḥ ti
translated: understanding. And virtue and concentration are the root of that. So he said “Good in the beginning with virtue and concentration.”

original: Paññā pana anubodhapaṭivedhavasena duvidhāti tadubhayampi gaṇhanto “vipassanāmaggehi
analyzed: paññā pana anubodha paṭivedha vasena duvidhā ti tat ubhayam pi gaṇhantaḥ vipassanā maggehi
translated: But understanding is twofold as understanding that penetrates the known and as understanding that penetrates the penetrable. So taking both he said “With insight and the path” .

original: majjhekalyāṇo”ti āha. Tassa nipphatti phalaṃ, kiccaṃ nibbānasacchikiriyā, tato paraṃ🔽kattabbaṃ natthīti dassento āha “phalanibbānehi pariyosānakalyāṇo”ti. Phalaggahaṇena🔽vā saupādisesanibbānamāha, itarena itaraṃ, tadubhayañca sāsanasampattiyā osānanti
analyzed: majjhekalyāṇo ti āha tassa nipphatti phalam kiccam nibbāna sacchikiriyā tato param  kattabbam na atthi iti dassentaḥ āha phala nibbānehi pariyosāna kalyāṇaḥ ti phala ggahaṇena  vā sa aupādisesa nibbānam āha itarena itaram tat ubhayam ca sāsana sampattiyā osānanti
translated: and good in the middle. Its fruit is the fruition attainment, and its function is the realization of Nibbāna. Showing that there is nothing further to be done after that, he said, “It is good in that it has a culmination in the fruit and Nibbāna.” Or alternatively, by the mention of the fruit he refers to the Nibbāna element with a residue of clinging left, and by the mention of Nibbāna he refers to the Nibbāna element without residue of clinging left. And both together are the culmination of the prosperity of the dispensation.

original: āha “phalanibbānehi pariyosānakalyāṇo”ti.🔽Buddhassa subodhitā sammāsambuddhatā, tāya ādikalyāṇo tappabhavattā. Sabbaso saṃkilesappahānaṃ🔽vodānaṃ, pāripūrī ca dhammasudhammatā, tāya majjhekalyāṇo taṃsarīrattā. Satthārā🔽yathānusiṭṭhaṃ tathā paṭipatti saṅghasuppaṭipatti, tāya pariyosānakalyāṇo, tāya sāsanassa
analyzed: āha phala nibbānehi pariyosāna kalyāṇaḥ ti  buddhassa su bodhi tā sammāsambuddha tā tāya ādi kalyāṇaḥ tad pabhava ttā sabbaso saṃkilesa ppahānam  vodānam pāripūrī ca dhamma su dhamma tā tāya majjhekalyāṇaḥ satthārā  yathā anusiṭṭham tathā paṭipatti saṅgha suppaṭipatti tāya pariyosāna kalyāṇo tāya sāsanassa
translated: and it is good in the middle. Its fruit is the fruition attainment. Its function is the realization of Nibbāna. And after that there is nothing more to be done. Showing this, he said, “It is good in the end because of the fruit and Nibbāna.” Or alternatively, by the mention of the fruit he refers to the Nibbāna element with a residue of clinging left, and by the mention of Nibbāna he refers to the Nibbāna element without a residue of clinging left. And both of these are the culmination of the prosperity of the dispensation. Showing this, he said, “It is good in the end because of the fruit and Nibbāna.”🔽The perfect enlightenment of the Buddha is well proclaimed. It is good in the beginning because it is the source of that. The purification by knowledge and vision of the way leading to the cessation of suffering is the outcome of that. It is good in the middle because it is the essence of that. The practice of the way leading to the cessation of suffering as taught by the Master is the practice of the good men. It is good in the end because it is the basis for the establishment of the dispensation in the world.

original: loke suppatiṭṭhitabhāvato. Tanti sāsanadhammaṃ. Tathattāyāti yathattāya bhagavatā
analyzed: loke suppatiṭṭhita bhāvato sāsana dhammam tathattāya ati yathattāya bhagavatā
translated: The Dhamma of the dispensation. In that way. In the way in which it was taught by the Blessed One.

original: dhammo desito, tathattāya tathabhāvāya. So pana abhisambodhi paccekabodhi sāvakabodhīti
analyzed: dhammo desito tathattāya tathabhāvāya so pana abhisambodhi pacceka bodhi sāvaka bodhi iti
translated: The Dhamma is taught for the realization of that, for the attainment of that. But that is the supreme enlightenment, the individual enlightenment, the enlightenment of the disciples.

original: tividho, ito aññathā nibbānādhigamassa abhāvato. Tattha sabbaguṇehi aggabhāvato,
analyzed: tividhaḥ itas aññathā nibbāna adhigamassa abhāvataḥ tattha sabba guṇehi aggabhāvato
translated: The Dhamma is taught for the purpose of realizing and attaining that. But that is threefold as the supreme enlightenment, the individual enlightenment, and the disciple’s enlightenment,

original: itarabodhidvayamūlatāya ca paṭhamāya bodhiyā ādikalyāṇatā, guṇehi vemajjhabhāvato🔽dutiyāya majjhekalyāṇatā, tadubhayāvaratāya, tadosānatāya ca sāsanadhammassa tatiyāya
analyzed: itara bodhi dvaya mūla tāya ca paṭhamāya bodhiyā ādi kalyāṇa tā guṇehi vemajjha bhāvato  dutiyāya majjhe kalyāṇa tā tad ubhaya avara tāya tad osāna tāya ca sāsana dhammassa tatiyāya
translated: because there is no attainment of Nibbāna in any other way. Herein, the first enlightenment is called “good in the beginning” because it is foremost in all good qualities,🔽and because it is the root of the other two enlightenments. The second is called “good in the middle” because it is middling in good qualities,

original: pariyosānakalyāṇatā vuttā.
analyzed: pariyosāna kalyāṇa tā vuttā
translated: and because it is the middle of the two. The third is called “good in the end” because it is the end of the two, and because it is free from their faults.

original: Esoti sāsanadhammo. Nīvaraṇavikkhambhanatoti vimuttāyatanasīse ṭhatvā saddhammaṃ suṇantassa nīvaraṇānaṃ vikkhambhanasambhavato. Vuttaṃ hetaṃ –
analyzed: esaḥ ti sāsana dhammaḥ nīvaraṇa vikkhambhanato ti vimutta āyatana sīse ṭhatvā saddhammam suṇantassa nīvaraṇānam vikkhambhana sambhavataḥ vuttam ha etam
translated: This is the Dhamma of the Dispensation. “Because it suppresses the hindrances”: because it is possible to suppress the hindrances when one listens to the true Dhamma while standing on the head of the “liberation-door” . For this is said:

original: “Yathā yathāvuso, bhikkhuno satthā vā dhammaṃ deseti, aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī, tathā tathā so tattha labhati atthavedaṃ labhati dhammaveda”nti.
analyzed: yathā yathā āvuso bhikkhuno satthā vā dhammam deseti aññataraḥ vā garuṭṭhāniyaḥ sabrahmacārī tathā tathā saḥ tattha labhati attha vedam labhati dhamma vedam ti
translated: “As the bhikkhu is taught the Dhamma by the Teacher or by a fellow monk who is his superior, so he gains the meaning and the Dhamma in each case” .

original: “Yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye ariyasāvako ohitasoto dhammaṃ suṇāti, pañcassa nīvaraṇāni tasmiṃ samaye pahīnāni hontī”ti –
analyzed: yasmin bhikkhave samaye ariya sāvakaḥ ohita sotaḥ dhammam suṇāti pañcassa nīvaraṇāni tasmin samaye pahīnāni honti iti
translated: “Bhikkhus, when a noble disciple listens to the Dhamma with eager ears, five hindrances are abandoned in him” .🔽And so on.

original: Ca ādi. Samathavipassanāsukhāvahanatoti samathasukhassa ca vipassanāsukhassa ca sampādanato. Vuttampi cetaṃ –
analyzed: ca ādi samatha vipassanā sukha āvahanato ti samatha sukhassa ca vipassanā sukhassa ca sampādanato vuttam api ca itaṃ
translated: It brings the bliss of serenity and insight: it brings the bliss of serenity and the bliss of insight. For this is said:

original: “So vivicceva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukha”ntiādi.
analyzed: so vivicca iva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi sa vitakkam sa vicāram viveka jam pīti sukhantiādi
translated: “Quite secluded from sensual desires, secluded from unwholesome states, he enters upon and abides in the first jhana, which is accompanied by applied and sustained thought, with rapture and pleasure born of seclusion” , and so on.

original: Tathā –
analyzed: tathā
translated: And:🔽“From whatever mental state

original: “Yato yato sammasati, khandhānaṃ udayabbayaṃ;
analyzed: yatas yatas sammasati khandhānam udaya bbayam
translated: The rise and fall of aggregates🔽Is well discerned by insight,🔽That state the wise man should cultivate;

original: Labhatī pītipāmojjaṃ, amataṃ taṃ vijānataṃ;
analyzed: labhatī pīti pāmojjam amatam tam vijānatam
translated: For when he does so, he will know🔽The deathless state that is secure” .🔽And:🔽“When he sees rightly with insight🔽The Dhamma that is well proclaimed,🔽He has the highest human goal,

original: Amānusī ratī hoti, sammā dhammaṃ vipassato”ti ca. ;
analyzed: amānusī ratī hoti sammā dhammam vipassato ti ca
translated: And he is called a brahmin” .

original: Tathāpaṭipannoti yathā samathavipassanāsukhaṃ āvahati, yathā vā satthārā anusiṭṭhaṃ,
analyzed: tathā paṭipannaḥ ti yathā samatha vipassanā sukham āvahati yathā vā satthārā anusiṭṭham
translated: Practising rightly: practising in accordance with the bliss of serenity and insight or in accordance with the Teacher’s instructions.

original: tathā paṭipanno sāsanadhammo. Tādibhāvāvahanatoti chaḷaṅgupekkhāvasena iṭṭhādīsu
analyzed: tathā paṭipannaḥ sāsana dhammo ta ādi bhāva āvahanato ti chaḷaṅgu pekkhā vasena iṭṭha ādīsu
translated: It brings about the state of being the Dhamma: it brings about the state of being the Dhamma of the Dispensation. For this is said: “The Dhamma of the Dispensation is of two kinds, that is, the Dhamma as teaching and the Dhamma as practice” .

original: tādibhāvassa lokadhammehi anupalepassa āvahanato. Esa bhagavā vuttanayena tividhakalyāṇaṃ🔽dhammaṃ desento yaṃ sāsanabrahmacariyaṃ, maggabrahmacariyañca pakāseti, taṃ yathānurūpaṃ
analyzed: ta ādi bhāvassa loka dhammehi anupalepassa āvahanataḥ esa bhagavā vutta nayena tividha kalyāṇam  dhammam desentaḥ yam sāsana brahmacariyam magga brahmacariyam ca pakāseti tam yathānurūpam
translated: because it brings about such a state of being, which is untainted by worldly conditions.

original: atthasampattiyā sātthaṃ, byañjanasampattiyā sabyañjananti yojanā.
analyzed: attha sampattiyā sa attham byañjana sampattiyā sa byañjananti yojanā
translated: The Blessed One, teaching the Dhamma which is good in three ways in the way stated above, reveals the spiritual life of the dispensation and the spiritual life of the path. The spiritual life of the dispensation is the dispensation of the Buddha’s Dispensation, and the spiritual life of the path is the path of the Noble Eightfold Path.

original: Tattha avisesena tisso sikkhā, sakalo ca tantidhammo sāsanabrahmacariyaṃ. Yaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: tattha avisesena tisso sikkhā sakalo ca tanti dhammo sāsana brahmacariyam yam sandhāya
translated: Herein, the three trainings in general and the whole of the Buddha’s Dispensation are the spiritual life of the dispensation,

original: vuttaṃ “katamesānaṃ kho, bhante, buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ brahmacariyaṃ naciraṭṭhitikaṃ
analyzed: vuttam katamesānam kho bhante buddhānam bhagavantānam brahmacariyam naciraṭṭhitikam
translated: with reference to which it is said: “Bhante, how long will the spiritual life established by the Blessed One last?”

original: ahosī”tiādi. Sabbasikkhānaṃ maṇḍabhūtasikkhattayasaṅgahito ariyamaggo maggabrahmacariyaṃ.
analyzed: ahosi itiādi sabba sikkhānam maṇḍa bhūta sikkhattaya saṅgahitaḥ ariya maggaḥ magga brahmacariyam
translated: The Noble Eightfold Path, which is included in the three trainings that are the essence of all the trainings, is the spiritual life of the path,

original: Yaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīya”nti. Yathānurūpanti
analyzed: yam sandhāya vuttam khīṇā jāti vusitam brahmacariyam katam karaṇīyanti yathā anurūpanti
translated: with reference to which it is said: “Birth is destroyed, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being” .

original: yathārahaṃ. Sikkhattayasaṅgahaṃ hi sāsanabrahmacariyaṃ atthasampattiyā sātthaṃ. Maggabrahmacariye
analyzed: yathāraham sikkhattaya saṅgaham hi sāsana brahmacariyam attha sampattiyā sa attham magga brahmacariye
translated: Yathānurūpaṃ = yathārahaṃ . The spiritual life of the dispensation, which is included in the three trainings, is meaningful in the sense of the fulfilment of the goal. The spiritual life of the path is meaningful in the sense of the fulfilment of the means.

original: vattabbameva natthi. Atthasampattiyāti sampannatthatāya. Sampattiattho hi idha saha-saddo.🔽Itaraṃ pana yathāvuttenatthena sātthaṃ, sabyañjanañca. Ye panettha “vacanasabhāvaṃ
analyzed: vattabbam eva natthi attha sampattiyā ati sampanna tthatāya sampatti atthaḥ hi idha saha saddaḥ  itaram pana yathāvuttena atthena sa attham sa byañjanam ca ye pana itthā vacana sabhāvam
translated: there is no need to say it. As to the perfection of meaning: as to the state of having a perfect meaning. For the word saha here has the meaning of perfection.🔽But the other is meaningful and has good grammar in the sense already stated.🔽But those who divide it up thus: “Meaningful is the verbal nature,🔽good grammar is the meaning nature,”

original: sātthaṃ, atthasabhāvaṃ sabyañjana”nti vibhajitvā vadanti, taṃ na sundaraṃ, tathā🔽vibhattassa pariyattidhammassa abhāvato. Saddatthā hi abhinnarūpā viya hutvā viniyogaṃ
analyzed: vibhajitvā vadanti tam na sundaram tathā  vibhattassa pariyatti dhammassa abhāvato saddatthāḥ hi abhinna rūpāḥ viya hutvā viniyogam
translated: are not good. Because there is no such thing as the doctrine of the scriptures divided up like that. For the words and their meanings occur as if they were indistinguishable,

original: gacchanti. Tathā hi nesaṃ lokiyāmissībhāvaṃ paṭijānanti. Satipi vā bhede “sabyañjana”nti🔽ettha yadi tulyayogo adhippeto “saputto āgato”tiādīsu viya, evaṃ sati “atthapaṭisaraṇā,
analyzed: gacchanti tathā hi lokiya āmissībhāvam paṭijānanti vā bhede  ettha yadi tulya yogaḥ adhippeto sa puttaḥ āgataḥ ti ādīsu viya evam sati attha paṭisaraṇā
translated: and so they are admitted to be undifferentiated in the world.🔽Or, even if there is a difference, if the combination is intended here in the way in which it is in such passages as “saputto āgato” , then in that case the doctrine of the emphasis on meaning in the passage, “Bhikkhus, you should be refuge-seekers in the meaning, not in the letter” , would be contradicted.

original: bhikkhave, hotha, mā byañjanapaṭisaraṇā”ti atthappadhānavādo bādhito siyā, atha vijjamānatāmattaṃ
analyzed: bhikkhave hotha mā byañjana paṭisaraṇā ti attha ppadhāna vādaḥ bādhitaḥ siyā atha vijjamāna tā mattam
translated: But if the mere fact of existence is intended by the word “good grammar” ,

original: “salomako sapakkhako”tiādīsu viya byañjanasampatti aggahitā siyā. Tasmā aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: salomako sapakkhakaḥ ti ādīsu viya byañjana sampatti aggahitā siyā tasmai aṭṭhakathā ayam
translated: The excellence of the phrasing is not included, as in the case of the words “with its hair, its skin, its flesh, its sinews, its bones, its marrow” .

original: vuttanayeneva attho gahetabbo.
analyzed: vutta nayena iva atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ
translated: So the meaning should be taken in the way stated in the commentary.

original: Sātthaṃ sabyañjananti ettha nettinayenāpi atthaṃ dassetuṃ “saṅkāsana…pe… sabyañjana”nti🔽vuttaṃ. Tattha yadipi nettiyaṃ byañjanamukhena byañjanatthaggahaṇaṃ hotīti “akkharaṃ
analyzed: sa attham sa byañjananti ettha attham dassetum saṅkāsana pe sa byañjananti  vuttam tattha yadi api nettiyam byañjana mukhena byañjana attha ggahaṇam hoti iti akkharam
translated: In order to show the meaning by the method of the Netti, “rebuking, reproving, convicting” is said in the passage, “He teaches the Dhamma to the bhikkhus rebuking, reproving, convicting, arousing, filling, consolidating, and establishing them in it.”

original: pada”ntiādinā byañjanapadāni paṭhamaṃ uddiṭṭhāni, idha pana pāḷiyaṃ “sātthaṃ sabyañjana”nti
analyzed: pada anti ādinā byañjana padāni paṭhamam uddiṭṭhāni idha pana pāḷiyam sa attham sa byañjananti
translated: Herein, although in the Netti the phrasing is taken up under the heading of phrasing by way of the phrasing, still the phrasing terms are listed first in the Netti with the words “The syllable, the word” .

original: āgatattā atthapadāniyeva paṭhamaṃ dassetuṃ “saṅkāsanapakāsanā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha🔽saṅkhepato kāsanaṃ dīpanaṃ saṅkāsanaṃ “maññamāno bhikkhu baddho mārassa, amaññamāno
analyzed: āgata ttā attha padāniyā iva paṭhamam dassetum saṅkāsana pakāsana iti ādi vuttam tattha  saṅkhepataḥ kāsanam dīpanam saṅkāsanam maññamānaḥ bhikkhu baddhaḥ mārassa a maññamānaḥ
translated: But here in the text the meaning terms are listed first with the words “He teaches the Dhamma to the bhikkhus rebuking, reproving, convicting” because the words “with its meaning and its phrasing” occur in the text.🔽Herein,🔽“rebuking” is the same as “reproving.” “Conviction” is “convincing.” “Arousing” is “rousing.” “Filling” is “consolidating.” “Consolidating” is “establishing.”🔽“The bhikkhu who conceives is bound by Mara, but the one who does not conceive is set free.”

original: mutto”tiādīsu viya. Tattakena hi tena bhikkhunā paṭividdhaṃ. Tenāha “aññātaṃ bhagavā”tiādi.
analyzed: muttaḥ iti ādīsu viya tattakena hi tena bhikkhunā paṭividdham tena āha aññātam bhagavā itiādi
translated: For that bhikkhu had penetrated it by himself.

original: Paṭhamaṃ kāsanaṃ pakāsanaṃ. Ādikammasmiṃ hi ayaṃ pasaddo “paññapeti paṭṭhapetī”tiādīsu
analyzed: paṭhamam kāsanam pakāsanam ādi kammasmim hi ayam pasaddaḥ paññapeti paṭṭhapeti itiādīsu
translated: The first is the revealing, the second the revealing-by-way-of-pre- eminence. For this word pasadana is like such words as paññapetī and paṭṭhapetī in the sense of “he makes known” .

original: viya. Tikkhindriyāpekkhaṃ cetaṃ padadvayaṃ uddesabhāvato. Tikkhindriyo hi saṅkhepato🔽paṭhamañca vuttamatthaṃ paṭipajjati. Saṃkhittassa vitthāravacanaṃ, sakiṃ vuttassa
analyzed: viya tikkha indriya apekkham ca itam pada dvayam uddesa bhāvataḥ tikkha indriyaḥ hi saṅkhepataḥ  paṭhamam ca vuttam attham paṭipajjati saṃkhittassa vitthāra vacanam sakim vuttassa
translated: The two words tikkhindriya and āpekkha are the terms of introduction. For one of quick understanding,🔽in brief, is the first, and he practices the meaning stated. The words vivaraṇa and vibhajana are the words of elaboration. For one of quick understanding,🔽in brief, is the first, and he practices the meaning stated. The words vivaraṇa and vibhajana are the words of elaboration. For one of quick understanding,

original: puna vacanañca vivaraṇavibhajanāni. Yathā “kusalā dhammā”ti saṅkhepato sakiṃyeva🔽ca vuttassa atthassa “katame dhammā kusalā? Yasmiṃ samaye kāmāvacaraṃ kusalaṃ citta”ntiādinā🔽vitthārato vivaraṇavasena, vibhajanavasena ca puna vacanaṃ. Majjhimindriyāpekkhametaṃ
analyzed: puna vacanam ca vivaraṇa vibhajanāni yathā kusalāḥ dhammāḥ ati saṅkhepato  ca vuttassa atthassa katame dhammā kusalā yasmin samaye kāmāvacaram kusalam cittam ti ādinā  vitthārataḥ vivaraṇa vasena vibhajana vasena ca puna vacanam majjhima indriya apekkham etam
translated: in brief, is the first, and he practices the meaning stated. The words vivaraṇa and vibhajana are the words of elaboration. For one of quick understanding,🔽in brief, is the first, and he practices the meaning stated. The words vivaraṇa and vibhajana are the words of elaboration. For one of quick understanding,🔽in brief, is the first, and he practices the meaning stated. The words vivaraṇa and vibhajana are the words of elaboration. For one of quick understanding,

original: padadvayaṃ niddesabhāvato. Vivaṭassa vitthāratarābhidhānaṃ, vibhattassa ca pakārehi
analyzed: pada dvayam niddesa bhāvataḥ vivaṭassa vitthāratara abhidhānam vibhattassa ca pakārehi
translated: in brief, is the first, and he practices the meaning stated. The words vivaraṇa and vibhajana are the words of elaboration. original: ñāpanaṃ veneyyānaṃ cittaparitosanaṃ uttānīkaraṇapaññāpanāni. Yathā “phasso hotī”tiādinā
analyzed: ñāpanam veneyyānam citta paritosanam uttānīkaraṇa paññāpanāni yathā phassaḥ hoti itiādinā
translated: in brief, is the first, and he practices the meaning stated. The words vivaraṇa and vibhajana are the words of elaboration. For one of quick understanding,🔽in brief, is the first, and he practices the meaning stated. The words vivaraṇa and vibhajana are the words of elaboration. For one of quick understanding,🔽in brief, is the first, and he practices the meaning stated. The words vivaraṇa and vibhajana are the words of elaboration. For one of quick understanding,

original: vivaṭavibhattassa atthassa “katamo tasmiṃ samaye phasso? Yo tasmiṃ samaye phasso
analyzed: vivaṭa vibhattassa atthassa katamaḥ tasmin samaye phassaḥ yaḥ tasmin samaye phassaḥ
translated: When the meaning is opened up and analyzed, “What is contact on that occasion? Whatever at that time is contact …

original: phusanā samphusanā”tiādinā uttānīkiriyā, paññāpanā ca. Mudindriyāpekkhametaṃ padadvayaṃ
analyzed: phusanā samphusanā ati ādinā uttānīkiriyā paññāpanā ca mud indriya apekkham etam pada dvayam
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the words “What is contact? At that time there is contact, the contacting, the state of contact” and so on is the pointing out and the teaching. This pair of terms is for the sake of those of dull faculties.

original: paṭiniddesabhāvato. “Paññāpanapaṭṭhapanavivaraṇavibhajanauttānīkaraṇapakāsanaatthapadasamāyogato”tipi pāṭho.
analyzed: paṭiniddesa bhāvato pāṭhaḥ
translated: It is also the text: “By way of pointing out, teaching, explaining, analyzing, making clear, revealing, and connecting with the meaning.”

original: Kathaṃ panāyaṃ pāṭhavikappo jātoti? Vuccate – nettipāḷiyaṃ āgatanayena purimapāṭho. Tattha hi –
analyzed: katham pana ayam pāṭha vikappaḥ jātaḥ iti vuccate āgata nayena purima pāṭhaḥ tattha hi
translated: But how did this section of text come about? It is said: by the method stated in the Nettippakarana, the former text. For there it is said:

original: “Saṅkāsanā pakāsanā,
analyzed: saṅkāsanā pakāsanā
translated: “Pointing out, teaching,

original: Vivaraṇā vibhajanuttānīkammapaññatti;
analyzed: vivaraṇā
translated: Explaining, analyzing, making clear, revealing,

original: Etehi chahi padehi,
analyzed: etehi chahi padehi
translated: By these six terms

original: Attho kammañca niddiṭṭha”nti. –
analyzed: attho kammañca niddiṭṭhanti
translated: The meaning and the action are shown.”

original: Desanāhārayojanāya ca etassevatthassa “saṅkāsanā pakāsanā”tiādinā āgataṃ. Pacchimo
analyzed: desanā āhāra yojanāya ca saṅkāsanā pakāsanā ati ādinā āgatam pacchimaḥ
translated: And by way of the application of the meaning of the teaching, this very meaning is stated in the Nettippakarana by the words “pointing out, teaching” and so on.🔽But the latter text🔽is stated in the sutta:

original: pana “paññapeti paṭṭhapeti vivarati vibhajati uttānīkaroti ‘passathā’ti cāhā”ti sutte
analyzed: pana paññapeti paṭṭhapeti vivarati vibhajati uttānīkaroti passatha ati ca āha ati sutte
translated: “He makes known, he teaches, he proclaims, he establishes, he demonstrates, he reveals, he explains, he makes plain, he says, ‘Look!’”

original: āgatanayena byañjanamattakato. Evañca nesaṃ dvinnaṃ pāṭhānaṃ viseso, na atthato.🔽Tathā hi saṅkhepato “paṭhamaṃ ñāpanaṃ paññāpanaṃ, paṭhamameva ṭhapanaṃ paṭṭhapana”nti
analyzed: āgata nayena byañjana mattakataḥ evañca na īsam dvinnam pāṭhānam visesaḥ na atthato  tathā hi saṅkhepataḥ paṭhamam ñāpanam paññāpanam paṭhamam eva ṭhapanam paṭṭhapanam ti
translated: and by the method of derivation, in the mere syllables. And the difference between the two renderings is only in the words, not in the meaning.🔽For in brief the words “firstly, announcing, making known” are not different in meaning from the words “firstly, announcing, making known”🔽and “firstly, establishing, making stand, is the same as establishing, making stand”.

original: imāni padāni saṅkāsanapakāsanapadehi atthato avisiṭṭhāni. Yañca purimapāṭhe chaṭṭhaṃ🔽padaṃ “pakārato ñāpana”nti paññāpanaṃ vuttaṃ, taṃ dutiyapāṭhe pakāsanapadena “nibbisesaṃ
analyzed: imāni padāni saṅkāsana pakāsana padehi atthataḥ a visiṭṭhāni yat ca purima pāṭhe chaṭṭham  padam pakārataḥ ñāpanan ti paññāpanam vuttam tam dutiya pāṭhe pakāsana padena nibbisesam
translated: And the sixth word in the first rendering,🔽“announcing by way of the letter”, which is said to be “making known”, is the same as the word “making stand” in the second rendering, which is said to be “making stand by way of the letter”.

original: pakārato kāsana”nti katvā. Yasmā ñāpanakāsanāni atthāvabhāsanasabhāvatāya abhinnāni,
analyzed: pakārataḥ kāsananti katvā yasmai ñāpana kāsanāni attha avabhāsana sabhāva tāya abhinnāni
translated: Because announcing and making stand are indistinguishable in being of the nature of illuminating the meaning,

original: sabbesañca veneyyānaṃ cittassa tosanaṃ, buddhiyā ca nisānaṃ yāthāvato vatthusabhāvāvabhāsane
analyzed: sabbesam ca veneyyānam cittassa tosanam buddhiyā ca nisānam yāthāvataḥ vatthu sabhāva avabhāsane
translated: and because satisfaction in the mind and steadiness in the understanding of all those to be trained arise when the nature of the subject matter is illuminated as it really is.

original: jāyatīti. Evaṃ atthapadarūpattā pariyattiatthassa yathāvuttachaatthapadasamāyogato sātthaṃ sāsanaṃ.
analyzed: jāyati iti evam attha pada rūpattā pariyatti atthassa yathāvutta cha attha pada samāyogataḥ sa attham sa āsanam
translated: So the Dispensation is “meaningful” because of the combination of the six meanings in the meaning of the True Idea as Text, which is of the nature of meaning and words.

original: Akkharapadabyañjanākāraniruttiniddesasampattiyāti ettha uccāraṇavelāyaṃ apariyosite
analyzed: akkhara pada byañjana ākāra nirutti niddesa sampattiyā ati ettha uccāraṇa velāyam a pariyosite
translated: At the time of utterance, the letter is the sound of a syllable whose word is not yet complete.

original: pade vaṇṇo akkharaṃ. “Ekakkharaṃ padaṃ akkhara”nti eke “ā evaṃ kira ta”ntiādīsu ā-kārādayo🔽viya. “Visuddhakaraṇānaṃ manasā desanāvācāya akkharaṇato akkhara”nti aññe. Vibhattiyantaṃ🔽atthañāpanato padaṃ. Saṅkhepato vuttaṃ padābhihitaṃ atthaṃ byañjetīti byañjanaṃ,
analyzed: pade vaṇṇaḥ akkharam ekakkharam padam akkharanti eke ā evam kira tanti ādīsu ākāra ādayaḥ  viya visuddha karaṇānam manasā desanā vācāya akkharaṇataḥ akkharanti aññe vibhattiyantam  attha ñāpanataḥ padam saṅkhepataḥ vuttam pada abhihitam attham byañjeti iti byañjanam
translated: Some say that a letter is a single syllable, as in the case of “pada” and “akkhara” . Others say that a letter is a syllable such as “a” in the case of “ā evaṃ kira ta” .🔽A word is that which indicates a meaning that is inflected.🔽In brief, a phrase is that which reveals the meaning expressed by the words.🔽A sentence is that which is connected with a verb and the specification of the case endings of the other words.

original: vākyaṃ. “Kiriyāpadaṃ abyayakārakavisesanayuttaṃ vākya”nti hi vadanti. Pakārato vākyavibhāgo🔽ākāro. Ākārābhihitaṃ nibbacanaṃ nirutti. Nibbacanavitthāro nissesupadesato niddeso.
analyzed: vākyam kiriyā padam abyaya kāraka visesana yuttam vākyanti hi vadanti pakārataḥ vākya vibhāgaḥ  ākāraḥ ākāra abhihitam nibbacanam nirutti nibbacana vitthāraḥ nissesa upadesataḥ niddesaḥ
translated: The phrasing is the analysis of the sentence according to the parts of speech.🔽The expression is the explanation of the phrasing.

original: Etesaṃ akkharādīnaṃ byañjanapadānaṃ sampattiyā sampannatāya sabyañjanaṃ.
analyzed: etesam akkhara ādīnam byañjana padānam sampattiyāḥ sampanna tāyai sa byañjanam
translated: The expression is the explanation of the phrasing. The explanation is the detailed explanation of the expression by means of the teaching of the etymologies.🔽The excellence of the letters, etc., is the excellence of the words beginning with “letters.”

original: Tatrāyamassa atthapadasamāyogo, byañjanasampatti ca – akkharehi saṅkāseti, padehi
analyzed: tatra ayam assa attha pada samāyogaḥ byañjana sampatti ca akkharehi saṅkāseti padehi
translated: Here is the connection with the words of meaning and the excellence of the phrasing: he teaches with the letters,

original: pakāseti, byañjanehi vivarati, ākārehi vibhajati, niruttīhi uttānīkaroti, niddesehi
analyzed: pakāseti byañjanehi vivarati ākārehi vibhajati niruttīhi uttānīkaroti niddesehi
translated: He reveals it by means of the syllables, he discloses it by means of the phrasing, he analyses it by means of the modes, he elucidates it by means of the verbal roots, he makes it clear by means of the definitions.🔽Thus he trains the type that is to be trained by means of the letter, having uncovered it by means of the syllables,

original: paññapeti, tathā akkharehi ugghāṭetvā padehi vineti ugghaṭitaññuṃ, byañjanehi vipañcetvā🔽ākārehi vineti vipañcitaññuṃ, niruttīhi netvā niddesehi vineti neyyaṃ. Evañcāyaṃ
analyzed: paññapeti tathā akkharehi ugghāṭetvā padehi vinā iti ugghaṭitaññum byañjanehi vipañcetvā  ākārehi vinā iti vipañcitaññum niruttīhi netvā niddesehi vinā iti neyyam evañca ayam
translated: he trains the type that is to be trained by means of the phrasing, having analysed it by means of the modes,🔽he trains the type that is to be trained by means of the verbal roots, having led it on by means of the definitions. Thus this Dhamma,

original: dhammo ugghaṭiyamāno ugghaṭitaññuṃ vineti, vipañciyamāno vipañcitaññuṃ, niyyamāno
analyzed: dhammaḥ ugghaṭiyamānaḥ ugghaṭita ññum vineti vipañciyamānaḥ vipañcita ññum niyyamānaḥ
translated: when it is being uncovered, trains the type that is to be trained by means of the letter, when it is being analysed, it trains the type that is to be trained by means of the phrasing, when it is being led on, it trains the type that is to be trained by means of the verbal roots.

original: neyyaṃ. Tattha ugghaṭanā ādi, vipañcanā majjhe, nayanamante. Evaṃ tīsu kālesu tidhā
analyzed: tattha ugghaṭanā ādi vipañcanā majjhe nayanam ante evam tīsu kālesu tidhā
translated: Herein, the uncovering is the beginning, the analysing is the middle, and the leading on is the end. Thus it is taught in three ways in the three divisions of time.

original: desito dosattayavidhamano guṇattayāvaho tividhaveneyyavinayanoti. Evampi tividhakalyāṇoyaṃ
analyzed: desitaḥ dosa ttaya vidhamanaḥ guṇa ttaya āvahaḥ evam pi tividha
translated: It is the remover of the three kinds of taints and the bestower of the three kinds of excellence. It is the trainer of the three kinds of person to be trained. Thus this Dhamma,

original: dhammo atthabyañjanapāripūriyā “sāttho sabyañjano”ti veditabbo “paripuṇṇo, parisuddho”ti ca.
analyzed: dhammaḥ attha byañjana pāripūriyā sa atthaḥ sa byañjanaḥ ti veditabbaḥ paripuṇṇaḥ parisuddhaḥ ti ca
translated: which is good in three ways, should be understood as “endowed with meaning and phrasing,” as “complete,” and as “pure,” because it is fulfilled and purified.

original: Atthagambhīratātiādīsu attho nāma tantiattho. Dhammo tanti. Paṭivedho tantiyā, tantiatthassa
analyzed: attha gambhīra tā ti ādīsu atthaḥ nāma tanti atthaḥ dhammo tanti paṭivedhaḥ tantiyā tanti atthassa
translated: As regards the words “deep in meaning” and so on, the “meaning” is the meaning of the Thread. The Thread is the Dhamma. The penetration is the Thread’s meaning’s

original: ca yathābhūtāvabodho. Desanā manasā vavatthāpitāya tantiyā desanā. Te panete atthādayo
analyzed: ca yathā bhūta avabodhaḥ desanā manasā tantiyā desanā te pana ete attha ādayaḥ
translated: and the penetration of the way things are. The teaching is the teaching by means of the thread of exposition that has been defined by the mind. But these meanings, etc.,

original: yasmā sasādīhi viya mahāsamuddo mandabuddhīhi dukkhogāhā, alabbhaneyyapatiṭṭhā ca,🔽tasmā gambhīrā. Atha vā attho nāma hetuphalaṃ. Dhammo hetu. Desanā paññatti, yathādhammaṃ🔽dhammābhilāpo, anulomapaṭilomasaṅkhepavitthārādivasena vā kathanaṃ. Paṭivedho abhisamayo,🔽atthānurūpaṃ dhammesu, dhammānurūpaṃ atthesu, paññattipathānurūpaṃ paññattīsu avabodho,
analyzed: yasmai sa sādīhi viya mahā samuddaḥ manda buddhīhi dukkha ugāhā a labbha neyya patiṭṭhā ca  tasmā gambhīrā atha vā atthaḥ nāma hetu phalam dhammaḥ hetu desanā paññatti yathādhammam  dhamma abhilāpaḥ anuloma paṭiloma saṅkhepa vitthāra ādi vasena vā kathanam paṭivedhaḥ abhisamayaḥ  attha anurūpam dhammesu dhamma anurūpam atthesu paññatti patha anurūpam paññattīsu avabodhaḥ
translated: are “profound” because, like the ocean, they are hard for the dull-witted to fathom and have no point at which they can be grasped.

original: tesaṃ tesaṃ vā dhammānaṃ paṭivijjhitabbo salakkhaṇasaṅkhāto aviparītasabhāvo. Tepi🔽cete atthādayo yasmā anupacitakusalasambhārehi duppaññehi sasādīhi viya mahāsamuddo🔽dukkhogāhā, alabbhaneyyapatiṭṭhā ca, tasmā gambhīrā. Tesu paṭivedhassāpi atthasannissitattā
analyzed: tesam tesam vā dhammānam paṭivijjhitabbaḥ sa lakkhaṇa saṅkhāto aviparīta sabhāvo te pi 🔽ca ite attha ādayaḥ yasmai anupacita kusala sambhārehi duppaññehi sa sa ādīhi viya mahā samuddaḥ 🔽dukkha ugāhā a labbha neyya patiṭṭhā ca tasmā gambhīrā tesu paṭivedhassa api attha sannissita ttā
translated: Or alternatively, the meaning is cause and fruit. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause. The teaching is the teaching of the cause.

original: vuttaṃ “atthagambhīratāpaṭivedhagambhīratāhi sāttha”nti atthaguṇadīpanato. Tāsaṃ
analyzed: vuttam attha gambhīra tā paṭivedha gambhīra tāhi sā attham ti attha guṇa dīpanato tāsam
translated: “It is profitable because it is profitable in the sense of the profundity of the meaning” is said because it shows the profitable quality of the meaning.🔽“It is connected with the profitable because it is connected with the profitable in the sense of the profundity of the teaching” is said because those teachings are dependent on the letter.

original: dhammadesanānaṃ byañjanasannissitattā vuttaṃ “dhammagambhīratādesanāgambhīratāhi🔽sabyañjana”nti tāsaṃ byañjanasampattidīpanato.
analyzed: dhamma desanānam byañjana sannissita ttā vuttam dhamma gambhīra tā desanā gambhīra tāhi  tāsam byañjana sampatti dīpanataḥ
translated: “It is connected with the profitable because it is connected with the profitable in the sense of the profundity of the teaching” is said because it shows the excellence of the letter of those teachings.

original: Atthesu pabhedagataṃ ñāṇaṃ atthapaṭisambhidā. Atthadhammaniruttipaṭisambhidāsu pabhedagataṃ🔽ñāṇaṃ paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāti imissāpi paṭisambhidāya atthavisayattā āha “atthapaṭibhānapaṭisambhidāvisayato
analyzed: atthesu pabheda gatam ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā attha dhamma nirutti paṭisambhidāsu pabheda gatam  ñāṇam paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā ti imissā api paṭisambhidāya attha visaya ttā āha attha paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā visayato
translated: Knowledge of the divisions in the meanings is the discrimination of meaning. Knowledge of the divisions in the Dhamma, in the language, and in clear expression is the discrimination of the Dhamma, the discrimination of the language, and the discrimination of clear expression respectively.

original: sāttha”nti, atthasampattiyā asati tadabhāvato. Dhammoti tanti. Niruttīti tantipadānaṃ
analyzed: attha sampattiyāḥ asati tad abhāvataḥ dhammo ti tanti nirutti iti tanti padānam
translated: Since this discrimination of clear expression also has the meaning as its domain, he said “It is profitable because it is profitable in the sense of the domain of the discrimination of the meaning and of clear expression,” because when there is no excellence of meaning, it does not exist.🔽“The Dhamma” is the language. “The language” is the speech that is extracted from the words of the language.

original: niddhāretvā vacanaṃ. Tattha pabhedagatāni ñāṇāni dhammaniruttipaṭisambhidāti āha
analyzed: niddhāretvā vacanam tattha pabheda gatāni ñāṇāni dhamma nirutti paṭisambhidā ti āha
translated: Knowledge of the divisions there is the discrimination of the language.

original: “dhammaniruttipaṭisambhidāvisayato sabyañjananti, asati byañjanasampattiyā tadabhāvato.
analyzed: dhamma nirutti paṭisambhidā visayato asati byañjana sampattiyā tad abhāvato
translated: “It is connected with the profitable because it is connected with the profitable in the sense of the domain of the discrimination of the language,” because when there is no excellence of the letter, it does not exist.

original: Parikkhakajanappasādakanti ettha iti-saddo hetuattho. Yasmā parikkhakajanānaṃ kiṃkusalagavesīnaṃ
analyzed: parikkhaka jana ppasādakanti ettha iti saddaḥ hetu atthaḥ yasmā parikkhaka janānam kiṃkusala gavesīnam
translated: The people who live round about are satisfied with him: here the word iti has the meaning of cause. Because the people who live round about, who are seekers after what is wholesome,

original: pasādāvahaṃ, tasmā sātthaṃ. Atthasampannanti phalena hetuno anumānaṃ nadīpūrena viya
analyzed: pasāda āvaham phalena hetunaḥ anumānam nadīpūrena
translated: “Inspiring confidence in the wise” : here the word iti has the meaning of a causal particle. Because it inspires confidence in the wise who are seekers after what is wholesome, therefore it is meaningful. “Possessed of meaning” : the inference of the cause from the effect, as of the rainfall from the flooding of the river.

original: upari vuṭṭhippavattiyā. Sātthakatā panassa paṇḍitavedanīyatāya, sā paramagambhīrasaṇhasukhumabhāvato
analyzed: upari vuṭṭhi ppavattiyā sātthaka tā pana assa paṇḍita vedanīya tāya sā parama gambhīra saṇha sukhuma bhāvato
translated: But its meaningfulness should be understood as being due to its being comprehensible to the wise, and that is due to its being extremely profound, difficult to see, and subtle.

original: veditabbā. Vuttañhetaṃ “gambhīro duddaso”tiādi. Lokiyajanappasādakanti sabyañjananti🔽yasmā lokiyajanassa pasādāvahaṃ, tasmā sabyañjanaṃ. Lokiyajano hi byañjanasampattiyā
analyzed: veditabbā vuttam ha etam gambhīraḥ duddasaḥ tiādi lokiya jana ppasādakanti sa byañjananti  yasmā lokiya janassa pasāda āvaham tasmā sa byañjanam lokiya janaḥ hi byañjana sampattiyā
translated: For this is said: “Profound, difficult to see” , etc. “Inspiring confidence in the world” : “with phrasing” :

original: tussati, idhāpi phalena hetuno anumānaṃ. Sabyañjanatā panassa saddheyyatāya, sā ādikalyāṇādibhāvato veditabbā.
analyzed: tussati idha api phalena hetunaḥ anumānam sa byañjana tā pana assa saddheyya tāya sā ādi kalyāṇa ādi bhāvataḥ veditabbā
translated: because it inspires confidence in the world, therefore it has phrasing. For the worldling delights in the excellence of phrasing. Here too the inference of the cause from the effect. But its having phrasing should be understood as being due to its being credible, and that is due to its being well-phrased at the beginning, etc.

original: Atha vā paṇḍitavedanīyato sāttha”nti paññāpadaṭṭhānatāya atthasampannataṃ āha, tato
analyzed: atha vā paṇḍita vedanīyataḥ sā attham ti paññā padaṭṭhāna tāya attha sampanna tam āha tatas
translated: Or alternatively, “meaningful” is said to be possessed of meaning because it is comprehensible to the wise, and that is due to its being the basis for the knowledge of the four noble truths.

original: parikkhakajanappasādakaṃ. Saddheyyato sabyañjananti saddhāpadaṭṭhānatāya byañjanasampannataṃ,🔽tato lokiyajanappasādakanti evamettha attho daṭṭhabbo. Gambhīrādhippāyato sātthanti
analyzed: parikkhaka jana ppasādakam saddheyyataḥ sa byañjanam ti saddhā padaṭṭhāna tāya byañjana sampanna tam  tatas lokiya jana ppasādakam ti evam ettha atthaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ gambhīra adhippāyato sā attham ti
translated: It is “meaningful” in the sense of having a clear meaning.🔽It is “well-phrased” in the sense of having a clear expression.🔽It is “meaningful” in the sense of having a clear meaning.🔽It is “well-phrased” in the sense of having a clear expression.

original: adhippāyato agādhāpāratāya atthasampannaṃ aññathā tadabhāvato. Uttānapadato sabyañjananti
analyzed: adhippāyataḥ agādha apāratāya attha sampannam aññathā tad abhāvataḥ uttāna padataḥ sa byañjananti
translated: It is “meaningful” in the sense of having a clear meaning.🔽It is “well-phrased” in the sense of having a clear expression.🔽It is “meaningful” in the sense of having a clear meaning.🔽It is “well-phrased” in the sense of having a clear expression.🔽It is “meaningful” in the sense of having a clear meaning.

original: subodhasaddatāya byañjanasampannaṃ, paramagambhīrassapi atthassa veneyyānaṃ suviññeyyabhāvāpādanato.
analyzed: byañjana sampannam parama gambhīrassa api atthassa veneyyānam su viññeyya bhāva āpādanato
translated: It is “well-phrased” in the sense of having a clear expression.🔽It is “meaningful” in the sense of having a clear meaning.🔽It is “well-phrased” in the sense of having a clear expression.🔽It is “meaningful” in the sense of having a clear meaning.

original: Sabbopesa paṭhamassa atthadvayassa pabhedo daṭṭhabbo, tathā ceva tattha tattha saṃvaṇṇitaṃ.
analyzed: paṭhamassa attha dvayassa pabhedaḥ daṭṭhabbo tathā ca iva tattha tattha saṃvaṇṇitam
translated: It is “well-phrased” in the sense of having a clear expression.🔽It is “meaningful” in the sense of having a clear meaning.🔽It is “well-phrased” in the sense of having a clear expression.🔽It is “meaningful” in the sense of having a clear meaning.

original: Tathā hettha vikappassa, samuccayassa vā aggahaṇaṃ. Upanetabbassāti pakkhipitabbassa
analyzed: tathā ha ittha vikappassa samuccayassa vā aggahaṇam upanetabbassa ati pakkhipitabbassa
translated: It is “well-phrased” in the sense of having a clear expression.🔽It is “meaningful” in the sense of having a clear meaning.🔽It is “well-phrased” in the sense of having a clear expression.🔽It is “meaningful” in the sense of having a clear meaning.

original: vodānatthassa avuttassa abhāvato. Sakalaparipuṇṇabhāvenāti sabbabhāgehi paripuṇṇatāya.
analyzed: vodāna atthassa a vuttassa abhāvato sakala paripuṇṇa bhāvena ati sabba bhāgehi paripuṇṇa tāya
translated: It is “well-phrased” in the sense of having a clear expression.🔽It is “meaningful” in the sense of having a clear meaning.🔽It is “well-phrased” in the sense of having a clear expression.

original: Apanetabbassāti saṃkilesadhammassa.
analyzed: apanetabbassa ati saṃkilesa dhammassa
translated: It is “meaningful” in the sense of having a clear meaning.🔽It is “well-phrased” in the

original: Paṭipattiyāti sīlavisuddhiyādisammāpaṭipattiyā, tannimittaṃ. Adhigamabyattitoti saccapaṭivedhena
analyzed: paṭipattiyā ti sīla visuddhiyā ādi sammāpaṭipattiyā tad nimittam adhigama byattito ti sacca paṭivedhena
translated: By penetration of the scriptures: by the penetration of the scriptures,

original: adhigamaveyyattiyasabbhāvato sātthaṃ kapilavatādi viya tucchaṃ niratthakaṃ ahutvā
analyzed: adhigama veyyattiya sabbhāvato sa attham kapilavata ādi viya tuccham niratthakam a hutvā
translated: which is the opposite of the lack of penetration of the scriptures. It is meaningful because it is not empty and pointless like Kapilavatthu, etc.,🔽but is endowed with meaning, since it is the opposite of the lack of penetration of the scriptures.

original: atthasampannanti katvā. Pariyattiyāti pariyattidhammaparicayena. Āgamabyattitoti🔽durakkhātadhammesu paricayaṃ karontassa viya sammohaṃ ajanetvā bāhusaccaveyyattiyasabbhāvato
analyzed: attha sampannam ti katvā pariyattiyā āti pariyatti dhamma paricayena āgama byattito ti  durakkhāta dhammesu paricayam karontassa viya sammoham a janetvā bāhu sacca veyyattiya sabbhāvato
translated: By penetration of the tradition: by the penetration of the tradition,🔽which is the opposite of the lack of penetration of the tradition. It is not without eloquence, since it is the opposite of the lack of eloquence in one who is confused, as if he were learning the scriptures in a language he does not understand.

original: sabyañcanaṃ. Byañjanasampattiyā hi sati āgamabyattīti. Sīlādipañcadhammakkhandhayuttatoti
analyzed: sa byañcanam byañjana sampattiyāḥ hi sati āgama byattī iti sīla ādi pañca dhamma kkhandha yutta to ti
translated: For when there is the excellence of the letter, there is the penetration of the tradition.🔽By being endowed with the five aggregates of Dhamma beginning with virtue: by being endowed with the five groups of Dhamma beginning with virtue.

original: sīlādīhi pañcahi dhammakoṭṭhāsehi avirahitattā. Kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ anavasesena samantato
analyzed: sīla ādīhi pañcahi dhammakoṭṭhāsehi avirahita ttā kevala paripuṇṇam anavasesena samantataḥ
translated: It is complete in every way, filled all around without remainder.🔽By being free from defilement: by being free from the defilements of conceit, etc.

original: puṇṇaṃ pūritaṃ. Nirupakkilesatoti diṭṭhimānādiupakkilesābhāvato. Nittharaṇatthāyāti
analyzed: puṇṇam pūritam nirupakkilesato ti diṭṭhi māna ādi upakkilesa abhāvataḥ nittharaṇa atthāya ati
translated: For the purpose of crossing over: for the purpose of crossing over the four floods.

original: vaṭṭadukkhato nissaraṇāya. Lokāmisanirapekkhatoti kathañcipi taṇhāsannissayassa anissayanato.
analyzed: vaṭṭa dukkhataḥ nissaraṇāya loka āmisa nirapekkhato ti kathañci pi taṇhā sannissayassa a nissayanato
translated: and for the purpose of escape from the suffering of the round of rebirths. He is not concerned with worldly gain means that he is not concerned with the support of craving.

original: Evaṃ ādikalyāṇatādiapadesena satthu purimavesārajjadvayavasena dhammassa svākkhātataṃ🔽vibhāvetvā idāni pacchimavesārajjadvayavasenāpi taṃ dassetuṃ “atthavipallāsābhāvato🔽vā suṭṭhu akkhātoti svākkhāto”ti vatvā tamatthaṃ byatirekamukhena vibhāvento “yathā
analyzed: evam ādi kalyāṇa tā ādi apadesena satthu purima vesārajja dvaya vasena dhammassa  vibhāvetvā idāni pacchima vesārajja dvaya vasena api tam dassetum attha vipallāsa abhāvato  vā suṭṭhu akkhāto ti su ākkhāto ti vatvā tam attham byatireka mukhena vibhāventaḥ yathā
translated: Having thus shown the well-proclaimedness of the Dhamma by means of the first pair of grounds for confidence in the Teacher,

original: hī”tiādimāha. Tattha vipallāsamāpajjatīti tesaṃ dhamme “antarāyikā”ti vuttadhammānaṃ🔽vipākādīnaṃ antarāyikattābhāvato ekaṃsena apāyūpapattihetutāya abhāvato. Niyyānikattābhāvatoti
analyzed: hi iti ādim āha tattha vipallāsam āpajjati iti tesam dhamme antarāyikā ati vutta dhammānam  vipāka ādīnam ekaṃsena apāyu upapatti hetutāya abhāvataḥ niyyānika ttā abhāvato ti
translated: now, in order to show it also by means of the second pair of grounds for confidence in the Dhamma, he said, “Or alternatively, it is well proclaimed” and so on. Herein, he misrepresents the meaning means that he misrepresents the meaning of those things stated by the Blessed One as hindrances,🔽because they are not hindrances to fruition, etc., and because they are not invariably causes of rebirth in states of deprivation. He misrepresents the teaching means

original: atammayatābhāvato, saṃsārato ca niyyānikāti vuttadhammānaṃ ekaccayaññakiriyāpakatipurisantaraññāṇādīnaṃ
analyzed: a tammaya tā bhāvato saṃsārato ca niyyānikā ati vutta dhammānam ekacca yañña kiriyā pakati purisa antara ññāṇa ādīnam
translated: that he misrepresents the teaching of the things stated by the Blessed One as leading to emancipation, because they are not the only way to emancipation, and because he does not know the nature of the sacrifice of the single oblation, etc.,

original: tato niyyānikattābhāvato viparīto eva hoti. Tenāti atthassa vipallāsāpajjanena. Te
analyzed: tatas niyyānika ttā bhāvataḥ viparītaḥ eva hoti tena ati atthassa vipallāsa āpajjanena te
translated: and it is therefore quite the opposite of the true path, since it does not lead out. ‘By that’ means by the occurrence of the perversion of meaning.🔽‘The sectarians’ are the non-Buddhist ascetics. ‘Because it does not transcend that state’ means that it does not transcend the state of being an obstruction, which is the state of being an obstruction to the five kinds of action, etc.

original: aññatitthiyā. Tathābhāvānatikkamanatoti kammantarāyādīnaṃ pañcannaṃ antarāyikabhāvassa🔽ariyamaggadhammānaṃ niyyānikabhāvassa kadācipi anativattanato.🔽Nibbānānurūpāya paṭipattiyāti adhigantabbassa sabbasaṅkhatavinissaṭassa nibbānassa🔽anurūpāya sabbasaṅkhāranissaraṇūpāyabhūtāya sapubbabhāgāya sammāpaṭipattiyā akkhātattāti
analyzed: añña titthiyā tathābhāva anatikkamanato ti kamma antarāya ādīnam pañcannam antarāyika bhāvassa  ariya magga dhammānam niyyānika bhāvassa kadācipi an ativattanato  nibbāna anurūpāya paṭipattiyā ati adhigantabbassa sabba saṅkhata vinissaṭassa nibbānassa  anurūpāya sabba saṅkhāra nissaraṇa upāya bhūtāya sa pubbabhāgāya sammāpaṭipattiyāḥ a khāta ttā ti
translated: ‘Because it never transcends the state of being the escape from the states of the noble path’ means that it never transcends the state of being the escape from the five kinds of action, etc.🔽‘The teaching of the way that accords with Nibbāna’ is the teaching of the right way with its prior stages, which is the means of escape from all formations and accords with Nibbāna, which is to be attained and is the escape from all formed things.

original: yojanā. Paṭipadānurūpassāti sabbadukkhaniyyānikabhūtā ārammaṇakaraṇamattenāpi kilesehi🔽anāmasanīyā yādisī paṭipadā, tadanurūpassa. Supaññattāti sīlādikkhandhattayasaṅgahitā
analyzed: yojanā paṭipada anurūpassa ati sabba dukkha niyyānika bhūtā ārammaṇa karaṇa mattena api kilesehi  an āmasanīyā yādisī paṭipadā tad anurūpassa su paññattā ati sīla ādi kkhandha ttaya saṅgahitā
translated: ‘The teaching of the way that accords with the practice’ is the teaching of the way that is of such a kind that it cannot be seized upon by defilements even when it is made the object, since it is the escape from all suffering.

original: sammādiṭṭhiādippabhedā micchādiṭṭhiādīnaṃ pahāyikabhāvena suṭṭhu sammadeva vihitā.
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi ādi ppabhedā micchādiṭṭhi ādīnam pahāyika bhāvena suṭṭhu sammat eva vihitā
translated: ‘Well proclaimed’ is the right view, etc., which are included in the three aggregates beginning with virtue and are well and truly made by the abandoning of wrong view, etc.

original: Saṃsandati kilesamalavisuddhitāya sameti. Evaṃ magganibbānānaṃ paṭipadāpaṭipajjanīyabhāvehi🔽aññamaññānurūpatāya svākkhātataṃ dassetvā idāni tividhassāpi lokuttaradhammassa paccekaṃ
analyzed: saṃsandati kilesa mala visuddhi tāya sameti evam magga nibbānānam paṭipadā paṭipajjanīya bhāvehi  aññamañña anurūpa tāya svākkhāta tam dassetvā idāni tividhassa api lokuttara dhammassa paccekam
translated: So the Blessed One has shown how the path and Nibbāna are well proclaimed by being in conformity with each other as practice and goal of practice.

original: svākkhātataṃ dassetuṃ “ariyamaggo cetthā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha antadvayanti sassatucchedaṃ,
analyzed: dassetum ariya maggo ca itthā tiādi vuttam tattha anta dvayanti
translated: Now, in order to show how each of the three kinds of supramundane Dhamma is well proclaimed, he said: “Herein, the noble path is the middle way” , etc. Herein, the two extremes are the two extremes of eternalism and annihilationism,

original: kāmasukhaattakilamathānuyogaṃ, līnuddhaccaṃ, patiṭṭhānāyūhananti evaṃ pabhedaṃ antadvayaṃ.
analyzed: evam anta dvayam
translated: of indulgence in sensual pleasure and indulgence in self-mortification, of being and non-being, of the pursuit of greed and the pursuit of annihilation, of depression and restlessness, of the unestablished and the over-established.

original: Anupagammāti anupagantvā, anupagamanahetu vā. Paṭipassaddhakilesānīti suṭṭhu vūpasantakilesāni,🔽paṭipassaddhippahānavasena sammadeva pahīnadosāni. Sassatādisabhāvavasenāti “sassatañca
analyzed: an upagamma ati an upagantvā an upagamana hetu vā paṭipassaddha kilesāni iti suṭṭhu vūpasanta kilesāni  paṭipassaddhi ppahāna vasena sammat eva pahīna dosāni sassata ādi sabhāva vasena ati sassatam ca
translated: Not to be gone: not to be gone to, or because it is not to be gone to. With defilements stilled: with defilements well suppressed; with hate well abandoned in the sense of suppression;

original: vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desessāmi amatañca tāṇañca leṇañcā”tiādinā tesu tesu suttesu
analyzed: vaḥ bhikkhave dhammam desessāmi amatam ca tāṇam ca leṇam ca ati ādinā tesu tesu suttesu
translated: with hate well abandoned in the sense of substitution of opposites; with hate well abandoned in the sense of rooting out. As having the nature of eternalism, etc.: in such suttas as “Bhikkhus, I shall teach you a Dhamma that is auspicious in the beginning, auspicious in the middle, and auspicious in the end, with its own intrinsic meaning, with its own intrinsic message, and I shall reveal a holy life that is perfectly complete and purified” ,

original: sassatādibhāvakittanavasena.
analyzed: sassat ādi bhāva kittana vasena
translated: it is praised as having the nature of eternalism, etc., in the sense of the eternal, etc.,

original: 148. “Rāgādīnaṃ abhāvaṃ karontena ariyapuggalena sāmaṃ daṭṭhabbo”ti iminā “ariyamaggena
analyzed: rāga ādīnam abhāvam karontena ariya puggalena sāmam daṭṭhabbaḥ ti iminā ariya maggena
translated: “By one who is a noble person and who is making non-existence of lust, etc., visible to himself” : by one who is a noble person and who is making non-existence of lust, hate, and delusion visible to himself by himself, without depending on another, and who is making the path and fruit visible to himself by himself, without depending on another.

original: mama rāgādayo pahīnā”ti sayaṃ attanā anaññaneyyena daṭṭhabboti sandiṭṭhi, sandiṭṭhi eva sandiṭṭhiko.🔽Tena tena ariyasāvakena parasaddhāya parassa saddahanena paraneyyena gantabbataṃ🔽hitvā ñāpetabbataṃ pahāya paccavekkhaṇañāṇena karaṇabhūtena. Pasatthā diṭṭhi sandiṭṭhi🔽yathā sambojjhaṅgo. Ariyamaggo attanā sampayuttāya sandiṭṭhiyā kilese jayati, ariyaphalaṃ
analyzed: mama rāga ādayaḥ pahīnā ati sayam attanā anaññaneyyena daṭṭhabbo ti sandiṭṭhi sandiṭṭhi eva sandiṭṭhikaḥ  tena tena ariya sāvakena para saddhāya parassa saddahanena para neyyena gantabbataṃ  hitvā ñāpetabba tam pahāya paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇena karaṇa bhūtena pasatthā diṭṭhi sandiṭṭhi  yathā sambojjhaṅgaḥ ariya maggo attanā sampayuttāya sandiṭṭhiyā kilese jayati ariya phalam
translated: “By himself” is the same as “by himself alone” .

original: tāya eva attano kāraṇabhūtāya, nibbānaṃ ārammaṇakaraṇena attano visayībhūtāya sandiṭṭhiyā🔽kilese jayatīti yojanā.🔽Bhāvanābhisamayavasena maggadhammo. Sacchikiriyābhisamayavasena nibbānadhammo. Phalampi
analyzed: tāya eva attano kāraṇa bhūtāya nibbānam ārammaṇa karaṇena attano visayībhūtāya sandiṭṭhiyā 🔽kilese jayati iti yojanā 🔽bhāvanā abhisamaya vasena magga dhammo sacchikiriyā abhisamaya vasena nibbāna dhammo phalam pi
translated: By himself alone, without being led by another, by himself alone, without being led by another, by himself alone, without being led by another, by himself alone, without being led by another, by himself alone, without being led by another, by himself alone, without being led by another, by himself alone, without being led by another, by himself alone, without being led by another, himself alone, without being led by another,

original: heṭṭhimaṃ sakadāgāmivipassanādīnaṃ paccayabhāvena upari maggādhigamassa upanissayabhāvato
analyzed: heṭṭhimam sakadāgāmi vipassanā ādīnam paccaya bhāvena upari magga adhigamassa upanissaya bhāvato
translated: Because it is a condition for the higher path, which is the fruit of insight into once-returning, etc., in the sense of decisive support.

original: pariyāyato “dissamāno vaṭṭabhayaṃ nivattetī”ti vattabbataṃ labhati.🔽149. Nāssa kāloti nāssa āgametabbo kālo atthi. Yathā hi lokiyakusalassa “upapajje,
analyzed: pariyāyataḥ dissamānaḥ vaṭṭa bhayam nivatteti iti vattabbatam labhati  na assa kālo ti na assa āgametabbaḥ kālo atthi yathā hi lokiya kusalassa upapajje
translated: It is said to “turn away from the fear of the round” in a secondary sense.

original: aparapariyāye”tiādinā phaladānaṃ pati āgametabbo kālo atthi, na evametassāti attho.
analyzed: apara pariyāya iti ādinā phala dānam pati āgametabbaḥ kālaḥ atthi na evam etassa ati attho
translated: “There is no time for it”: there is no time for it to wait. For just as there is a time for the giving of the fruit of mundane profitable consciousness to wait, saying “Be reborn, come again,” etc., so there is no such time for this.🔽That is the meaning. Hence he said “not five days,” etc.

original: Tenāha “na pañcāhā”tiādi. Pakaṭṭhoti dūro. Phaladānaṃ pati kālo pakaṭṭho assāti kāliko,
analyzed: tena āha na pañcāha atiādi pakaṭṭho ti dūro phala dānam kālo pakaṭṭhaḥ assa ati kāliko
translated: “Obvious” means distant. It is “time-belying” because the time for giving its fruit is distant.🔽It gives its fruit after a lapse of time. Hence he said “in giving its own fruit.”

original: kālantaraphaladāyī. Tenāha “attano phaladāne”ti. Pattoti upanīto. Idanti “akāliko”ti padaṃ.
analyzed: kāla antara phala dāyī tena āha phala dāne iti patto ti upanītaḥ idam ti akālikaḥ iti padam
translated: “Attained” means reached. “This” refers to the words “not time-belying.”🔽“Method” is the way. The words “Come and see” are a way of speaking.

original: 150. Vidhinti vidhānaṃ, “ehi passā”ti evaṃpavattavidhivacanaṃ. Vijjamānattāti paramatthato
analyzed: vidhim ti vidhānam ehi passa ati evaṃpavatta vidhi vacanam vijjamāna ttā ati paramatthataḥ
translated: “Existence” means existing in the ultimate sense.🔽“Purity” means complete purification by the absence of the stain of defilements.

original: upalabbhamānattā. Parisuddhattāti kilesamalavirahena sabbathā visuddhattā. Amanuññampi
analyzed: upalabbhamāna ttā parisuddha ttā ati kilesa mala virahena sabbathā visuddha ttā amanuññam pi
translated: “Even though not allowed” means

original: kadāci payojanavasena yathāsabhāvappakāsanena dassetabbaṃ bhaveyyāti tadabhāvaṃ dassento🔽āha “manuññabhāvappakāsanenā”ti.
analyzed: kadāci payojana vasena yathā sabhāva ppakāsanena dassetabbam bhaveyya iti tad abhāvam dassento  āha manuñña bhāva pakāsanena ati
translated: So, in order to show that it is not that, he said, “By the demonstration of its suitability.”

original: 151. Upanetabboti upaneyyo, upaneyyova opaneyyikoti imassa atthassa adhippetattā🔽āha “upanetabboti opaneyyiko”ti. Citte upanayanaṃ uppādananti āha “idaṃ saṅkhate
analyzed: upanetabbaḥ iti upaneyyaḥ upaneyyaḥ vā opaneyyikaḥ iti imassa atthassa adhippetattā  āha upanetabbā ti opaneyyikā iti citte upanayanam uppādanam ti āha idam saṅkhate
translated: “To be brought up” is “to be brought near” (upaneyya); and because the meaning intended is “that which is to be brought near is suitable to be brought near,”🔽he said, “Suitable to be brought up is suitable to be brought near.” The bringing up in the mind is the arousing of it. Therefore he said, “This is suitable to the supramundane state, which is a limited object.”

original: lokuttaradhamme yujjatī”ti. Citte upanayananti pana ārammaṇabhūtassa dhammassa ārammaṇabhāvūpanayane
analyzed: lokuttara dhamme yujjati iti citte upanayanan ti pana ārammaṇa bhūtassa dhammassa ārammaṇa bhāva upanayane
translated: But the bringing up in the mind is intended as the bringing up of the state that is the object of the mind to the state of object.

original: adhippete asaṅkhatepi yujjeyya “ārammaṇakaraṇasaṅkhātaṃ upanayanaṃ arahatīti opaneyyiko”ti.
analyzed: adhippete asaṅkhate api yujjeyya ārammaṇa karaṇa saṅkhātam upanayanam arahati iti opaneyyikā ti
translated: So it would be suitable even in the unlimited, saying: “It is suitable to be brought up, that is, to be made an object.”

original: Allīyananti phusanaṃ. Nibbānaṃ upaneti ariyapuggalanti adhippāyo.
analyzed: allīyanam nti phusanam nibbānam upaneti ariya puggalam ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: “To be clung to” is to be touched. The intention is: “It brings up the noble person to Nibbāna.”

original: 152. Viññūhīti vidūhi, paṭividdhasaccehīti attho. Te pana ekaṃsato ugghaṭitaññūādayo
analyzed: viññūhi iti vidūhi paṭividdha saccehi iti attho te pana ekaṃsataḥ ugghaṭita ññū ādayaḥ
translated: “By the wise”: by those who are discerning; the meaning is, by those who have penetrated the Truths. But they are the type that is the single-opener, etc.,

original: hontīti āha “ugghaṭitaññūādīhī”ti. “Paccatta”nti etassa “pati attanī”ti bhummavasena
analyzed: honti iti āha etassa pati attani iti bhumma vasena
translated: “The kind of person who is quick to understand, etc.”🔽“In one’s own mind” should be taken in the sense of “in one’s own self” .

original: attho gahetabboti āha “attani attanī”ti. Veditabboti vuttaṃ, kathaṃ veditabboti āha
analyzed: atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ iti āha attani attani iti veditabbaḥ iti vuttam katham veditabbaḥ iti āha
translated: “One should know”: how should one know?

original: “bhāvito me”tiādi. Tattha “me”ti iminā “paccatta”nti padena vuttamatthaṃ anvayato
analyzed: bhāvitaḥ mā itiādi tattha mā iti iminā paccatta nti padena vuttam attham anvayato
translated: “I have developed … in my own mind.” Here, by “my own mind” he shows the meaning of the word “in one’s own mind” by way of coordination.

original: dassetvā puna byatirekena dassetuṃ “na hī”tiādi vuttaṃ, taṃ suviññeyyameva. “Viññūhī”ti
analyzed: dassetvā puna byatirekena dassetum na hi itiādi vuttam tam su viññeyyam eva viññūhi iti
translated: Then, in order to show it by way of dissociation, he says “not in another’s mind.” This is easy to understand.

original: idaṃ antogadhāvadhāraṇanti dassento “bālānaṃ pana avisayo cesā”ti āha.
analyzed: idam antogadha avadhāraṇanti dassentaḥ bālānam pana avisayaḥ āha
translated: “For the wise” is a restrictive particle. Showing this, he says “but this is beyond the scope of fools.”

original: Evaṃ ādikalyāṇatādinā aññamaññassa anurūpadesanāya dhammassa svākkhātataṃ dassetvā
analyzed: evam ādi kalyāṇa tā ādinā aññamaññassa anurūpa desanāya dhammassa svākkhāta tam dassetvā
translated: Having thus shown the well-proclaimedness of the Dhamma by the mutual appropriateness of the teaching in terms of the excellence of the beginning, etc.,

original: idāni purimassa purimassa pacchimaṃ pacchimaṃ padaṃ kāraṇavacananti dassento “apicā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: idāni purimassa purimassa pacchimam pacchimam padam kāraṇa vacananti dassentaḥ apica ati ādim āha
translated: he now says “Moreover” in order to show that each subsequent word is a reason for the preceding one.

original: Tattha sandiṭṭhikattāti yasmā ayaṃ dhammo vuttanayena sāmaṃ daṭṭhabbo, sandiṭṭhiyā
analyzed: tattha sandiṭṭhika ttā ti yasmai ayam dhammo vutta nayena sāmam daṭṭhabbaḥ sandiṭṭhiyā
translated: Here, “immediately evident” means that this Dhamma is to be seen by oneself in the way described, and it is immediately evident.

original: kilese viddhaṃseti, sandassanañca arahati, tasmā svākkhāto durakkhāte titthiyadhamme🔽tadabhāvato. Iminā nayena sesapadesupi yathārahaṃ attho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: kilese sandassanam ca arahati tasmā su ākkhātaḥ durakkhāte titthiya dhamme  tad abhāvataḥ iminā nayena sesa padesu pi yathāraham atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: He breaks up defilements, and he is worthy to be shown, thus the good is well proclaimed in the bad, the other bad, the bad of the other sectarians.

original: 153. Tassevantiādīsu yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ buddhānussatiyaṃ vuttanayena veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: tassa iva nti ādīsu yam vattabbam tam buddha anussatiyam vutta nayena veditabbam
translated: The meaning should be understood in each instance according to the method stated in the case of the recollection of the Buddha.

original: 3. Saṅghānussatikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: saṅgha anussati kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the recollection of the Community

original: 154. Ariyasaṅghaguṇāti ārakattā kilesehi, anaye na iriyanato, aye ca iriyanato, sadevakena
analyzed: ariya saṅgha guṇāti ārakattā kilesehi anaye na aye ca sa devakena
